author: Trusted Reviewer
title: Exceptional Headphones
content:
These are the absolute best headphones I have ever owned and they were most certainly worth the money. The noise cancelling is truly incredible. I am currently using this with my gaming computer and it is absolutely fantastic. Paired with my fantastic sound card, my volume hovers at around 20% and it's loud enough with the noise cancelling to block even my own voice.

The reason I didn't give this 5 stars is even though its build quality is exceptional, the sound quality is exceptional, and the battery is rated for a whopping 30 hours which is very good, I simply cannot excuse Sony's use of a puny little usb c cable. The cable is probably 6 inches long, including the usb c connector and regular usb connector! You are also not given an ac adapter! In order to get this thing charging, I had to get under my desk and hook it up to one of the usb ports in the back of my computer. After three hours, I had to go under my desk again to extract the headphones.

A few months ago I had bought another pair of Sony Bluetooth headphones for working out and they came with a 2 foot cable. I thought that was bad but it seems Sony wanted to amp up their cable shortening game. (if you're wondering why I can't use that cable because it's micro usb and these headphones use usb c) Honestly, you can't beat Sony's engineering but their bean counters or whoever authorized the use of these ridiculously short cables ruined the experience to some extent. Be prepared to get uncomfortable to charge these or fork up the extra money for a useable usb c cable. If you have an extra ac adapter lying around, you will need to use the box these headphones came in as a layer between the headphones and the ground because again, the puny 6 inch cable isn't long enough for you to rest them on a table. I couldn't even place these these on top of my tower computer because the cable wasn't long enough to reach the usb connectors. I truly do find it unacceptable I paid so much money and Sony supplied me with their shortest cable yet!

author: SW
title: Good quality
content: Fantastic headphones but they should be for the price.

author: Trey T.
title: Great product! Recommend!
content: Great product! Recommend!

author: Debbie Swartz
title: Excellent headphones!
content: I love these' they cancel noise on airplanes, easily adjustable and holds a charge for 30 hours.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good buy
content: A little expensive but a very decent set of headphones.

author: PSG
title: Noise reduction
content: Effectively surpresses background noise. Bluetooth is easier than I feared. Carrying case will be useful for travel. Bought a second pair for my son and daughter in law?  Pleased with my purchase

author: Kindle Customer
title: Handsome, comfortable, and truly amazing sound
content:
These headphones are light and very comfortable on my very large head. Noise cancellation is uncannily effective and the sound quality is great although I found myself fiddling with the equalizer to boost the mid-range to fit my taste.

It's not touted as a top-line feature, but the headphones are Google Assistant compatible which allows them to do special tricks like read my notifications on my late-model Android phone. If that floats your boat it's another little nice-to-have that you might not have realized looking at the product listing.

My only complaint is the touch controls for playback. I have to double-tap the right ear-cup to pause/play. Not only is it really loud (because you are essentially playing a drum on your own ear) but the double-tap doesn't always register and I find myself doing it multiple times! Shaking my head about the war on buttons...

author: Bob
title: Love these headphones!
content:
I bought these as a gift for my wife. Normally she casts off her tech to me when she’s disappointed (which happens often).

She loves this Sony set and raves about them EVERY TIME she uses them. I guess I’ll have to buy my own set.

author: J just J
title: That was a fast disappointment.
content:
2nd day, right side is dead.  No cause I can detect.  Neither wired nor wireless matters.  Did the reset settings and factory reset routines...nadda.  Dead.

First.  I bought them because the sound and noise cancellation were AMAZING.  I was transfixed and amazed by the demo set.  Better than the Bose, Beats, Skull Candy...and whatever that other brand was on the display.

BUT the cons quickly won.
The onboard mic is crap.  "You sound like you are in a tunnel".
They are plastic and feel delicate.
The "velvet covering" on the cups is the kind of stuff that turns to sticky goo in a few years.
The "fake leather" covering seems the/is the same on my last set of Sonys that finally flaked off (took a few years - to be fair).
The volume, forward/reverse controls were tedious.  The "cover to pause" worked well.

AND expensive.

Glad the crappy part came through so quickly...can take back IMMEDIATELY.

author: Charlie
title: Hands Down!
content: Best headphones I've ever put my money on! These headphones are well worth the price they're being retailed for.

author: Christian
title: Love them
content: They're awesome! I work in a very noisy manufacturing facility and it cuts the noise down a lot even without playing anything. Comfy and the battery lasts a good bit.

author: jbnszk
title: Definitely the industry leading noise canceling headphone
content:
I chose these Sony WH1000XM3 headphones based on reviews from Amazon, CNET, Tech Radar, and more, and trying them in a store. Noise canceling was my main requirement, second was comfortable, over the ear.

I bought a Bose Series 1 and returned them next day and ordered the Sony. Simple controls, quick Bluetooth connection, beautiful adjustable sound, and extremely comfortable.

author: TheGeeDawg
title: Better than Bose QC35 II
content:
I originally ordered the Bose QC35 II. They were extremely comfortable and the noise canceling worked well. The thing is the Bose QC35 II sounds very  good but not great. Its flat signature is good everything but great at nothing. It’s like they don’t want to offend anyone.

These Sony’s were released a week after I had the Bose and based on professional reviews it appeared Sony hit a home run. I still wasn’t convinced so I went to my local Big Box store and tried them. WOW! I returned the Bose and never looked back. These headphones do everything the Bose does except a little better. And I mean everything (sound, NC, codecs, features, battery life, app) Comfort is equal with the Sony redesign.
The only + for the Bose is it connects to multiple devices at once. That’s not something I care about but I thought it was fair to mention since that may be a deal breaker for some people.

author: S.C.
title: Great quality
content: Husband loves these, he uses them at work and now can't live without them.

author: Jacob Staley
title: Great!
content: I love them

author: Trevor
title: Lacking in Bass
content: These don't seem to have much bass punch. Overall i think they are good, but could use a bass boost.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A great pair of headphones
content: I bought this pair of headphones because I have to travel for work, and these make flying much more enjoyable.  With regular ear buds I could still barely hear music or movies, but the sound quality and noise cancelling ability of these are great.  For me, they are very comfortable for hours at a time, the longest I usually wear them is 4-5 hours.  My ears can feel a bit warm if the room or plane cabin is warm, but otherwise I don't really notice them.  The ability to cover the headphones and be able to hear without taking them off is a nice feature that I ended up really appreciating.

author: Ash
title: Great sound, finicky controls, terrible construction
content:
In some ways, these are one of my favorite purchases in recent years. They sound great, but for $350 headphones, the build quality is poor.

Only weeks after starting to use them, the part of the casing that houses the sliding part of the headpiece started popping open (causing the headphones to no longer be usable).

It started as an occasional nuisance, where you could click it back in, but eventually would no longer stay, causing me to need to tape the casing together.

author: grant
title: Life altering
content: Had a couple of people next to me talking on a flight for hours. They sounded like they were 100ft away and forgot about them as I listened to a podcast.

author: keenan Flynn
title: Awesome noise cancelling headphones
content: Sounds great love these headphones the only complaint I have is the on the right earcup the speaker sounds a bit loose but other than that , I love it.

author: Sabhay S.
title: Great headphones with 1 chink in the armor
content: Every thing about these headphones are great and especially if you have came for just listening to or producing music. The mic quality is bad tho, so like if u intend to make a lot of calls then this isn’t a good option for you. The noise cancelling is amazing on these (probably the best in the market right now) and sound quality is also top of its line, quality is good, battery life is amazing, and comfort is decent.

author: JOSE RICARDO DAVALOS DIAZ
title: Great product
content: Great product, no complains

author: tyger115
title: Awesome Headsets
content: Don't waste your money on Bose products. Sony is the way to go. Sound quality is ten times better as well. I'm not a big on wireless head sets , however  the Sony WH1000XM3 are flawless.

author: Patrice782
title: I wanted to love these Headphones
content:
I just want to start of by saying that I really wanted to love these headphones!

The Pros:
Sound quality is amazing, I don't think I've ever heard a pair of headphones sound this good. The bass is pronounced but not overbearing and the mids and highs are crisp and clear. It's also worth noting that the equalizer on the app is fully customizable and unlike many other headphones, you can actually notice the difference when making any changes in the EQ settings.

The Noise cancellation was great too, I don't think I was blown away as much as many reviewers on youtube have expressed but these headphones did a great job of reducing a lot of ambient noise. Just don't expect them to block out people's voices.

The look and feel of these headphones is top notch. They have a certain minimalistic look to them that screams quality, and the touchpad controls were really convenient to use.

They are extremely comfortable to wear (minus the sweaty ears after extended amount of use). And they don't feel too heavy on your head.

The battery life on these is also amazing! and USB-C definitely takes that to the next level with the quick charge feature.

Now for the cons....

Quality Control; like many other users have expressed, my headphones had a strange scratching or popping noise in the right ear cup when Noise Cancellation was tuned on. This noise would stop and go away randomly and it was really noticeable and irritating when playing music at low volumes. Now I know what you're thinking? Maybe I had a bad pair and I should exchange them for another? ... I gave Sony the benefit of the doubt and I exchanged these headphones, 2 TIMES! All three pairs had the same popping noise issue. One of them had the issue on both ear cups. For $350 headphones, this isn't something I was willing to deal with.

Multi-pairing; One other major issue I have with these headphones is the lack of a multi pairing feature. You can really only pair with one device at a time while using these and if you want to switch to another device, then you have to unpair from the previous device before you're able to pair with the new device. This seems like a minor issue to deal with but if you use multiple devices, say an iPad, computer and phone to listen to any type of media throughout the day, this can quickly become an inconvenience. This is especially true if you're already used to the quick pairing features of any Beats headphones, or multi pairing features of Bose Headphones.

All in all if you're ok with having to play the lottery with quality control when ordering these headphones or if you're not worried about having to pair multiple devices while listening, then these headphones might be the ones for you.

author: Shawn Kennedy
title: Love these
content: Wear this a lot. Thank you

author: Tahir Yasin
title: Noise Cancelling
content: Best headphones I ever owned, I have tested B&O, Bose, Beats. The sound quality and battery life is great, very comfortable.

author: Cindy Ngo
title: Used to hate headphones, now I can't travel without these!
content:
Holy moly, these are hands down the most comfortable headphones ever! I have no idea what the cushions are made of, but they are so comfortable. My ears never feel squished.

In terms of music, it was just pure bliss the first time I used them. The sound quality is just off the charts along with the noise cancellation option. It doesn't drown out all of the loud noises around you, but it does help tremendously.

The Sony Headphone app also lets you play around with different settings, allowing you to fine tune your music preferences.

Having USB C charging is a huge factor of owning these, as it's one less cable I have to carry around. All of my friends and family that I've let try it on fall in love with it instantly.

author: Jorge
title: This is another level of feeling music!!!
content:
I have been using the headphones for almost two weeks and I don't have words to describe how good is the sound quality. Really, after using these headphones it is really difficult to go again to regular earphones. You simply feel the beat in a way that is difficult to explain. Even with maximum sound, I haven't felt pain in my ears. I can easily use the headphones the whole day. Also, the battery is so good. It can really last the whole day or even more. I literally listen the whole time so these batteries are serious things.
It is true that switching between devices is not as easy as it should be. Nevertheless, the product is so good that in the end, you get used to.
Definitely, if you are so sick for music as I am, then getting this pair will upgrade your sickness to levels difficult to reach.

author: BS
title: Nice.
content: Very nice.

author: Sean L.
title: In This World You Get What You Pay For
content: The noise canceling is great and music sounds wonderful in this headset. You won’t be disappointed just download the app and enjoy. Set up was easy and pairing was simple.

author: GT/ Music Expert
title: Want to multitask ? Sony WH-1000X  M3 are the way to go
content:
I work from Home and get distracted but my surroundings, I need to answer calls and enjoy the Mobility.
The Sony WH - 1000X M3 are Perfect to focus on Work and enjoy Great Sound at the same time. The Headset is great for travel and going on long trips. I love the details you can hear out of each Song, Deep Base, and hights matter fact the app allows you to adjust like in the old days,,,,, with an Equalizer! I highly recommend the Sony!  WOWWWWW

author: Max
title: Fantastic comfort and sound quality.
content: Great for every day in an open office

author: Vernon E. Parker III
title: What Pro Reviewers fail to mention...
content: I bought these headphones because I had some extra cash, I am a tech-aholic, and I wanted to offload my barely one year old Sony WH1000XM2 to my father who asked me for some headphones. I may end up giving him the news model because it is most definitely not worth the upgrade price. The ads will dazzle you with fancy terms like Liquid Crystal Polymer drivers or fast charging, the reality, in simple terms, is that these headphones are marginally better sounding than the previous model. What makes these headphones different aside from all the fancy new tech built into them is this, they are designed for people with bigger ears and bigger heads. The padding which was ample on the older model was thicker. The new driver technology in the headphones sounds marginally better which amounts to basically nothing since the older model sounds exceptionally good. You'll hardly notice the better sound since the key feature in the noise cancelling headphones is worse in the new model, that being the noise cancellation. That thick cushion layer in the old model helped with the noise cancelation, any pro-reviewer that tells you the noise cancellation is better with the new model is a shill and I will stand by that statement. I use my headphone primarily at the gym (I am in the military) and the difference is quite clear. When wearing the older model, I barely head the grunts, chatter, or equipment from the other people using the facility even when I am not playing music. I have to turn the music up on the newer models to block out most of the ambient sounds since the thinner cushioning does not block out anywhere near that level of noise. Noise cancellation on any headphone that lays claim to that term is a combination of lots of things including the technology. The tech only goes so far. Yes it is excellent software based sound cancelling but without the extra cushioning it is wasted. Does the new model sound better, just a little. Not the current over $300 price they are charging better. Are they more comfy, to me no. But if your ears and head are bigger than mine, probably a great deal. It is most certainly not worth the price they are asking for if you own (and are happy with) the older model, definitely not worth the upgrade. Wait for some truly incredible headphone breakthrough before you upgrade, buy the older model which is the sam price.

author: Anon
title: Great Sound, Easy to Use
content:
I put off buying noise cancelling headphones for a long time because, for the same price, you can get great studio headphones with better sound quality. These headphones sound great though, and for most listeners will have sufficient sound quality. I haven't tested the battery life yet, but the features are great and they are fairly comfortable.

I'd recommend buying a longer USB-C cord though, unless you only ever plan to connect them to your computer. The cord is only a few inches long so it won't work if you want to use a wall charging block.

author: Sam
title: It's time to transfer from Bose QC35 to Sony WH1000XM3
content: Due to Amazon's worst service quality, I have taken too much time to get this wonderful device (70days) although I did not get the pre-order: I ordered this again: I will return the pre-order when it arrive. Anyway, I am a kind of early adaptor in terms of the Noise Cancelling headset. About 2.2 years ago, I purchase Bose QC35. At that time, the noise cancelling headset was wonderful. And, I still use this product. However, today, I met Sony WH1000XM3. I just recognize that I need to convert from BOSE to SONY. First of all, as the description say, you can easily master all functions within 1mins. It means that this Sony headset is very naturally well-designed. Second, the ear-cover is very comfortable. As you know, one of the issues the user of the previous version of Sony (WH1000XM2) was the uncomfortable ear-cover: So, my brother usually complaints. By comparing with Bose QC35 (first version), this new product is really great! Third, this device has Bluetooth 4.1 function. It means that you can connect two devices at once (in my case, smartphone and laptop). Fourth, there are three modes, such as noise cancelling, ambient sound, and normal. If you select ambient sound, you can more clearly listen others' speak and background sounds than normal mode even though you wear this headset. Fifth, the noise cancelling function is not different from Bose. But, the feeling is more comfortable (In Bose QC35, when you turn on the noise cancelling function, you may feel very subtle strange: that does not happen in this device). Lastly, the most important thing is sound. Yes, this is Sony. The sound quality is really wonderful!

author: Travis T.
title: noise canceling
content: Thank god i cant hear Ian anymore

author: Tonmoy
title: Excellent headphones
content: Comfortable and great sound canceling

author: T.Hoff
title: Outstanding Headphones - must try
content: I am a headphone addict.  I have Bose QCs Nuraphone, Sennheisers, etc.  I got these for a trip to try them out and am amazed.  Noise cancelling and sound clearly beat Bose with amazing comfort. Outstanding product.

author: Jacob Durden
title: Poor speaker reliability
content:
I bought these Headphones April 19, 2019. Having previously only ever used Beats this was a huge upgrade for me. When I finally got the headphones I was astounded at the sound quality and how well it canceled noise, however it only toke me all of 3 minutes to figure out that there was a pretty major flaw with these headphones. After taking the headphones through a hertz test, I discovered that at around 80 hertz the bass in the right speaker was significantly weaker than the left, and stayed this way until the frequency got so low it didn't even respond. And when I say significant, I mean you can't even tell its responding unless you remove the left cup from your ear entirely

Pretty disappointing. So I got in touch with costumer I told them my problem and after jumping through a few hoops they offered to send me a replacement pair.

So two week pass and I finally get my replacement headphones and low and behold, it has the same problem. Granted not the exact same since the drop off point moved from 80 hertz to 60 hertz. Since this wasn't quite as bad, and I didn't feel like waiting to weeks, I decided to keep these and try to ride it out. It's now September and the Headphones have gotten much worse.

Now starting from 200 hertz and going down until the headphones no longer respond there is a huge difference in bass. At 130ish hertz you might as well take the right cup off because of how little it responds. Not buying Sony headphones for awhile now unfortunately.

author: Emmanuel Osadebe
title: Defect on hinges. Think before you buy
content:
I researched for over a month before buying this product. Barely 2 weeks of reasonable use. Product hinge pulled out due to no fault of my own. . Sony refused to fix it, talk less or replacement.

See response from sony:

 Thank you for contacting Sony Electronics Inc. regarding your Sony Headphones . Your case has been forwarded to the National Customer Relations office for response. Sony takes great pride in the workmanship and design of each of our products. A Limited Warranty was provided with your product that warrants against defects in material or workmanship for a designated period. We apologize for the inconvenience this issue has caused you, however due to the fact that your unit was diagnosed with Physical Damage whether it is intentional or unintentional, Sony will not be able to honor its warranty and that we are unable to assist you with the repair/exchange. Thank you.

THINK Before you buy

author: Capricorn
title: I like the previous sony model
content:
Some features of the previous version was removed to this new version.  The sound quality of previous version is better.
The voice feature is removed on this version.

author: Sam Garofolo
title: The bees knees
content:
Love these things. I’ve had beyerdynamic DT880s in the past and they were awesome. I lost them a year ago, which put me in the market for new headphones. The sound quality of these to me blows them out of the water.

The noise canceling in these is mind blowing. I like to these on family and friends and then activate the noise cancelling and watch their face. I should get some commission from Sony for turning about half my family on to these headphones.

I’ve seen some people online say these were uncomfortable. I couldn’t disagree more, and I have a large head. I could honestly sleep in these. There are times at work I’ve worn these for 8-9 hours and haven’t had any issues.

author: Tyler Thompson
title: Amazing
content: Love love love - controls are really good, definitely get some incorrect inputs every so often though

author: RCS
title: So far, so great! Possible weakness with microphone performance for phone calls.
content:
Talk about timing. My Sony WH-1000X M3 arrived yesterday, the same day that my trust 10+ year old Bowers & Wilkens P5 finally experienced a critical structural failure.

I've been using these for ~24 hours. These are my first active noise cancelling headphone, and I'm loving them so far.

One possible weakness may be with phones call. I tried to take one phone call with them while in a cafe, and had to switch to the phone mic because the party on the other side said that "I sounded like I was far away". I'll update after I have more experience with the headphones.

author: Alex
title: Easily the best headphones out there
content: And I do not mean only ANC, but sound quality, build quality, aesthetics (I am really digging Sony's look) and overall look and feel. It feels really premium and I am using it on a daily basis. I will be flying very soon so putting it to the test and based on reviews, I can finally enjoy music during a flight.

author: Amazon Customer (atp)
title: Superb Headphones - No. 1
content: I have compared a number of headsets including the Bose QuietComfort 35  which are the closest in terms of features and quality to this Sony XM3.  Sony XM3 beat them all on a number of aspects.  Superb sound quality, excellent noise cancellation with with great 1. adaptive sound control 2. sound position control ; 3. surround options and 4. full sound equalizer.  Very comfortable to wear even for a person with glasses.  Definitely the headphones with NC and very high quality of sound to beat.

author: Lawrence J Kelly
title: Sound Quality is excellent
content: I have been a Bose fan for a long time.  In fact my current headset before buying the Sony still works fine except it is a wired set and all of my devices I connect to are Bluetooth only.  After reading reviews, I tried these and have been very pleasantly surprised.  For both my wife and me, we found these more comfortable, the noise deadening more effective and the quality of music sound excellent.  She has lost some of her hearing range and wears hearing aids.  After listening to music for the first time with the Sony headset, she was very excited.  She made a point of saying how clearly the sound came through and that she was hearing familiar songs like she hadn't in years.  We are delighted with the purchase.

author: Wutang
title: Love it.
content:
4.5/5 if I could do halves.  I did a lot of research on ANC headphones and eventually landed on this one. My previous ANC headphone was a taotronics over the ear model. I thought the ANC was decent on that one,  1000MX3 is significantly better and has a few more options. I like that it has an app that you can tweak the sound profile. In the office, I can blockout everything while keeping the music volume really low. One cool feature is if you're using the 3.5mm jack, if you unplug it the ANC automatically shuts off.

There is always a debate between the Bose QC35II and the 1000MX3. Here are my reasons I picked the 1000MX3
- LDAC codec
- USB-C charging
- A bit more bass heavy in the sound
- Hand over right cup lets in ambient sounds
- Ability to toggle: No ambient sound just music, ambient with music(This is what Bose mostly sounds like) and no ANC.

There are 2 cons I must mention: my ears get a little warm using this for a bit and the 3.5mm port on the headphone is really small so you just can't just plug in one that's laying around. Paying this much for a headphone, I'd like to use any AUX cord I have laying around. Minor annoyances but overall a great product.

author: Monica B.
title: Wow sound, excellent features you get what you paid.
content:
WOW! I absolutely love this headphones.
Quality sound, quality product. I just hope it does not crack as previous model reviews mentioned this problem but so far it a great product.

author: Jennifer C.
title: Great hardware, less than perfect software.
content:
At first I was hesitant spending this kind of money on headphones, considering there was nothing wrong with my Sony mdr-zx770bn headphones, but reviews I read convinced me I should take a chance on these. I'm pleased with the product, but it isn't as polished of an experience as the Bose QuietComfort 35. After testing the two side-by-side, I felt the Sony headphones had a head up in most areas. Sound quality, fit and finish, ergonomics/fit on my head, and the noise cancelling all seemed better to me. The way it looks and USB-C were bonuses.

But the product begins to look less appealing after long term use. People have been talking about the mics amplifying ambient noise in phone calls, but that is not a problem for me since I don't primarily use it as a headset. It is still an issue, but not much of one for me considering where I make my calls and how often I make them. More annoying are multiple software oversights. First, the sound quality settings aren't intuitive. Why can't I use the in-app equalizer when using the "prioritize sound quality" connection mode? There is also no way to modify settings without using the app, such as the sound quality or function of the nc/assistant button. My experience with the connection in high sound quality mode is mixed. Every device I tried to have the problem: sometimes it stutters, sometimes it doesn't, seemingly at random. These devices support LDAC and the other audio formats, but none of them seem to connect properly with these settings.

I am glad I chose these over the Bose, since I consider those all small grievances. It's a fantastic product, but not for everyone. If you are willing to sacrifice convenience for the best of the best, get these. For anyone who wants to pair their headphones and have them work well every time, get Bose headphones.

author: Vincent L. Davis
title: Sony WH1000XM3 - Great N.C.H.
content: After doing a fair amount of research between the two-industry leading N.C.H...  (Bose and Sony); I went with the Sony WH1000XM3. The tipping point, the hand over the right ear mute feature. It may seem simple, but I cannot begin to tell you how convenient this feature is. On my last airline trip, I found myself using this feature time and time again. From brief conversations to listening to announcement, all without removing my headphones. For sound quality, long-wearing comfort, & noise canceling, the WH1000XM3 is top notch.  As for some of the comments, I've read surrounding the difficulties, & inconvenience with pairing up with numerous devices, I've found it not accurate.  I have my WH1000XM3 paired with two different laptops manufacture with different OS, two different types of cell phones, and a plethora of Samsung devices. The only knock I have with the WH1000XM3 is…, I think the qc35 ii has a better outward presentation, (aesthetics) and that's all.  Technology, sound quality, comfort and features, WH1000XM3 hands down. The price points are about the same so, that’s not really a factored. I hope you find the hope somewhat helpful.

author: Mark
title: Very Comortable with Decent Noise Cancellation and Good Sound
content: I am really enjoying these noise cancelling over-ear headphones. They're extremely comfortable as they fit over the ear. I can wear them for hours and hours without any ear pain/discomfort like I get from on-ear headphones. My only complaint is that the noise cancelling isn't as great as I would like. I also have Bose In-ear noise cancelling headphone and the noise cancelling on those are extremely hard to beat. But these Sony ones are wireless Bluetooth which is why I bought them. For what they are they are great.  A big plus is they actually can go much further from the Bluetooth source of what they are connected to than what is stated by Sony which is great. I've been able to walk almost 50 feet or so away from my computer and still stay connected and hear my music, even through some walls.

author: DCB
title: Great noise cancelling! Large heads will break these!
content:
These headphones are easily the nicest pair of over-the-air noise cancelling headphones I have ever owned. If you do not have a ginormous head and you fly a lot, give yourself a treat and get these.
However, if you have a giant head like yours truly, they will break (see pictures) eventually. I would love for these plastic joints to be made of metal, I have yet to find over-the-ears that wont break on me.

author: Mjwrise
title: Nothing to compare them to, but am enjoying them
content: This is my first set of NC headphones, so I have nothing to compare to, but I've been happy with these.  They are comfortable and the NC seems to work pretty well.  I haven't tried to do calls yet from them so I can't give feedback on that part.

author: Larry
title: 30 hour battery life and great sound and almost total background blackout
content:
Comfortable, battery lasts 30 hours, easy to use.  Have not tried many features yet
I like them but they seem to classify my wife’s speech as noise cause I can’t hear her when I’m wearing them

author: Amazon Customer
title: Volume control has some issues, otherwise great product
content: The volume control does not work very well on my device.

author: Mike
title: Great Headphone
content: These pair well with my iphone and sound amazing.

author: Brenna Gaffney
title: Arrived in perfect condition! Amazing headphones
content: Headphones arrived in perfect condition with original packaging and instruction manual. The noise cancelling works great. They're very comfortable. The battery life is impressive, we hardly ever charge them. I bought them for my husband but we definitely share. They are just what we were looking for.

author: Friedeien
title: Great sound and features
content: The charging cord is too short.

author: Fadi
title: You can't go wrong with these.
content: The noise cancelling is amazing on these. They're going to be great for studying. They're very very comfortable as well. You don't feel like you're wearing anything at all. They charge really fast as well. The sound quality is amazing as well. I really suggest you take a look at these. The build quality is really excellent as well.

author: nick abbott
title: From Bose to Sony
content: Had the Bose Quite Comforts... They had an accident. (The dog chewed them up) After reading and watching several reviews I decided to try the Sony. Love the sound quality and noise cancelling. Best feature by far is the hold your had over the right ear to activate pass through sound. Super convenient!! Also the app has a lot more features. My one feedback is that only one bluetooth device can be connected at a time.

author: Clint C. Carter
title: Work great and noise cancelling is amazing
content: The reviews I read were right on the money. I really like these headphones and the noise cancelling works very well.

author: Brandon
title: Cheap build quality, doesn't seem to work with Linux?
content:
These headphones sound fine, and the ANC is incredible. I have zero issues with sound quality.

However, the build quality is extremely concerning. They're built out a plastic that feels very brittle and cheap, and I have concerns about their long term durability. Reading other reviews has only bolstered these fears. It seems that Sony is uninterested in warranting their product. For the price, there's no reason Sony couldn't use a metal + pleather band and hinge mechanism.

I also haven't been able to get them to pair with either of two Linux computers.

If they were $200, I'd have given them 4 stars with reservations. But at $350, they just don't hold up to my expectations.

author: DONALD P FORD
title: Sony
content: Great headphones

author: JLS
title: Terrible bass
content: Terrible bass quality. Very disappointed that I waited a week to get my expensive headphones with terrible sound quality.

author: Seattle Girl
title: Crap!
content: Head phones won’t turn on or charge! Very Frustrated! Don’t waste your money!

author: A. SCOTT
title: Superb Noise Cancelling
content: Really has changed my life - I don’t know why I went so long without noise cancelling headphones. Better than expected - and has the edge over Bose I think. Touch response is a bit wonky, but overall quite amazing. Instantly pairs with iPhone once set up. No hassles.

author: Harrison Ogren
title: Great sound
content: Best headphones of 2018

author: Carlton J. Horton
title: Worth the money!
content: As I travel a lot, these have become mandatory on flights. The noise cancelling does wonders. I can tune out the plane noises, loud talkers and crying babies. I can plug them into my laptop and hear ONLY my movies.  The only problem I've found is the touch volume on the sides tends to be temperamental. Other than that, I love them.

author: SeaCat
title: Great sound...except in Noise Cancel mode.
content: I love the sound quality of these headphones. Alas, after 20 minutes on Noise Cancel mode, the right ear cup begins making clicking and rustling sounds—very distracting. I’ve read I’m not alone in experiencing this—very disappointed as these aren’t cheap headphones. Also, Focus cameras (3rd party seller) was abysmal in response.

author: Mimi’s Angel
title: Excellent Product
content: Excellent headphones! So many variations on sound and noise cancellation.

author: Frank
title: Very impressive headphone
content: This is the first ANC headphone I have. But I used my friend's QC35 II for a while. XM3 is the much more comfortable for me and I can wear it longer than 3 hours without any complains.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Top notch sound quality and battery life
content: Phenomenal sound quality for a Bluetooth headphone. Battery life is exceptional and it looks sleek and attractive. I own the Bose q35’s and I would choose these over them any day of the week. Excellent buy if you need quality sound and unbeatable noise cancelation.

author: JAR546
title: Comfortable with great sound
content: This are the most comfortable headphones I own.  I love the noise cancelling and quality of the sound.

author: rhlogie
title: Gift for wife who loves them
content: I'm currently working as an RV camp host in a "vacation resort" RV park setting. That means people like to come here and make noise partying or playing with their toys. (My job is to keep the noise down and try to keep people safe.) My wife was very annoyed by the noise so we tried this before moving on. All the outside reviews say Sony jumped past Bose with this new model so we tried it. It seems to cancel all the extraneous noise for her and she loves it. She uses it for audio books as well as music. She has used it on flights and in airports. We're in the Arizona desert in the summer (!?!) and it cancels out the RV air conditioning noise for her along with the erratic guest noise. In all situations she says she has perfect silence behind her selected source. However, in spite of how much she loves it, I'm hoping that I don't become an extraneous noise! (As a partner you will also be cancelled out so I go over to her and touch her to gain her attention ... and take each interruption to share a hug and kiss. In that sense it's improved the relationship.

author: John
title: Great!!! Sony is the best
content: Best of the best of the best!

author: Jose Melgar
title: Wow
content: Best of the best

author: Tyler J. Gilbert
title: Better ANC than the Bose QC15s
content:
I can only compare these to my Bose QC15s.

The noise canceling is much better than the 1st gen Bose, and less fatiguing for long flights. There was no noticing hiss when using ANC. It handles voices and other noises quite well, where the Bose was only good at cancelling steady, droning noises. There is also a button to turn noise cancelling off or down if you don’t want, or need it.
They are comfortable and fold up very compact into the case that they come with.

author: HA
title: Great headphones!
content:
The best wireless noise cancelling headphones in the market
Premium price with premium quality
Extremely comfortable
Best noise cancelling
Totally destroys Bose qc35
Sleek design
Long battery life
Amazing sound quality
Touch buttons are inconvenient and annoying to use

author: Taylor
title: Great noise cancelling, but no multiple simultaneous connections
content: Great for getting no noise. Only gripe is no multiple simultaneous connections.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Fantastic
content: Perfect for watching movies and music. App controls the level of the sound and it gets annoying but you can always tinker with it to keep a steady level. The noise canceling blocks out everything that isn’t directly close to you and also comes with an ambient sound control to hear everything without taking the headphones off. The only reason to take these off is because I get sweaty and minor sores around the ear from time to time. Otherwise a near perfect product

author: Nicholas Rudowich
title: Changes My Air Travel for Ever
content: I have used these now for about a month. Have been on multiple flights both regional and long-haul I will not fly without them. I have not owned the Bose QC35II, but I was able to try them on side by side, and the Sonys in my opinion are by far the better of the two.

author: Mak
title: Excellent
content: Excellent sound quality, unsurpassed noise cancelation.. Blows away my wired Audio Technica M50x's all around! Amazing technology! Enjoy.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Better Than My Bose.
content: Best by a long shot. I’ve had two pairs of Bose noise cancelling. I was a sworn Bose user. Not after using these headphones.

author: TheFlamingHips
title: Sound quality & battery life are the amazing BUT unintuitive Bluetooth connection is a real headache
content:
UPDATE: I have returned these headphones. The Bluetooth issue was too hard to ignore for such a high tier headphone. Other issues I had but didn't put below were the sides of the earpieces stick out a little too far on your head. So either side of your head looks a bit like a 1950's robot. They're not as aesthetically pleasing as I would like.

The material and sound quality are amazing. The Battery life is outstanding but I can only give this product 3 stars because I expect a $350 pair of Bluetooth headphones to be able to intelligently connect to multiple devices. I am always hopping between my laptop, iPad and iPhone. Each time I go to a different device I have to manually disconnect the Bluetooth from that devices and them manually reconnect the Bluetooth to the new device. EVERY TIME. I can’t believe such a top of the line pair of headphones would have such horrible intellegent Bluetooth handling. I would hope that the headphones would know which device I would need to hear from the audio coming from said device. I’m very close to returning these and trying out the Bose. I’ve read the Bluetooth connection on the Bose are more intuitive.

author: Mahi
title: Best ANC and sound, but is that enough for a $350 price tag ?
content:
Amazing noise cancellation & sound quality.
Connects to only one device at a time (not worth the 300/350 price tag)
NFC is present, but no use except pairing to device initially and switching on ur device using NFC (which I consider extra work than using the power button).
Better option is Jabra elite 85h which offers multi device connection and equivalent sound quality and 2 year rain / dust protection warranty.
I hope XM4 would be brilliant.

author: Tman
title: These are awesome
content: I ride in a commuter train and these actually cancel the noise of the train, the trains noisy air ventilation / circulation system and background conversations while delivering an amazing sound quality

author: Nathan
title: Overall fantastic product
content:
First of all, this pair of headphones opened up an entirely new listening experience to me. I have no experience in high quality audio equipment, but I loved these headphones. I ended up returning them because of a minor squeak on the left hinge, but I'm sure that was a fluke. Also, I will say I had an issue where there was a weird audio problem on certain lower frequencies, but that went away after a day or two...breaking in period?
Overall these are quite expensive, but I would definitely consider ordering another pair if/when they go on sale.

author: Maaike
title: Had to return
content: I returned the headphones since the microphone was not working. Also the touchpad to change/pause ect the songs stopped working once you were outside. If you google this, you'll find a lot of complains about it and it seems like sony is not working on fixing it.. too big of a deal for a 400 dollar headphone to ignore.. I never usually complain.

author: Amazon Customer
title: good quality
content: is very good and comfortable.

author: khalid
title: love them
content: love this headphones to bits.

author: B.
title: Big for a smaller person
content: So far the sound quality and noise canceling are on par with other reviews. However, these headphones are huge for a smaller head. They sit on my cheeks and has no adjustment for a smaller head. I am constantly adjusting them. They put pressure on my jawline and really uncomfortable. I get a neck ache trying to accommodate the off-balance they give. I have a long flight tomorrow, so I will see if they are good for that. If not, I will be returning them. I was really looking forward to these headphones - I would NOT recommend for someone with a smaller head.

author: neveral0n3
title: First time I own expensive headphones = blown away
content: Never had the nerve to spend over 200$ on headphones. I live in NYC commute daily like a rat on busy, crowded subways while jamming to Audible or some good deep house music before I sit at my desk at the hedge fund and get busy for 12 hours. These headphones changed my life. My commute has been better, I feel less agitated, happier. I don't have to listen to people talking, yawning, subway cars making noise. I am completely in my own world. Sound is great, I am playing around with the  Equalizer a little, Noise cancelling is good but it doesn't cancel out human voice fully if you dont have music on and someone speak to you, you will be able to hear it if its loud enough. The headphone do a great job at cancelling out all other noise like HVAC, Vacuum, Traffic, subway, plane hum, my dog running etc. Im very satisfied so far.

author: Richard
title: Meh
content: Meh

author: Dee
title: good noise cancelling headphone
content: very good noise cancelling headphone.  However, it is not noise proof.  If you have music on, you won't notices the difference.

author: Amanda
title: Great sound, great noise canceling
content: I got these to wear when I travel and I love them. They do double duty - block noise and discourage other passengers from trying to talk to me. I watch a movie or listen to music and can relax.

author: john wills
title: Best investment ever !!!!!!
content:
So after a good long bit of research I decided I was gonna try and skimp out and go with a budget pair of headphones even though I REALLY wanted the Sony’s so $50 later and a quick 30 min test the things were back in the box and will be on the way back to amazon today.........I made the decision to go with the Sony’s
  For me $350 is a pretty big investment but figured I’d give it a shot and I’m so glad I did WHAT A DIFFERENCE the noise canceling is absolutely second to none and with the app and the EQ you can really dial these things in to your own taste and personal experience
  Build quality seems sturdy (no creaks or cracks when bending) and I gotta give em a 10/10 for comfort
  Haven’t tried a phone call but we’ll see
  If your looking at these and have hesitation because of the price like I did give them a shot they are worth every penny

author: Keith Blunt
title: Great product
content: So far so good, no complaints .

author: Net mate
title: Not for me
content: I’ve been considering getting a pair of noise canceling Bluetooth headphones for sometime And after watching a ton of reviews decided to get this even though I realized that I’d have to compromise on sound quality and some technical limitations And today I drove over to a local retailer that had these in stock They really minimize outside noise and they felt comfortable And that’s it for the good part The sound quality was even worse than I’ve expected Now that could be to individuals preference and type of music I mostly listen to instrumental classical jazz and some pop These headphones wouldn’t pair with PlayStation 4 unless you want to pair them thru your monitor or something like that according to the store clerk If you plan on using your headphones on multiple devices you would need to pair them every time The touch controls felt unresponsive They didn’t have these in black so out of curiosity I walked to Bose section and tried a pair of q35 The sound was bad in its own way although soundstage was way better and ear cups were slightly bigger But still I decided not to get them Looks like I’ll be living with the wires a little longer

author: Amazon Customer
title: A review from the average university student
content:
So I am going to preface this by saying that if you are looking for audiophile grade cans, turn away now. Go get a pair of sennheisers and an amp.
I am a student at the University of Central Florida, so I will be writing this for my university homies, hopefully this helps, and note my inexperience with every set in this class. I have only use the QC 35's and surface headphones briefly.
So basically, we've got 5 important things for these headphones, as compared to something like the Bose QC 35 series II, which are the other leading headphones in this segment and price range. Sound, comfort, quality and reliablity, features, battery life, and value. I use these almost all day with my OnePlus 6t and have no issues at all, and when I get home I plug the aux into my gaming PC and it works amazingly for gaming, music, and noise cancelling all around. Now, for the specifics:

Sound - 10/10 - The sound is great, very punchy bass as one would expect, while still keeping clarity in the mids and highs. Honestly its a pair of headphones the average person would absolutely love.  I wont even put the likes of beats or anything in here because they don't compare. I know some have complained about the sound quality not being as balanced as the Bose QC 35 series II, but I also want to counter that by saying that the Sony app has an equalizer built in that really helps balance out the sound. When I hook them up to my computer, the EQ on my soundcard allows me to make them sound natural, and does not make the sound feel very fake, as it happens when you mess with the natural sound of headphones. Honestly just a great sound and fantastic listening experience.

Comfort - 8/10 - There isn't much to say here, the Bose QC 35 series II would be an easy 10/10 here. Those feel like you are wearing pillows. As a Florida man, it gets pretty hot here, and my ears do sweat when wearing the XM3's. Apart from the sweating (which never happens to me if I'm not outside in the heat), they are super comfortable. And they even keep your ears warm when it's colder outside, they're like earmuffs.

Quality and reliability - 7/10, ?/10 - This was a tough one, since I have not had them for very long. Its been about 3 weeks now and they are already creaking and making sounds when I move them around, though they do feel very nice to touch and though they are made of primarily plastic, the quality of the headphones is pretty good. I can't give a reliability score because I am not sure whether these will have the headband snapping issue that the previous versions have had, but the creaking is not a good sign. If you're going to buy these, buy the protection plan.

Features - 10/10 - Great features! I can't say enough good about the features for these headphones. Noise cancellation is the best in the segment, works without even having to be connected to bluetooth. The Sony app gives you TWENTY ONE LEVELS of noise cancellation. It's absolutely insane, and it works so incredibly well. I honestly can't hear a thing with the noise canceling on and music at about 30%. If i'm too lazy to take them off in class, I just turn the noise cancelling down to 16 (open mics) and can hear my professors very well. The touch pad controls are weird at first, but I have gotten used to them and they work consistently. Putting my hand over the earcup comes in handy when ordering food or thanking my shuttle driver, since it instantly turns off the noise cancellation and opens the mics so you can hear. Best features in the segment, amazing for use at university, and easy to use and control. The case for these is also great, and is very good at keeping the headphones safe and tucked away.

Battery life - 10/10 - Can't argue with the battery life on these. 10 minues and you get 5 hours of playback time with noise cancellation on and they will even charge to full in around 3 hours, which is absolutely mad. (Tested with a wall plug and charger, not on a laptop/PC). USB type C, which some care about, I do. Best battery in the segment, and I really have no complaints.

Value - 7/10 - Being the best headphones in this segment isn't easy. I can't give this a higher score because of reliability issues that have happened in the past, along with the creaking I am currently experiencing, but if it wasn't for reliability issues this would be an easy 9/10. The fact that one would also feel inclined to buy the 3 or 4 year warranty because of these reliability questions also knocks off a point. But these are definitely best in class, and even better if you can catch them on sale.

Tl;dr, great headphones. Would recommend them if you're a university student who travels on shuttle or bus, or if you just like to isolate yourself and listen to music, podcasts, or videos in crowded or noisy places. They charge fast, sound great, are comfortable enough, and have best in class features. If comfort and pure sound are your two priorities and you don't care about extreme noise cancellation, usb C charging, don't want to spend ~$15 on a 4 year warranty, and don't care at all about modern features, get the Bose QC 35.

author: Lee Duncklee
title: Wonderful
content: I got both the bose and the Sony M3, I kept the M3. Have used it on a overseas trip and was oh so happy with the ease of use and superior function. The M3 is the right choice for me. It is just a great comfortable headphone. Give it a try.

author: Samantha Easley
title: B+
content: Very Good earphones. However switching between my laptop in my phone is a hassle as I just disconnect them from one devices in order to connect to the other. With other headphones once you try to connect them to a different device they will automatically terminate the old connection to connect to whichever device u want them to. Also battery life is not that great, maybe it’s the noise canceling draining the battery but it goes down pretty fast.

author: Tyler Yates
title: Best headphones ever!
content: ok maybe not ever but that I have ever had! they are noise canceling so the quality dips just a little behind the 700$ open back, studio sound booth quality stuff.... not that you need that! this is the headphones I use when I need to focus in allow place. when I want to tune out the dishwasher. when my upstairs neighbors are doing the things.  The touch controls are on point. the sound is loud if you want to crank it up. but the best feature of all is the quick charge! 15 min on the charge gives me a full day's worth of off and on use.

author: Akash

its makes some kind of noise when you try to put it on !!
  that's the only drawback of this.

author: Ekundayo
title: Right ear makes scratching noise
content: The right ear makes scratching noise when in noise cancelling mode.

author: Edy Gomez
title: Great comfort and noise cancelling
content: The ear cups are very comfortable, I wear for very long periods of time, the only downside is that if you sweat a lot, then you will sweat even more with these headphone when it’s hot. The noise cancelling is very good, I can always hear my music loud and clear no matter the noise outside. The bass and mids are great but the highs need a little bit more work.

author: Xianhao

content:
I love it, especially during flight. It make the long journey not so tired.
However, as I imaged before I bought it, it's not good to use it in hot summer.

author: sam

content: these headphones are great.  battery life is fantastic, no problems connecting.  very comfortable to wear for long periods.

author: Tarik shuman
title: MUST BUY
content: i bought used ones for 250 and they are amazing!

author: Johnny
title: Noise Cancellation distortion
content: These headphones are easily the most beautiful and best sounding headphone I have ever owned. I used to be a Beats guy but with the outstanding disappointment I decided to buy a pair of the Sony WHx1000m2 and literally two weeks after I bought them Sony released the xm3's so I sent back the m2's and after some wait got these bad puppies. Over all sound is amazing and then bass in these headphones makes quite a statement for itself. However I have one problem with them. When noise cancelation is one and you are either walking or chewing something and listening to a song, the movement of the ear cups on your headphone interfere with the noise cancellation and you kind of get this kick back that doesn't sound very good. I have only noticed with while moving and eating with them on. When you are completely still this doesn't happen.

author: Teresa Godsey
title: Great sound + TERRIBLE call quality = EPIC FAIL
content: I agree with what everyone is saying about sound quality but who really cares if you have to switch to your air pods every time a call comes in?  I mean, noise cancelling headphones are big with business travelers, and you do A LOT of calls in business, so until they fix this, they need to stop producing these and Amazon should stop selling them.  And even if these are strictly for pleasure, 90% of the time you use them, they are connected TO YOUR PHONE and your phone GETS CALLS.  So I don't get when people give it 3 stars for sound.  It would be like giving 3 stars for a car that is comfortable and drives great but all the electronics in the cabin fail every time.  That is called a product fail. No points for “great sound” when they can’t even handle a simple phone call. Sony needs to do a recall.  Literally 50-60% of every review had to send them back repeatedly until they got a pair that worked.  That is a 50-40% success rate.  That is an F in any book.  Buy at your own risk!

author: Basar K.
title: Great ANC headphone with a major flaw
content:
This is a great ANC headphone. Has great noice cancellation, great sound but it has a major flaw. Unlike the Bose QC35, this headphone does not support active pairing with multiple devices.

Let me explain with an example. Let's say you are sitting at your desk at work, watching a video on your laptop, sound coming out on your headphones. You get a call on your phone.

What happens with Bose QC35: You answer the call on your phone, QC35 automatically recognizes that it's a call and automatically switches the connection so it's between your headphones and your phone and you start talking through the headphones. When you hang up the call, the headphone switches back to your laptop to resume watching the video.

What happens with Sony XM3: You answer the call on your phone, you disconnect your XM3 from the laptop's bluetooth menu, you wait for XM3 to pick up the new connection to the phone, and then choose XM3 from your phone's output menu to use the headphones for conversation. When you are done with your call, you go to your phone's bluetooth menu to disconnect it and then reestablish a connection with your laptop and the XM3 through your laptop's bluetooth menu.

To summarize, this is a perfect device for those who use it only with their phone but if you have more than one device such as a laptop, tablet and a phone, the user experience is pretty terrible.

author: JustAGuy
title: Absolutely worth it
content: Best noise cancelling headphones on the market.

author: Amazon Customer
title: King of the $350 price range
content: These headphones are phenomenal. I don’t see anyone being disappointed unless you’re an audiophile. Noise-canceling works really well. The virtual surround can also be impressive depending on what you’re listening to. Unclear if I’ll ever make a follow-up review on these headphones, but my initials impressions stand firm.

author: Jimnah
title: Best NC headphones I've used
content: Fast shipping and delivery, loved playing around with the adaptive ambient NC

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great battery life and noise cancelling.
content: Although it does not completely block human speech,it is really close.

author: Brian Fischer
title: Used Sony and Bose on plane. Sony won, easily.
content:
Way better than Bose for noise cancelling on plane.

Bought both Sony and Bose and used on plane.  Returned Bose. No comparison.

Comfort is better on Bose.

Sound quality is better on Bose at both low and high volume.  Crisp and clean.  Audio books sound better on Bose.

When flying and listening to a movie at low volume, you honestly cannot hear a thing!!!
I AM NOT EXAGGERATING!  Sony Rocks.

Loved the equalizer on Sony.

Recap:
Sony won out because of sound cancelling and sound controls.  Sound quality and comfort are good enough.

author: peters
title: Perfect for me
content:
Picked these up to try and help a bit with my focus and for comfort.  Tiny bit of background: I'm a full time student (grad school)... with a full time job (open office plan)... and I have two young (3&5), active, loud children.  As a result, I often have a hard time focusing on my work and studies when I need to actually concentrate. Did I mention I get distracted easily? Like right now I should be working... anyways.

So for the last few months I've been using two devices at once. I wear noise cancelling earbuds (active 65Ts-which I love), inside of noise cancelling over the ears(QC25s- which I also love).  The problem though was that for extended periods the solution just wasn't comfortable.  You get the inside the ear itch coupled with the head squeeze, but compared to the noise, the annoyance was worth it.

So last week I picked up these guys, and oh man are they game changers.  I ran some semi-qualitative tests and saw a significant improvement over the earbuds and a solid improvement over the over-the-ears in pure noise rejection.  Now all and in all they don't eliminate as much as the double solution, but it's close and so much more comfortable.

Things I like so far:
*Noise Cancellation- even without music playing they make background noise manageable.  The ANC is much better than anything else in my stable and I was able to go down to a single set for the back half of the week.
*Sound- music clarity is just simply amazing. The equalizer options are easy to use and cycle through.
*Comfort- Very light and very comfortable. I don't have a set of 35IIs, but I can say they are much more comfortable than the fleet of headphones I have in my house. My only other ones that are close are a set of RF175s on my home audio setup that I bent into perfect submission.
*Battery life- the 30 hour stated life is no joke, and USB-C much needed and appreciated.
*Pass-Through audio- This needs to be on everything with noise cancellation. The right ear hand cup to be able to hear is great. Being able to turn it on all the time is useful too.
*Right ear track and volume controls- this has grown on me quickly. I love how its implemented with the gestures and not needing hard pushes or long pushes.  On ear buds that sit in your ear this is not fun at all.

The OKs:
*Call quality- the bass seems a bit amped up but that could be my settings, the people I've had calls with say I sound fine.
*Aesthetics- ehh, not exactly my style.  The copper accents are nice I guess, but like I said, not my style.

The nitpicking:
*NC/Ambient Button- would really like the option to setup sound pass-through to pause music(like the 65ts).  I don't much like the delay either with the lady in my ear telling me what state the phone is in between pushed. I can hear what state its in just fine- just change quickly and be done with it.
*The app- I know its new, I think i'm just spoiled with others as far as usefulness and working through the app. I also like how with 65ts you can stream any number of white and pink noises though it and shift around the order on the UI.
*Cost- its high, but you get what you pay for.  I don't regret the purchase at all, and suspect it will be a long time before these get discounted... they are simply that good.

So yeah, to sum it up... so far I love these things and look forward to many enjoyable years with them as my daily drivers.  They are comfortable, have great sound, noise cancellation, battery life, and are just good for pretty much everything but exercising.

author: Quinn
title: Must buy
content: My only gripe is that the pause/play gesture is a bit finicky and does not always work. Other than that they are the best par of headphones i have had and works wonders on plane rides!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Overall best noise cancellation headphones for its price
content:
Had these for over 2 month now and I am very happy.

The noise cancellation cannot seize to amaze me. Very useful in places like buses where you can just zone out. Noise cancellation works particularly well with low frequency sounds, which make air conditioning, ventilation, bus/car engine sounds almost unnoticeable. Be careful with these outside. I usually do not use them while I walk outside of campus.

Sound Quality: it is pretty good. The high frequencies could have been a little bit sharper, but it is not a very significant issue.  The bass is boosted to normal commercial level which is enjoyable, but not so good for music makers. Also, the mic is good, but sometimes it is hard for people to hear me well when I call through them.

Design and convenience: very well made headphones with a neat case. The hand interface is amazing. I did not buy them for that, but I was very pleased to find out about the feature.

For its price, it is the best choice on the market right now.

author: Omid Sadeghi
title: Best noise cancelling headphone ever
content: Stylish, lightweight noise cancelling headphone with great sound quality

author: Dri Marie
title: awesome headphones
content: purchased as a gift for my stepdad and he loves it

author: Filipp Pitersky
title: Love it
content: Very good quality

author: MShafer
title: Why did I wait so long?
content: Excellent for airplane. Take them off in flight and you realize how good they are. Good battery life too

author: NoireFloraison
title: Crisp and Comfortable, with Awesome Features
content:
The Sony WH-1000xM3 is an all-around great pair of headphones with excellent sound quality, superb noise cancellation, beautiful design, and plenty of features that make the $350 price tag worth it. I got my pair on sale with a military discount on the military exchange site for $300.

In the box, you get the carrying case, a short USB-C charging cable, gold-plated L-shaped stereo mini plug (3.5mm), and a plug adaptor for in-flight use. Both the 3.5mm headphone jack and charging cable have Sony branding.

The battery life is amazing. The M3s feature 30 hours of playback with a full charge. The USB-C input allows for quick charging. Charging them for 10 minutes gives you 5 hours of playback which is almost insane. After charging these for about 25minutes I’m consistently at almost a full charge. This is a major plus for me since I have my headphones on for almost all hours of the day and I typically sleep with them still on my head.

I do still have several complaints about the M3s. Some of my complaints are just me being nit-picky, others are truly annoying. First, the adaptive sound control mutes whatever is playing and makes a chime when it recognizes a change in your actions (ex. going from walking to running). I find it annoying to have my music paused for this feature. Second, I haven’t been able to get the touch controls to respond while wired. It’s a hassle to have to pull out my phone just to pause or change a track. The only touch feature I’ve found that works while wired is the quick attention (placing your palm over the right ear cup minimize volume and amplify the sound of your surroundings). This also only works when the headphones are turned on, of course. Thirdly, forcing the headphone priority to be on stable connection when utilizing the equalizer or sound position control. I personally prefer the priority to always be on sound quality. Last, one of the touch controls will activate when laying my head on my right shoulder. This is frustrating when flying or laying down when talking on the phone. If I lay my head to the left, I cover the microphones and the person can’t hear me over the phone.

Sound Quality:
Needless to say, the sound quality is phenomenal. I have never really understood how anyone could say the Bose QC35 IIs sound better than the Sony’s. The Bose just sound flat with a terrible soundstage.

I do not hear that much of a difference in quality when listening wirelessly vs. wired. I prefer listening wirelessly. I will admit that I was disappointed with the sound right out of the box. The M3s sounded very very similar to my h.ear on wireless 100ABNs. I mean almost identical. When I first starting using the 100ABNs, it took several days to “break them in”. The more I listened to them, the better they sounded. I’ve had the same experience with the M3s. This time after several hours of listening they sounded much better. This could simply be that my ears needed time to become attuned to them. In comparison with the 100ABNs, the M3s have much better clarity in both the highs and mids. The M3s also handle bass very well. Bass sounds full and detailed. EDM, hip-hop/rap, and even classical sounds crisp and warm.

I downloaded Tidal for desktop and Android to test the audio quality and compare it to Spotify. I get a student discount and opted for the Student HiFi subscription ($10/month). The M3s do indeed sound better when streaming from Tidal with this subscription, as I’m sure most headphones would. The sound is simply more detailed, especially on the desktop app with Master Quality Audio. This is not to say that the M3s don’t sound great when streaming from Spotify because they certainly do. Most people would have to pay $20/month for HiFi and I’m not sure that amount is worth the switch to Tidal. With the codec is set to LDAC on mobile (not available for iPhones) and the upscaling provided by DSEE HX, you simply can’t not enjoy the high-resolution audio quality.

Noise Cancellation:
The noise cancellation is also phenomenal. If you have not yet tried them, I suggest visiting Best Buy or a similar store to experience them. The amount of noise cancellation is truly mind-blowing. I tested them out in a dining hall at my university. Its full loud students and the sound echoes off of the walls. Without music playing and the NC turned on it sounded like a few people were talking from a distance. I was pretty much blown away. With music on, I cannot hear anything but the music. I could see their mouths moving, but couldn’t hear a word of anyone’s conversation.

Design and Comfort:
Compared to the M2s, I was first a little disappointed in the design of the M3s. I thought the leather, textured style looked so good on the M2s. I also was not sold on the copper/gold accents. I don’t think it makes them look like $350 headphones. In a way, this is a bonus because they aren’t necessarily thief magnets (unless they know what their stealing). The design has grown on me since I have had them.  And they are lighter with the all plastic design. Sometimes I think I have scratched one of the ear cups but I can just wipe away whatever scuffs or marks appear on them. The still look brand new after a couple months. More importantly, they are very comfortable. I usually forget I am wearing them after several hours and I find myself sleeping with them on.

TL;DR:
If you want bluetooth, over-ear headphones with the best noise cancellation on the market right now, superb sound quality, great comfort, and a simple design, get them. You won't regret it.

author: Ryan H.
title: Faint crackling, almost like TV white noise, coming from right earphone.
content: First off, I'll start by saying that the noise-cancelling feature on these headphones is awesome.  I mainly bought them to use while I'm studying.  I just started going back to school again and I work full-time, so I need my solitude when I'm trying to focus.  These definitely help with that.  The sound quality is also amazing.  My favorite songs sound phenomenal on these.  The frequency response is excellent.  They even have a good amount of bass, though that's not what they're designed for.  I think they're pretty comfortable as well.  Sometimes I wear them for 4-6 hours at a time, when I'm doing my coursework.  They're fairly light and fit my head and ears well.  I was a little skeptical about the touch controls on the side, but they work just fine.  I haven't had any problems with them.  My only complaint about these headphones is that after the battery life has dropped 10-15% from a full charge, I notice a crackling sound in the right headphone, but only when the noise-cancelling feature is active.  If I switch the headphones around,  I can hear it on the left side.  When you're playing music or watching a video, you don't really notice it, unless you have the volume really low.  If I'm watching a video lecture or instructional video, where there may be pauses in speech or dialogue, it becomes quite annoying.  If you research this condition on the web, others have experienced similar issues and seems that not all devices are affected.  I've even tried updating the firmware as suggested on Sony's website, but it's still the same.  Perhaps I just got a bad set.  These headphones would have easily gotten 5 stars if it weren't for my issue.  Hopefully I can get it sorted out.

author: Drew H.
title: Superb Headphones
content:
I recently upgraded from the ATH-M20X to the WH1000MX3, and wow! I'm no audiophile, mind you, but I think these headphones rock! The noise cancellation on these is really impressive. It's AMAZING at canceling out white-noise such as a fan, dyer, or air plane engines. It doesn't fair quite as well with a stiff clap or penny in the dryer ... BUT It's still does a very good job at dampening them down as compared to non-existent with white noise. I'm also speaking about a test of just noise cancelation alone without music playing. With music playing you're going to need to rely on your spidey senses if someone were to walk up behind you and smack you across the head - you're not going to hear it.

As far as the sound quality, I think its quite a step up from the monitor phones I've been using and they are supposed to be professional quality. The lows are much richer in the new Sony's , and the mids and highs are clear and distinct. The superb sound quality coupled with industry leading noise canceling really takes these headphones to another level.

The only potential complaint I can see is if someone likes it being ear bleedingly loud. These get pretty loud but they won't burst your ear drums like some phones.

I was hesitant about the price, but in the end I'm happy about this purchase.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great purchase
content: Great purchase.  Sony is a silent killer in the headphone sector.  Great work.  A+

author: jennwaine
title: very nice
content: i like

author: Krystle brunette

content:
I was apprehensive with a $350 price point as anyone would be. However, after the easy setup and listening to the first song on this pair of headphones, I was blown away. As soon as I turned on the pair of headphones, there was silence. Then as the song started I could hear nothing but the song and at such a HIGH QUALITY!!! I experimented with the different Surround VPT settings in the app and for different songs I selected the outdoor concert, indoor concert, etc. I felt like I was there.

I am so so very happy, we shall see how the battery life is !!

author: Mark C.
title: Everything Sony said about the improvements is true
content:
I own the 1000XM2's.  Sony said these would be lighter and they are. They said they would sound better, and they sound twice as good, especially after setting your custom EQ settings in the app.  They said the noise canceling would be better and it is.  They said they would be more comfortable, and due to larger ear cups (and the lighter weight), they are.  They said they would look better, and the narrower profile does make them look better.  They did all of this without sacrificing the quality of the construction (I sleep with these on, rolling right over onto my pillow at night).

For me, the much-improved sound quality of music is the most dramatic improvement and the most unexpected, although all the improvements add up to make these vastly improved over the XM2's.

author: Brian Anders
title: The quality versus other headphones is amazing. The noise cancellation is top tier.
content: This item was a "treat yo-self" purchase and I'm more than satisfied with it. The noise cancellation is amazing, especially on flights. I love putting these headphones on my friends or family and seeing their jaws drop when I turn on the noise cancellation.
