author: Michael Anderson
title: Great headphones for the money
content: The Sony WH1000XM3 headphone is quite a good headphone for the money. The noise cancelling and sound quality is stellar, and paired with the ability to adjust the sound through the apps makes it so that I can adjust the headphones to match the type of music or podcast that I’m listening to. I bought the headphones renewed from Amazon Warehouse, and I was initially fearful due to the quality faults that other reviewers talked about. I have been using these headphones almost daily for a month, and I have seen no evidence of cracking along the headband. I do wish Sony had made these headphones from higher quality plastic or metal so that the cracking would not be a concern.

author: Nut
title: Remember to install the app to change settings like 5min shutdown.
content:
Although I gave it 4 stars, the important thing is I'd pick this over others at this price point, the MS Surface Headphones.  Bose lags behind in just about everything, especially software, so it was easy to eliminate.

Surface has better software features but both sound quality and noise cancelling were inferior.  While it is possible for Sony to add these features, they probably won't.

What Surface does better:
- The biggest feature I miss from Surface is the ability to change connected devices.  If you want to switch from your laptop to your phone on the Sony, you have to manually disconnect on the laptop settings before you can connect to the phone. It's not a big deal unless you like to switch often.
- dials give better control than swipes; swiping on the Sony for volume +/- might get mistakened for next track as the can is slanted anyway and "up" actually needs to be diagonal. It's also nice to be able to dial down the environmental noise incrementally. It also takes a while to change volume with swipes.

What Sony does better:
- noise cancelling
- sound quality

author: Brittany Bailey
title: I tested the Bose and Sony and kept the Sony
content: I bought these and the Bose Quiet Comfort Qii whatevers at the same time as all of the reviews were on the fence about which is the best.  Short version: noise canceling is marginally better on Bose, but sound quality for classical and orchestral music was MARKEDLY superior on the Sonys.

It took a week or two to get used to them but they really are great headphones for music and walking around noisy neighborhoods. Their battery life isn't too bad and they charge ultra fast.

author: electrlux
title: Excellent all round design and sound
content:
I purchased these just when my old Bose QuietComfort on ear headphones had one of the ear pads fall off after 3 years of use and I was not a happy camper about it.

So to say that the timing of these being introduced was perfect is an understatement so let's get on with a bit of a review....

Sound
There been lots of reviews online about these it's no secret that the noise cancellation feature is superb on these it's also no secret that the sound is also superb and I found it to be accurate and pleasing to the ear no matter if I've been listening to rock music, classical music come or reggae. Another thing that I'm really happy about is that I can plug these into the TV through the 3. 5 mm cord with an extender and there is no sound delay listening to the TV but I have not yet tried Bluetooth connecting it with the other sound mode yet.

Hand touch features
The hand touch features on the ear outside of the ear pads is nothing less than brilliant and I prefer the motion touch ability to increase or lower the volume change tracks Etc by simply using my hand motion as opposed to a hard Hardware button. Took me about 5 minutes to get used to it but it was pretty intuitive and pretty easy to pick up.

They don't have to rest on the top of your head:

one thing that you won't see in any of the reviews except this one probably is that every pair of headphones I tried on at Best Buy and other places the top of the headphones almost always rested on my head. This was one department where Bose was a leader for me because I was able to increase the size of the headphones and have the headphones stay on my ears and stay on my head without the top actually resting on the top of my head and these Sony headphones have managed to achieve that and I give him credit for it. Having a pair of headphones partially supported with its weight on your head is not good for comfort factor so the fact that these can be expanded still stay on your ear and not be resting on top of your head for me is a big deal and adds to the overall comfort factor. my older Bose on ear headphones or more compact but that's to be expected compared to an over-the-ear Headphone set and although these are bulkier they are still quite portable.

The carrying case
The case that came with it is beautiful it's a hard shell case with a textured finish an open net on the back where you can sleep in a charger or anything else that'll fit and also has storage for your headphones inside along with two more what I call vertical pockets for your charger cord or other peripherals.

Headphone color choice:
I was tossed up on whether to get the black or silver headphones and I'm pleased to say the black ones were the right choice black tennis shoe look smaller aesthetically speaking and the copper colored accents really at A Classy Touch to the design in my opinion. Speaking of designs these are as far as I can tell 100% if not close to 100% plastic but they feel very sturdy and the joints on the swivel for the ear pads are smooth in operation and don't feel like they're going to break very easily unless you find a way to sit on them one day :-)

I'm not going to go into more detail than that because you can find millions of reviews online for these headphones and they will be going into much more detail than I am but I did want to point out a few things that you won't find in other reviews.

These headphones are pricey there's no doubt about it but if she's got the bucks for it don't even blink an eye and order them they're superb

author: Amazon Customer

author: Alex

content:
I use headphones for one month.Compare with Bowers&Wilkins PX. As a result, refused to B&W PX. Both goods bought on Amazon.
B&W PX  have a beautiful design and excellent upper frequencies. Unfortunately, this is the pros. In one year of use, I was not used to the pressure around my ears. Very distracted from the music. Patience enough for half an hour. With the head tilted, the headphones slipped off. Very heavy weight.
Sony WH1000XM3  has all the best. Gently sit on the head. Do not move even when you shake your head. The sound opened after 100 hours of warming up. There was a scene depth.  The basses are great. The headphones are bass heavy, but have a very handy way to configure them to be more reasonable by default.

The stock settings have some sort of “enhancement” setting that produces noticeable distortion and audio artifacts, but if this setting is disabled they sound just as good as my wired Sony V6 headphones.

author: jefFnurk
title: Pretty Good, but not quite the “perfect”/”best” headphones many declare them to be.
content:
Pros: I’ll open this by saying that these are hands down the best sounding pair of headphones I’ve ever owned. I have about 20-30 hours of use and have yet to experience a single BT signal drop. The noise cancelling feature is pretty great. So why not five stars?

Cons
1. The voice mic doesn’t really function for what I need it for (and how I think it should).
2. App/connectivity issues.
3. Probably not useful in some environments.

Details
One. I bought these primarily as a replacement for my wired computer headset I use on my desktop / laptop, thinking they would at least replace my wired/mic’d headset. Unfortunately, there is literally no functionality to be used as a mic’d headset with these. I figured since they can be used as a talk/listen device for calls on a mobile phone, they would function as such on a computer or phone apps. Nope. Don’t fall for it. Move on right now if that’s a thing you’re looking to do. It does state in the manual that these cannot be used with other voice apps on a phone (so don’t expect that either), but my desktop / laptop doesn’t even recognize there is a mic option with these headphones. No connecting to or using it Google Voice/HOuts, or any other VOIP app/recorder, either on the phone or desktop. This is a big flaw, and something people should be fully aware of IMO. It would have been enough for me to not buy these. I’ll be hoping Sony fixes this in a future app/FW update.

Two. There is no Windows (and presumably Mac) app at all for connectivity and settings (iOS and Android only). Windows BT recognizes these as a regular pair of headphones just fine, but you will not be able to adjust *any* internal settings unless you do it from the phone app.

BT battery reporting on the phone app initially did not work and said I had 0% battery, despite the headphones vocal prompt telling me they were fully charged 100% and being able to make all other adjustments in the app (fully connected and functional otherwise). For a bit of back and forth and power ups and downs or both phone and headphones, I got pretty frustrated and was ready to return them for a faulty battery as the app won’t even update the phone firmware if the problem was these because the battery is “too low” and since there’s no way to do it through Windows (USB cable or BT) I was on the verge of packing these up to return. Fortunately, in a last ditch effort, I disconnected and told my phone to “forget” the BT device and when I reconnected the BT device, and was able to finally update. Unfortunately, again, when the headphone FW updated it happened again despite everything else about the app settings functioning perfectly again (clearly a bug Sony hasn’t fixed yet). So I had to do a disconnect and forget and reconnect all over again. There’s really no excuse for the app not knowing the battery level when the actual headphones do.

Another aside too, it would be really nice if these has some kind of “disengage” option, at least for a time, to the touch volume and playback buttons on the right headphone even if only in the app. While it’s nice and handy and works well, I’ve also accidental paused and or advanced or changed the volume of these several times already just brushing it while trying to adjust the comfort on the physical headset. I don't see ever being able to sleep with these on.

Three. Although I knew what I was getting with this style of headphones so I don’t consider it a flaw, so far I’ve only used these in an environment of 70 degrees or less. They will likely be too warm to wear in in non-AC summer setting and I can see getting limited use in the summer months, which wouldn’t bother me much if these also didn’t have a low point operational temp of 32F/0C. While they’ll probably be fine for a brief period in lower temps, in Chicago it spends about 4 months below these temps, I don’t expect using them as makeshift earmuffs in 12 degrees at the L/bus stop is going to always work either.

Again, most of this is not enough to make me regret the purchase or return them, but I’d wish I’d known about a couple before buying. Hope this review may save one or two of you some frustrations.

author: Abobby
title: Beast!
content: Best Headphone out there!!

author: Jay-213

content: These knock out the majority of noise in my environment even without music playing. I was surprised by how long the battery lasts and also the quick re-charge.  The volume control on the right headset works really well.  I love swiping away to change the volume or advance a track.  I can manage any plane trip or work environment with these and no longer have any fear of getting a noisy neighbor.  I also found them to be quite comfortable for hours on end.

The other issue is there's no way to turn off or lower volume of the status voice. The computer voice heard when linking headphones by Bluetooth or turning headphones on/off.
It's a loud voice when you desire silence.

author: Bill Fredericks
title: Great product
content: Controls on the ear set are difficult so I use the application

author: Ozgun Babur
title: Great sound but not the most comfortable
content:
We were able to compare Sony WH1000XM3 with Bose QC35II. They are both high quality, but optimized for very different use cases. At the end, I decided to keep Bose and my wife decided to keep Sony.

Sony is optimized for music listening. It makes you feel you are sitting inside the orchestra, or as if you are the conductor. If the recording is high quality, you hear every detail and you breathe with the musicians. (Default setting is too bassy, but if you decrease the "clear bass" on the equalizer screen in the app, it becomes better.)

Bose, on the other hand, does not immerse you in the music. You feel like sitting among audience, you are not the conductor. You can put a mental distance between you and the music, so that you can concentrate on other things while listening music. Don't get me wrong, the sound is still high quality. And it let's you work.

Sony's "ambient sound control" is very impressive and innovative. Previous to testing it, I did not understand what they are doing from the advertisements and from other reviews. I thought they just let you control the level of noise cancelling, like Bose does. What they actually do is a kind of "anti-noise-cancelling". When you want to hear your surrounding while listening music, you turn surrounding noise on, and the headphone amplifies the surrounding noise for you, blending it with the music. You can put a human voice filter to this amplified surrounding noise so that you hear people but not other low-pitch sounds. They simply cancel out both active and passive noise canceling when you use this feature. You hear people as if you are not wearing any headphones. Isn't that the coolest thing? I can still be around, conversing with people while listening music privately. One thing they can improve in this feature is that I actually want to amplify human sound around me more than the natural levels. It is because I am hearing the music but other people don't, so they don't talk as loudly as they would if they heard the music. Even if I hear them at the same level, I still need to turn the music down to understand them.

If you are walking and listening music, forget Sony. You will hear your steps as "thud"s, 3 times louder than Bose. If you will make a phone call or a conference call on your computer, again forget Sony. Its mic is surprisingly horrible. People won't hear you. I wonder if that can be fixed with a new firmware.

The touch controls on Sony is brilliant, works very nice. I can skip a song in a second, with swipe of a finger. With Bose, I have to search for that multi-function button every time with my right thumb and double click on it. Takes about 5 seconds.

The main reason I prefer Bose is because its ear cups are bigger and deeper. Sony hurts my ears after an hour. I am fine indefinitely with Bose. But my wife is comfortable with both of them. She may have smaller ears than me.

The main reason my wife decided to keep Sony is because it has much better noise cancellation; she does not get distracted while working.

From this review I learned that there is no one ideal headphone to get. Sony can improve by making ear cups wider and deeper, working on that thud sound, and using a decent microphone. Bose can improve by copying the touch controls. Even though its sound quality is inferior, I prefer that while I am working. Do you want to feel like in the studio every time you listen to music? I don't.

One last note .. Sony says it supports aptX low latency codec so that you can use it for watching tv and hearing sounds synchronized with people's lip movements. Bose does not support that. But I have to admit that I don't notice any latency when watching Netflix on my phone with Bose. Maybe that is not very important, or there is something specific to tv that I don't know.

author: Yoonanimous
title: Better than Bose (for me)
content: I love these. My old Bose noise-cancelling headphones created an uncomfortable pressure in my ears. The noise-cancelling function is a little weaker on these but no discomfort.

author: Bianca

I bought this primarily for university, because of its noise canceling options.

The headphones are fully customizable with the phone app.

author: Alexander Koprivnik
title: Perfection.
content: Love.

author: Eduardo Herrera
title: Quality
content: I'm enjoying this headphones very much.

author: Shaun
title: WAYY BETTER THAN BEATS! Seriously. 10/10.
content: I’ve used over the ear beats headphones for many years and after they died, I decided to skip Bose because of the bad ratings and tried these, what a perfect pair of headphones. The sound quality is surreal, and I can hear crystal clear sounds I’ve never heard in some of my favorite songs too - the app to adjust the audio is a great benefit too, even though I prefer the default (no adjustments). Physical quality is what you’d expect, very comfortable, and the noise cancellation is surreal. Standing near my loud ac unit system, I put these on (still turned off) and I could barely hear it, and turned on, it was dead silent. I can’t believe it. Now my wife wants a pair too... if you’re on the fence about which headphones to buy, BUY THESE!

author: Frank K. Gutfrucht
title: These are great headphones
content:
I truly love the sound quality and noise cancelation. I am somewhat a headphone freak, and currently use in ear and on ear headphones. Some wired and some Bluetooth. They range from top of the line Etymotic wired ear plugs with customer molds, to Samsung Icon X gen 2, AKG N60 NC, Bose etc. etc.
My job has me flying all the time and that is what I bought them for. The Etymotic in ear with the molds are awesome too, with their passive noise cancelling, but on long flights it is a pain sometimes to deal with the wire. So, I bought the Sony, based on the reviews I read.
First impression was "Wow" just for the comfort. Even while switched off, they already canceled the outside noise, though their comfy fit. After getting them charged, it was time to try the noise cancelling. I had the washer and dryer running, stood in front to them and pushed the button. It became silent, and their noise just disappeared. I paired them to my Samsung Note 9 via NFC, and the connection was almost instantly. The sound while playing music is just great, and I did tweak my preference through the app manually, adding some clear bass to it. For me they sound awesome, and I am very happy with my purchase.
I will try them out in the airplane on Sunday, during my next trip, but am sure that they will perform better, compared to the AKG, which is a great set as well. I also like the ambient sound feature, when placing the hand on the right side of the headphones.
As to the setting of different activities and ambient sound levels, this feels a bit unresponsive and it will take some time to switch. Not a big deal for me though, since I won't use it.
The phone function works fine, and people can hear me OK. Again, not something that was high on my importance listing.
These are the best over the ear headphones I have ever owned, in relation to ANC, battery life and sound. They are a must have for road warriors and folks who want to enjoy great sound in their own private space, even if they are surrounded by many noisy elements.

author: Anthony C. Cooper
title: Great for Noise cancellation but, avoid if sound is purely or mainly what you are looking for.
content: Actually the sound does not come close to the sound from those small ear buds that ship with expensive galaxy phones.  The AKG buds.  I am convinced that the expensive over ear beats I had were a little better and the little buds are a lot better.  These are more comfortable than beats but still get uncomfortable after being on too long. You know like itchy pillow and these 5 or 10 pounds weren't heavy at the beginning uncomfortable.

author: C.
title: Amazing ANC, good sound, great features, overall excellent product
content:
I read many, many reviews in shopping for a pair of premium ANC headphones.  Most shoppers end up comparing these Sonys and the Bose QC35.  After extensively researching and trying both, I decided on the Sonys and I couldn't be happier.  The ANC is top-notch, indistinguishable from the QC35s and better than any other model I tried.  The touch controls on the headphones are great, allowing me to seamlessly change tracks, increase/decrease volume, and have conversations.  The latter feature drastically reduces music volume and actually amplifies external sound, making conversations quick and easy.  This is a god-send for someone like me who needs the ANC to reduce ambient sound (I have tinnitus in both ears and am very sensitive to sound) and then come back to conversations, when necessary.

The headphones are generally comfortable to wear, although my ears do get a bit warm after a couple hours of non-stop use.  Build quality seems to be great; they feel well-made and substantial without being overly heavy.  In terms of design, the Sonys have an understated elegance that was missing from the QC35 (of course recognizing that aesthetics are purely subjective).

The carrying case is nothing special, but it does serve its purpose just fine and protects the headphones reasonably well.  Charging is a breeze, although the supplied charging cable is shorter than I'd like.

Overall, I am quite happy with my purchase.  $350 for a pair of headphones is a lot of money, but I expect to get many years of use out of these, and their performance is excellent.  If you're in the market, try both these and the Bose QC35, it seems you can't go wrong with either.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Greatest headphones.
content: Greatest of all time. And I own the XM2

author: Michael
title: Better NC and Sound than QC35 II
content:
I wanted a noise canceling headphone to use in the office to block out the annoying chatter. These definitely muffle the environment on their own, but with a little music playing at low volumes you're not going to hear anything going on around you. I compared these to the Bose QC35 II at Best Buy twice, on two different occasions, and both times the QC 35 II with NC engaged gave me an uncomfortable pressure I felt behind the eyes and I left the store with a very slight headache; the Sony didn't have that effect. I've read lots of reviews on the QC 35 II and almost everyone said that's very unlikely to happen to the majority of the population, and if it does happen to you, will go away on its own as you get used to it. The QC35 II did feel slightly more comfortable on the head than the Sony, but the effect is negligible as the Sony are very comfortable on their own.

Sound quality is better than the Bose but both sound really good. The best way I can describe it without getting into technical jargon like lows/mids/highs/frequency range, etc. is to say the Sonys sound more "vibrant" and "alive"

I asked my wife and son to compare the headphones back and forth and they both agreed the Sony's sound better.

The sound out of the box of the Sony is too bass-heavy for me. That can be adjusted with the headphone app that allows you to adjust the EQ which, when used with these settings below, brought out a very pleasant, engaging sound to me:

400 no change
1k +4
2.5k +6
6.3k +5
16k +5
Clear bass 0

That being said, just like people like different desserts and different style of clothes, our ears prefer different sounds. Those EQ settings might do it for you, or it may not, you'll have to play around with it a bit. Or maybe the default sound out of the box will already sound great to you. What's convenient is that you can adjust it to your ear's content.

Which brings up a common complaint about using the EQ "downgrades" you from the better codecs to the standard codec, SBC (which is all that the QC35 II offers by the way). Unless you're a professional audiophile or have the ears of a fox, I challenge most people to even be able to tell the difference between SBC vs the better audio codecs the Sony headphones offer (like aptX for example).

I love my pair of Bose headphones but these Sony are just slightly better in sound and NC. Bose is still the King of Comfort but if you're worried about Sony being uncomfortable don't be. It's like comparing the comfort of a Cadillac to a Lexus (some will just prefer one over the other even though they are both comfortable; that can probably be applied to the sound signatures of both headphones, too.)

author: Jenny D
title: Best wireless noise cancelling headphones on the market
content:
Before trying these I went for the Sennheiser PXC 550 and the Bose QuietComfort 35.  I returned both in favor of these.

These are hands down the best headphones I have ever owned.  They blow the Sennheiser and Bose out of the water.

Good:

- Unbelievable noise cancelling, almost too good!
- Super comfortable
- Lightweight
- Incredible sound quality
- Easy to use, practical features
- Awesome "palm to the outside of ear cup to turn down music and disable noise cancelling so you can hear" feature

The Bad:

- The noise cancelling is so good it's actually dangerous.  It effectively cancels out car horns and trains.  Luckily the app allows you to tweak the amount and type of noise cancelling.
- I never want to take them off

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bought - USED - VERY GOOD
content: I bought these USED- VERY GOOD condition from Amazon Warehouse. Received in the original package with all the accessories. The headphones looked like new and unused. I'm very happy about this purchase. Saved me 100+ $$ on new headphones. I'm pleased with sound quality and mobile application works great. I found somehow difficult to use google assistant with those, however, I'm not using it anyways. Paired well with my Galaxy phone and Samsung TV. Recommend.

The only complaint is that it can only connect to one device at a time, so you need to disconnect it manually each time you want to switch device.

author: Amit
title: Amazing
content: This is beast. Better then bose.

author: Hasan Ismael
title: Amazing Quality
content: highly recommended

author: Alastair
title: CRITICAL FLAW for use with computers! Terrible connection with anything that isn't IOS or Android.
content:
First off, I owned the first gen of these and loved it and everything about this unit's build quality is great. If you only intend to use them with your phone. Definitely pull the trigger. But they were absolutely terrible with my computer and amazon tablet.

And the reason was just verified to me by sony costumer support. The headphone's bluetooth connection by default prioritizes sound quality over connection quality. In practicality, under this setting you can't walk more than a few meters away without connection interruption. In my apartment and elsewhere, I literally couldn't move more than 2 meters or have kind of obstacle (sofa) in between myself and the transmitting device. Even sitting directly in front of my 2016 Macbook Pro, kindle paperwhite, amazon tablet there were occasionally disruptions. However, with my phone the Headphones app can prioritize connection quality over sound quality. When I did this, they were spectacular. I could walk 15 meters with multiple concrete walks in between me and my phone. But without the app on the transmitting device, it is impossible to enable this setting. Reviewing google, previous generations apparently had the ability to change this on the headphones themselves, but for whatever reason that was dropped on the 3rd gen which is seemingly perfect otherwise.. i never had to do this on my mdr1000x's though.

If you're using these mostly for computer use like me, you may be seriously disappointed. I was very excited about these, but I don't need $350 headphones just to make phone listening more convenient, need something to move around wearing while doing work. Otherwise what's the point of being wireless?

Sidenote: The app doesn't seem fully baked through yet even for phone use. Settings in the app seem to disappear and require re-setting often.

author: zach berger
title: Great for listening not for gaming.
content: Great for on the go and listening to music and watching movies but this particular headset is not for gaming since there is not an actual mic built in for communication.

author: M. Martin
title: Functioned exactly as expected
content: Everything was exactly as advertised and worked as expected. There are plenty of fantastic reviews on these headphones compared to the Bose that will detail exactly what you will be getting. I have been using them for several months now and am continually glad that I purchased them.

author: vbunn
title: Great sound quality
content:
Awesome sound
I got these for class and I absolutely loved them

author: Jumpmaster
title: Outstanding Headphones
content: Outstanding noise cancellation, sound quality, and amazing battery life. Bought for a business trip to Saudi Arabia and there had plenty of life for each of the 20+ hour flights. You will not be disappointed. Same price as the Bose QC 35s.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Expensive but good!
content: The quality of the sound and noise cancelling is amazing. It randomly starts making echoey- static noises and difficulty pairing to devices though in both my original pair and the replacement I received which is disappointing for the price. But overall I love them.

author: Jason S Anderson
title: Amazing. 1 Month+ follow up: Still amazing.
content:
These are my first pair of noise cancellation head phones. They are simply amazing. But not having a plethora of experience with other heasphones of this type it's hard to gauge just how awesome these are. I watched MKBHD's review on these and the Bose 700s. He still stuck with these as his daily driver. A co-worker has a pair of these so I got to try them out. I love them. A surprising plus was how compact the case was on these. It's small enough where I'll probably actually use the case and not just toss them somewhere.
--I week follow up: Still in love. Only issue's I've had was quality loss on my PC at work (linux) and that's because it's using the SBC Codec. Once I get it working with LDAC I'm expecting the quality to come back. I use these all day at work and then at home. When I'm going to bed I plug them in. They generally have 40% battery at that time.
--1 month+: Fixed the codec issues at work. I use these for hours literally every day. On a long day I'm usually getting low batter messages maybe an hour before bedtime. I still use the Case every day. It's pretty convienent.
My only gripe with these is I wish it was easier to tell Left from Right. There's a small L and R with the R being red. But in a dark room (spend most of my computing hours with the lights off) it can be hard to tell which orientation they're in when picking them back up. The Bose 700s have a large L and R printed on the speaker foam in the ear can which seems like it might be a better option.
For now I suppose a thin strip of tape on the right side will have to do.

author: yavuzalp yamaner
title: Perfect but little bit big
content: Perfect

title: nice
content: thx

author: shelly bernazzoli
title: Amazing Sound
content: Headphones have great noise cancelling and excellent sound. Clear audio with plenty of base.

author: Heart
title: Worth it
content: I love these headphones. I like that you can put your hand over it and it'll lower the volume for a quick conversation. The noise cancelling feature is also very good. Once you play music you cannot hear anything else. One thing I found disappointing was that of you chose to add Google assistant or Alexa, you lose the noise cancelling feature.  I do with you could keep both but it is what it is.

author: Pro Comp
title: Charging Cord Too Short
content: Just received the headphones and overall quality looks good. Downloaded the Sony Connect Headphone app to my iphone and got a message that the battery level is too low on the headphones to update the firmware. So went to plug the headphones in to charge and found that the charging cord is about 5 inches long. So need to find a wall outlet that is within 5 inches of a flat surface to lay the headphones on. Very short sighted on Sony's part. The charging cord should be longer. Also note that the firmware upgrade takes about 20 minutes.

author: Mark Butterworth
title: Great headphones
content: Very pleased with the headphones!

author: Nathan
title: Awesome noise cancellation!
content: Exactly what all the hype is!

author: Mattan Cohen
title: Absolutely amazing headphones
content:
Bought and returned Bose 35II's and Sennheisers HD1's before landing these gems. Noise cancellation is phenomenal and, unlike Bose's 35ii's, the sound quality isn't compromised by it. The Bluetooth signal never breaks up thanks to their "signal priority" mode (unlike Sennheiser's HD1's) and holy s*** do they sound amazing.

Full bass, crisp mids, soothing highs. Everything from classical to heavy metal sounds mind blowingly good on these bad boys. Highly recommend.

author: Chingu77
title: Definitely worth the money!
content: It's definitely worth the money.  It eliminates all noises around you.  I took it to a Casino and you can barely hear the slot machines and the loud musics they play inside the Casino.  I cannot wait to take it on a plane trip...

author: Miguel Barrio
title: It was great until firmware 4.11
content:
I have two of these units, and a WI-1000x as well. I have owned all versions of this headphone (v1, 2, 3). This v3 WAS great. The latest firmware release end of Jan 2019 DESTROYED noise cancelling, it barely does anything anymore.

If Sony does not fix this ASAP they will lose me as a customer.

author: Neeraj Alavala
title: Amazing Product
content: Amazing sound quality, great for general use

author: Amazon Customer
title: Noise canceling
content: When I googled reviews, I saw that these beat Bose 35 in noise canceling-with some people saying Bose has essentially been knocked out of 1st place. I own Bose 35s.  Sony has done it. Love these.

author: Kunta Kinte
title: As good as the reviews
content: As good as the reviews

author: Ed V.
title: I hardly knew ye
content: These headphones come highly rated both on Amazon and in product review videos.  Out of the box, they would not charge.  After troubleshooting through Sony support - trying everything, different cord, different USB port, restart, factory reset, it would not charge and had to return.  I cannot speak to sound quality or noise cancelling as I never got to actually use as intended.  It's been a long time since I bought a Sony product and not likely to again.

author: Alexander
title: Amazing headphones. Worth it.
content: This is the most I've ever spent on headphones. I have a couple wired pairs that were around $150 each, but are not noise cancelling. The audio quality is similar. You're paying for wireless and noise cancelling. I use these while mowing the lawn and flying and they have made both experiences so much better. Worth it.

author: Rene B.
title: Premium headphones!
content: Sound, feel, function, design...these headphones are classic material!

author: Samuel taylor
title: Best Headphones
content: Great sound and battery life!

author: Basel Abdel-aziz
title: Great sound quality but not controls
content: Amazing sound and noise cancelation quality, but touch controls don't always work

author: Rob
title: Ditched the Bose for them
content: Ditched my Bose QC2 for these and haven’t regretted. The Bose were great, but these are just better. In every way. EVERY. WAY.

author: person
title: overall i had a better set from wish.com
content: I like the headphones overall but they have a nasty tendency to have no volume in one ear or the other and this should not happen if this product is this expensive. I have sunk a certain amount of my paycheck into having my own world with this setup but when it malfunctions I find myself very upset with the manufactures and the Overall Amazon REVIEW person, you should be ashamed of your company for producing this item at this cost when it does this!

author: Sean T. McFarland
title: Power Cord
content:
These headphones are flat-out amazing.  Noise cancelling is phenomenal and the sound quality is VERY impressive.  My one and only complaint that I just discovered is that Sony uses a proprietary charging cable for the headphones.  That was not a problem until I couldn't find the cable and just reached for a micro USB, only to realize they are not the same.  I found the cable but will be investigating whether I can purchase a spare.

Update: These evidently use a USB Type C connector.  I have regular and micro cables, as well a Apple's lightning cables spread throughout my entire house, but this is the first device I have purchased that used the Type C.  Looks like there may be a drive to make it an industry standard?  Just be aware.

author: omu
title: Awesome sound, ANC and battery life, and little else.
content:
I really wanted to fall in love with these headphones, especially considering the price point. The sound is awesome, the ANC is good, battery life is excellent. And that's pretty much it for me.
1. The touch sound control on the right can is a pain to use, and easy to invoke other commands.
2. Inconsistent actions on the power button. Sometimes it'll turn off after 2 seconds as design, sometimes after 5, sometimes pairing mode will be invoked, sometimes it will give me a battery life read out etc.
3. Pairing more than one device is a PITA; you have to disconnect one before reconnecting the other. Gets real cumbersome when switching between laptop and phone.
4. Could not get it to work with VOIP apps on my laptop/phone. Pretty much a deal breaker.

The engineering of basic functionality on these cans is pretty good. However, I went in wanting something that was more general purpose and that could seamlessly handle my requirements. Should have done more research, I guess. Returning them.

author: Brooke Smith
title: Noise Cancelling works very well.
content: Amazing product. A little bulky for my small head but great quality.

author: Jon
title: Life changing for travel and coffee shop working
content: Overall fantastic. These have made a huge difference when I fly and when I need to focus while at places like coffee shops. The touch controls are a bit harder to figure out, but overall I highly recommend these.

author: simon
title: Good
content: Love Sony

author: vst
title: Pros and Cons from a new user
content:
I have been a loyal Bose fan ever since headphones became standard gear.  I currently use the Bose QuietComfort 35 noise cancelling and they are a great headset.  But I've never liked the Multi Function button.  When I read the Sony reviews, mostly very positive, I decided to give the a try.  General review is the headphones are great and they have unseated my Bose.

Pros
- Comfortable (similar to Bose)
- Long battery life (not certain how much longer than the Bose)
- Sound Quality ( a bit better than the Bose)
- Ease of functions like pause, volume, skip tracks, etc (much better than Bose)
- Range (distance from Bluetooth music source, much longer than Bose)
- Charge time (also not certain how different from the Bose)
- Noise cancelling (similar to Bose)
- Sony headphones app (does a lot of things to customize the headphones, Bose app not very good)

Cons
- The function touch pad is sensitive and easy to unintentionally do something like skip the track when adjusting the headset on your ears.  It's annoying when it happens but as time goes by I'm getting better at avoiding that.  And the Bose multi function button annoys me as well so no loss or gain here.
- They are large but so are the Bose, really the same size.
- Price (but the same as Bose)

I definitely recommend these as a buy.

author: Happy Amazon Customer
title: excellent headphones and noise cancelling
content: These are excellent headphones. Greg for drowning out babies, chitter chatter and such on the plane. Perfect sound of music selections. Also, to just dampen room noise I have put the on without turning them on just to take a nap. Couldn't be happier!

author: Nuanen
title: Stunning noise cancellation, brilliant controls.
content: Just stunning performance. Brilliant controls.

author: Maureen Jepson
title: beautiful sound
content: I love these earphones.. I had the previous model. I can sit and watch videos on my laptop and not hear anything going on around me. I use them on the plane a lot to watch movies while in flight. I've had some difficulty with the volume control but it might be a case of needing to check the directions again.

author: kgp
title: Best Noise Cancellation
content: Hands down beats the Bose lineup in terms of noise cancelling. If noise cancellation is a priority, this is definitely a worthy purchase. It’s got great sound quality, and it’s a great set of headphones. The controls are a little bit odd to use, although it is a pretty cool way to control volume with a slide of a finger. The biggest critique would have to be of the design. They are big and clunky. Definitely heavier than anything on the Bose lineup. Still a great set of headphones, and wouldn’t hesitate spending the money for these.

author: Faramarz Munshi
title: The best headphones I've ever had
content:
Literally the best headphones I've ever had. Incredibly quick to charge. Better noise cancelling than the Bose QC25s that I used to have. Better sound quality once the mixer has been changed a bit in-app to adjust for your listening preferences. The sound quality is crisp, it handles bass fantastically, and is amazing for every day listening and workouts. They do feel a bit plasticy, but other than the feel which I've been getting off all recent headphones lately, it does its job perfectly. Would recommend any day to anyone looking for the premium!

It's worth the money.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazing for flying
content: I seriously love these headphones. They sound great, they feel great, they look great, everything. I used them on an airplane and was amazed how much of the sound they cancelled. Also, the battery lasts forever too! Overall I'm so impressed I'd buy these over and over again.

author: Soo D
title: Fantastic noise cancellation but perhaps less plastic
content: The noise cancellation on this set of headphones is amazing. No regrets giving away my Sennheisers.  Battery life is great. Would have liked a little more metal on the product to make it a little more premium.

author: MS
title: We call these the headphones of the gods at my house
content: They are absolutely amazing, feels like magic.  I am not sure how else to explain it without you wearing them yourselves.  I use on train and at work.  Since the new paradigm is to smash people together as close as possible at the office....noise canceling earphones are the new cubicle.  These are very nice, so far no squeaking or weakness in the joints as others have complained.

author: GRYGU
title: Excellent headphones
content: I had no idea noise cancelling technology could be this good. These things are near life changing. Highly recommend.

author: WaveTheory
title: Current ANC Champs
content:
I have almost nothing negative to say about these. If forced, I'd say they can make my ears a little warm(?). But that's if I'm forced.

Sound quality is really good, even with BT and ANC running. ANC may be slightly surpassed only by the Bose 700s, but the Sony is the more complete package. The sound signature is bass forward, which may be too much for some. The included app does allow you to back off the bass, though, so don't let that be a reason to not go for these. There are better sounding headphones for $300-350, but they won't be noise cancelling or bluetooth.

I consider myself an audiophile and I think these headphones are amazing for what they do. The sound and feature set are all really impressive. If you're interested in high end ANC headphones, these are top dog right now.

author: DaveF
title: Work great and comfortable with glasses
content: They work great! This is my first pair of noise cancelling headphones. Before I had earbuds that blocked a good amount of noise, but these headphones are so much better at blocking ambient noise and more comfortable. I wear glasses and they are still comfortable. The only issue I've experienced with wearing glasses is that some ambient noise can be heard. Voices tend to cut through when in noise cancelling mode with the no additional audio being played - but turn on music and it blocks out all background noises. Great at blocking white noise. I use these in an office setting.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Peace at last
content: The price oh my goodness but the job oh yes. I normally write reviews but after some time I think I should. I had these headsets for a while now and now I can give a proper review. I could not hear anything with low volume on I gotten scare so many times. The setting on the apps are cool too. Play with the environment and sounds and get a cool effect. Trust me try this. Listen to the song lil babe and put it on club and excited and you will sound like you are in a bass boost car. Like what in the world type of headsets are these. I highly recommend to anyone who listen to all genres of music and want a certain sound to go with it. As well peace and quiet. I tried them at school in a busy mall area hardly couldn't hear anyone it just sound like soft muffles when nothing is playing. when a song is playing on low volume too there is just the song anything else. I let my friends try it on and the same for them too. In the morning a plane passes by my school and I couldn't even hear that. The price is no but the result and yes. Enjoy these headset, Bye!

author: BNG
title: Great sound - Comfortable to wear - Great App
content:
These headphones far exceeded my expectations. The headphones have a pretty neutral sound, but the phone app is great and has an equalizer so you can adjust as needed. It has 3D sound (if you have a music service that supports it) that sounds amazing. Touch controls could be a little better, but far from annoying. It comes with a nice case, and I love that I can use them even if the battery is dead. Really, the only complaint I have is that the USB cable to charge the headphones is a little small - like 6 inches long, which is a bit of a let down considering the price. The noise cancelling "atmosphere" they generate can be a tiny bit uncomfortable when things are silent, but I think that's true of all noise cancelling headphones so not surprising. When music is playing, you can't even notice it.

These are much more comfortable than the Bose headphones I tried out, and they feel solidly built, like a high end Sony product does.

My last pair of Sony headphones lasted me 7-8 years (they still work but I needed noise cancelling at work) and I plan to use these just as long. I paid just under $300 and they were a 100% worth it. I would happily buy them again. Don't hesitate if you have been considering wireless noise cancelling headphones.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Noise cancelling is subpar
content: Just bought these on the holiday sale and was excited to put them on. At first glance seemed really nice. Nice case, felt comfortable. Turned them on and I could still here everything. Put the tv on and it barely filtered it out. Next tried to put on music low volume. Still the TV was a big distraction. Put on my Bose QC 15 (yes, the very old model) and low and behold, with music at half the volume, the TV was not able to be heard. With all the reviews I am very disappointed. No way these will filter out those babies crying on airplanes as well as my old Bose did.

author: G. K.
title: The headphoones to beat
content: Fantastic quality headphones.  Ordered the white ones but received the black pair.

author: Spawnzilla
title: Good but control could be improved
content:
Fit is comfortable and sound is pretty good.

I'm not a fan of the touch functionality. Double tapping to pause music causes a loud drum noise into the ear-cup.

Main issue is that it does not have noise cancelling control through an analog switch. So every time you turn it on, the ANC button needs to be pressed twice to turn of noise cancelling. Or at lease have default setting for startup.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good Headphones
content: Unlike some reviewers, I don't have the luxury of having tested every set of headphones on the market. I've owned Beats studios for years, and felt it was time for an upgrade. But here's the deal, you can't go wrong buying these, it's a great headphone. The noise cancellation is incredible, the sound quality is damn good, and I like the option of changing EQ settings through the dedicated app. Where the unit falls is the loudness. I like loud music, and these headphones don't 100% satisfy that. Whenever I'm listening to music, I feel like I should be able to get another notch or 2 from the volume. Regardless, coupled with the noise cancellation, you will be totally immersed in your music, and with the battery life and comfort of these, you'll be able to listen for hour without an issue. I won't lie, the gestures throw me off a bit as well, but I don't care enough about them, it's quicker to pull out my phone and change the volume or song from there anyways.

author: JAM
title: Don't buy if you use it in flight
content: Sony made a great product but didn't think that most flyers using these headphones would want to use them to eliminate plane noise while sleeping.  These headphones will turn off if no sound or Bluetooth connection is present unless you are using the cable. Sony could have added a setting to allow the headphones top stzy on at all times, unles one turns it off. Ridiculous!!

author: Alaskan Curmudgeon
title: Best headphones for noise cancellation
content: Best noise cancelling head phones I’ve ever worn.  Very comfortable.

author: Jake Chamseddine
title: Best headphones I have ever used.
content:
I am completely blown away by these headphones.

I have been on the Boise 35 bandwagon for a while now and didn't think that I would ever be able to stray away from them. Sony sent me a pair of WH-1000XM3's to test out and I have to say I fell in love instantly.

From the moment I got a chance to set these up with my phone and laptop they have not come off my head. The noise cancellation is something I had never experienced before. It feels as if the headphones are pressured to my head perfectly. I feel like I have been lied to by all other form of noise cancellation headphones. From editing videos, listening to music, or just browsing youtube videos, it all feels like a new experience with these things on my head.

To top off the noise cancelation, the headphones are beyond comfortable and have an extremely unique touch interface on the right ear. I didn't know how I was going to feel about this when I initially used the headphones. Swiping volume up and down/skipping/pausing songs by swiping over my ear felt very foreign at first. But this quickly changed with using the headphones for a couple of hours. It now feels like second nature and is a feature of the headphones I don't know I will be able to look past in the future.

To top it all off, the audio sounds honestly amazing. I feel like When I put these on it feels like I am listening to songs I know and love for the first time again.

Battery has been great to me thus-far as well AND it has a USB-C charger!? Perfect for my workflow.

To wrap it up, I am in awe with these headphones and I think they have blown all other competition out of the water. I feel like these will be my go to headphones for quite some time.

Thanks Sony, incredible product!

author: Laurel Bluhm
title: Great sound but the microphone stinks for calls.
content: As headphones they are great, but as a headset for calls they are lousy.  The voice mic is terrible and I usually have to take them off so people can hear me on the phone.  If the microphone worked properly they would be 5*.  I bought these as Amazon return item, so maybe they are defective.

author: Jonathan Palley
title: Great quality BUT doesn’t connect to multiple devices like Bose does
content: Great noise cancellation and sound quality.  Annoyingly doesn’t doesn’t connect to multiple devices like Bose does

author: Hunter
title: Awesome noise canceling but expensive
content: Really nice replaces an old Bose I do believe the Sony’s have an edge on noise canceling now. These headphones are really nice and well made too. Only downside is they don’t work while charging which is a real bummer. I haven’t gotten 30 hours out of it yet but 23 was the longest so far.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good while functioning
content:
Good product while functioning.
I have received a product which the left ear speaker stopped working during the second week of receiving it

author: John P.
title: Sound quality
content: I’ve used Bose for years.  The noise cancelling is a bit better with the Bose, especially on an airplane.  However, the sound quality of the Sony is far superior to the Bosr

author: Alvaro
title: Low quality. To bad from Sony
content:
Great sounding headphone, built quality looks cheap.
The worst part is that after three recharging cycles it did’nt hold another charge, the red light blinks and there is no way it will charge. Have tried it with different chargers, all of great quality to no avail.
I will try to have them replaced.
I am not a satisfied customer.

author: Lacey Long
title: Amazing sound, but poor connectivity
content: These headphones had some absolutely amazing drivers for incredible sound, but they had a really hard time connecting to my phone and computer. They could connect but would sound very distant until I turned them off and on multiple times. The touch-controls on the side rarely worked, which was pretty frustrating. When these headphones worked, they were incredible, but it seems like I either got a defective pair or that Sony still needs to work out a few bugs.

author: Madeline McCombe
title: BRUH I LOVE THESE HEADPHONES
content: Dude. Listening to music with these headphones is on a whole other level than listening with earbuds. A truly magical experience. It's also great to drown out coworkers and office noise. A worthwhile purchase!

author: Darrell
title: Great with noise - so/so with sound quality - terrible mic
content: As expected, the microphone on this headset cannot really compete with a good headset and I ultimately decided the sound quality on my headset was better than the mic on my Sony, so I returned the Sony headphones.  All ANC headphones have some issues with sound quality as compromises have to happen, but the quality just wasn't there for me to warrant the expense.  I did not experience any quality issues with the headphones and for most people the sound quality would be great.  I use really nice wired open can headphones and they are definitely a notch or two up in sound quality for me.

author: Melissa
title: Quality off the chart
content: These are amazing

author: Amazon Customer
title: You might want to update the headphone software using the Sony Headphone app.
content:
Likes:
- shipping was super fast - product arrived 1 week earlier than estimated
- the sound is create and levels of bass, treble, vocal can all be configured using the app.
- it fits perfectly over the ears and very comfortable to wear.
- battery really charges to over 70% in under 15mins and lasts longer than you'll ever need.
- the NC (noise cancellation) mode feels like in a really quiet distant forest  with nothing but your thoughts.

Dislikes:
- the charging cable is too short (maybe 10cm) in length

author: Andrew Hanshaw
title: Maybe not worth the price, but they are very quality.
content: I'm not a headphone professional by any means, but I can tell you that they work really well. A little expensive for my taste, but I wanted some wireless headphones that would last me a while. The noise cancelling is really great (hard to get used to at first). This came in handy on my four hour flight to San Diego. No complaints here other than the price.

author: Hamid
title: Great headphone with horrible microphone
content: At the start, I really liked how these headphones sound. They were not that far from the AudioTechnica M50x IMHO. However, I bought this mainly for noise cancellation and online conferences. If you are planning to use this for calls (Skype, Zoom, phone calls, etc) stay way. The microphone on these is TERRIBLE to the degree that it's unusable. It's depressing to have this kind of microphone on such a great headphones. I returned them as one of the main purposes of using these is not achievable. I hope Sony fix the microphone on their next version.

author: Muriel Msalwa
title: Great product :) am happy :)
content:
Overall - 4.5 stars: I have only had them for about 6 or so weeks now. I like the color. It's neutral and yet very chic ;) .As it is getting colder, they keep my ears warm :)
Noise cancelling (4 stars) - I only like it when am on the train or seating in the office. When I switch to walking in the park or on the street, I don't particularly like the ambient sound. However, I once left the office and walked to Times Square, NYC. The purpose was to see if I could notice the change in the level of outside noise as I approached TS. It was pretty impressive, there was no change. Same when I walked into the subway :) :)
Sound quality (4.5 stars) - AMAZING
Volume control (2 stars) - For some strange reason I find it difficult to control the volume (swipe up or down). Maybe its just me but I think it could be better.
Bluetooth connectivity (1 Star) - when am around Grand Central, I get some sort of interference. Maybe this has nothing to do with the headphones and something to do with my cell phone connectivity....but its annoying!!

author: Michael Schell
title: Loves these!
content: My mower is a Scag Turf Tiger 2 with a 37 hp efi Vanguard motor. It is very loud and they do a very good job at noise cancellation. Sound quality is very good.

author: James Perry
title: Great for most uses except exercising
content: I liked it for public settings where I wanted to seclude myself but it wasn’t great for a work out or any sort of exercising.

author: Reviewer
title: Impressive
content: These are my first set of noise cancelling headphones and I'm very impressed. The battery life is phenomenal. The noise cancelling is incredible. I wish that the noise cancelling didn't turn on automatically, though. Also, the Android app is a little confusing at first but you eventually figure things out.

author: CubeJitsu
title: Absolutely Amazing
content: I am not a headphones expert or an audiophile so don't take my review as serious as some others but I have had my share of budget and nice headphones (non-ANC and ANC) and these are amazing! The ANC is incredible even when you're not playing music and it makes it a lot easier to drown out all the chattering when doing homework or something. The sound is great as well (remember, I'm not an audiophile) and I generally listen to pop, classical music, R&B, and modern instrumental songs and I must say the sound is crystal clear and even on the higher end sounds great. The build quality is good, I guess, only time can really tell, and I'm a huge fan of the touch sensitive controls and had no problems with them. I did hear that phone calls are bad on these headphones and I can agree they're not the greatest and the other person on the end of the line was asking where I was, but I really don't use phone calls through headphones anyway. Overall, awesome headphones with great battery life where you can drown out the world!

author: Leonardo Marenco
title: no funcionan
content: no cargan, no funciona la cancelación de sonido. solo funcionan con cable de audio, como cualquier auricular de 5 dólares.

author: Trajon
title: Best sounding headphones I have.
content:
After reading extensive reviews I plunged deep into buying this model since I really wanted a pair of headphones that were adapt to  noise canceling features, while having great sound quality. For me, these do the job nicely, having wide support added with the app included for the sony's in the playstore/itunes libraries.

One thing, however with these models to be aware of is the build quality seems to be a possible issue with these headphones. Previous models have been known to have bad design around the head band, and for my model, these headphones have started to creek when I initially place them onto my head. As many people I have seen have this issue, this seems to be a design flaw presented in this model that is equivalent to other previous models. However, for that point, when well taken care of the noise cancel quality is top tier, as well as the sound quality delivered in many different kinds of environments, so for those qualities I do recommend, however be careful when using these, preferably do not use for vigorous activities outside due to the build quality possibly being diminished by usage.

author: Jonathan R
title: Great headphones but pricey
content: I would have been just as happy getting Sony's $100 noise cancelling headphones

author: Ivan H. Colon Nicolau
title: Best NC headphones hands down
content: Love these headphones, very comfortable, long battery life, impressive noice canceling can’t complain, just plain love these cans

author: B Forbes
title: Changed everything!
content: I think this is a situation where you don't know what you've been missing out on, until you're exposed to it. These noise canceling headphones are the best decision I've made (electronic-wise) in a long time. The sound quality is outstanding, I love the hand-hovering feature, and the design is incredibly sleek. I would give caution that these feel rather fragile; I certainly handle these with care. But, I tested the TaoTronics "equivalent" and easily stuck with Sony.

author: Hossam Ali
title: Amazing
content: I loved this one very much it's the best

author: mehdi h.
title: Good pair of headphones
content: Haven't fully tested yet. material quality was good. heaphones are extremely light. Didn't find any defects or something. Highly recommend the product.

author: Todd G
title: headband hurts, good otherwise!
content: starts hurting the top of my of head after about 45 minutes. I love the headphones otherwise. I just adjust the position and wait another 45 minutes...

author: B. Clarke
title: THE BEST !
content: ABSOLUTELY LOVE THESE !!! I have the Bose but these, hands down, are so much better, worth every penny. I travel a lot and love to sit back, put them on and zone out. Blocks out engine noise and crying children.

author: STEVE CHRISTIE
title: Perfect
content: Exactly what I was looking for!

author: J
title: Good headphones
content: Bought right before a long flight.  They got the job done, I didn't hear any of the typical plane noise, music was clear and good quality.  I also use these while mowing the lawn, they work great for that also.  I am happy with the purchase.  Battery last a very long time.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Get one
content: Great all around

author: Kim J.
title: Sony Quality!
content:
Insane noise cancelling especially when compared to the Bose version. I've trialed both head phones for about three months now and both have their strengths.

Sony: Much better noise cancelling (night and day when compared to Bose). Battery life is more reliable and faster charging, USB-C advantage. More comfortable and classy imo than Bose. Hand over the ear to hear outside audio was a neat feature but most of the time you end up taking off the headphones anyway if it is something speaking to you.

Bose: Can switch between multiple paired devices seamlessly. Microphone is higher quality and reduces outside noise much better. Audio jack is bizarre, it has two different males sizes because the headphones don't accept the typical 3.5mm.

Both had equally as good a case but I would give Sony the win, as an avid traveler these were infinitely more powerful in the noise cancelling category and I could wear them for longer periods of time than with the Bose.

author: Ryan
title: Beats the Bose QuietComfort II by a lot.
content:
I bought the QuietComfort II and WH1000XM3 and compared them back to back. Bose does three things better: Aesthetics, controls, and microphone. I think the Bose just looks better, but personal preference. I'm a huge fan of buttons instead of touch controls, my biggest complaint with the Sony's is that I'll swipe to change the volume and it'll change the song. Finally, the microphone on this is just bad.

These do everything better than the Bose otherwise, especially when it comes to sound. I used a DT770 Pro and a BD 990 Pro as a daily driver for years, so when I put the Bose on I was astounded at how bad the sound was. I have $50 Bluetooth earbuds that sound better. The XM3s sound just as good as my DT770s, if not better. The bass is very clear and crisp, but not overpowered. Bose's noise cancellation might be a hair better, but I could just barely hear the noise cancellation ambiance, which annoyed me. Did not have that problem with the XM3s, and the noise cancellation is still very good.

Finally, the App allows so much more features for the XM3s thant the QC35. Bose's app is just... there, where the Sony app you can actually do a lot to customize the headset sound. Overall, it wasn't even a question at which was better. Sony easily takes the cake here

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent NC Headphones!
content: In my opinion these are the headphones to beat right now. The are extremely comfortable and put no pressure on the ears even for people with large ears! The noise cancellation is the best I have heard and the sound quality is great. Yes they are expensive but no more than Bose and I highly enjoy them.

author: asdf
title: Bad Call Quality/Features Only Work Through Cellphone Bluetooth
content:
When listening to music via bluetooth on my phone, these are the best headphones I've ever owned.

BUT...

When I use these to make a call, it sounds like I'm under water. I was hoping that this issue was fixed when people started saying they got a replacement and the issue went away (i.e. they fixed the manufacturing issue) but unfortunately this is not the case.

Secondly, when I use the app to adjust the equalizer to my liking then use the headphones plugged into my computer to stream music, the equalizer settings revert back to default. Really disappointed by this as I don't want to have to buy an unlimited data plan for my phone to be able to stream music while at work (no wifi available).

Will be returning and purchasing the QC35 II instead. Big bummer.

author: BA
title: Almost perfect
content: I love the headphone voice quality is great, noise cancelling works great, but the only issue I see it controls, when you try to skip a track it won't skip or you have to do it again and again. You might have to control from your phone at times. I wish there was a button on it instead of swipe feature.

author: Robert Sch
title: Must buy for music lovers
content:
Best headphones I’ve ever used. It’s like you’re meant to listen to music with these!

Considering to get the Bose 700? Let me save you the hassle and recommend you to get these instead. Infinitely better than the Bose 700s.

Music is full and brought to life. Great range and great depth. Hearing notes in music I never noticed was there. Unlike the Bose 700s, which muffled the music.

Must buy for music lovers.

Only issue I have is some slight difficulty with the volume control, but that’s more of a me issue. I’m not familiar with the interface yet.

author: Brian Alvarez
title: Comfy, great Noise Cancelling, Enough volume, but I like it louder
content:
Quick Summary: IF YOU LIKE MUSIC LOUD DO NOT GET THESE. They give you more than enough loudness and bass and are super comfy. Noise/Ambient sound cancelling is top notch.

Full Review:
I bought these Headphones with the expectation that they were the top of the line in all aspects but while they are absolutely phenomenal in Noise cancelling and ambient cancelling, they are most certainly not at all that loud. They are loud enough if you listen to music. At a loud enough volume, but personally I wanna feel heavy bass and loud sound and this just doesnt give you that. It give you a little more than enough.

What I can attest to is how comfy they are. I have glasses and a big head so if they were too clamping I would've had a headache. I've had them on for 2 hours with no fatigue or hot ears.

The case they come in is pretty nice and comes with the 3.5 mm cord that's a good length, airline adapter and USB C charger. USB C is great for charging time reduction and it matches my Galaxy S9's port so I can charge these using my phones charger which is nice

author: AMNYA
title: Too early to judge, but for now, its awesome
content: Awesome headset. Will update the review once i use it more :)

author: Lee J
title: Lawnmower tamer
content: Makes my 22 hp Kawasaki lawnmower engine that sits right behind me sound like a large fan. And that is before I turn the music on. Can hardly tell the mower is running with music playing. Very happy with this purchase.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Disappointed
content:
After about a month of use, day after the return window closed, left ear cup started making a white noise like sound whenever I put them in active noise cancelling mode. After a couple of google searches it turned out to be a known issue that Sony ignoring.
I suggest you go with the Bose QC3 I definitely wish I had.

author: Flavio55
title: Buy earpad coverings too
content: I use these for my workout and I blast them all day battery life is long even at max volume. I have no complaints except for one if you sweat too much buy earpad coverings it will prevent the sweat from running inside between the padding and headphone plastic( thats if you use them to workout and sweat too much) sound quality is great theres no complaint at all.

author: HA shopper
title: Excellent sound & noise cancelling, terrible mic
content:
Everything excellent, except the mic. Mic has severe echo and sounds muffed when I call anyone. Mic basically unusable. I will have to return it if no fix is possible in a few days. The noise cancelling and sound are top notch. What a shame!

I strongly suggest people try out the mic before the return deadline, see if you can live without the mic. The large number of reports on this problem found online indicate this is a systemic defect. Sony - do you have an answer to it?

author: Jonathan Locke
title: I don't usually write reviews, but... these are pretty spectacular
content: Setup was easy, noise cancellation works better than I expected and the sound quality is truly great on these bluetooth headphones (which I've never experienced before). I'm impressed. I haven't bought a Sony product in years, but Sony is in top form with these. Can't speak to the battery life yet since I just got them yesterday, but overall they seem well worth the extra money.

author: RBB
title: Noise canceling good. Sound pretty good. Difficult to use with multiple devices.
content: The quality of the product is good. The noise canceling is good: have sat in long journey with rowdy teens and their loud music without an issue. The sound quality is than Bose but not quite as good as Sennheisier to my ears: the separation is not as good as I'd like it for my music. The connection will drop a couple of times every hour even if my phone is in my back pocket. Cannot use with 2 iOS devices easily, so have to "forget" the connection on the device I want to use and repair (this is not a problem unique to Sony though). Have not used for phone calls.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good
content: Liked All

author: Skip Nelson
title: They are very comfortable
content: I wanted a better pair of Bluetooth headphones to listen to my mixes with - I am a recording engineer and figured after reading all the reviews that i would get this pair -- After fiddling with all the app crap -- and then finding the correct EQ setting which there is only one - all the rest are worthless - they do not make me want them except that they are comfortable to wear - I have a pair of Bludio turbo's that I got on eBay brand new for $23.00 that sound fantastic and I do not think that the extra $350.00 is worth the comfort thing at all -- I have to keep them as I do not return already worn stuff for a month and then return them knowing they are going to send them to somebody else

author: sc_demandred
title: Good, but not as good as the MDR 1000X
content:
I bought this new pair when my Sony MDR 1000X finally broke in the same way that many other people experienced with that product. That pair was excellent except for the physical flaw that eventually caused them to break, so I was hoping the new one would measure up.

THE GOOD: In terms of sound quality and noise canceling, they work very well. The Wirecutter claimed there's a sensation of "eardrum suck," but I don't get that at all. The right cup gesture controls still work well toplay/pause, control volume, rewind/fast-forward, and skip ahead. The swipe-foward-and-hold in order to fast-forward isn't my favorite control method, but it does work (mostly; see below). So far, they've proven to be just as durable as the MDR 1000X were before they broke. It also looks like there's been a change in the design of the arch (What DO you call that part?) so that it appears to concentrate force more vertically; hopefully that will prevent the breakage that us MDR 1000X owners experienced.
The battery life is still excellent, and this model seems to charge much faster than the MDR 1000X did.

THE BAD: The biggest complaint I have is that the headphones often lose the right cup controls, so I'll be double-tapping like crazy in order to pause the podcast I'm listening to, all to no avail. It's not clear what causes this; sometimes I'll be at the edge of Bluetooth range for the phone and get audio stutter, and when I move back in range, the controls are still working. Other times, I'll do the same thing, and they aren't. Sometimes the controls aren't working and I've never been out of range of my phone. There's no way to discern the cause. The software app seems like it should allow for a lot more customization than it does. I would really like to be able to set the double-tap length, but I don't see an option for it. I like the voice notifications for everything except the notification when the headphones drop to 10% battery; I don't need that warning, I always use them until they shut off and then recharge them. I wish I could shut off that one notification, but you have to shut off all voice prompts or none, and the info panel seems to imply that the battery notification might not shut off even if you do turn off all voice prompts.
The controls on the right ear cup work most times, but often they have trouble discerning between when I'm changing the volume and when I'm trying to fast forward a podcast. Sometimes the fast-forward gets detected as a skip. I would really love to be able to change it so that a single swipe forward is a 15-second fast-forward while swipe-forward-and-hold skips to the next podcast, because I use the latter far more frequently.
The change from a leather cover to plastic on the outside of the ear cups makes them feel cheaper. It was a nice luxe touch on the MDR 100X that is gone.

I would still recommend these headphones to people, but without the enthusiasm that I recommended my pre-breakage MDR 1000Xs. I don't know if I would go back to Sony over-the-ear phones the next time I'm in the market for noise canceling headphones.

author: LAA
title: Love these!
content: Excellent.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Stylish and Great Sounding
content: The look great, they are light and thus feel great.  The audio is amazing, the noise cancelling indeed matches the hype.

author: Chris A.
title: Best Noise Cancelling Headphones
content: I have the Bose QC35 and the Beats Studios. Each of those two headphones are great and have a time to be worn. But these Sony WH1000XM3 headphones are the BEST in comfort, noise cancellation, and sound quality. The app that is available from Sony is excellent. You can adjust your sound to what you want to hear and how you want to hear it. I travel by plane around 2-3 times per quarter and using the noise cancellation on an airplane is amazing. I can wear these headphones for 3-5 hours and will not feel ear fatigue from the cushions. The ear pads are soft and the headband does not hurt with long periods of use. The carrying case is light and thin, but it will work fine for my traveling needs. I am glad I purchased these WH1000XM3's. Now my wife wants a pair...

author: Da Man
title: NOT WORTH THE PRICE
content: I am so disappointed in SONY.  The noise cancellations is really good. But when it kicks in the EQ really changes to a dull tone.  If you use the headphones without turning it on the sound is pretty decent.  I think the noise cancellation affects the the overall EQ and it distorts at a very low level.  What a lousy mid range - very muffled.

author: Ben Queliza
title: noise cancelling
content: excellent

author: T. Kennedy
title: A great listening experience
content:
Pros:
- the charge lasts for days and recharges are very fast
- easy to figure out how to use
- excellent noise cancelling. I work around air compressors and they do a pretty darn good job of dulling that sound
- sounds are clear and crisp
- comfortable

Cons:
- A little heavy (but all the good things make it worth it imo)

author: Noam Manor
title: Great audio performance
content:
Amazing headphones
Better audio quality than bose.

author: Dan D.
title: Earplugs are better at noise cancellation
content:
I bought this over the Bose mainly based on a highly upvoted review, claiming that the headphones blocks the reviewer's wife's voice. I suspect she was messing with him by mouthing words in silence.

I'm in coffee show right now that's mostly empty (around 20 tables), except for my table and one other table about 15ft away, with a few women chatting. The MX3 does NOT block those female voices.

I've cycled through the three noise management settings: Ambient Sound - useless, Ambient Sound Control Off - muffled background noise, and Noise Cancelling - the quietest. The annoying sound of the coffee grinder is blocked quite well, but I can still hear voices around me. I'm not listening to anything, because I want to focus.

By comparison, a good pair of earplugs (Howear Leight Max 33db NRR) was better at blocking both noise and voices, and doesn't require charging.

UPDATE: I kept testing the headphones in various coffee shops, but they just do NOT block voices. They block ambient noise, but not voices. If anyone has a different experience, please chime in.

author: Carlos Miguel Ramirez Flores
title: This headphones are perfect!
content: Best headphones ever! I love it!

author: Jordan Cain
title: Maximum Autism Sensory Relief
content:
The primary reason I got these headphones was to help ease my symptoms of autism, primarily the over-sensory stimulation of sounds. And holy cow, every time I put these on it's like a wave of relief washes over me.
