The touch sound controls on the earpiece make a huge difference, i love being able to mute and turn off the noise cancellation just by covering the earpiece.  Other than that my ears can't tell much difference between these and the Senn pair that I had.

author: DvD
title: Forget about phone calls
content: This model has fantastic features and very good sound quality. If you only going to use it for LISTENING - it's great. However if using these headphones for phone calls is important to you - don't even think about buying them. In quiet environment your voice will me muffled, but with some effort people likely will be able to understand you. In any more noisy environment - cafe, street, bus etc - your voice will not be heard AT ALL. I tried two different units, so this is not about single defective one. It's an engineering mistake.

author: Josh T
title: Perfect
content: I had never used noise cancelling headphones before.  The reviews said these were better than Bose, and I was not let down, they are amazing, from blocking out the airplane noise to the crying kids.  I should have had these years ago.

author: charles mcdonald
title: Worth the price
content: These are my first pair of noise cancelling headphones, I have started travelling more and needed something to keep my sanity. Within the 1st eight days of ownership, I used them for over 60 hours on two charges, the battery life is exactly as advertised. The comfort is outstanding, I wear glasses and this pair of headphones accommodates them perfectly.  I had four very long flights and Sony's adaptive noise cancelling system works like a dream, with music or movies playing, all background noise, including the plane turbines, disappeared. The build quality is high. These are a premium set of headphones and worth every penny.

author: John
title: Silence
content: Can't believe how great they work.

author: Wyatt S.
title: You get what you pay for
content: Expensive but worth it. Kinda bit the bullet on something out of my typical price range, however I don't regret it at all. You get what you pay for.

author: Adam
title: GREAT headphones with amazing ANC
content:
These headphones are great! The sound quality anytime is amazing and compares to many open back headphones I've used in the past. The drivers are huge and yet still fit over my hear nicely.

The Active Noise Canceling (ANC) was great as well. As long as you have fairly active music on, these block out almost all noise. For example, I could mow my lawn with "Hamilton" playing and just hear a quiet buzz. Of course, you feel the vibrations (it's a rather large and loud gas mower) but overall sound is much reduced.
The ANC works best on white noise but still can work on voices, etc.
The app was functional and some people may enjoy it and the equalizer settings but I have separate apps for that, so it wasn't what I needed.
The touch controls were nicely functional and very intuitive.

Overall, these are great headphones- if you can afford them. Yes, they are better then anything Sony has to offer right now, in my opinion.

author: anthony
title: Great headphones maybe a little to expensive though
content: The noice cancellation is great but sometimes increasing the volume with the headset is hard cause you can accidentally pause it or skip to next song or video. The app is good too

author: A. Nony Mouse
title: Quality is excellent, can't use all chargers though
content:
Other USB-C chargers will not always work on these. Had to use the one that shipped with the product.
Will not remain on unless you're playing something through them (Can't use them for sound dampening alone, must play audio)

author: lauren
title: Great sound quality, blocks out noise.
content: These sound great. They block out at least 95 percent of noise. I got them to block noise in a shared office space but they are great for any time you don't want to hear the outside noise.

author: Marcos Vinicius Cavinato
title: Best in the Market
content: Although the price is salty, this is definitely worth it if you would like to have your quite moment!!!

author: Chris
title: The Comparison Trap: Unmet Expectations (vs Senn HD600)
content:
TLDR: Narrow soundstage, with disappointing punch on bass. Touch controls VERY frustrating.

I use a Senn HD600/Chord Mojo setup on my laptop (with True-Fi) for the majority of my listening. I did not expect these wireless headphones to have the same quality, but I certainly hoped for a wider soundstage and "thump" for an over the ear headphone so highly rated (and priced). These have been reviewed as a bit bass-heavy (?!), which they should be given their frequency response curve. That being said, even using True-Fi with bass turned up, these sounded very soft on the low-end (as a point of reference, my v2 AirPods were better). The Senn HD600s are not bass-heavy cans, so I was pretty surprised at the difference here.

Maybe I didn't give them enough time, but I HATED the touch controls. If your head is leaning forward at all, a swipe up to turn the volume up can easily be interpreted as a swipe to the right to skip to the next song. It was infuriating how deliberate I had to be to make volume adjustments on these.

I can't review the quality of the NC/battery/etc. I didn't use outside my home.

author: Gui Barthel
title: Way better than Beats Studio
content: These are the best cans I’ve ever had. I’ve had the Beats Studio 3 for over a year, but never quite loved the sound and build of it. Last Christmas my brother in law got the px30 from B&W, I tried it, the sound was stunning, but the comfort was beyond acceptable. Last week I stumbled upon another reviewer of the Sony 1000X-M3 and decided to give it a try. Man, these cans are light years ahead of Beats, I couldn’t be happier. The sound is as amazing as B&W, they are extremely comfortable and the design is simple and elegant. I’m keeping it and selling my beats.

author: Sony Fan
title: Best NC earphone you can get now
content: This earphone definitely gets a huge improvement from the previous version. The sound quality and the noise cancelling are perfect. The comfortness of wearing it is also much better but not good as Bose QC35 2.

author: Peter & Inge Crosby
title: Great performance - but no multipoint BT connection
content:
After reading multiple reviews, I upgraded from a Bose QC25 to the WH1000XM3.
The good:
- great noise reduction performance
- excellent audio
- some cool features (eg suspend ANC by holding hand to R ear cup)
- Google Assistant (or Alexa) connection.
- comfortable
- well designed storage case - especially for travelers
- great battery life

The Bad:
- no easy multipoint connection. Although it is possible to pair with up to 9 devices, you can't connect with more than one device at a time. For example, you might like to listen to music on your computer, receive incoming Skype calls, while also accepting incoming calls on your cell phone. This is impossible (at least in the Win10 with Android universe). There is a workaround that allows phone calls with a connected phone, while also listening to music from a computer (or audio from a video), but it doesn't solve the problem completely.

Hopefully a future software upgrade may address this, or the soon to come WH1000XM4 that is rumored.

BTW, this seems to be a common issue with BT headphones, and will become more of an issue as time goes on and more people have multiple BT devices.

author: Filipe De Alcantara
title: Update 4.1.1 Broke the ANC
content:
Ok, so I know, that everyone is having a different experience with the headphone after the update 4.1.1. My personal experience was that, before the update I could not hear the voices of other people in my office, and that was WITHOUT any music playing, after the update the sounds could only be blocked if some music is playing, even then, I can still hear the voices if they come close. I used for 20 days on the 2.0.0 so it was pretty clear to me after the update that something was missing.

About the Sound Quality it remains the same as before, for me it's awesome! Very good bass and distinction of each part playing in the music.

For gaming there's a little problem, if u put the headset in the handsfree mode so u can use the microphone and the phone at the same time everything becomes worse, this is because the bluetooth divides the band so that voice and sound can be in the same frequency (this is what I read somewhere so I'm assuming this is the cause). If u play with a separate mic then everything is smooth.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Must get for travel and to just escape everyday life
content: Great purchase, and haven't even used them on the plane yet. Great for streaming movies from your phone to the TV so to not wake anyone up.

author: Rafael Montelongo
title: You get what you pay for - These are pricey
content: The best head set I own but probably not the last. I use them around 6 to 8 hours a day and depending on the weather they get hot. More comfortable than my Bose but looking for something lighter. If you have the money I highly recommend them but if you are on a budget these are not for you.

author: Gslug
title: Game changer, excellent noise cancellation and comfort.
content:
Game changer!
Friend had me try these on in a semi busy room and it went completely silent, then she added some music and I literally melted into my seat.

Purchased a week later and have not taken them if since. It's amazing how loud of a world we live in and how great music sounds with good noise cancellation.

As a student these are a must, or in a loud house. I often fall asleep in them to the sound of thunder or rain from YouTube.  I can wear these for hours with out any comfort issues.

author: william X. Chen
title: Good headphone for comfortable listening
content: Switching among  devices is not easy.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Worth every penny
content: Amazon was a bit late delivering these (they were out of stock), but worth the wait. You can never go wrong with these.

author: protasio g.
title: AWESOM PRODUCT.
content: I was a little bit sceptical about buying a used product but I just couldn’t resist the offer when it arrived I opened it and it was in perfect condition and it works flawless. Thanks !

author: Chris W
title: Good buy!
content: Bought these before a flight overseas. Awesome noise canceling and very comfortable. Battery life was great as well.

author: Chris
title: Headphones
content: I like the overall comfort of the headphones and that it came with a case and all of the attachments. I wish the charging cord would have been a little longer.

author: Book buyer
title: Just buy them
content:
I have my fair share of audiophile wired headphones, amps and dacs, but these are a pretty amazing contender great sound quality but with the convenience of wireless and noise canceling.
I had the Bose but their noise canceling gave me headaches like alot of people and the sound quality wasn't quite as good as the previous version of the Sony's.  I've had the Sony XM2's for awhile and when I heard of these I knew I had to get them right away.
Sound quality, comfort, and weight are much improved and well worth the upgrade.
Highly reccomended.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good Sound quality but not comfortable to wear
content: Good NC and sound quality, but lot of pressure on head and scratch between ears and the headphone. It is not as comfortable as Bose WC25/35. Also, the touch control is not accurate.

author: Foxisquick
title: Best wireless noise cancelling headhpones the world has ever seen.
content: It obviously has great noise-canceling and great sound.  But that isn't the main reason why these are amazing.  The battery life is crazy good, the weight is light, and I have a huge head and these are incredibly comfortable.  The method of silencing the headphones and being able to switch from noise canceling on and off is very easy.  I don't know what else to say.  The only downside is price, but you absolutely get what you pay for which is probably the best wireless noise-canceling headphones on the market.

author: Carl Lara
title: FALSE ADVERTISING
content: Product description states the unit's bluetooth capability can connect to multiple devices but that's not the case. This unit can only connect to one device at a time.  If you want to connect to another device, you have to cancel the existing bluetooth connection and then initialize the headphone (reset to factory setting). Not what I expected from Sony let alone from a $300 headphone.  It's so disappointing.

author: Lucas
title: Great product
content: I was really surprised with this headphones, they really live up to the expectations. Great sound and isolation.

author: Jonathan Birge
title: Comparison to Bose QuietComfort 35s
content:
I have both this and a recently purchased set of Bose 35s. I have used both extensively on commercial flights, as well as in quiet rooms to assess the sound quality. Bottom line up front: the reviewers are right, the Sony's do have better noise cancelling, and the sound quality is on par (if not better) than the Bose set.

Where the Sony wins
------------------------

Noise cancelling. The Sony does a slightly better job of drowning out airplane hum, and seems to have a higher frequency range at which it can cancel than the Bose. It also has less background hiss than the Bose (in fact, has none I can hear) though the Bose doesn't have much to speak of. The Sony can run a test to tune the noise cancelling based on your altitude and the way you're wearing the headset, making it less sensitive to how you're wearing the headphones. I've found the Bose, by comparison, has differing levels of performance depending on how you're wearing them.

One of the nicest things about the Sony is that you can tailor everything from the app, ranging from noise cancellation settings (e.g. you can allow voice to come through) to equalization and bass response.

The interface to the Sony is also superior, with very intuitive swipe commands on the right earpiece taking care of most functions. Want to increase the volume, swipe up. Skip the song, swipe right. Want to hear what the flight attendant is saying to you, hold your hand over the ear piece and the noise cancelling switches to a mode where you can hear voices. Much easier than fumbling around for buttons on your head or trying to use your phone.

Where the Bose is better
---------------------------

Build quality. The Bose is arguably better made, and has more metal components and softer, higher quality padding. There are stories of the Sony breaking rather easily. Something they've supposedly fixed in recent builds, but even still, the Bose headsets are clearly sturdier. That said, I have been using the Sonys for a few months and haven't run into any problems.

Multiple Bluetooth pairing. The Bose set can pair to two devices simultaneously, and you can actually hear both. The Sony can pair with two devices, but you can only really use one at a time, and switching between them requires a bit of work. So, the Bose wins if you really need to be using two devices at once (e.g. your computer and a phone).

Where they are equal
------------------------

While I slightly prefer the sound of the Sony set better, it's hard to argue they are too far apart. It will mostly be taste. The Bose have much thicker bass, which I don't really like, but both have excellent sound quality, especially for noise cancelling headphones. Neither has much of the "hiss" that used to be associated with early noise cancelling headphones, and both have very clear highs.

Bottom line
--------------

Given the better noise cancelling and customization of the Sony, it's become the headset that I regularly use now, and unless you really need dual device Bluetooth pairing, you can't go wrong with the Sony.

author: arenner
title: Canceled the sounds of a screaming bachelorette party
content: If your wondering how good the noise canceling works, let me tell you it is fantastic. I recently attended a weekend bachelorette party sober and could not have done it without these headphones. Even without sound coming out of these, they drowned out the sounds of 8 drunk screaming girls. This should be the test for all noise canceling headphones. Everything else about them is pretty good too. I would highly recommend.

author: Jade
title: Nothing but praises for these headphones 👍
content: These headphones are the bomb. I've owned Bose headphones in the past and I always thought they were the brand that could not be beat but wow was I wrong. Sony has taken it to the next level with these headphones. They are insanely noise cancelling. Normally you can hear all the background noise on an airplane (the loud wind your flying through) but I SERIOUSLY could not hear anything but my music. The corresponding app shows you how the headphones automatically adjust to the atmosphere your in. It's insane. Well done, Sony.

author: Tommy
title: Nice and quit
content: Got these for my wife. She used my bose set on a plane flight and fell in love. So she loves these when traveling now.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Touch controls can get weird.
content: Great!

author: felipe mendoza
title: Sounds is very clear
content: This is really good headset

author: Josh
title: uncomfortable and difficult to use
content:
These headphones have almost no horizontal clamping force around the ears, so all the weight sits on the top of my head. Also, the touch controls on the right earcup is difficult to use. Why can't it just have actual buttons?

The noise cancellation seems to be almost as good as my Bose QC35 II, but not quite as good. The phone app does have some neat features that the Bose does not have, though, such as EQ leveling. Also, sound quality is as good, or maybe even better (I am not an audiophile, though)

author: book ryder
title: Beautiful, understated and works as well or better than hoped
content: Read all the rave reviews about the sound quality and noise cancelling.. it’s all true. Flew 3 hours with no discomfort and excellent noise canceling. Highly recommend

author: Anthony V. Scally Jr.
title: Great
content: Unbelievably good sound and tremendous noise canceling

author: Yarhoo81
title: Very impressed by their sound quality, noise canceling and phone call features
content:
Really impressed with these headphones! Wireless sound: Although I didn't use their top-end Bluetooth capabilities yet (I connected them only to my unremarkable cell phone), I am impressed by their sound quality.
Noise canceling: I cannot compare them with their direct competitor Bose, but I am impressed by their noise canceling capabilities. I just took my first flight with them and I was pleased to hear so much background noise filtered out. Although not all the outside sound and voices are canceled, the combination of the excellent noise canceling features and the noise masking provided by the sounds that they reproduce guarantee quite a relaxing and pleasant experience.
Controls: very pleased with the touch-based controls on the right cup - very responsive and intuitive.
Phone call features: I must admit that I was slightly concerned by the reviews that mentioned that these headphones were pretty useless for phone calls. I don't know if those issues were due to a bad first batch or to some firmware upgrade, but I can say that this is probably the feature that impressed me the most: I took work conference calls and personal calls from airport lobbies and noisy streets, and the feedback on my voice quality was very positive - they said that even if some background noise was still noticeable, my voice was still loud and clear.

author: messman
title: Noise Canceling could be better
content: These things are great!!  Just a touch on the heavy side.  They are really light but not space age light.  The Sound is crisp and clear while the bass will blow you mind!  The feel of the material is so soft and cool.  The feel good after hours of wearing them as well.  But, the noise cancelation is just ok.  Maybe I'm doing something wrong but I can totally hear whats going on around me and other people speaking.  So if you are expecting them to completely block out your surrounding ambient noise, these may not be fore you.

author: Slav
title: Currently the best Noise Cancelling headphones
content:
After having 1000X and 1000XM2, this is surely a worthwhile successor. No competition in terms of sound qulity and noise cancellation. Comfort has been vastly improved from previous models and is almost on par with Bose QC line.
The only issue I noticed is a somewhat worse touch control compared to the previous models, but I think this is an issue with my specific set.

author: P. Tyler
title: Would definitely recommend.
content:
I watched plenty of videos, read reviews, and tested the headphones at Best Buy probably close to a dozen times before pulling the trigger to purchase them. I monitored the price with camelcamelcamel and purchased them at the $300 price.

The reviews were correct about the ears getting a little sweaty. It will depend on the outside temperature, and what you are doing. Casually listening might take a couple of hours.

I did find when sometimes adjusting the volume accidentally skipping to the next track.

The battery life is AMAZING !!! I charged it for the first time after about a month, and it still indicated 20% battery left. I used it short stints, but thought the battery would go down more without use, but it didn't.

I got them primarily for the noise cancellation when listening to music, gaming, and using with my music keyboard. However, was still taken back by the price and almost returned them. However, I then tried them without listening to anything...and I was sold. They do such a great job silencing what's around you, so I stuck with them. I just have to figure how to get them to work wirelessly with the PS4.

In summary, I would definitely recommend ... despite the high price tag.

author: Akeora
title: Best Headphones So Far
content: Best headphones. I've tried alot of headphones before, and these are the most comfortable, great sounding, and best in NC. For those complaining about it messing up at subzero temperatures, there's a way to fix that on the help page for the Sony Headset app, they're aware of the issue and there's a way to troubleshoot it. Just take care of the earphone pads, wipe them down after each use so that the salt from the sweat doesn't make it tear, and it should last. And as far as people saying that you sound like a robot over the microphone on calls, maybe it's a defect? Cause mine work perfectly fine and I've made many calls.

author: Robert Taylor
title: Great headphones
content: The noise cancelling and ambient sound features work very well, the sound quality is unrivaled. The only issue I had was until you get use to them these headphones get warm. All covered ear headphones do but unless you have used them before this may catch you off guard. It regulates pretty quickly but initially it does catch you off guard.

author: Richard Tuttle
title: Top quality comfort with best ever noise cancelling
content: Excellent tech inside these wonderful headsets. The only thing I wish was better was it's "listening mode" isn't as loud or clear as I would like. Still works fantastic though!

author: Ashot
title: Very good headphones!
content: Very comfortable to use , Noise cancel and audio quality is gorgeous!

author: Arsinoe L. Carias
title: Very good noise cancelling headphones
content: The only thing i dont agree is the quality of the materials they are not from a headphones the cost 350 dollars, but the sound and espcially the noise cancelling is impressive, its tecnology is unique on the market

author: QueJon
title: Authentic
content: Good sound great quality and fast shipping

author: Steven
title: The Best
content: I've tried Bose and other noise cancelling headphones and these have the best sound/noise cancelling.  I prefer the fit/comfort of the Bose a little bit better but not enough of a difference to pass of the better sound.

author: CLS
title: Comfy!
content: Way more comfortable than the previous model! Sound amazing, noise canceling the best I have seen

author: Dylan Lawrence
title: Fantastic noise cancellation and light weight.
content:
I spend a lot of time on the computer and am fairly accustomed to wearing headsets. These are among the lightest I've ever worn. The comfort level is fantastic, though after a few hours I did notice a little bit of weight fatigue on the top of my head, but I expect that from most headsets.  The overall fit is great, even over glasses.

The most important feature to discuss here is probably the noise cancellation, which is pretty phenomenal. I used noise cancelling headphones many years ago and found them to be average and allowed a lot of sound leak around where my glasses were. It's amazing to find a pair of headphones that don't rely merely on a tight seal to cancel noise. I don't notice any sound leak on these. It's important to note that the adaptive noise cancellation may make you think these don't work as well as they should. Be sure to tweak some of the settings to get the right noise cancellation for you.

Connectivity to my phone has been good, though I haven't traveled much distance away from my phone to test that. Overall pairing was simple and easy and the headphones were ready to go in under five minutes.

Battery life is also incredible, hours of use and 10% charge or less has been used. I highly doubt anyone would worry about these losing power during the day.

Overall, one of the best wireless headphones I've ever owned and I highly recommend it.

author: Jose
title: Best headphones in the market!
content: Bought these for my wife and she loves them. Best decision!

author: Robert D. Mccarthy
title: very nice
content: this is better than Boses

author: no problem
title: very good.
content:
comparing the MX3 to bose QC2, the sony XM3 has better bass, and i would asy the better audio experience in general.
the XM3 has noticeably better noise cancellation over the QC2.
comfort of wearing the headphones: i feel the QC2 are more comfortable than the XM3.  the XM3 are comfortable, just less so.
comfort of use: the bose have physical buttons, which i prefer over sony's touch interface, which doesnt always register my touch gestures, so i have to repeat them.
i did not manage to simultaneously connect the XM3 to two devices. i could pair it with two, but not connect simultaneously. the QC2 has the advantage that i managed to connect it simultaneously to two devices.

to sum it up, i will use the bose when i wanna connect to two devices, and the XM3 when i want superior noise cancellation and bass for music, which usually means when i go to the gym, or on flights.

author: Marylou Morales
title: Go ahead, buy ‘em!
content: Obviously it’s impossible to cancel out all noise, but these headphones let me forget there’s other people around me! I use them at work, at the gym, and for studying. I keep them with me at all times. It is slightly annoying that it can only pair to one device so it’s annoying to have to switch from your phone to your laptop or vice versa. But that’s my only complaint. These headphones definitely deliver and I love mine.

author: AJ
title: Does not cancel anything
content: This definitely should not even be considered noise canceling. If you want that you will have to pay extra and get the higher end Sony headphones which I did which work great but this product is terrible

author: jackson h.
title: noisecancelling
content: great headphones

author: christopher brooks
title: Much quieter, but not soundproof.
content: I like it. It’s the first and only noise cancelling headphone I’ve ever used. So, it’s hard for me to compare it to others. I can still hear other people on airplanes (hence the 4/5 stars) but certainly less. The sound quality is great. The controls are quite intuitive. I can’t imagine anything out there is much better.

author: Michael Dominguez
title: They sound great but crackle sometime over bumpy roads
content: I had the 2 series until they were recently stolen and bought this upgrade. Listened to them for the first time last night on the bus ride home and the sound quality is excellent -- but I've only listened to 1 album so far, the Beatles' remastered White Album. Anyway, whenever the bus hit a bumpy road or sometimes merely changed lanes, the headphones would emit a single little crackle, very audible and very disturbing. Any one else have this problem? Maybe I have a pair of defective headphones.

author: Mrblurr
title: Great headphones!
content:
I originally bought the Nuraphones, which have a much better sound, but they hurt my ears, so I was looking at Sony and Sennheiser. I finally decided on Sony and I'm glad I did. Headphones are lightweight and comfortable for long sessions of playing games or listening to music. Battery life is great! The touch controls aren't something I use much since I mainly have them at home, but from the little I've used them I have no complaints.

I would definitely buy them again!

author: Scott & Megan Wallace
title: Works great!
content: Works really nice, looks great, fast shipping, noise cancellation is on point. Con: price.

author: Swiftks
title: Works Great For TV Too!!!!!
content:
Unlike most people, I purchased these headphones to primarily be used while watching tv, movies, etc.  Evening thing that makes these great headphones for listening to music, also makes them great for listening to video as well.

Even though my Samsung TV supports Bluetooth, to get the most out of these headphones, I wanted to run them via the aptx HD codec, so I have them paired to a Avantree Oasis Plus transmitter, which supports the codec and also keeps the latency down; which I can't decern... Latency video test via YouTube look spot on.  Keep in mind I'm also running a Toslink between the TV and transmitter.
Only thing that would be better would be pairing via the LDAC codec, but currently there aren't any transmitters that support this codec, only receivers; hopefully in the future.

Coming from a pair of good pair Sennheiser RF headphones, I can hear even more detail... Those quite wispers are crystal clear.  The fit is perfect for long use.  And there's the noise cancelling, which you can read another hundred reviews on.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best of all over-ear headset with noise cancellation
content: Amazing sound and noise cancellation. The unit itself without even being turned on is already good noise insulation. I'm just blown away by the sound and the long battery life. Get the beautiful looking tan unit

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Product!! Tested in flight.
content:
Great product. Thank you, Sony! Noise Cancelling works perfectly in flight. No problems to the product and seller.  Bought it after thorough research with Sony strong competitors and never regret.
Note to Sony: Please, add some more in-app education about some app features like Sound Position Control, Equalizer, what is DSEE HX: auto?

author: Harsh Upadhyay
title: VERY COMFORTABLE
content:
The only thing I could complain about is that unlike the Bose QC headphones the cups tilt the other way. This is of course the only minor con I can think of.
Sound quality is fantastic and so is the touch functionality on the right side cup. The app is decent and I like the adaptive noise cancellation feature esp when I use it to protect my ears from the cold while walking outside but want to be able to talk to others or listen to the noise on the street as a pedestrian.
Battery life is pretty good for my daily needs and when I turn on noise cancellation, the dome pressure isn't as oppressive as the Bose - as a result I do not feel nauseous on prolonged use.

author: Robert
title: Great headphones but for one thing
content:
The noise cancellation is great. They sound great too. To my ears, they're better sounding than the Bose QC35. The fit is good. They're well made.

The biggest problem is that you can pair them with multiple devices but it is virtually impossible to make them switch from one device to another if they're both in range. I have resigned to only using them with my phone. It is too much of a hassle to switch to my laptop.

Also, buyer beware that the privacy policy of the Sony IOS app gives them the right to track all your listening behavior. You cannot opt-out. Bose used to be the same but they have an option now to opt-out (albeit buried in the app and defaults to opt-in).

Because of these two problems, I cannot recommend this product.

author: Sandra Cruz
title: Wao wao super excellent headphones
content: Ugh so amazed by this headphones love it

author: Sports car
title: Aftermarket car exhaust noise cancellation works great
content:
Love product for listening to WiFi pandora.
Bought because after 7 years of listening to aftermarket exhaust sound on my sports car the low frequency noise on 5 hours of interstate driving began to bother me. Now I can enjoy my load exhaust sounds when I get into the mountains and avoid the constant exhaust noise while on flat interstates that I need to take to get to the mountains.
Can still hear other non objectionable driving related sounds with noise cancellation on.

author: Jen
title: Mu husband's favorite, when he wants to shut the world out so he can work.
content: He works from home and he can really zone out working because the noise cancelling is so effective. He loves it because he can't hear me randomly nag or talk lol. Effective when you have kids too at home. Sound quality - AWESOME too!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Poor Controls
content: The volume controls that are touch sensitive on the headphones do not work well. Even at maximum volume the volume is relatively low. This is probably to protect hearing, but it overdone.

author: Tom
title: Best noise cancellation technology on the market
content: Outstanding headphones.  Comfortable, light, and well made.  Noise cancellation is unbelievable.

author: George T. Haber
title: Great Product
content:
It's a great product with good sound quality and pleasant overall features.
I replaced my Bose Q35 with this amazing product.

author: Suman Bhatt
title: its a good product but not without flaws
content: they sound good. the noise cancelling worked perfectly the first time, but the quality deteriorated after first use. now the touch controls have stopped working. I didn't expect such poor quality from Sony or a product with this price range.

author: Scott V
title: Great headphones with a potentially fatal flaw
content:
There's been a lot written about these headphones, most of which I feel no need to reiterate. The noise canceling is class-leading, the sound is excellent, if a bit bass-heavy, and battery life is top notch. Overall, I really love these cans, but they have a major problem for anyone that lives in cold climates....

Anytime I am outside in sub-freezing temperatures (less than 32F or 0C), the touch control cup starts to pause, skip, volume up/down - all on its own. The touch controls become completely unresponsive to user input, which negates a pretty major feature of the headphones. I specifically bought these to use in winter as a pair of ear muffs (in summer I use buds or I'll show up to work looking like I swam a few laps). Google this problem; I am most definitely not the only one.

If you live somewhere that never gets below freezing, I really have no reservations with the WH1000XM3's. Unfortunately for me, they are not a long-term solution and while I generally prefer the Sony's to the equivalent Bose model, I have no choice but to go with the latter.

author: Alice Bowers
title: Perfects
content: The sound quality is perfect, as well as noise cancelling. The battery life also is great! Happy with my purchase

author: msbarra
title: Comfortable, lightweight,  and excellent sound cancellation.
content: Amazing sound cancellation

author: Amazon Customer
title: Improving my life, your the best.
content: My wife yells at me... I can't hear a thing. God bless you.

author: Adam Shen
title: Pretty good
content: Pretty good, I like it better than my bose qc 35 II.

author: kimberly cyr
title: They are costly but you will not be disappointed
content: I been using these while mowing grass and I'm not sure how they cut that much noise out. It's really amazing and the sound clarity is really great. The only one that hates them is my spouse because I cant hear her call my name lol

author: Mike Jones
title: Bang for the buck
content:
It sounds amazing. People blast their music as the gym and I cannot hear a peep except during song intermissions.

The best part is I listen to it so much and every once in a while when I'm heading to the gym I'll forget that I haven't charged it in a while. Check the battery. "You have 80% remaining."

"Oh okay"

author: Al
title: Phenomenal headphones
content: Hands don't best set I've owned. The sound can be customized and the noise cancelling is superb. While Bose was sitting comfortably Sony ate their lunch and even with the 700 out it still eats their lunch. Don't waste your money on new Bose save them and buy in ear phones too. Only pet pieve is pause and resume touch controls are annoying AF.

author: Karin J
title: Cannot easily use on your laptop.
content: You can't use these easily on your laptop.  First you need to attach the wire,  so they are no longer wireless.  Also you need to add "audioware" to your device manager to allow it to work.  When I did that, it caused a problem with my computer sound.  Not worth the trouble.

author: Sheila Hahn
title: Outstanding!
content: I bought these for my husband's birthday. He tells me how great they are every time he puts them on. He couldn't be any happier with them. Great sound and sound cancellation.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Failed after 5 months
content: Great headphones for 5 months, completely stopped working one day. Power button does nothing anymore, tried everything in the forums. The seller said there's nothing they can do, poor service for how expensive these are. They shouldn't just die.

author: Elvis Mendoza
title: Good noise cancelation
content: For the money I expected better and louder sound. Maybe I have not found a way to make it sound louder but that is number 1 thing I look in any headphones is that the sound is loud. My beats sound louder than these.

author: Smoothbassman
title: Absolutely Stunning
content:
There isn't much to say here that has not already been stated.

The noise cancelleation is the best on the market.

The sound is balanced and controlled.  Great for listening for all types of music.

The comfort is great.  I fell asleep in the bed with these on, and slept all night with no problems.

Battery life is awesome!  I have gone 1 week using these on on off all day without charing them, and it only take 2 hours to charge them back up to 100% from 10%.

Sony you outdid yourself here!  The only thing that would make this better if is you figured out how to allow these headphone to pair to multiple devices at the same time!  That is very frustrating, but I'm willing to deal with it now because of how good these dang things are!

Fix the connection issues, and you get 5 stars!

author: mubariz
title: Good experience
content: Worth the money

author: Jordan Houck
title: Charging cable
content: It is unbelievable that a product this expensive would be sold without a wall adapter for the charging cord.  Additionally, the charging cord is only about 6 inches and doesn’t even reach my counter from the outlet.  This is rediculous.

author: Amazon Customer
title: More amazing than the older ones
content: Replaced my mdx1000 with these and they made lots of improvements. Hope these are better built, dropped old ones about 6 inches and Broke the arm.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great headphones!
content: I love the sound quality and the noise cancelling features of these headphones.  The ability to modify the sound using the  headphone app is a bonus!

author: Smitty28
title: Great for hip hop, EDM & pop
content: Unreal sound in general and you can personalize it from the app. Was going to buy Bose but reviews said this was best for bass and sound. I listen to hip hop and really wanted solid bass. No regrets, except the microphone is not very good for calls. Apparently the new Bose 700s are better for that. Overall I am very happy with this choice.

author: Dity
title: As a DJ with plenty of cans these have become my go to for home/travel (not DJing)
content: I picked these up because I'm starting to struggle with tinnitus and wanted to listen to music at lower volumes while on the road.  These have changed the way I fly.  I even go to sleep with them on now (noise cancelling on/music off) on red-eye flights because they are so comfortable and they lower that noise from the plane to a much more comfortable level.  The sound quality is on point. I have Sennheiser 650s, V-Moda M100s, and I would put this right up there with all of them in wired mode.  They are great on bluetooth with an iPhone, unfortunately Apple doesn't support higher quality Bluetooth codecs just yet, but it's more than good enough for me and it's great being wire free.  I wish the call quality was a little better. If they had a detachable wireless mic like some of the gaming head sets out there, it would be awesome. The battery life, weight, build, and case are great.  I've taken these headphones on a few domestic flights over the past month and they've worked great.  I used to use my AirPods pretty frequently day to day, but now I only use them for calls and working out because these sound so much better and have such better isolation.

author: Pete
title: these are really awesome.
content: especially the touch controls.  sound quality may not be on audiophile levels, but definitely better than boze or beats.  Really nice and soft cushions around the ear.  USB-C chargeable.  I love it that it was free.

author: AMathew
title: Not recommended if you want to use it for calling
content:
If you are using this headphone for listening to music only  then it is the best. If you want to use it for calls it is the absolute worst. Sony support is equally bad at helping with issues. Sony’s forums are full of users complaining about call quality and the non responsive nature of Sony. This appears to be a hardware issue that cannot be fixed with a firmware update.

Update: I have been checking the Sony thread where I originally posted this issue and I could see more and more people reporting this issue. And Sony has not responded to any of those with a reason or an anticipated fix. Instead they are asking everyone of direct message them. My experience with direct messaging was bad - after exchanging messages for 3 days (1 per day), the moderator was silent for 4-5 days. After this he arranged a call with their support team who walked me through resetting the headphones which didn't help. By this time I was on the last day for returns and I shipped it back. On the next call from Sony I told them I returned the device and they said I can call them back if I buy a headphone. And I didn't get an answer to my question - If I buy another one would I experience the same issue. Doesn't look like they are confident of this headphones being useful for taking calls.

author: Monika W
title: First day concentrating at work in a while
content: Actually got work done, on a day where there was a never ending conversation all around me! Reduced background chatter enough that I could no longer easily follow conversations and therefore ignore them (I could still hear them, even with a bit of music, but they were easy to ignore). My Bose to great to suppress airplane noise, but left me wishing for a bit more mid suppression in the office. I'm not terribly audiophile, but the sound quality seemed fine to me. I found the touch-pad controls intuitive, and used the cup-hand-over-ear to listen several times. Love them! Only wish the charging cable was a few inches longer ... oh, and the ears got a bit warm in the afternoon, but I have that with all ear covering headphones. But none of that weird headache inducing pressure-on-eardrum feeling I've come to associate with noise cancelling!

author: Eddie W Givens Jr
title: Stopped working after 2 months
content: I was impressed with these headphones when I first got them, but soon realized that I had not made the best choice.  They don't stay synched to Bluetooth on my Chromebook (constantly drops and I have to re-connect).  Finally, they completely stopped synching to Bluetooth on my iPhone after 2 months of use.  Buyer beware - brand name doesn't alway mean the best product.

author: Brian C.
title: Amazing Would Buy Again or The 4th gen Lol
content: BUY BUY BUY BUY NOISE CANCELING IS PHENOMENAL ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

author: peter thornley
title: very good noise cancelling
content: they  are  awesome!

author: William
title: great sound
content: all good

author: Luis Garcia
title: Sony did it right
content: Sound quality is the best overall. Support for many updated applications.

author: Niko Wang
title: Great Headphone to me so far!
content: Not the first SONY headphone but the best so far!

author: Daniel
title: 100% Quailty device
content:
I could not speak more highly of these headphones! From the quality of the sound, to the noise cancellation capabilities.
I 100% recommend these.
If I could change 1 thing about them, it’s that the volume control have the capability to go up/Brown more then one notch per swipe.

author: Crew19
title: Best overall noise-canceling headphones
content:
I bought these to replace my B&W PX headphones, which are also very good but not comfortable and have too narrow of a sweet spot due to the angled speakers. Comfort of the Sony WH-1000XM3 is light years better than the PX. After wearing the headphones for a few hours I got no discomfort. They are also very light weight. Ear cups are nice and soft. Noise canceling is fantastic just walking around a busy city. I have not gotten onto a flight with them yet but expect them to perform very well.

I really like the sound. Yes bass is a little boosted and not technically "accurate" according to many reviews out there. But you know what, they sound FUN. I'm not a professional recorder or audiophile and don't like a flat and boring neutral sound. To each his own.  Bass is more punchy than the PX and certain voices at high volumes aren't as ear drum piercing as the PX. The beauty of it is, you can adjust your settings within the Sony app if you want a certain sound. I am fine so far with the out-of-the-box sound.

I am using a Pixel 3 XL phone and LDAC codec set to "optimized for audio quality" 990kbps setting. So far I've only walked about 20 feet away from the phone with 1 wall obstructing and I've not had a drop out in audio yet.

Highly recommend picking up these headphones if you want best in class noise canceling in addition to comfort and sound.

author: DefinitelyAmazon
title: Good noise handling headphone
content: Better than bose, light weight, better noise handling

author: Sandy Strong
title: Perfect comfort perfect sound quality look out Bose serious competition in town
content: I bought them as a gift for my hubby. We both wanted them (was hoping for a pair myself)- ok hands down amazing sound quality and the comfort of this set beats anything out there. They are light weight and no pinch, it’s hard to believe your wearing them. I did some serious research before buying these head phones with a laundry list of what I wanted from an over the ear headset. 1. Big bass over streaming without requiring cord (check) 2. Full surround HD quality (check) 3. Ultra comfort (Check) 4. Real noise cancelling with pick up while on calls (check) 5. Over ear (check) 6. Easy remrmetable settings in off, call answer, volume on set (check) .. list goes on but those are my key requirements. All the reviews I have read about these Sony’s really competing with Bose and surpassing them is all true. They are freaking amazing! Now I’m buying them for myself. Really giving a hard core Bose fan a run for their money. Sorry Bose Sony really stepped up their game. Completely worth the money and I did purchase the extended warranty. I recommend that if you are doing over ear wireless headphones comparisons you add these bad boys to your comps list. I think not only will you be surprised about what you read because Sony has cornered the market on headsets, I’m willing to bet you will buy them when all is said and done. The cost is worth it! The research is worth it! If for any reason they don’t meet your expectations? Amazon will honor the return anyway so at least give them a try :)

author: Orlando
title: Best noise canceling
content: These are great headphones if you want to cancel out noise but don’t get as loud as I wanted to. Other then that great headphones nice and light, comfortable, and clear rich sound.

author: dwen
title: These are the best
content: I've had some Bose headphones for years but these are so much better. I can even sleep with them if I make a slight accommodation for the ear cup, and there is no squeaking (which the Bose did very easily with any pressure on the earpiece). The blue tooth sound quality is also excellent for music. My wife liked them so much she got a pair. Helps her bear my snoring when we travel (at home she'll go to another room!).

author: Rich West
title: Great sound
content: Love the headphones great sound and control. Good range. The app is nice allows a good amount of customizable settings.

author: Wing C.
title: Great headphone with questionable manufacturers supports
content: I like the headphone a lot for what it cost. Excellent refine sound quality and great bass are good points. Some may complain too much bass, i found it only true when using Bluetooth function. Bluetooth sound good but not great comparing to wire connection. Five months after I own the SONY WH-1000x M3 headphone, something seems going wrong. I can no longer use it purely for noise cancellion. If no music playing through, it will automatically shut off. If re power on, about five minutes later it will shut off again. That's very annoying. It wake me my several time on a plane trip to Chiago Axpona audio show. Checked SONY service web but found no answer. I am not sure if the headphone is still under warranty after 5 months of purchase. Anyway there are no return or replace offering on my Amazon purchase record.  For playing music though, I think the haearphone still is a great product.

author: Larry Doyle
title: Almost worthless when used with a laptop
content:
When using WH-1000XM3 headphones connected by bluetooth on my 2018 Macbook Pro, the ambient sound stays on even in the noise cancelling mode, to the point where it is actually worse than no noise cancellation at all. I connected the headphones to the app on my phone and lowered the ambient sound settings, and it worked, but only on the phone. When I re-connected to the Macbook I got the same issue. When I connect to the Macbook via the headphone jack, I do not have this problem. But I don't want to be tethered to the headphone cord.  I did all the trouble shooting stuff in the manual and online, and tried to contact Sony support. I was unable to do this via chat or email because Sony does not recognize this model number. When I called they had me go through all the trouble shooting I had already done and then said I need to download drivers from Apple. There are no such drivers. The Macbook is entirely up-to-date on all its software and firmware. Also, the ambient sound is being detected by the headphones themselves. I can block it by cupping my hands over the ear cups, but it's hard to type that way.

UPDATE: After three months trying to get an answer, I'm told that the headphones are not supposed to work with laptops or desktops.  Huh. That's funny. When I read their ad copy on this page,  it didn't say WILL NOT WORK WITH DESKTOP OR LAPTOP COMPUTERS (It's still not there.)  Also, you'd think the design would be a little more sleek if they were intended to only be used by people with phones. I can't imagine anyone running or biking with these on.

This is pathetic and unacceptable. I want to return these but more than 30 days passed beforeI found out that this was not a bug and not a feature. If this was an Apple product, there would be several class action lawsuits and stories all over the internet.

(also, what that rep said about bluetooth was utter b.s. It doesn't work that way.)

UPDATE UPDATE: I read on the Sony site that the company was replacing these headphones with ones that worked if you called support and gave them the serial number. So like a fool I called support.  After several minutes, the person on the line came back and tried to lead me through  rudimentary troubleshooting (which I've been doing since November [see above]) and then he went away and came back and said there must be something wrong with my laptop, and then when I pointed out that people have had this same problem on different laptops and desktops, he said, and I kid you not, that the headphones are NOT GUARANTEED TO WORK WITH THIRD PARTY PRODUCTS, and when I pointed out that wireless headphones are pretty useless if you can't connect them to a third party product, he said that Sony has NO RECORD OF EVER SEEING THIS PROBLEM.  This particular support person also had the very annoying verbal tic of beginning each of his sentences with "actually," followed by something that wasn't true.

This product should not be for sale.

May 12, 2019 Update: Got tired of waiting for a fix. Bought new headphones. Cheated out of $350.

author: RoCo
title: Buy the older version instead.
content:
Buy the older version (WH1000XM2) instead, they're fantastic. I had a pair of the old ones for over a year and upgraded a few months ago. The new model is significantly worse:
- battery life decrease by about 20-30% in real life use.
- software bugs frequently keep me from using the headphones to make phone calls (Bluetooth disconnects)
- built in microphone is more sensitive to wind noise
- sound quality is no better
- lighter construction makes the passive noise cancelling less effective.
- most noticeable is that the swipe interface on the right cup and button interface on the left cup are both 3x slower. The old headphones had almost instant respose, this has a clear a present lag.

author: Bruce
title: impressive noise cancelling
content: They sure cost a lot but they do an incredible job of canceling the noise. I stood directly in from of my cloths dryer which was tumbling two pairs of blue jeans (with metal rivets) and couldn't hear a thing. Sound quality is good I am not sure I would say it is excellent but it is more than good enough if noise cancelling is your primary reason for purchasing them. I feel the money was well spent.

author: Pst
title: The BEST Noise Cancelling Headset Currently in the Market
content: The noise cancellation is so good on this thing. I use this on my international flights. It blocks flight noise and children crying noise. It is a lifesaver on the airplane. Swipe control is good and easy to navigate. Blue tooth connection is good and the distance is long. Sound quality is good enough with strong bass. When you are thinking to buy a wireless noise cancelling headset, this is it.

author: bobby
title: Never have to worry about battery, great noise cancelling, comparitively, very comfortable.
content: I couldn't ask for a better pair of headphones.

author: Melissa Miesle
title: QUITE EFFECTIVE!
content: I purchased these to primarily use at work. My building is currently being remodeled so jack-hammering is not abnormal and I sit in a generally noisy Cubicle Kingdom: shouters, smoker's laugh, nail clipping, and the Bevis & Butthead laugh... these things block ALL of that out so well people have to waive to get my attention when the walk into my cubicle. While I'm not an audiophile, I feel like the sound has great quality. The headphones leverage equalizers and sound features through the app on my phone. The headphones are comfortable to wear at my desk and while walking around, although I would not want to work-out wearing them.

author: Dr. Dinosaur
title: Excellent Headphones
content: These are comfortable, portable, simple, and sound great. The noise-canceling is top-notch and amazing. The only problem is sometimes connecting or switching between devices with Bluetooth, but I'm not sure if that's the headphones' fault or the fault of the devices. Overall, these are excellent and worth getting.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Idea, but didn't work for me.
content: Noise canceling and sound are great, but the swiping mechanism is inconsistent and unreliable. It would not forward or go back conistenly. I use headphones at work and I purchased these with the Hope's of  avoiding taking my headphones off when someone's speaking to me. The pause is frustrating,  I had to tap a number if times before it connected. I would attempt to increase the volume and it would skip a song. It was too much for me. I returned the product and  went back to my Bose QC 35 II.

author: Mark A. King
title: Work wonderfully as advertised
content: Once I figured out my right from my left, they provided magnificent sound and very effective noise cancelation even when I wasn't listening to anything.

author: L
title: Great noise cancellation, good audio quality
content:
Great noise cancellation. I’m coming from Bose QC15s, and was impressed by how much better the noise cancellation is. They are comfortable, don’t have the ‘ear suck’ of prior generations of noise-canceling headphones, and eliminate an impressive amount of ambient sound. Battery life is outstanding, and they are relatively easy to set up. I’m not an audiophile but the sound is clear, with a tiny bit of a bass boost (which is easy to adjust through the app).

Minor complaints: my ears get warm, and there is not quite enough space for my ears. They are largish, and make my average-sized head look tiny.

author: Nick
title: Impressive!
content: Amazing product so far. Purchased these after trying a friend's Bose wireless headset. I must say, previous reviews were correct, this product is amazing. Sony took the time and did it right. Battery life is great as well. Worth the money in my opinion. Looking forward to trying it with the PS4

author: ted greene
title: Work as described .......
content:
Does the job, easy to use.

Great quality

author: Tom Noble
title: Great sound.
content: Awesome.

author: Milan C.
title: The BEST
content:
Insanely good headphones!!!!
Don't like the "silver" color though, looks cheap.

author: Gary
title: I need more cowbell.
content: I think these are good headphones.  However, I’m not certain they are worth the money.  I have several pairs of buds and phones that are less than a third of the cost, and to my taste, perform about the same.  Battery life is fantastic, fit and finish are acceptable, sound quality is fine although, they are not loud at all.  My musical taste is hard rock and metal, and I like it loud.  I would gladly trade a few hours of battery life for more thump. So let’s hope that next time out, Sony can go the spinal tap route and turn it up to 11.

author: Sara
title: Very comfortable
content: These headphones were absolutely worth the investment. The noise cancellation is great, and they are comfortable to wear for many hours a day at work. Be careful, it's easy to get addicted to the peace and quiet!

author: standroid6971
title: Best in noise cancel and sound over bose 700 & bose qc35II . Do research b4 buying & see .
content:
I am so glad my local retailer was out of the bose QC35II that day .
Otherwise i would have probably never did the research that lead my to the sony 1000X M3 . Everyone agrees and the tests prove that the SONY X M3 destroys bose 700 & QC 35 II . My own listening tests that ive done proved the same thing to me over the bose 700 & QC35II . Are the SonyXM3 perfect NOPE but everywhere it truly matters they are the best in their class . Plenty of bass even without using the apps eq settings as well . I listen to my MX3s flat and the sound is AweSomeNess PerSoNiFied

author: Family7
title: Durable and well made. Excellent headphones! I absolutely love them!!
content:
I have always dreamed of getting something like this. I always looked up to those bose system headphone that my friend had, and I would use them.... so comparing these with his is a who different level. They are completely wireless! They are light and soooo comfortable to wear. The sound is as crisp as it gets. I do wish there was an option for bass though, unless I’m missing something..
you press a button and you can hear your surrounding sounds or “ambient” sounds as a woman speaks through the headphones. You can turn it off. And you press again and you turn on the noise cancellation. The cancellation of blocs is incredible. It’s like you are watching things around you and people talk but you don’t hear ANYTHING (maybe 95 percent of it is completely noise cancelled).
The Bluetooth connection took literally 1 second. I just love the feel of them as well and the look so slick. If you are worried about the battery life, it’s like 30 hours! It also came in a very nice case, and the headphones fold easily for efficient space.
I would most definitely recommend these for leisure, music, flights, whatever whenever..
I hope I was helpful. Thank you.

author: O B M B
title: High Quality Product!!
content: High Quality Product!!

author: Tareq Abou Samra
title: More comfortable than previous model.
content: Sounds great, and does not cut off.

author: E.O.
title: Excellent Noise-cancelling, but with a few trade-offs
content:
Let me begin by saying that the noise-cancelling on these headphones are as described, I don't hear anything when I play music at medium volumes, and it really lasts long. It's also rather comfortable once I adjust it the right way, so much so that I don't really need the Bose QC35 for comfort (I was able to wear it for 5 hours straight without taking them off once). The sound quality is also good enough for me, especially since I can EQ it to what setting I choose.

However, there are a few issues that have developed with the headphones. For one, the hinges have started to creak when I try to stretch them out, this probably has something to do with the plastic build and I'm particularly concerned for how it will hold up in the future. Another is that the Bluetooth connection with LDAC has begun to crackle all the time in the short time that I've had it, which forces me to switch to the SBC codec which is more stable but results in less quality. This could be my source device (Sony Xperia Z1) or the headphones, but whichever one it is it's not good at all.

And I like many others wish they would make a proper form of multi-device pairing, because as it is now you can only connect to the phone for call purposes and to a 2nd device for media. While this may be a way to accomplish it, I feel that it's a lot more complicated to do that than whatever it is that others such as Bose and Sennheiser do.

But as long as they don't break, I feel I can live with them.

author: Louis
title: Simple review
content: Headphones good

author: Rodrigo Galindo
title: The best
content: Just buy em.

author: Ernest Nunez
title: Great headphones
content: This has been the best headphones I ever bought.  Great sound and noise cancellation features, really love using finger swipes to control device.

author: Thomas P. Moran
title: Love these headphones
content: I spent weeks researching options because I wanted wireless headphones with a good mic for calls and excellent noise cancelling for calls.  Since receiving these I've flown cross country roundtrip, set them up for music and movies on my Samsung Note 8, and set them up for taking conference calls using both Microsoft Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams on my Dell laptop.  A couple of things I've noted - they won't connect to my phone and Dell laptop at the same times which leads to disconnecting from one to connect to another.  Second is while they work seamlessly with Teams, Skype for Business takes a little more set up.  I've asked people on the other end how the mic sound and they said I sound fine.  I even took a call from a noisy coffee shop today and nobody complained.  All in all I'm very happy with my purchase.

author: Xotl
title: Great Headphones
content: Sound is balanced and seems overall the headphones looks high quality. The only cons i have are the fact that the voice for the commands like turning it on or off is very verbose and slow, also that the blue LED never stops blinking while turned on which in the night is annoying.

author: William Lucas
title: Best
content: Simply the best headphones on the market.  Makes flying so much more enjoyable.

author: Reuben Njuguna
title: Noise cancelling the best there is.
content: I couldn't have bought a better head over ear headphones. It is quite addictive, and keeps you locked up listening to music and audio books. The noise cancelling is simply the best I have ever experienced, Sony has outdone the competition on this. The bluetooth call connection is impeccable, and i use it mostly when am driving or walking while shopping. This product is sensational.

author: Eric
title: Awesome sound quality, but external touch controls a little tricky
content: Awesome sound quality, but the external touch controls are a little tricky -- when I'm trying to adjust volume or change track, it always seems to do the opposite.

author: ckrank424
title: Amazing
content: My husband and Son both love these. Husband uses on the train to watch movies, and Son uses to sleep.

author: Dylan Still
title: Great quality, buy these headphones.  I am completely unaffiliated with Sony.
content: These headphones are lit.

author: Mark Donne
title: Live somewhere with cold weather... Stay far far away from these headphones. DON'T BUY THEM.
content:
Although these headphones overall are great they get a 1 star from me because they don't work in cold weather. The voice and volume controls turn on randomly without me touching the touch pad. I do not recommend these headphones especially if you live somewhere that has cold weather.

Sony support was rude when I called them about this issue and it's frustrating because of how much they cost.

Do NOT buy these.

author: Biglow1
title: It's a great buy.
content: The Sony noise cancelling feature works better than the Bose,the sound quality of both are excellent

author: Shahar Rosner
title: amazing headphones
content: Amazing headphones, very good sound quality. can use either LDAC or APTX, both work fine with nice results. LDAC is a bit higher quality, but APTX provides lower latency, so it's good you can choose between them based on your uses. The headphones are a bit tight, but overall very comfortable. I guess they will adjust once I 'break them in'. Noise cancelling is very nice, though I still haven't tested them on a very noisy environment (like plane and such). Touch controls are working very good , and covering the ear cup to hear someone around you is a very nice added feature. The traveling case is very nice and relatively compact. Battery life is long.

author: Abhishek
title: Great headphones but beware!
content:
This is a great headphone by most accounts but beware of the following quirks that are a downer on me:
1) They are a little bit heavy so make sure to reaaaallllyyyyy adjust the headset to fit TIGHT on you, else it will fall easily
2) The noise cancellation isn't that great. The only two settings that work are full noise cancellation and none. Those adjustments between them are really not that smooth in transition.
3) The noise cancellation in this is a little bit weird, sort of feels like pressure is being reduced around your ears so your balance does go a little bit off every time you wear and take off the headphone.
4) The touch controls are wonky, most times they work and some times they don't. But you really gotta be exact with your movements else they won't work at all.

author: Phil
title: enchanting.
content: Excellent finish and enchanting sound quality.

author: ndrwum
title: gives me headaches
content: for some reason, when NC is turned on, i get a major headache. idk if it's the waves it's producing to cancel the noise out or what but it doesn't seem safe. the bose qc35's didn't do that. aside from that, NC and sound quality is better than bose. still not enough bass for me. the headphones are also kind of heavy and the volume controls aren't precise and my ears feel hot after a while from wearing them. i love that you can temporarily turn NC off by covering your hands over one side of the cans. Unfortunately, since my head kept on hurting i had to return them.

author: amelia jones
title: Completely blocks out family members arguing during Thanksgiving. 5 stars!

author: slidvendetta
title: Excellent Wireless Headphones
content: I travel a lot for my job and these headphones are indispensable. Battery charge lasts, and charges quickly. The noise cancellation is very good. The last red eye flight I was on I was sitting next to a heavy snorer and I didn't hear it at all. I wouldn't have known until the air crew had to reach in front of me to wake him up because he was disturbing the other passengers. I use these headphone with Android primarily. The app is really well designed and very useful. The carry case is light weight and very sturdy with room for the supplied accessories.

author: Levi B
title: Need an upgrade? Give these a shot before buying Bose.
content: I love these. I normally use Bose, but opted for these as my latest replacement for my old pair. Highly recommend them. Sounds quality is excellent. Noise canceling is fantastic. I really like the palm gesture to activate external mics so that you can hear what's going on or to have a short conversation.

author: Steve Brown
title: Good quality, stylish, and pretty comfy.
content: Very happy with these headphones. Great noise cancellation, solid sound quality, and lots of cool features. They fold a bit oddly in the box (I always find them tricky to put away) but other than that, all good.

author: OBXer4LIFE
title: THE BEST!
content: The best headphones I have ever purchased. Great design, comfortable, and sound awesome. Also, key, is the charging time of 10 minutes for another 5 hours of use. I like these better than my $500 Bang & Olufsen h9i-

author: Velias
title: Defective or poorly-designed, just learned why Sony is no longer competitive!
content:
These headphones keep disconnecting from my phone which is very close by, in my pocket.  Constant "chime" every few minutes and silence then reconnection to bluetooth.  Never had these problems with other bluetooth headphones and same phone.  When the manual discusses this "issue" it's a clue Sony doesn't know how to design stuff anymore.
What a disappointment, should have gone with the Beats.........
How do I get my money back?  You don't expect problems like this from $300+ "Top of the line" headphones.

author: Lucas C.
title: Overall Great Headphones, with a few minor annoyances
content:
For a while prior to the purchase of these headphones, I really wanted a nice pair of Premium sounding NC Bluetooth Headphones.  For the weeks prior to my tax refund check arriving, I debated the Sony Wh-1000mx3's and the Bose QC 35 ii's, I obviously went with the former of the two.
These arrived in a very timely manner, and the first thing I noticed out the gate was the immaculate and incredible presentation, huge shout out to Sony on that regard! After trying these headphones on I noticed how incredibly comfy they are, since owning them I have worn them for hours on end.  Once I got the app setup through with, which was very easy and straightforward, I put these cans on, and man do they deliver! I listen to a lot of EDM, which consists of a lot of bass, and treble both that balance each other out.  These headphones deliver in both departments.  The bass is nice and punchy, with a good thundering sound to it, and the treble is crystal clear, with no distortion.  I've also listened to other genres such as Rock, Pop, Rap, and a little bit of Country to try these out, and these sound incredible across the board! Another really awesome feature is the EQ, which is by no means a gimmick, as in other pairs of headphones/earbuds.  Each individual preset in the EQ completely changes the sound, it's mind blowing!! The noise cancellation is also better than I was let to believe.  Once you put these on, you are in your own world, surrounded by your favorite music.  One of the first things I did when I got these headphones, was took them outside to test the cold weather glitch, because it was below freezing when I received these.  If you're not familiar with the cold weather glitch, it's where the touch controls bug out in temperatures below 40 degrees Fahrenheit.  The issue was prevalent in the other reviews I read, and I can attest that my set did it as well, but it's only a minor annoyance in my case, and I can definitely live with it.  The only other annoyance I noticed was that my model started creaking whenever flexing the headband to put them on, but this has not caused any structural issues in the 4 months that I've had them.

Overall Pros/Cons
Pros:
Fantastic Sound
Solid EQ
Exceptional Noise Cancellation
Lightweight, comfortable feel.

Cons:
Touch controls malfunction in cold weather
May start creaking

Final Verdict:
Overall these are a fantastic buy.  I have been loving and enjoying them on day 1, I would 10/10 buy these again! I feel like these are worth every penny out of the $350 price tag, but if you can get them cheaper, then by all means go for it!!

author: Wayne A.
title: Satisfied end user
content: Very comfortable fit, very good sound (including Bluetooth). Most often paired with iPad & iPhone 7s - but can only be paired with one device at a time.

author: Stephen G Wheeler
title: SO GOOD
content: I travel a lot for work and I can’t even describe in words the difference these have made. So good.

author: Bryce Tennant
title: Epiphany
content: Shockingly good with an authentic holy sh*t moment! Worth the money. I listen to music constantly at home and this is going to change both how I listen and my expectations moving forward.

author: Bruce A Taylor
title: Beats out Bose as best noise canceling headphones
content: Switched from Bose to Sony noise canceling headphones +fit, weight, sound; overall superior- very happy with these new headphones!

author: Ashwin
title: Good quality sound, noise cancellation. Easy to use.
content: They pair pretty quickly and are comfortable to wear. One thing to note is that the noise cancellation while pretty good, will not be effective if you intend to just put the headphones without music. Loud noises will still get through. Once music is played however, you can't hear anything around you. The quick ambient sound filter by putting your hand to the right ear works really well if you see someone talking to you but don't want to talk off your headphones.

author: Justin
title: Sound imbalance
content: The noise cancelling effect is amazing . However my headphone have a sound imbalance issue. My left ear up will sound much louder than the right one.

author: Clay King
title: Awesome technology
content: Well worth th price

author: Deborah VanDerKar
title: Sony headphones 🎧
content: These headphones rock!

author: Austin C Barker
title: Best Sounding Headphones
content: Absolute best headphones I’ve ever owned. Makes you feel completely surrounded by the music. 10/10 highly recommend. BUY THESE NOW!!!

author: John N. Doggett
title: Better Than Bose 700.
content:
I have been a Bose ANC headphone owner for decades.  So I was really excited when the Bose 700 was released.  What a disaster the Bose 700s are.  The Bose Music app is trash.  I was constantly trying to keep it connected to Bluetooth.  It is impossible to turn off, so I had to set the "auto-shut off" feature to 5 minutes so the battery wouldn't run down.  I sent the first unit back.  The second unit was a little better, but it is very difficult to pair it with a second deice and it still won't turn off manually.

I was so frustrated with the Bose 700s that I decided to try the Sony.  I am so glad that I did.  The sound is slightly richer.  The Noise cancellation is better.  The on ear swipe controls are flawless.  And, most important, it is brain-dead easy to pair them and keep them paired.  Finally, I can turn them off manually.

Bose, you've lost a lifetime customer to Sony.

author: Leo
title: Buyer Beware
content: Gifted this product on Valentine’s Day and  learned that it was not working properly less than a month later. The microphone call feature is unusable. Too late to return. Total waste of money.

author: Yana
title: Gift
content: Got this for my BF as a gift and he loves it so much! :) noise cancellation was everything. The sound was superb! Definitely worth buying

author: keylargo77
title: Lightweight quality headphones
content: My husband loves these quality headphones!  He wears them while mowing with a commercial grade LOUD ZTR.  Said he can't hear the mowing noise at all.  Sound quality is fantastic!

author: jb
title: Whoa these blow the Bose headphones out of the water!
content: Absolutely worth the money. Returning my Bose headphones.

author: Dick Silver
title: These things ar amazing!!
content: I've been traveling for work on commercial airliners 50 weeks out of each year for years, and require noise-cancelling headphones to hear music and videos. I previously owned Beats, then Bose, and never imagined Bose could be upstaged- but they have been. Never thought I'd say it, but the noise cancellation in these is superior to Bose, and I actually forget that I'm on an airplane with these guys- you hear nothing except the audio you're listening to...down to ice tinkling in a glass in a movie. I'm far from being an audio geek, but I know superior sound quality when I hear it!

author: D. Marte
title: Best NC headphone.
content: well, I've had the Xm1 / Xm2 and today got my Xm3. The sound quality has improved when wireless, also, they do feel a lot lighter and cheaper. I am not sure about the NC, I feel like the Gen 1 and Gen 2 had better NC, maybe I need to fuzz a bit more with my calibration, but I can hear the MTA trains a bit more than before while commuting in NYC. I'll make a 10 Min video this weekend on my overall thoughts on the Xm3, but so far not impressed with the supposed HD Noise Cancelling chip, the QN1.

author: Nc
title: MUST BUY!!!
content: These headphones are Miraculous.

author: solace295
title: Expected Performance
content: Upon receiving this product, I was pretty excited to ignore my noisy household.  I this aspect, it did not disappoint. These headphones are able to keep almost all noise out of the headphones and let the noise in when you so choose. The features are helpful and the sound quality is excellent. I would buy again.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazing Noise Canceling
content:
After trying these on at a local best buy, I was honestly blown away by how well the noise cancellation works. The experience was surreal. My initial reaction was to laugh because honestly, it was a joy to experience isolation in a crowded and noisy best buy. I found myself constantly taking the headphones on and off to compare, because I just couldn't believe how well they worked.
