title: Abysmal voice quality on phone calls
content:
Five stars for everything but microphone quality on phone calls, a scenario in which these headphones are pretty much unusable.

I tried them several times from my Samsung S9 and everyone on the receiving side said my voice sounded tinny with echoes.

If Sony can't fix this with a firmware update I may have to return the headphones to Amazon for a refund.

author: -b
title: Great Sounding Comfortable
content: These are some of the most comfortable over the ear headphones I have worn. The ANC is great and battery life is unreal. I am very happy with this purchase.

author: Savinaya
title: Best noise cancelling Headphones by Sony
content: One of the best of the Bluetooth headphones 🎧 with Good noise cancellation features and enough software control and easy to pair and don’t have to remove if need to listen to outside audio just by keeping the hand on headphones and touch control for volume and pause and play

author: Ian P.
title: Great Product, Extremely Fragile
content: I took care of these headphones extremely well. Wiped them down after each use, always stored them in their case, etc. They’re a really great product, except for the fact that they mysteriously stop working. My first pair produced a crackling sound in the right ear while talking with the noise cancelling feature. I thought this must be a flub and tried them again. The second pair lasted a bit longer, but even then would randomly shut off or not turn on (even with the battery fully charged). I would not recommend.

author: Simon J Newton
title: Superb!  Long time Bose fan has converted.
content:
I've been using Bose headphones for more than 10 years and recently changed to Sony.

These are noticeably lighter than the XM2 and the USB-C means I don't have to carry extra chargers. Worth the $50 extra on top of the XM2s.

I'm glad they finally provided an option to disable the auto-power off. On long flights I don't want to have to keep the headphones paired with my phone and leaving the cable plugged in was annoying.

Bose is playing catch up now.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Overall they’re OK
content: I personally prefer the Bose Quiet Comfort 35.

author: lente
title: Frustrating buy. Don’t do it...
content:
The headphones started clicking in loud environments. Other owners have the same issues. Additionally the headphones have some real design flaws:
- you cant have phone calls with them bc the mic is too weak and it doesn’t noise cancel well while doing so. You are hearing everything in the background!!
- you cant use them while charging
- you cant have phone calls using the headphone jack bc it has no mic integrated
- the pairing process to devices is slow

The battery lasts 10h or so. That’s fine. Overall this product is not thought through.

author: F. Mercado
title: No low latency.
content: They don't have low latency, so you can't watch TV with them, the sound is all out of sync with them. For something that's as expensive as this it's kind of disappointing they can't do this.

author: Trey Chatman
title: Great Headphones!
content: Good sound quality! Noise cancellation is very effective!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent at preventing spoilers
content:
Friends: "dude that was crazy when Daenerys Targaryen..."
WH1000Xm3: "Power, On"
Friends: "..."

author: Eric
title: The best noise cancelling headphones you can buy
content:
These are great headphones!  I've been searching for a pair for quite a while.  Came across these that were at the top of many review lists, and I agree - these are the best.  In no particular order, here are my findings:
1. They're nicely padded and comfortable and my ears don't get hot or feel pressed even after wearing for a few hours when streaming shows or gaming. the ear cups alone cut down a lot of the external noise.
2. the battery lasts forever and it's great that its rechargeable through a USB-C adapter (which is Super fast at recharging).
3. the sound quality is very impressive.  sure, it isn't body shaking like a home theater is, but it can certainly fill your ears with the whole range, including great bass.
4. the noise canceling is great.  it immediately sounds like you've stepped into one of those sensory deprivation rooms.  Of course you'll still hear the occasional loud noise or if you're next to someone trying to talk to someone you can hear them but it is very reduced.  keep in mind you wont hear someone calling you from the other room.
5. the controls are actually really good and useful. I thought they'd be a gimmick with the touch pad gesture controls, but they are well thought out and executed well.  the menu voice telling you system status, battery life, etc, is also very nice to have and works well.  The bluetooth connection works seamlessly too.
6. And one of the key points that made me choose this one, that I haven't seen in a lot of other noise canceling headphones, is that these will still work as regular headphones even if you don't have to have them powered on (no noise canceling or controls of course) as long as you have them wired up to your device.
7. the choice of colors-black or white is nice, and the case that they come in is also quality.

I'm not a big Sony fan and thought I'd end up with a Bose or Sennheiser set, but I'm very happy I chose these headphones, these are the best - quality, performance, and value.

author: Kirill M.
title: These things changed music for me
content:
I'm a music lover, but never had headphones like these before. Putting these on for the first time changed everything for me. I'm incredibly grateful for the experience offered by the WH1000XM3's. Their price is beyond justified.

The noise cancelling is incredible. There's constant construction noise happening outside my apartment that's been a nuisance. And even with no music playing I hear nothing from the outside.

Only problem is that I don't think I'll ever take them off from now on.

author: Bryce
title: Worth what I paid for
content: The controls are intuitive, the sound quality is great, the noise cancelling is phenomenal, and the battery is quite something. I'm really glad I splurged and bought it

author: KTD
title: Great
content: These sound excellent and the controls are super intuitive. However some of my devices have difficulty connecting to them. They sound and look great but just wish they weren’t so expensive. I have not tried the Bose but definitely get these over beats any day

author: J.A.
title: Great
content: Has great noise cancelling

author: dollhouseLady
title: The best on the market
content: These work so great for my husband who deals with anxiety while traveling.  Totally quiet and if I need to talk to him I touch his arm and he touches the side of the ear piece and we can talk.

author: Vic
title: Volume
content: Difficult adjusting sound swipe up or down every attempt paused track and replayed will try Bose next

author: Peter Ferreira-Gandolfo
title: Great for Commuting
content: Love these headphones. Best Christmas gift to myself in ages. Love the sound quality and the noise canceling is amazing especially when on subway or bus.

author: PlayingWithFire
title: Core product is good but man there are a lot of compromises for this price point
content:
I will say first that after comparing this to competitors like Bose and Sennheiser as well as the older XM2 I chose to keep this pair. It is the best over the ear NC BT headphone I've tried. But boy does it come with a lot of complaints.

The Good
1. Very comfortable. Sweat might be a problem in the summer. But bigger/deeper than XM2, XM2 gets uncomfortable after an hour or 2. I can wear the XM3 for 4+ hrs no problem.
2. Sound quality is great for bluetooth. The Sennheiser PXC and Bose QC35 ii I've tried can best be described as lifeless no matter how I tweak the EQ. The XM3 is too bass forward by default but with some eq it shows a lot of dynamic range and the soundstage is much bigger than the other 2 listed here.
3. Noise canceling is excellent, a bit better than QC35. Allows me to listen to music at lower volume and pick up more details.
4. USB-C: Thank you, microusb shouldn't be used on non budget devices in 2018

The Bad
1. The build quality: The comfort and flexibility is great but man this feels cheap. Plastic squeaks with movement sometimes. Very plastic heavy all around.
2. The non replaceability: The ear pads and headband pads aren't designed to be replaced. While the material suggest that they should be able to be wiped clean, I'd still appreciate some modularity in case they get flat/dirty in the future.
3. Lack of multiple BT connection: It's 2018, cheaper headphones supports 2 BT devices to be connected at the same time for a while now and with these Sonys I still have to disconnect/connect between my PC/Phone every time I need to make a switch.
4. The touch control: Cool in concept, works reasonably ok in non windy situations. But man it cause problems in the winter when it would erroneously register all sort of command (Google assistant, the "hear the surrounding" command, skip forward, skip back). Every time I go outside in near freezing weather I have to reset it by turning it off, wait a bit until headphone get used to surrounding temperature, and then turn it back on. Same thing for when I go inside. Even then it has false registrations. I wish there is a way in the app to turn off certain functions that I rarely use (the cup ear thing comes to mind) so they wouldn't mistakenly get registered. But I currently do not see that function.

But at the end of the day there are compromises for all BT headphones now. And if you have the money and the pros here line up with your priority, this is still a decent buy.

author: Adan
title: Sound quality is as cheap as earplugs
content: The sound quality and Bluetooth connectivity are so bad......

author: Talon475
title: Awesome Headset!
content:
I have always wanted a noise cancellation headset, and an upcoming trip to Hawaii gave me the perfect excuse to get one.  I had narrowed it down to the Bose QC35 II's and the Sony WHX1000XM3's.  After doing a lot of research I settled on the Sony's because of the reported flexibility of the app and equalizer, the touch controls, sound quality, and the USB-C charger.

I have been using these regularly for a month and am very happy with my purchase.  The noise cancellation is amazing.  The sound quality is very good.  I was worried since the reviews mentioned the bass was more pronounced with the Sony's than that of the Bose, but I found that it was not overpowering.  The battery life is really good as well, and the touch controls work just as advertised.

It did take a while to get used to them since I used mainly in ear bluetooth buds for many years, but they are really comfortable, and I am able to wear them for hours without ear fatigue.

I definitely recommend these headphones.

author: Scrub
title: Not bad... but you have got to be kidding me
content:
Focusing on the work at hand can be difficult. I purchased these headphones with the intention of cutting background audio sounds like fans, clicking of keyboards etc. (or at least assisting with them). They do a relatively decent job. The sound quality on these headphones are pretty decent as well. Not bad for listening to music with more bass. There are two problems with these headphones in my eyes... the microphones and accessories. I know the product is purely made for "noise cancellation" and the focus is not with accessories, but you have GOT to be kidding me. After spending this much money on a headset they send you a cable to charge your headset SO SHORT that it can't reach anything without putting strain on the adapter you use or the USB-C jack. I honestly think the cable is ~6 inches. Also, do not anticipate using these headphones for a phone call... seriously.
+Good sound quality
+Noise cancellation works decently
+Touch controls
-Terrible mic. quality
-Basically have to buy your own charge cable

author: Elizabeth A. Bell
title: Great quality
content: I love the headphones, unfortunately, the charging wire was not in the package.

author: Michael R
title: Great sound and very comfortable
content: I bought these mainly for air travel to drown out the noise and enjoy music or a movie in more clarity. For this I say mission accomplished. The noise canceling is great. Just putting them on instantly blocks a lot of the surrounding noise and with the noise canceling turned on it is blissfully quiet. Wearing the headphones for long times while watching a movie they stay comfortable and never hurt my ears but somehow the headband is causing a pinching pain on top of my head. Usually that goes away when shifting the contact point slightly. I have 4 stars because I find the volume control a little difficult and more often then not I skip a song or pause the music.

author: Balatar
title: You let me down Sony
content: The control cup is very unresponsive I will try to pause music and it won't respond, even at times on it's own Will call on Google assistant and the phone call quality is crappie

author: Ceyhun_Badirkhanov
title: Super
content: Super

author: Greg NJ
title: Absolute Cluster F*&# From The Sony "Support" Team.
content:
The product worked great for about 3 weeks until the audio in the headphone went out.

Contacted sony about returning the product, sent it to them, they offered a replacement,  and then they put in the wrong address on the package so now the replacement is sitting in a FedEx facility 20 minutes away from me but they won't let me even go out of my way to pick up the headphones (because that's not company policy).

They need to contact a "shipping team" different from their "support team" to help me. The shipping team can't be called, but they must be summoned like batman, by shining a giant light into the sky, and only then can they look into the case. But don't worry, that's only if your case gets expadited. They've sent me to beurocratic hell and they keep adding fuel to the fire.

 So what was a 1-week debacle is turning into a 3 week return time?!?!

This was fun -.-

Summary: Sony can sell you there stuff but you're on your own when you have a problem.

author: Bradley
title: Nicely done Sony!
content:
These headphones are a near-perfect blending of the best qualities of the Bose QuietComfort 35 (Series II) and the Sony WH1000XM2.  Nicely done Sony!

Update 2018/11: After 9 or 10 weeks I'm still enjoying these headphones a lot, I use them primarily to create silence for work. It's a fun and unusual sensation to be in a busy place, like a restaurant or coffee shop, and yet hear almost nothing. I recently used them on a flight and was amazed at how effective they were at blocking the noise, the in-app atmospheric pressure optimizing feature does make at least some a difference.

author: Catherine
title: Exceeded my expectations and then some
content:
These noise cancelling headphones exceeded my expectations and then some. The fit for me (I am 5'0") is most excellent and very comfortable. Went on an Alaskan cruise with 4,000 others and these headphones helped me be in my own very exclusive bubble.

I also had the opportunity to use them when talking on the phone. Usually I don't like using bluetooth earphones when talking on my cell as quality ranges from poor to piss poor. However, these headphones made me forget that I was using them as my cellphone go-between.

The price is steep but you know what they say...you get what you pay for.

author: Gordon Swobe
title: Very pleased, very high tech
content: I had not realized how far headphone technology had advanced until I purchased these headphones. They are comfortable and the sound quality is superb. The important functions are controlled with simple hand gestures on the side of one of the earpieces. Very satisfied.

author: Michael Lynch
title: Great pair of headphones, that don't work after a few months
content:
I loved these headphones, as a sound engineer these very good. The issue is that they don't work after a few months of use. The battery level is as advertised and does last a long time, but the sound keeps cutting in and out. I've tried it with different devices from my computer to my phone.

I would like Sony to fix this, but when I go visit their support page, these are not found on their site. I can't return them to Amazon because of the time frame. $300+ headphones that are superb but because they don't support it anymore it's a waste.

Too bad, probably the best sounding headphones I have ever used.

author: Cheryl s.
title: G'ma got 5 stars for the gift!
content: I cannot give 5 stars as I have not used them, but my grandson assures me he loves them for the noise cancelling and it also has "really cool features"!

author: Kevin
title: Phone calls a serious flaw
content:
I like these headphones - fit, noise cancelling, sound , battery life are great.  The big flaw for me is phone calls.  Everyone complains and tells me to call them back without the headset.  I didn't expect this at all given my less expensive Bose never had a problem.
1) Has there been any software updates to deal with this?  If not is any in the works?
2) When I receive calls noise cancelling automatically turns off and I hear amplified ambient noise.  Is there a way to
keep noise cancelling on ALL the time?

 I don't want to resort to using a cable as it defeats the whole purpose of this headset.  Any solutions appreciated.
Some have exchanged their XM3's for another pair and phone calls improved a little but still not great.

I don't want to return these but I cannot go 3+ years without making bluetooth phone calls.

Thanks

author: Raymond K.
title: Battery goes BAD
content: It turned on once and I was never ever able to get a charge again!  Since I hadn't used it in over a month I guess the company wouldn't take it back.  Not even advice of what to do with this piece of  trash.

author: NorthStar Alarm Services
title: Wonderful... but dont try to take calls
content: I got these as a gift and I absolutely Love them! the Noise Cancellation is the best (look at any other tech review) the sound is amazing (after I tweak it a little bit with the app) and the "buttons" are pretty on point! After I first got them though when I would turn on the noise cancelling it made me feel motion sick but after using then 3 or 4 times that stopped happening. Also THESE ARE NOT A GAMING HEADSET OR ONE TO TAKE CALLS ON! I read lots of reviews saying how bad it is for that and it got low stars for it, to those people I say, You're Dumb! Its never claimed to be those things. for what it says it's going to do, it does it very well! for what it doesn't say it's going to do... It's fine but not good.

author: KAITECH
title: Noise cancellation is great for plane travel
content: It has a 30 hour playtime and charges in 3 hours.  I found it to be very effective at canceling plane noise while listening to music or watching a movie on my iPad... These headphones are also very comfortable to wear...

author: Connor
title: Excellent!
content: I owned version 2 of these headphones. I decided to buy version 3 because I read that they charge faster and they're more comfortable, and the reviewers were right! This version is very close to perfect. I love using these headphones at work.

author: Lucio Israel Pérez Rosales
title: Truly impressing NC and sound
content:
I use these headphones in the office (open floor plan), and I love everything about these headphones:

- Noise Cancelling: the fact that you can adjust the NC level is great, as I can ignore everything else at MAX, or be able to hear someone coming with just one slider.
- Sound: great quality, I'm not an audio expert so I can't describe it better
- Comfort: I use these up to 10 continuous hours a day, and have never been uncomfortable wearing them
- Materials: very good quality, there is no part of the headphones that feels cheap to the touch. I'm not aware of the details of the cracking that past generations used to have, so I am in the lookout for any signs of stress

author: Brian M Daniel
title: Great Sound
content: The sound is great, pairing is simple and they REALLY cut out the ambient noise.

author: AshishM
title: Amazing headphones. Highly recommend
content:
This is an excellent pair of headphones. I was blown away by the noise cancellation and the phenomenal sound quality. I was deciding between the Bose QC35 II and these and while the Bose is a great product too, this is just far more superior in terms of noise canceling (well, just by a smidge though, very tiny difference if you really want to notice it) and Sound (this is just more fun to listen with more bass and more details and sound separation compared to the Bose ). I’ve been re listening to my favorite tracks and it’s so much more enjoyable with these headphones.. really glad I got these.

One gripe I have, actually 2- it’s difficult to make phone calls with these in windy or noisy environments since people on the other end have complained about too much background noise, and second- switching between devices is not smooth, sometimes you have to disconnect Bluetooth from the 1st Device before connecting the 2nd one. This makes it a laborious task. Bose is better for these 2 aspects.

But do get these if all you are looking for are great sound quality and excellent noise cancellation. Highly recommended!!

author: eddie jin
title: Life changer
content: If you have never experienced these, find someone who has and try it, or go to best buy and try it. These are life-changing headphones. I fly a lot, and when I put these on, I can't hear anything, engine noise, babies, etc. Also great for canceling out your nagging girlfriend.

author: db12
title: Very comfortable, but they will get sweaty when you work out.
content: One of the best things I ever purchased.  It really blocks out sounds around me-helps me with concentration.  Well worth the money!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Sony’s best headphones so far.
content: It’s a great product, puts you in a different world won’t be able to hear anything around you, and got a great feel to them. Materials are good, and light. Battery lasts a long time. I had them on for almost 2 days, and they were still working. The great thing about them is the noise canceling, and how it adapts to your surroundings.

author: Wayne Weil
title: Life changing if you are on airplanes or in an open office
content: I spend a lot of time on airplanes and in open office environments.  These things are amazing.  I did a lot of research and these were consistently the highest rated (even better than Bose).  Finally took the leap and have not regretted it for a second.

author: Pankaj Thapar
title: Brilliant headphones especially for the price!
content: Great sound, very good battery life and brilliant noise cancelling.

author: cincyshirm61
title: Can't easily switch between devices (ie. phone/pc
content: These are a great set of headphones. The build quality, the sound, the ANC functionality, all top notch (as they should be for the price). However, I can't remember the last time I had such a poor experience switching between bluetooth devices. The instructions say you can pair up to 8 (i think) devices, but that doesn't mean you can quickly switch between them. Really wanted to listen to music and take calls on my PC, yet if I got a call on my cell, be able to answer it with the headphones, as i can do on any number of bluetooth headsets, including a several year old set of QY7 earbuds. they switch seamlessly, yet the experience with these was horrible, I returned them.  Also, they made my head sweat around my ears after hours of use. Not too upset about this part but worth mentioning.

author: Royce
title: Best noise cancelling headphones in the market.
content: Bought this for my daily work meetings over the internet and it was perfect for multitasking. I could partake in the meeting while pooping given the excellent wireless range. The noise cancellation is probably the best out of all the headphones I’ve owned.

author: Amanda Messina
title: Great Wireless and Wired Headphones for People with Hearing Loss
content:
I'm so happy with these. After looking and looking, reading reviews and ratings, I decided to take the plunge on these. Suffering from hearing loss makes me have to wear hearing aids on both ears, which helps but brings in some background noise. Traveling in planes is the worst! You need the hearing aids to hear the announcements and flight attendants, but even the top of the line hearing aids allow some airplane noise. I'm taking them on and off. It's also super annoying to hear the talk of other people, the coughs, babies crying.......and the hum of the engines.

Well, I thought I would tr;y these and put them on in the plane. I could not hear ANY of those sounds! I was in my own quiet, peaceful world. These blocked out so many sounds that the flight attendant would have to tap my arm to get my attention. NOISE CANCELLING IS GREAT. That said, it might be a different experience for a person without hearing loss.

Then I turned them on and the sound was stunning. Just beautiful. You can use this with or without the cord so you can plug it right into the seat back screen. The charge lasted all day long until I put them away. The charging cord is a little short but fine.  Nice adjustable comfort, felt quite luxurious.

Worth every penny!!

author: daniel
title: Noise canceling works as advertised
content: With these amazing headphones I am able to block out my noisy air conditioning unit, excellent battery life, the controls take a little getting used to but once mastered they work without fail

author: Matthew Chapell
title: Wrong Headphones in the sealed box !!!!!
content: There was a pair of $50 Sony headphones in the sealed box , not what I paid for !!!!!!!!!

author: Damien Beckham
title: These things are the genuine article
content:
I took these to work, and the response I got was all the same. They were asking where I got them, how much, holy crap I need me some of those.

I let them listen to $200 earbuds, and how the sound quality of these headphones just blow earbuds out of the water, they agreed of course once I shown them the light.

The Noise Cancellation is really amazing, I mean you could turn it on, in the middle of a busy store and just fall right to sleep it's so soothing how much sound is cut out. Added that with the superior audio quality, these things are the BEST investment, if you go anywhere and want to listen to music, and not have earbuds in your ear.

author: B. Hart
title: Good product without issue
content: Good product without issue. Could have a bit higher volume.

author: Sandokan
title: It's easy to use
content: I like the sound, I use it to watch movies and hear music

author: CL
title: Solid headphones at its price point
content: You can't go wrong with buying this pair of headphones. Overall pretty decent sound quality (though not the best out there, you can get better sound by paying more). Very comfortable and good noise cancellation. It does lack volume buttons though. The ANC toggle has 3 modes and talks to you for a long time before switching modes, which was slightly annoying. However, my money ends up going to Bowers and Wilkins for their $300 pair of active noise cancelling headphones, which has better sound, a better interface, and looks sleeker.

author: Kevin Hill
title: Soooooo Good!
content:
Wow these things are impressive! I’ve used them for a couple months now on planes, while working in the evening (spouse sleeping) while mowing the lawn, etc. My wife used them while vacuuming and declared it “life-changing experience.” Haha! ☺️

The ability to control volume and pause content with just a swipe or double tap is great. Noise cancellation is wonderful, and sound is really good; plus you can adjust to your liking with equalizer via app. My only suggestion is that they make the headband a little wider (front to back) to help distribute the load a bit; while wearing for long periods of time I would have to adjust it occasionally to prevent minor pain. I also haven’t found any need for the other two audio options (ambient sound on, and noise canceling off). Overall though, these things are killer! 4.8/5 Stars.

author: Bear
title: Pretty good as everyone reviewed
content: Pretty good as everyone reviewed

author: Kiku
title: Great noise cancelling
content: The best noise cancelling headphones I have ever had!

author: Scott
title: Great noise canceling, poor sound quality
content:
The noise canceling ability of these headphones is phenomenal, but if you care at all about accurately reproducing sound these are not for you. The mix is heavily tilted toward the bass with the mids and highs very muted. Still trying to decide if the noise cancellation is worth it over the sonic properties of my etymotic ear buds which, though not active, do a great job of blocking noise.

Edit: I am revising this down to a 2 star review. These deserve 2 stars for the noise cancellation, but if you care about sound quality at all do not buy these. Even though the mix is tilted toward bass, if you listen to anything with heavy bass the sound is muddy as hell. Do not buy these if you care about sound quality.

author: Michael R Kelley
title: These are awesome!
content: Expensive....?  Yes.  Worth it......?  Oh yeah.  These wireless headphones are fantastic.  I use them on walks and when things get noisy while working from home.  For sheer comfort, I'd give the nod to Bose, but these are still very comfortable and the sound is incredible.  Also works great for phone calls.  Clear as a bell.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The headphones are remarkable in their ability to cancel ambient noise!
content: I like the noise cancelling dynamics. I use them whenever the noise in the house gets too loud. They work better than hoped for!

author: Preston
title: Comfortable with great noise reduction
content: They work just like advertised!  Noise reduction is great and all the controls seem easy to use.  They are also very comfortable; at least to me.  I have a first generation Bose over the ear noise reduction head phones and these [admittedly 2 decades newer] are clearly superior.

author: Misterpv
title: As Advertised!
content: Most of the publications had these headphones as the best over Bose, which was what I wanted to buy initially. I decided to purchase the Sony WH1000XM3 based on the positive reviews it received and I have not been disappointed. The sound quality is superior and the fit is extremely comfortable as they are so light on my head and ears. Other features like the touch controls and the assistant mode just added to my overall satisfaction in buying these headphones.

author: Julie Chase
title: They're perfect lol
content: They are perfect except for two things. 1. They are a little clunky 2. They only pair with one primary bluetooth device at a time so if you want to switch it you have to re-pair it with the device you want to listen to. Anyways, buy them lol.

author: Nelson Gonzalez Restrepo
title: Excelente para el día a día siempre con música
content: Producto cómodo, muy buena calidad de sonido y efectivas cancelación de ruido. Los controles táctiles a veces no son muy efectivos.

author: marcos jota
title: Excelente inversión
content: Excelente inversión

author: Homero Avalos
content: La mejor versión de audífonos sin ser profesionales, app y bateria excelentes, bastante intuitivos, ergonómicos y súper estéticos, aunque la calidad del sonido no es %100 la mejor pero compensa, quizás el precio podría ser menor

author: Rhaiza Lima
title: Nice
content: My husband loved it

author: EMF
title: they're just so good
content: Bought these to study in busy places and they are absolutely excellent. The ability to change the volume and skip tracks with swiping on the ear is a huge perk too.

author: Tricia M
title: Bose Quiet Comfort are better
content: I do not like these headphones at all. Sure, they sound great and are great at noise cancellation, but the usability is poor. If you connect these to more than one device at any point in time, then good luck getting music to play from one of them when you want it to. I connected to my phone first, and all was well. I then connected to my laptop yesterday and work. When I got home and was cooking I wanted to listen to music on my headphones so I did not bother my husband, but after 30 minutes spent messing with my phone and headphones, I could not get spotify to play. I reconnected and disconnected over bluetooth. I turned the headphones off and on. I went into the app to see if I could change the primary device, like you can in the Bose QC app, but I ultimately couldn't get them to work. That to me is the downfall of these headphones. I need to be able to switch between different devices - I am not even saying I need to be able to switch easily, like I could with my Bose, but just being able to switch at all would be nice. I also do not like the volume/pause/play/skip controls on these headphones. I rested my head on my shoulder and my music started playing directly from my phone two days ago when that connection was working. Bizarre. Overall, I do not recommend these.

author: Roei Elfasi
title: Over the top Headphones
content: Really above what I’ve expected! Excellent piece of technology. Worth every penny. Amazing sound that really is enhanced with the noise cancellation.

author: saguviper
title: Annoying popping noise!
content: So, when you are not moving or traveling, these are really good. But if you are in a vehicle moving, there seems to be an issue with the noise cancellation. A click or popping noise happens while riding in a bus, van, or other vehicle. If you are just listening to loud music, might not here it. If you are listening to a podcast or any talking, it can be annoying. I am getting a replacement, so I will see if this continues on. If it does, I might get a full refund because for me, it’s annoying!

author: T. D. Koenig
title: Don't assume you'll get silence
content:
I got these headphones for airplanes, and because they definitely improve the plane noise I decided to keep them - my first pair of headphones. I bought these - relatively expensive - having heard all the raves about the "noise-cancelling." Perhaps I was naive, but I expected that I wouldn't be able to hear conversations around me, flight announcements, etc. I can hear all that, plus some engine noise, but certainly it's much more pleasant than without them. Also, easier by far to hear movies than with simple earbuds.
You might be able to get something acceptable for a lot less money.

author: Corey k
title: Perfect for the frequent traveler!
content: Extremely happy with these! I was looking for a good pair of headphones I could travel with, mostly on airplanes (3-4times a month) wanted something with great sound, noise cancelling, Bluetooth AND wired, great battery life, comfortable and can pack up small to fit in my backpack. These checked ALL boxes! I did a lot of research and the only headphones that came close in comparison were a pair of Bose QC35. The noise cancelling is awesome and works wired or wireless,you something I've seen not be the case in some other headphones. You can also change the level of noise cancelling, allowing some ambient noise in so you know your surroundings, as well as cut out completely and have wind cancellation. They also fit great around the ears very comfortably so you can get hours with them (battery life is amazing!). This also seals out the noise. My favorite part about these that i don't believe the Bose have is NFC. Didn't even know this was a feature I wanted until I got to use it. I just tap my Android to my headphones and they connect or disconnect. This makes pairing and switching to multiple devices the fastest I've ever tried! Only one thing I'm not a huge fan of is touch buttons. I never like touch buttons because they tend to cause problems due to the sensors. I haven't has problems yet but I've heard of others that do. I've also used them for oyone calls and haven't yet to have complaints. Haven't done a ton with phone calls yet though.

author: User R
title: How will Sony and/or Bose Top This?
content:
More than a little impressed with the Sony WH1000 X3. Purchased an open box without instructions. Trust me the instruction are important if you have not own previous gens of Sony WH1000. Download the app, update the firmware, and enjoy. Sound is way too boomy for my taste out of the box. With a little eq help and balance from the app, all is well. Would like more SQ features in the app but well enough for now. Great job Sony.

*Past headphones and IEMs for my smartphones- Bose QC15, MDR NC60, Shure 535, and Ultimate Ears.

author: Worker bee
title: Bad design for controls, good noise-cancel when they worked
content:
I used this on an airplane flight.

The good:
Very comfy around the ear, noise-cancel worked great, and the talk -thru feature was good.

The bad:
Design.
The buttons for control are on the bottom of the left side and kept bumping against my shoulder and turning off the noise-cancelling feature.

Functionality.
They would randomly just stop cancelling noise, though they were charged, and it wasn’t due to them turning off by accidentally hitting the button on my shoulder. I could tell when the charge was low and I had to charge them, vs random turning-off every hour or so. Very annoying.
No idea why that kept happening.

author: Valeria Marie Diaz Garcia
title: Super happy
content: Its perfect. The noise cancelling its 👌the sound and battery just as they described it.

author: Michael
title: Impressive!
content: Very sleek product from Sony from operation, connectivity, sound quality, and build quality.  I have owned these for several months now and am impressed every time I put them on.  Noise cancelling is beyond what I expected as is the sound quality.  I'm not cool enough to walk around town with them but enjoy just about any activity around the house wearing them.  Definitely a worthy investment if you like high quality things that work well.

author: leilani
title: POS
content: I bought this and was told it didn't work because the charger cable was probably faulty. NO the headphones were though! After ordering a new charger cable and waiting for 2 weeks for it to arrive it still sucks. The help I got was ineffective. DON'T buy this POS!!!

author: K. Janken
title: Excellent sound quality!
content: Sony WH1000XM3 Wireless Industry Leading Noise Canceling Over Ear Headphones, Silver (WH-1000XM3/S)I was the proud owner of the Sony WH1000M2 for 2 weeks. I did like them a lot. Very good sound, excellent noise cancellation, but not the most comfortable. I started to watch a lot of reviews of the WH1000Ms on youtube and decided to exchange my M2 for the M3. Yes!! Wow! Super comfortable! Even better Noice Cancellation. But the sound quality? In my opinion a very big upgrade! Fantastic sound quality! Much better than the M2. Maybe just a tad bass heavy, but I adjust that on my Galaxy S9+ equalizer. When you connect with the Sony LDAC lossless codec, you are not able to use the Sony apps build in equalizer. I prefer to use LDAC instead of the standard SBC codec since it is totally uncompressed. I listen a lot to classical music, and in my opinion, the M3 offers for me at least, a very very decent soundstage! I could not be more impressed. Best headphones I have ever had! Big upgrade from the M2!

author: Steve & Kelsey Burkholz
title: Can't connect to more then 1 device.
content: I bought these from best buy but I want everyone to know my opinion. So disappointed. If you are like me that has more then one Bluetooth devices then you expect a headset to easily switch between those devices. With these Headphones you need to first unpair the current devices and repair the new device you want to use. After doing this 3 times you will want to take them back. I'm at work all day and answer my phone through my so us but to make a confrance call through my computer I have to repair them every time. This is 2019... This is crazy for a $350 product. Going back to the Bose QCii

author: Mario
title: Terrific experience with music, terrible music ver the phone
content: Sound cancellation is great, the ambience sound options help a lot and it is very smart to have the location option that gives the chance to the headphones the control whether you’re walking on the street and reduces the cancellation, or in public transportation which increases it. Horrible though the over the phone experience, I can hear the other but it is not the case for who’s calling me, they hear me far and with a lot of background noise. For the price this is a real big letdown, I’m not sure I would recommend these headphones because of this

author: Helvética. th
title: the best on the market
content: so damn good. Best on the market. The panel to change from songs and volume isnt that good tho, is impossible to not do mistakes in that.

author: Shusil S.
title: quality music
content: noise cancelling and touch pad control is okay. But, sound quality is excellent.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great sound and comfort
content: Don’t play games, so don’t have an opinion. Great on a plane for comfort and noise cancellation

author: Adam Trybom
title: Noise cancellation is incredible!
content: I am a late collage student. 37years old.  With all of the commotion around the house I was becoming difficult to study.  My wife talked me into purchasing the (expensive) headphones.  From the moment I started using them I find it easier to study.  These things are worth a letter grade in school!

author: Terry J Ehrhardt
title: Great headphones!
content: Superb to excellent noise cancelling. Very good tonal quality to any type music I have tried.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Noice Cancelling is Top Notch
content: These are the best headphones I’ve ever owned...from Beats Studio...Solos... which I’ve given away because these are that good.

author: Jennifer Lawlin
title: Great overall performance with bias on sound quality.
content:
At much like them overall but tap controls on right headset are difficult to master and use!
Noise canceling is very acceptable bs Bose and sound quality is a plus, though not true audiophile quality it is very good!

author: samarA
title: What a let down
content:
I ordered these headphones the moment they were released only to receive a faulty item. The right channel would produce a loud humming noise when I moved my head around. I found out through experimentation that this is because of a feedback loop that is created because the interior microphone is presented with too much of the outside noise when a perfect seal is broken. Clearly it's not supposed to do this (as the left channel didn't). When I contacted the customer support at Sony they provided me with the most useless links and didn't even try to understand what the issue was and offered to help or replacements at all. I had to return this pair.
All this said, when the earphones worked they were great. Nice quality sound, excellent connection, and even the microphones had a pretty good quality for phone calls (this is a major upgrade from the previous generation).
If it wasn't for the terrible customer service, in fact, I would give this a 5 star since I think the noise cancellation is better than anything else I've tried (and I've almost tried them all).

author: Lumen
title: Read their website, carefully
content: I wanted these to work, however....you must manage them with an app that received 2 stars from the app store. There is a warning not to use them within 30 feet of a wireless device or their performance will/could be diminished. I purchased them to use with my computer. I'm sending them back.

author: Mark G.
title: Total enjoyment using!!
content: Pure enjoyable Sound!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Must have it
content: Must have it. Especially if you’re student and prepare for important tests... noise canceling very helpful

author: Bobby O
title: Fantasic
content: Everything you've heard about these is true. The best noise cancelling in the business, and I own a Bose set to prove it.

author: Vs
title: Sound so clear and qulity of headphones is very good
content: Wow. I neve ever had headphones of this qulity befour.

author: s_cruz
title: Great Headphone But Not As Loud As You Would Expect
content: These headphones are great, the noise cancellation allows you to focus on the music and puts the world to rest. The controls and automatic adjustments designed into the headphones make it  very easy and functional for anyone to use. The comfort is also great as they cover the ears without putting pressure onto the ears but around them allowing for a tight secure fit. Overall the design is comfortable, functional, and looks good. My only complaint is the loudness of the volume and impact of the base, I often compare headphone to the first generation of Beats by Dre as they would blow  your head off. The base and volume were truly amazing, they were like walking around with a boom box. I believe this Is controlled due to Europes regulation for how loud headphones can be. Other than that these headphones are a good buy. I am going to return them as they do not fulfill my requirements in term  of volume level and base, if you are going to buy them, do not buy them for the normal $350. They go on sale a lot to  around $290, be patient and wait if the price goes back up to $350.

author: James A. Hemphill
title: AWESOME!
content: These are incredible!  Buy them.  The only people I could see being remotely disappointed are audiophiles that have $1000+ headphones.

author: Dac Nguyen
title: Too strong ambient sound
content:
Bought go replace old Bose QC35 but had to return after 1 trip.
My ears got hot after 1 hour and the worst thing was that the ambient sound for noise cancelation is too strong.
I may go back to Bose.

author: The_Abenator
title: The XM2s were better.
content:
I tried buying these twice from Amazon but ended up with the predecessor of these, the XM2.

However I did go to a brick and mortar store to buy these once I got my refund and let me tell ya,

It's probably not worth the upgrade. I feel like I should have kept those XM2s because they had better sound quality. Super disappointed. But you know...

Oh well... They're superior to the others of their class, Bose wasn't so great for me and didn't really hit the mark for me and these definitely blow Bose out of the park.

Design and feel wise, Sony Really stepped up their game again and made an honestly "sexy" pair of headphones. They're soft, they're comfortable, the materials are very premium feeling and the case is absolutely stunning.

Good job, Sony.

I think that may be I need more time to let these guys break in, but I keep hearing what sounds like, a "blown speaker" kinda sound so ... Maybe it needs more time of mid volume play before I hit hard with bass or play with the different sound stages.

I'll let you guys know how that goes. Grab the XM2s for now. Not these.

author: Jeffrey A. Lowy
title: Comfortable with great sound and noise cancellation
content: Great headphones. The best pair I’ve owned (I’m upgrading from Beats Solo 3, so that’s not saying much). The sound quality is amazing. The companion app could use some work but does the job. The noise cancellation is great most of the time, except when outside and it’s windy. I would prefer physical buttons for volume and playback controls. It’s easy to change tracks when you meant to change the volume. Other than that, these headphones are amazing.

author: MR
title: Great headphones.
content: I own many headphones including the Bose QC35 II.  These are much better, if ever so slightly less comfy. High tech controls, nice app.  The only drawback and it is a PIA, is it won’t connect to more than one device at a time.

author: Martin Berkowitz
title: Preserve Cilia
content: The product is effective for use on the New York subway system.

author: Michael Ndu
title: Great Headphones
content: Great Sound Quality but it is expected from the best headphones from 2018.They represent a good value for money and I have no complaints over shelling $350 on them

author: MrCookie
title: Great
content: Great product, warmly recommended

author: Amazon Customer
title: Just amazing
content:
Well, to begin with this is my first noise cancelling headphone so I can't really compare it with others but I have to say that this product itself is just amazing! I'm using it for about a month now and absolutely love it in every aspect. Sound quality is very very good, noise cancelling just blew my mind, battery life is also very good. I mean you can charge it only for 10 minutes and use it for 5-6 hours, maybe even longer.

I was a bit skeptical at first when I was considering buying these. After all it really isn't a cheap product. Now I believe it's one of the best tech I've ever bought! If you do the kind of work where you need to fully concentrate and go deep just buy these. I mean seriously. Just buy.

author: Michael
title: For the money
content:
For what you pay for them you would think they could include a charging cord longer then my hand.

As far as the headphones themselves go, they sound awesome and the noise cancelling is great.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Considered the best NC headphone out there for a reason.
content: The quality of the noise cancellation on this thing is class-leading and the audio quality is surprisingly good - I feel its sound signature is more enjoyable to most people than Bose. Comfort level is maybe a tad below the QC35 when worn for hours on end, but the ability to use noise cancellation when wired is a winner since that is how I use it, having an LG V20 with a quad DAC. It's a little annoying that the signal processing features Sony has included in the app (even EQ) can only be used while connected to Bluetooth as opposed to being set while on Bluetooth and used when wired, but this is still a relatively minor gripe with an otherwise excellent pair of headphones.

author: SteveG
title: The best choice - comfort and effectiveness
content: Really like how easy these are to use - the touch controls on the outside of the ear are great, comfort is the best of all, I worn them on flights up to 8 hours so far with no discomfort like other headphones I have had. Noise cancelling, ambient sound, adjustments in the phone app - these are all great additions.

author: KVKinCLT
title: Better Than The Competition
content: Having purchased the latest and greatest noise cancelling headsets from a 'leading' headphone company for myself early in the year, decided to purchase a set for my wife.  The Sony product, only a few months newer than the ones I purchased, offers better features and functionality for the about the same cost.  Now I am jealous.

author: Dod M.
title: Great item.
content: Satisfied with this item.

author: me
title: first noice cancelling headphones
content: amazing sound and great noise cancelling.

author: Ryan
title: Great headphones!
content: Comfortable, sound great, perfect for an airplane

author: Perrier
title: Does not work fully with iOS 13.1
content: Software Does not work with iOS 13.1. Otherwise a great set of headphones.

author: Leo
title: Coming from a QC35 II useer
content: I have to say, Sony really did a great job with these headphones. It's premium in everything - the app could get a little bit better, but the overall features and benefits of it are as crisp as it can be.  Sound quality and noise cancellation are on point. I'm not sure how much better it can get from this, maybe even more noise cancellation?  I was trying to find something I didn't like about this and couldn't. Comparing to my Bose, the M3 is superior in every aspect. Maybe the only thing is the Bose QC35 II is a little bit lighter and more comfortable in long hours of use. I could see the M3 being a little tiring after a long use, which for me is not a problem since I don't listen to anything longer than 2 hours anyway. My experience so far has bee incredible. I love my Bose and I will be using it to go to the gym, grocery store and such, but when I am traveling or want to enjoy the music a little deeper, the M3 is definitely my go to headphones.

author: Rick
title: Microphone is literally useless.
content:
Decent headphones otherwise. Relatively comfortable, noise cancellation is nice, sound quality is passable for bluetooth, but their construction is relatively fragile and not something I would count on lasting past a year.  USB-C is their biggest differentiating factor, but that's more of a convenience thing.

Now back to the title of this review. You can't take phone calls on these. You sound like a literal robot. I don't know what kind of useless microphone they outsourced for these, but it sure doesn't belong in a $350 headset.

Are these worth the money even without the microphone issues? Probably not unless money's a complete non-factor for you. But if you planned on making phone calls, do not buy.

author: slowbutsure
title: Drown out the world.
content:
I purchased these headphones in order not to disturb family when listening to music or watching TV. It was recommended by a professional audio video expert. For the price I didn’t expect a whole lot. I was very surprised and pleased at their quality and performance. I’m not exactly an audiophile now but I’m on the fringe. I know there are headphones out there costing 10 times more. I’m sure they was sound superb, but that wasn’t the object.
I recently spent a substantial amount replacing my AV system into cutting edge technology. However I don’t have a sound room so at times I respect others in the household and use these headphones.
I can say they far surpass the Bose and Bears by a lot. They are comfy too. I like the noise cancelling really works great!
A great buy.

author: Alex
title: Expensive..  But worth every penny.
content:
Let me first start off by saying that this this is my 1st pair of high end noise cancelling headphones.
If you're riding the line of "is it worth it to buy these.. they're $350" then the answer is probably yes, and i'll explain why.

1.) Sound quality: the sound quality is beyond phenomenal. Even at low volume, you can hear all sound ranges really well with these. With the use of the  free Sony headphones app, you can not only alter the bass as desired, but also tailor the specific frequency ranges either manually or through presets such as "bright, excited, jazz.." etc. These seriously thump when you turn up the bass- another reviewer was right when they said it feels like it rattles your skull haha.

2.) Build quality: the plastic parts and hinges seem sturdy, and the earcups are very soft leather that do not cause pressure points. Though these are allegedly the heaviest out of its competitors (QC35), you'll likely find that they're so comfy that you may forget that you're wearing them. These new XM3's feature a USB C changing system that are very quick charging. The battery isn't a slouch either- the battery lasts around 30 hours between charges, depending on whether you're using NC or not.

3.) Features: as advertised, the pause, skip forward/backward, palm gesture, and more are all very responsive and useful. The noise cancelling in phenomenal; it even has the ability to "calibrate" to your particular face, ears, hair, and glasses. The app lets you control how much noise cancelling you want. For example, on ambient (or adaptive) sound 20, I can practically hear everything as if I were not wearing the headphones at all. At ambient sound 0, it blocks around 98% of the sound and you'd really need to focus to try to hear any sounds that make it through. When you have music playing at any volume, I'd venture to say that the noice cancelling blocks virtually 100% of outside noises- be it HVAC, airplane engines, annoying conversations, blaring TV's, and so on.

Hope this helps! If not, there are plentiful reviews on youtube concerning these and its precursors (xm2) in comparison to the Bose QC35

author: House
title: Meh, save your money
content:
- Unable to use equalizer and high quality codec with Android while using Bluetooth (unconfirmed for iOS or when connected with cable, but what's the point in that?)
- Got hot after only a couple of hours (common complaint)
- Could still hear my air purifier with noise cancelling enabled, and couldn't hear somebody calling my name with ambient noises at max volume (with a focus on voices enabled).

Otherwise not bad headphones, but at the price point can do much better.

author: Mateo Mendez
title: You must download the Sony headphone app to get a better experience.
content: The noise cancelling and ambient sound features make this one of or if not the best headphones right now.

author: donta42
title: The best sounds purchase ive made this year..
content: I had the bose qc2 for a month and returned it for these Sony's instead. They are WAY better sound, better noise canceling and also more comfortable to wear. The bose design is kinda "flimsy" - you know exactly what im talking about if you've ever worn them. The sony ones are way sturdier and sit better on my head than the bose. Im glad i switched and went with the sonys in the end.

author: Thierry TARSIN
title: Excellent Wireless Bluetooth Over the Ear Headphones
content:
It change my life.
Noise cancelling is a better thing i have seen for working an concentrate in noisy environnement.
it's not perfect but seem's to be à real comfort
Thant's sony an sony solder to propose us an excellent  goods

author: Bluestocking
title: Air travel bliss
content: LOVE these! No more airplane roaring for hours upon hours, just a background hum. Such a relief. I had no idea how much that nonstop noise was contributing to flying stress. Also great for privacy from talkative seat mates, yelling kids, and soothing tunes or audio books.

author: Alek Taylor
title: Really good deal on a great pair of headphones
content: I really like how comfortable they are, the soft ear cups don't leave impressions in the skin or squeeze over an extended period of use. The battery life on them are great, and the ability to fine tune the equalizer makes it all the better for that perfect quality I'm looking for. Only thing I wish they did was if they had the noise cancelling and equalizer when plugged in VS bluetooth

author: Leandra Zapata
title: perfect for traveling g in airplanes
content: The noise canceling is VERY GOOD

author: David Banner
title: Excellent headphones, but not as good as the second generation xm2.
content: Thought these were excellent. Although I have a pair of the WH1000XM2, and compared to these, I felt the noise canceling and the sound quality were better in the second generation (XM2 BETTER THAN XM3).

author: Soeren Klitgaard salling
title: Extremely bad sound quality of microphone. Can't recommend them if used for other than ANC
content:
Do not buy these headphones if you are planning on using them for phone calls. Given all the positive reviews both here and on Youtube plus the price level I really thought these were excellent. But unfortunately, they are useless as a tool for a phone call. Your sound will sound muffled and low.

I am surprised why 99% of the Youtube reviews never mention this? It is quite disappointing since this is obvious for anyone using them for more than 5 minutes.

Did all the updates but still the same. I have returned them to Amazon (which I have to say were very helpful) and will consider buying either the Bose or the new Jabra Elite 85h when they arrive in April and if they get a good review.

Build quality seemed good but I was also not impressed by the sound quality of music and the fit (but that of course varies)

And the fact that these can only pair with one device at a time is also bad. It was quite a hassle to change back and forth between phone and laptop.

author: Alan Bryant
title: Great product!
content: Shopped between this and Bose. This has better functionality for my purposes.

author: alexander
title: Very good
content: Rec for buying

author: Warren
title: Best noise cancellation
content: I’ve owned Bose, Dr Dre and now Sony and the Sony by far have the best noise cancellation. I use them while on a riding mower and the background noise is virtually eliminated. Very impressed.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great sound, charging a little bit slow
content: Great product. Sound and noise canceling are very good. The charging time is a little slow.

author: DAVID B
title: Great for Flying
content: Used on a long airline flight, worked beautifully.  Reduced my fatigue for the flight.  Could hear movies at a normal volume instead of having to blast them.

author: Milo
title: Very comfortable and perfect for air travel.
content: Very comfortable and perfect for air travel.

author: RH
title: Bose < Sony
content: These are better than my old Bose headphones in every way. Similar battery life, but superior sound and noise cancellation. The feature that allows you to cup your hand over the earpiece to mute music and hear ambient noise is really nice. My only complaint, and it's a mild one, is that the  swipe controls are a little finicky for changing tracks and adjusting volume.

author: juan
title: Excellent sound with customization
content: These have an excellent sound, and the freedom the customize the sound, the noise cancellation is in par with Bose’s which I own as well, comfort is good but but as good as Bose’s, but I manage to wear them for a long trip and didn’t have problems with them.  My only complain is that any sudden movement of my head, flexión, rotation or extension, my ear would touch the pad inside the cups and it would disturb the sound, chewing food would create the same effect, some people recommend to get a third party cup, but that would compromise the noise cancellation, so I decided just to deal with it, by the way, I have small ears.

author: KH
title: Absolutely amazing
content: So amazing my mom loved it so I was forced to buy her one. 10/10 in flights. >Bose QC

author: Kelly
title: Phone calls?, Don't bother!
content:
The good,
build is great
Light weight in a good way
App seems to work well.
The ANC is fantastic.

The bad (just one thing)
Call quality is horrific.
abysmal
Downright embarrassing

Subjectively heavy on the bottom end, bass focused.
Great for everything except your wallet and phone calls. Probably the worse bluetooth call solution i've used in nearly 15 years.

author: KA
title: Top of the line
content: Great headphones.  Just as good and in some ways better than bose. In fact if I was going to get a free pair of either, this would be my pick.

author: AlwaysWorkin
title: These Bad boys are amazing.
content: I work in a loud environment and these bad boys kill the noise and the mic is great for conferences. Volume control on these is tricky. Highly recommended.

author: Anthony Piazza
title: Not as good as the Bose quiet comfort
content: Used like new. These were definitely use but not like now. Missing parts etc.

author: nick
title: August 2019 - For this price point, still the best overall BT ANC on the market.
content:
I am not an audiophile, but I am a prosumer enthusiast. I have 10ish pairs of nice headphones. From Klipsche in-ears, to Bose QC 35ii, Nuraphones, AKG open mixing cans, Airpods, Sennheiser HD4.50 and a few others - and the these Sony's are still my go-to for daily listening. First off, they are well-built, Light, and very comfortable. I am prone to headphone fatigue, which is the #1 reason I have abandoned really enjoyable headphones like the Nuraphones. Next, the battery life is killer, 25+ hours with ANC on. Next the ANC is hands down the best out there, if you do you homework this will be abundantly clear. Bluetooth 4.2 is great for the average use case, though it's a bummer these don't have 5.0, which gives a bit more range and codec options. Next, and probably most important is sound. I will admit, these headphones arent honest. There is an emphasis on bass, and certain things can sound muddy with the out of the box settings. However, with the app, or any music app with a decent EQ (yes, this includes spotify), you can tweak them to your liking and get a much more balanced sound signature. Personally, when I put these on after the Bose QC35, or the Sennheiser HD4.5, the bass heavy EQ is most striking. But if I just throw these on without listening to a brighter EQ before, its not off-putting. These are by no means Beats, which are basically nothing but low quality bass, but they are noticeably less bright than most.
Bottom Line: If you are looking for great every day over ear ANC headphones in the $300-$350, these are infinitively the right choice. If you care about nothing but a flat EQ in a similar setup, you can go with Bose (but you can still EQ these to get close). If you want soundstage and honest profile, get some wired AKGs. But I will reiterate, these are the best over ear BT ANC headphones in this price range today.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The best noise cancelling. Ever
content: These headphones by Sony are the best I've ever had. The noise canceling is amazing. And with the impressive sound, it's a mixture that deserves an A+. There also very lightweight, making them surprisingly comfortable on long trips.

author: Brandon
title: Worthy of your $350
content: These things are something else, but in a good way. The extent that you can customize almost everything in the app to the headphones has really set a new bar on what NC headphones should be capable of. Bose QC35's are basically just how strong you want the noise cancellation, but with the Sony's, you can do that but MUCH MORE. I can't hesitate it enough, if you're willing to drop $350 (or $300 when they're on sale) on headphones, buy these!

author: Nathan A. Rader
title: touch control without on/off makes these garbage
content: These have a gimmicky touch sensitive control for volume and playback. This means if you touch the sides at all, you will skip, pause or change the volume. Incredibly annoying and Sony has confirmed that it cannot be turned off. I highly recommend against. Also, as with any headphones that only have active cancelling, this will cut out ambient noise, but allow speech and random noises to pass through uninhibited.

author: NCSurfer
title: I Switched from Bose
content: I've had (nearly) every iteration of Bose QC over the ear headphones. Always found them great for long haul flights and daily use... until I found Sony headphones. These are simply, in my experience, the best noise-canceling headphones available in April 2019. Highly recommended.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Thank you.
content: Thank you.

author: Swimmer
title: Love it
content: Blessing for peace and quiet. Must buy for planes

author: william hipps
title: Mind blown
content: Unreal.. these have changed my life

author: christy carpenter
title: Excellent head set earphones
content: These earphones are very comfortable with great sound quality and are easy to use. I'm very happy with my purchase.

author: Gal Gofrit
title: Bad quality control and frustrating experiences
content:
I got the headphones and I was very excited to, the noise cancelling was great and sound was pretty good...
They came fully charged, but ever since I got them they wouldn't charge. I initially tried to use the provided cable to a PC and no luck, the percentage kept going down. I tried using my phone adapter , changed cables around and everything. The battery just arrived defective. I immediately ordered a replacement, but since they're out of stock, now I need to wait another month or two (or three) for them to restock, and that's just frustrating.... plus, honestly I would expect more from a Sony flagship product that sells for 350$.
Other than that, they simply cannot handle using multiple devices. When I'm at work it's really frustrating because I connect them to my laptop, and whenever I have a phone call or need to leave my laptop, I need to disconnect my laptop from it and connect my phone, and the process takes time.
All in all, I expected a lot but was unfortunately let down by a very negative experience.

author: E. Kim
title: Best Noise cancelling headphones if you have no use for the mic
content:
Sound 5/5
Noise cancellation 4.5/5 (Best NC compared to all other brands)
Comfort 4.5/5
Microphone  1/5 (HORRIBLE)
Extras 5/5

A MUST BUY, unless the mic matters to you. I never use it so i really dont care.

I give this a 4.8 out of 5 stars

author: Amazon Customer
title: Noise cancellation is amazing!
content: I love these headphones! Best I’ve ever own.

author: Ryan Guptill
title: Super Satisfied
content: Touch/volume skip-initiation works pretty good but not great.  The sound and the noise cancellation is AMAZING! Synced great with both my iPad and my iPhone.

author: Amazon Customer
title: High quality and worthy contender to Bose
content:
Sound: The sound signature is very bright with deep bass and clear vocals. Even with noise cancelling on, I couldn't detect much (if any) quality difference vs my wired AKG 7xx.
Noise cancelling is extremely good for deeper background noises. At the gym, I can just about barely hear the vocals from music playing on the speakers but none of the background music. With my own music playing at low volume, outside noise is almost unnoticable.
The touchpad controls are very intuitive and work as expected 98% of the time. Occasionally, ill have to repeat the gesture but this is usualyl when its very very cold outside or my hands arent dry.

author: Charlie CR
title: Audifonos
content: Excelentes

author: Amazon Customer
title: Superior quality and comfort
content: Extremely comfortable and easy to use.  Padding is superb and the noise reduction is outstanding, especially on a plane.

author: Mark McKeague
title: Fantastic
content: I got these for flying. The noise canceling works amazingly. I love the feature where covering the right side allows you to hear the “outside” world, it made it easy to communicate with flight attendants.

author: Campmaster Tom
title: So nice! Sounds great!
content: These headphones sound fantastic. easy to use, great application (using on Android). Versatile and great noise canceling!

author: TOMMY
title: Best headphones I've ever had.
content: Tip: use mp3 320kbps and Poweramp player (find it on Google play) for best sounding. Streaming services suck, you won't get best quality of sound, so no need to but this headphones for them.

author: Mr. & Mrs. Collins
title: Fit of the headphone gave me a headache
content: I give Sony 5 stars on sound quality and noise cancellation. Where it fails, and the reason I had to return it is the fit. The top of the head rests on my head and it is uncomfortable. So as a fix, I thought I would lengthen /extend the earphone part to make space for my head and the top of the headphone but it didn’t work. The headphone just dropped down and still resting on my head. I gave it several days but it was the same.  My husband has the Bose quiet comfort 35 ii and I have used it in occasion without a problem. In the end, I returned the Sony and bought a Bose instead.

author: Agirl
title: great battery life
content: I don't know how I lived without these for so long. The noise cancellation is great and the battery lasts for days.

author: Lisa O'Neill
title: Great sound control
content: The best money ever spent. Worth it completely.

author: Ellijah
title: Hours of use = a few minutes of charging
content: Pretty awesome, only complaint I have is the lack of a mic. Can get hours of use from just a few minutes of charging, pretty amazing. Sound quality is great after messing around with the app and changing settings, noise canceling is wonderful, can't hear a thing with music going when it's active.

author: Andrew Lam
title: Favorite Headphones
content:
Great sound quality, solid build, rugged, aesthetic design. Wired (3.5mm jack or larger jack adapter came with package) or Bluetooth enabled. Battery capacity as described. Still feels comfortable after 8+hrs continuous wear with beautiful sound quality on classical/baroque/rock/drum and bass/house/club, etc. music.

While it can be brought/used in most conditions, I recommend keeping it for home/indoor listening, as the silver paint/wrap gets dirtied very easily.

author: Paul M.
title: Finally, Bluetooth Over the ear headphones I will keep.
content: These headphones do everything I want and have great sound, long battery life, very efficient wired cable connection, and easy control over volume and mute.  I use these headphones with my LG V40 phone which has an excellent Quad DAC and the wired sound thru these headphones rivals my $800 headphones.  The sound provides has clear and slightly rounded treble, excellent  midrange and warm bass.  The app controls allows the sound to be dialed in to personal preference which I found to work well.  These headphones are very efficient and work well with the power button off providing adequate volume from the V40 at 50% output.  Sound is better wired but the Blue Tooth sound is as good as I have heard and provides all the additional features that put these over the top and I have tried many competitors.  The different noise canceling modes are easy to change and work well and they are comfortable and provide very good isolation.  Unlike some others have experienced and perhaps because of my phone, I found the call quality to be very good.  I love the feature of putting your right hand over the right control to mute the sound and immediately hear outside conversation, this is great during flights.  I found the touch controls on the right side to work very well.  As evident, I highly recommend these Sony WH1000XM3 Bluetooth headphones.

author: kristine West
title: Grandson had to have these for Christmas!
content: These were on my grandsons Christmas list! He loves them!

author: Trevor Battle
title: Buy it!
content: Nothing to dislike! PERFECT sound and noise cancellation.  Once you'll try these you'll never go back

author: Me
title: Comfortable!!
content:
I owned the previous version WH1000XM2 and while I thought the noise cancellation was top notch; I could never wear them for more than a few hours without my ears hurting.

I am so happy to say that I just got off a 9 hour flight with my new WH1000XM3 and I didnt have to take them off even once.  The pain is gone!!  I believe its because the ear cups are bigger and the headband is more evenly distributing the weight.  Sound is amazing!!

I dont know why another review was saying that voices are not cancelled bc on my flight I was in my own world for 9 hours and didnt even hear announcements from the captain/crew bc the noice cancellation is so effective.

Finally the comfort of the Bose QCII with the powerful Sony Noice Cancellation; it doesnt get any better than the WH1000XM3!!

Update: Sony released firmware 2.0.0 today which can be obtained through the iOS and Android apps. Adds support for Google and improves call quality!

author: Geraldo f.
title: Earphones
content: Sorry, but I can't evaluate the product because I didn't stay with it.

author: Aditya M. Rao
title: Arguably the best noise cancelling headphones out there
content:
These are the best headphones I’ve owned and quite possibly the most well engineered piece of tech I’ve ever used.
The sound palette is virtually infinite, able to simultaneously capture the lilt of a violin in a waltz to the crashing climax of a 60s rock solo.
The touch controls work excellently and OTA software updates via Bluetooth are an excellent idea and work very well too.
I debated for a week whether to buy the Bose QC35 ii or this set, and it was a meaningless debate. The Sonys dominate.

All this is before you queue up a movie. You’ll hear nuances and sound you’ve never heard in a 10 viewings of a movie to the point where the sound almost engages more than the visuals.

There’s no question, there’s no comparison, there’s no equal to these. Buy them with your eyes closed. And your ears open.

author: DScott719
title: A Travelers Companion
content: I spent a lot of time looking at these before purchasing. I was in between these and the Bose QuietComfort 35s. I went to Best Buy and tried both pairs on to see what I preferred. Between what I felt comfort wise and what one of the assistants also told me there I decided to purchase these headphones through Amazon since they were having a summer sale. I have no regretted my decision they are extremely comfortable and sound terrific. The noise cancelling is perfect for traveling as it helps to block out all surrounding noises. I would recommend these to anyone who spends lots of time on planes. As well as anyone else currently in the market for a fantastic set of headphones.

author: Josh
title: Great sound and awesome features!!!
content:
Ok first off, my first pair of newer over ear headphones were the Soul by Ludaris as I went to Bestbuy and listened to the Beats, Soul, soul Republic, Bose, etc etc, and picked the Soul by Ludacris because to my ears they sounded the best. (These were wired)

My son had a pair of the over ear Beats which also sounded good but not as good as the Soul did (also wired)

I was in an airport a few months back and bought the Bose QC35 II's, and they were very nice but didn't go as loud as I would have liked them too.  I gave them to my wife and trusted CNET and other reviews stating Sony had outdone themselves on the Gen 3 of these headphones.

First, I do not wear them everyday, I take them when I am traveling and randomly use them if I need to tune everything out to get work done.  The noise canceling on these is amazing.  My keyboard clicks very loudly and with these on I cannot hear it at all.  They have 3 settings, noise canceling, ambient, and no ambient.  The noise canceling is truly the best I have ever tried from the Soul's to the Beats to the QC35 II's.  Handsdown amazing noise canceling.  As for the ambient setting, it is nice as is slightly amplifies the ambient noise around you so you can hear without the headphone muffling the noise.  And when they are in no ambient the software isn't running and they act like standard over ear headphones that would somewhat muffle sound.

The features are quite cool.  I read in someone's review that when outside in the cold the touch interface has issues, but I am not wearing them out in the cold so that is not something that would affect the performance for my usage.  The right ear exterior is the touch interface with simple intuitive gestures to make it play, pause, volume up or down, skip tracks forward and backward, and my favorite feature hold your hand over the right ear and they recognize that you need to speak with someone and they switch from active noise canceling to the ambient boost setting so you can talk without shouting or taking them off.  Quite ingenious when you think about it, especially if you use them frequently on planes.

All in all, I own playstations (3 and 4) but have rather thought of Sony as an afterthought when it comes to high level electronics in today's market.  However, these headphones earn their top choice editor's pick status hands down.  I trust a lot of the reviews on CNET and other reputable tech sites, and can say that if you are looking for a great pair of bluetooth over ear noise canceling headphones, then look at these, as I think they are the best.
