The difference between 0.8 and 0.9 atmosphere has a big effect on noise cancellation effectiveness.  They are also extremely comfortable to wear for long periods of time.  They are a stupid amount of money, but they work amazingly and you are paying for a lot of high tech to make it work so well.  If you are already looking in this price range, I would highly recommend them.

author: Kahomada
title: Great for sound.  Don't even think about phone calls.  Just don't.
content:
Do NOT buy these for phone calls.  They're terrible for those.  Like... Awful Terrible.  I actually can't believe Sony put a microphone on them and then let it through QC.

The noise cancelling and sound quality are incredible.  I wear them for hours on end at the office.  Blocking the noise has been a game changer for me.  The battery life has been incredible, and I've enjoyed the easy interface of the app.  Overall I'm very pleased with them.  I'd be head over heals if the microphone was decent.

author: just me
title: Love these headphones
content: Love using these while traveling on the Long Island Railroad to work.

author: Sergey
title: Wh1000m3
content: Very good head fones

author: Chester Harrington
title: Unbelievable
content: You ever buy a product before and you're just amazed at how good it is? The sound quality is phenomenal. They are comfortable. The app works great(it also feels like a Japanese toilet when the optimizer runs). The noise cancellation is very good, and does not cause the overpressure sensation that some other systems will cause. The EQ may require some slight balancing, but it will be to level things, not compensate for weakness in the drivers.

author: Michael Rosenbaum
title: excellent performance
content: Especially like the noise cancellation on a plane

author: Bishop
title: Almost Perfect
content: This is a very good set of headphones. The noise cancellation works pretty good. I fly every week and I use these on the plane. It does cancel most noises and sound quality is very good. My only real complaint is that my headphones sometimes connects to other devices with no warning. Sometime just turning them on will auto connect without any paring warnings. The finish is good and the fit quality is very good.

author: Shay P.
title: Smokes bose
content: Best pair of head phones I’ve owned

author: Kyle Jones
title: Best Wireless Headphone Sound In 2019
content:
I went to a few electronic stores, and tested as many wireless headphones available over the holidays. The consensus between my fiance and I was the Sony WH1000XM3's had the best sound over Bose/Beats/Sennheiser/Audio-Technica. And to be honest, it really wasn't close.

PROS:
1) Sound quality for all types of music. I personally listen to a lot of bass music, and its so crisp and boomy.
2) Very comfortable.
3) Features in the accompanying app. The EQ is super customizable along with the presets, and you can customize the ambient sound quality (noise cancelling).
4) Battery Life... it's incredible how much charge these hold. They also charge super quick. I plug mine in to charge maybe once a week and I use them 4-5 hours a night.

CONS
1) If I had to nit-pick, these are definitely not built for the gym or working out. They are comfortable, but not super tight.

author: davidguadron
title: Excelente
content: Excelente producto

author: robert
title: Great Noise Cancelling Headphones
content: These headphones are absolutely great! I take them everywhere (greyhound, plane, work) and they block out sound superbly. It’s almost as if your in your world for a bit.

author: Big Brother!
title: Best on market
content:
I’ve Obsessively tried a lot of similar items these beat even the Bose brand
They’re truly awesome a must have for sound enthusiasts

author: RickS
title: Incredible noise cancelling feature
content: I've asked friends to try these headphones on to see the incredible difference it makes in noise cancellation. Crazy how it intelligently filters out the "noise". Headphones are comfortable and sound quality is great.

author: L K
title: Great headphones but terrible for phone calls
content: These headphones are great! Helped a lot on the plane and in hotels, but the microphone is terrible for phone calls!! It is incredibly muffled and the person on the other end cannot hear me at all. I don't know if I got a broken one? but for a ~$380 headphone, I was expecting that the microphone would be better.

author: marissa
title: Dont waste your money
content: I paid 100 dollars more than the new ear peice that came out and these supposed noise cancelling headphones dont noise cancel for sh** they are just regular headphones, I downloaded the app and set it to noise cancelling and nothing I hear everything in the background. What a disappointment

author: Steve
title: Best I’ve owned.
content:
Sound and build quality as well as NC are absolutely top notch.

I use these about 6-8 hours a day at work. NC blocks out nearly everything. Battery life is as advertised.

Don’t forget to fool around with the equalizer to get the best type of sound for you.

author: Alexej Muran
title: The best noise cancellation
content:
I compared several noise cancellation headphones and these are by far the best. The sound is also top quality. Warm and well balanced. I returned these headphones because the microphone is not good at all - what a disappointment. Not useable for calls. If you are looking for headphones with the best sound and the best noise cancellation - these are it. If you need headphones for phonecalls - stay away from them.
+noise cancellation
+sound quality
-microphone

author: Marcus J. Lintault
title: Not the best as many reviews say.  I regret buying these haedphones
content: So I have a real love hate opinion of these headphone.  Yes they have amazing sound quality, Iove the incredible noise cancelling...you are in your own personal cone of silence and are very comfortable...BUT this is all swept away because the hinges creak constantly unless you do not move your head.  The creaking introduces a huge distraction and completely negates the sound and NC quality because of the noise it makes.  When brand new it does not happen and it takes about a month for them to get going but then it is constant and so aggravating because the cost of the headphones was so much.  I even returned them to Sony for another pair and they also became creaky after one month.  In addition the touch controls are clunky at best and 4 out of 5 times I have to redo the motion to get the action I wanted, and often times it does another action instead.  I have an older pair of sony NC headphones with physical controls and they were perfect in that regard.  I am about to get another brand of headphone but I really feel cheated by Sony because of their poor design.  A friend has the MX2's and he said they did the same as well, so this is an enduring design flaw they never have fixed.  Do not get cheated and buy these headphone unless you want to hear creak creak creak where you take a step, move our head or chew.

author: D
title: Don't buy if you plan to connect to multiple devices, or make phone calls
content:
Don't buy if you plan to connect to multiple devices, or make phone calls.
Phone calls: horrible quality, others said that I sounded as if I was 10 feet away from the mic. In addition, headphones picked up too much of outside noise and it was hard for me to hear others.
Multiple devices: Paired with 2 devices(followed Sony's Multipoint connection instructions), but it did not work. To switch, I had to turn off Bluetooth on one of the devices. Sometimes needed to reconnect manually. That's unacceptable at this price point. Maybe I got a defective item, but
I give 2 stars, 1 for great sound, 1 for great ANC.
P.S. I checked many online resources and found that others are having same issues. There are even post on Sony forum. Apparently, Sony does not care about customers. I should have read the reviews before buying. Returning it now.

author: Luke McKinnon
title: Love my Sonys
content: So far I love these headphones. I’m usually a Bose fan but I made the change to these and have no regrets! Great noise canceling and amazing sound. I’ll be traveling for the next few months and will update my review on how the do flying.

author: Paul J Koehler
title: Amazing headphones with superior noise cancelling and excellent wireless reception
content: This is my third pair of wireless Bluetooth headphones, but they are the best ones I have had by a long shot. One thing that stands out is that the noise cancelling is so good that I wasn't able to hear my neighbors next door even though they were asking for me! Fortunately, there is also a feature that automatically adjusts for loud volume outside depending on the situation (e.g. traffic) but the fact that such a feature is fascinating. Honestly, at this point, my only issue would be that I have trouble going to any other headphones! Highly recommended and close to the best in its class, if not the best in class!

author: Brian
title: Great sound, good noise cancelling, but poor comfort when worn for a while
content:
I picked these up because I wanted to finally jump into the noise-cancelling headphones market. I'm a medical student so being able to study in quiet is nice. I bought these at the recommendation of many reviewers who said they were superior to Bose QC35 in sound quality and equal in comfort. That sounded like a good deal.

Unfortunately, while the claims of great sound were well-met by these headphones, the comfort was lacking. I need headphones that I can put on my head and forget about completely. These headphones were not that. I could make it roughly 2 hours before a headache started. The headache gradually worsened the longer I wore them. I really wanted to like these, because the sound quality was great, the noise cancelling was pretty good, and the ambient noise mode was super convenient. But at the end of the day I can't keep a product that gives me a significant headache after just a couple hours of wear. I don't know what caused the headaches, but after trying a friend's Bose QC35's for a day, I think it may have something to do with the tighter, somewhat heavier fit of the XM3's. Where the Bose's seem to distribute their light weight evenly across head and ears, the XM3's hold most of their (significantly heavier) weight on top of the head. The ears also fit fairly tightly, so the overall effect is a pretty strong squeeze. For the record, I have a normal sized head. Promise. And again, the Bose model fit perfectly with no discomfort at all.

Ultimately, these are good headphones with good features. But comfort is a major concern. If you can try them out before buying, do that. Anyone who will be wearing these for hours at a time should try to recreate that scenario before assuming comfort is guaranteed.

author: Rob Fenn
title: Perfect except no multipoint
content:
I've been looking for the perfect headphones (for me) for a while and thought I had found them.  I need/want:
1. Noise Cancelling Bluetooth - these are the best I've tried
2. Good build and sound - very comfortable and sound is great
3. USB C to charge - I want to pack one cable, when the 3 series came out with USB C I thought my search was over
4. Google Assistant - I use it all the time now and it worked perfectly on these
5. Multipoint - this is where these fail for me, I need to be connected to my phone and work computer at the same time and was shocked that Sony left this out

If these had multipoint, they would be perfect.  My only hope now is that Bose will come out with a Q35 III with usb C.  Right now, the Bose are missing USB C and the Sony's are missing multipoint.  If anyone reading this knows of a headphone that meets my 5 things please respond because after a year, I'm still looking.

author: Mr. Adam Lippes
title: Good but hot.
content: They are really good. Noise cancellation, features and sound, excellent. Along with battery life. BUT. They are HOT. There is absolutely no ventilation. And that makes them often uncomfortable to wear for long periods.

author: Ben
title: Best Noise Canceling Headphones
content: I got these for a long haul flight and wear them all the time now.  I was skeptical about how well these were supposed to work but after the first 16 hour flight, I was a believer.  The sound is amazing.  The noise cancelling is top notch.  The controls are easy to operate.  The battery life is amazing with minimal charge time.  After using them, I bought a pair for my wife.  They are expensive but worth every penny.

author: Bill Blanken
title: I LOVE these headphones
content: the battery life is amazing and they are super comfortable and the controls on the side are very easy to use. 5 stars!!

author: sandeep kandekar
title: Love it
content: I use it every day.

author: BDWright
title: Perfect headset.
content:
This is third one I have bought for the family!

Do a fair bit of travel and the noise reduction is fantastic.

20 hours of battery life is great.

Simply a great headset.

author: Joshua C.
title: Awesome headphones!
content: Higly recommend these headphones. I previously owned the bose headphones which are awesome but these sony are even better in my opinion.

author: Megumi Kiyama
title: Top-notch product right now
content: I have the Bose QC 35II, but it's at work, and is used at work, so when I had the opportunity to look for a comparable headphone, I figured the Sony mark 3 finally caught up to expectations. And they have. They are just as good as the QCs, the differences in noise-cancelling are minor, if any, but the other differences are its touch-sensitive outer piece. It works great, but feels unnecessary. The leather ear cushion creates a great barrier, and almost too good, as it creates a bit of a suction. Overall, very pleased and just yesterday, working from home I had the fan on, and the gardener was mowing the lawn outside. Heard none of it, only noticing after taking the headset off. Good stuff.

author: Briizie
title: Great noise cancelling and sound quality and long battery life
content: I love these headphones, as the noise cancelling is the best I've experienced so far. My only complaint is that it doesn't like to sync with bluetooth for some apple products like my Mac book pro, but there is a cord for those things, so it is more of a minor inconvenience, but still wish it did. That would make them perfect. I don't really like the app that you are supposed to use to get it to sync with iPad either tho, as it Is not very user friendly and likes to not work too, making it to where I really can't use it with my tablet hassle free.

author: npete
title: Device switching not graceful & play/pause interface is cumbersome.
content: I wanted to like these! But I just sent these back to Amazon after the left channel starting emitting a soft crackling sound that I could hear over even Star Wars music! The reason I did not get them replaced with another pair was because the right cup is a capacitive surface you use to play, pause, skip tracks, and turn up and down the volume and every time I pulled them off my head, I found myself doing all of those things. Also switching from one iOS device to another was very cumbersome. It made me miss the ease of switching devices with my AirPods.

author: brandon heera
title: This is the future of wireless headphones. (Update)
content: Ok I've been using it for a month now and this is my only problem;  when I connect it to my computer and play videos It glitches playing at half speed or slower whenever I repeatedly tap the pause and play button.  Only solution to this is disconnecting and pairing back which is really annoying 9/10.

author: Viet
title: Cannot disable the stupid touch control. Volume does not sync.
content:
Update: The headphone has its own volume and does not sync with system volume. Every time I connect it to my phone, I have to swipe up many time for the volume to match system volume.

I touched my headphone once and discovered my iPhone has been playing music for the entire day.

author: Elk Valley Properties
title: Worked great on international flight
content: A bit bulky on the head, as expected, but well worth it for the elimination of aircraft noise.  Comes with mini to mini plug as needed on airplane, plus a nice travel case.  I was able to use for several hours on one charge.

author: pentair not as advertised
title: The Bose QC35 II have been dethroned as the King of ANC
content: Great headphones!

author: Captain Jerry Polverino
title: Wonderful headphones even if somewhat flimsy.
content:
I had this product for over a month and checked it out throughly.  Here’s my take.
Product came packaged undamaged in a nice solid box.  Headphones have a good quality case that can take some real abuse.  It arrived with very simple cartoon picture instructions.  So far everything is going fine.  Charged them up and wow.
Very good noise canceling and excellent sound quality.  I am a musician, a very critical listener, and I have a good ear.  I also used my test CD’s for a frequency check.  I am quite happy with the quality of sound, but read on.
WARNING!
I purchased these to use in a loud construction environment, operating diesel powered equipment and driving trucks.  As much as I’m enjoying them, and as well as they work, they are rather cheaply made and somewhat flimsy.  If you purchase be careful.  I recommend this product only if it will be used in a normal environment such as inside a car or house.  It’s simply not tough enough to wear operating heavy equipment, outside on a lawn mower, anywhere you might need to take them on and off frequently, or if you’re wearing work gloves.  I’m disappointed because that was exactly where I needed them.  I’m still using solid, construction quality ear protection rather than the Sony headphones.  A disappointment for me, but perhaps not everyone is driving diesel trucks and tractors outside in the weather.
Additionally Sony could have designed a better hold down strap that keeps the charging and cable cords secure.  It’s useless since they will both just fall out.  I already lost the charger cord after one use.
I can’t give you a report on talking on cell phones, so read other reviews.
To the big question.  Would I buy them again?  Do I recommend them?  Yes, but only with the understanding they are very easy to break if roughly handled, and the minor complaint the hold down strap in the case is mostly useless.
Synopsis:
* Easy to use.
* Excellent noise cancellation.
* Excellent sound quality.
* Good solid case that will take abuse and protect the headphones.

author: M
title: Just perfect
content: Best headphone I’ve ever laid hands on

author: Amazon Customer
content: Great headphones if your looking for something on noise canceling, used then at work and did a great job, however I did notice a cracking popping small sound on the right side when it was on the noise canceling setting...

author: Thomas
title: Perfect!
content: I've been waiting for this headphone for a long time and it doesn't let me down. Everything about it is so perfect and now I use it every day.

author: mich wizard
title: great product
content:
I used these Sony headphones on airplanes, they decrease the background noise by at least 95%. They minimize the light headedness after air travel. They had better tech and use  than my daughter's Boise headphones (lowering volume, fast-forwarding songs, listening to announcements...), however they did not feel as comfortable as hers, especially on my ears. Sound was good but not breathtaking.
I have a complaint about the delivery, where these expensive headphones were left in the middle of my front porch for every one to see and grab! I have been with Amazon for more than 10 years, this is my first time I feel that I have to be careful ordering from Amazon expensive items!

author: D Brook
title: Noise Cancelling is superb
content: It met all my expectations. I use them mostly for flying, and some phone calls. Phone calls sound great on my end, and on the callers end. I wish it had support for multiple bluetooth devices like the Bose.

author: Leia C
title: Great sound quality, excellent noise cancelling without pain.
content:
I've been using this at work in my open office for about a month and a half now, and it's safe to say I've been pleased. I've been able to compare with my coworkers' headphones, and am very happy with the purchase.
Compared to the QC35iis, it's lighter and has better bass, and the noise cancelling leaves me with less of a 'pressure' feeling.
Compared to the WH1000XM2s, both the sound quality and noise cancelling are way better.

Having a Pixel, it's nice having most of my travel environment be on USB-C. The headphones are easy to fold and carry, and the case has a slot to put the cables inside, which is a nice improvement from the last case. Battery lasts a long time; never measured, but I can usually go 1-2 work days without charging these guys.
One qualm I have is that I don't seem to be able to tweak the NC when not connected to my phone/using the app. Not sure how to do that on the computer, but the change in NC is significant when switching between my phone and my computer on bluetooth.

author: jeff
title: Great sound and noise cancellation!!
content: Just fantastic really love the USB quick charge and gesture control.

author: wr
title: The touch controls are very touchy
content: I've had this product for over a month and it is still wildly inconsistent with volume and playback controls. At times, it becomes possessed and will not turn off. The sound is awesome but the touch control is wildly inconsistent. Very, very annoying.

author: John
title: Poor value for price
content:
TL;DR: This product is a fairly mixed bag of highs and lows (audio puns aside) - Extremely poor user interface choices and poor design choices cripple an otherwise decent (but expensive) product.

I certainly enjoy using the headphones, they're comfortable, and the sound quality is good. Noise cancellation is fairly solid, although it certainly isn't as good as just putting in some in ear headphones with high quality foam tips. Even the battery life is pretty good, assuming you're using them for extended periods of time.

Unfortunately, there are some serious issues that drag this down and make me wish I'd have gone with the Bose 700's (which I will likely do anyway). In no particular order the pain points I found were:

1. Touch Controls. Barely usable while sitting perfectly still, mostly due to the poor direction detection and the attempt to use 4 way touch controls (Up, down, left, right). Having to swipe up 4 or 5 times to get the volume to change by an appreciable level is already annoying, and having 2 or those attempts accidentally skip a song forward or backward is just misery. Double tap to start/stop music is....unreliable as well.

2. Control "App". Doesn't really give you much control, doesn't seem to work well with the system controls (i.e. you stop a song in your music app of choice, but the Sony headphone connect app has no idea whats going on, and thinks sound is still playing) The vast majority of controls are hidden away in this, and most of them aren't customizable so if you'd like to change what the buttons do, or turn off the terrible touch controls, well you're out of luck.

3. Probably the biggest gripe on my list, because its both simple to implement, and nearly universal elsewhere - No battery saver/auto-shut-off/etc (full disclosure, there is allegedly an auto-shut-off if you move them out of Bluetooth range. Which is basically useless). If you're listening to music, and you fight the touch controls to pause a song, then set the headphone down to do something else, Sony assumes it should just keep canceling noise and waiting ever so patiently for your return. This isn't so great for the battery life, fyi.

3a. I'm not saying the headphones need to be able to detect if they're on your head or not, (I mean, my shitty airpods can do that....), but the bare minimum for functionality here is auto-shut-off when sound isn't playing. This is something that *should* be configurable in the "App" and *should* be able to support both auto-shut off without music and I dunno use one of the 2 buttons on here to disable the auto-shut-off and let you use just the noise cancellation if you want. I've likely used about as much battery listening to music as I have forgetting that these things are on, and not wearing them, while they happily cancel sound, for no reason.

Anyway, if it were my money, I'd buy some SE215's or 315's with the bluetooth connector cable. Which is what I did. Tada!

author: Nancy
title: Great for commute/planes
content: The noise canceling function is really good. Great sound quality. Super comfortable to wear for hours.

author: Top Dog
title: Battery DIES!!!!
content: My battery died after 6 months of use. It's not like I used it on a daily bases. $60 bucks for replacement and a whole bunch of little screws later (and a big headache). Now I'm invested in over $400. There has to be better! (Check out Boise) My LAST Sony Product good luck!

author: Thomas Allen Nelson
title: Ambient Kills
content: The ambient option is a winner.  In other regards, the best earphones I've ever used, hand down.

author: miguel valle
title: Hi fidelity
content: Súper cómodo y el sonido importante

author: Erin
title: Worth every penny
content: These are amazing! The headphones allow me to block out all unwanted noise and provides me with great sound.

author: DongDong
title: Good headset
content: good item with great noise cancelling

author: Nathan Packer
title: Better than the competitors at this price point
content: I was surprised with the sound quality of bluetooth. I now use this headset everywhere. It is comfortable, the controls are arranged efficiently, and the play time is more than adequate. The price? This is where you have to assess the price point based on your perception of quality and usefulness. At this point, I believe the price is reasonable for the perceived quality and for the overall pleasure it brings to me.

author: Sally C
title: Worth it!
content: The best noise cancelling headphones I’ve had. Comfortable, great sound, and a really long battery life. Very happy with my purchase.

author: eric
title: Excellent so far.
content: I used these on three commercial flights across the US  and they worked well. I watched downloaded TV shows. The noise cancelling worked fine. They seem well designed; the control features (vol up/down, mute, FF/RW all seem intuitive).

author: Jeff Doran
title: Sustained quality
content: After 2 months of daily use, the sound is still crisp, noise cancelling is the best I've ever experienced and the bass is booming on these things. Great Bluetooth connection - I can travel pretty far from the connected device without issues. They are extremely comfortable, even to fall asleep in. Definitely beyond satisfied.

author: Jeremy McGeehan
title: Amazing headphones
content: Absolutely incredible, love the quality

author: Molly
title: Yes yes yes!
content: First off, I ordered them on a Saturday evening and the order was processed Sunday. I was supposed to receive them on Friday, but they arrived Monday! Not even late Monday, Monday morning! I'm not sure why it was so early, I didn't pay for two day shipping, but I'm very happy that they got them to me already. I'm assuming it is all based on your location and the location of the item, but I'm amazed! Okay, now in terms of quality, I'm coming from $15 earbuds from Target, so the quality seems extremely nice in comparison. The sound quality is very good, I can't really compare sound quality to other headphones on the market. The noise cancelling is amazing, as well as the gesture controls. All of them have worked flawlessly. I have not had these headphones long enough to really rate the battery life, they are supposed to be 30 hours of battery life I believe, which is unbelievable. Overall, extremely satisfied with this purchase!

author: mtvG
title: Trash
content:
Purchased and used for two days before returning. Problems included poor sound quality (distortions even at low volume, fuzzy, hollow, even after tuning with the app), inability to maintain Bluetooth connection from more than a couple feet away from source, would lose Bluetooth connections if I turned my head (tried with multiple sources and distances), and people I spoke with using the mic said they were getting echoes from me and that I sounded far away. Also, the plastic construction while light/comfortable reeks of cheapness and seems fragile. The leatherette covering the foam ear muffs is liquid-thin and pitifully cheap; was already showing slight cracks out of the box.

With respect to the poor sound quality and connection problems, I probably got a defective unit, but  the production quality proved so poor I wouldn't try them again at even half the price.

author: Mayra Cruz
title: Really cancels ambient noise
content: Amazing product! Battery lasts forever, I work at a pretty loud office and I cannot hear a thing other than my music, these were a lifesaver highly recommended it’s worth the investment

author: scott harvey
title: a great sounding headphone
content: excellent sound and the app adds to the value

author: T. Hicks
title: Best Ever!
content: I have the Bose equivalents and while I still love the Bose, these seem to have a better noise cancelling feature. The sound quality is amazing and I enjoy the features of the APP that Bose does not have

author: William W. Akers
title: Love These Headphones
content: I have a room air conditioner, when turned on, sounds like a Boeing 747 taking off!  A bit of an exaggeration, but the AC is annoyingly loud.  With noise cancellation turned “on” with these headphones the AC noise is reduced almost entirely.  And the sound quality is excellent.

author: Nathan Lam
title: This is the one
content: Between the Bose 700, Bose QC 35 II, and the XM3's, decided to pick up the XM3's. I wish I pulled the trigger earlier, the ANC works great since I'm using this in an open office space where there are doors being slammed, people talking, chairs shuffling, and noise distractions. The noise is 90% removed so its perfect for me. I'm also exclusively using this as wired headphones even though it has bluetooth capabilities. The only slight negative thing is that the wired cable that comes in the box is slightly short but I'll be getting a longer cable. But other then that no complainants, highly recommended especially if you can grab it on sale

author: Samuel J Litzler II
title: Best headphones I’ve ever owned
content: Best headphones I’ve ever owned period.

author: C. Pilot
title: Definitely the best of the current "Big Three"...
content:
The Sony WH1000XM3 headphones are 1/3 of THE trifecta of wireless headphones, including the Sony offering, the Sennheiser PXC550 headphones, and the Bose QC35-II headphones. I have been able to try all three, and can say that the Sony headphones are the winner for me.

NEGATIVES:
(1) I really only have found one and it's rather glaring -- these headphones can only be paired with one device at a time.  Meaning that if you've already paired them with your phone, when you want to use them with your laptop you have to completely go through the pairing process all over again.  And once you have it paired with your laptop and want to go back to your phone, you have pair everything all over again.  I really can't believe Sony botched this feature this badly, and I really don't know what they were thinking.

A minor negative is that the Sony headphone app is not compatible with Android on Chromebooks. Although I have a monster bulky Asus ROG gaming laptop, I mainly use my Acer Chromebook while on the go, and although the Chromebook runs Google Play Android apps, the Sony headphone app reports that it's not compatible with this device.  So when using these headphones with my Chromebook, they're aren't anywhere near as tweakable as when I'm using it on my phone.  I'm sure it would work with a genuine Android tablet, but I don't use Android tablets anymore since I got the Chromebook.

Another minor annoyance is the tiny little 6" (at best) USB-C charge cable that Sony includes.  It's just simply not convenient to charge these headphones on such a short cord, and it really would've only cost Sony maybe pennies to include a more standard 3' cord.

POSITIVES:
(1) These headphones are very comfortable to wear, even for longer periods of time. They are just slightly less comfortable than the Bose QC35-II headphones, which feel like magical unicorn sparkle angel pillows on your ears.

(2) A big thumbs up for future-proof USB-C charging! I haven't found any other brand of higher end headphone using it yet, so I suspect that Sony is the first.

(3) The ANC feature is superb -- definitely equal to, if not actually superior to, the Bose QC35-II headphones.  And the app makes it even better by allowing you to tweak it to your personal preferences.

(4) Another big thumbs up for Sony making the wired cord 3.5mm to 3.5mm rather than having a more proprietary (and difficult to replace) 2.5mm on one end.  Again, I'm pretty sure Sony is the only one doing this in higher end headphones for some reason.

(5) Sound quality is excellent and in direct comparison I think it's better than the Bose QC35-II. I realize this is rather subjective, though, but I really have nothing negative to say about Sony's sound quality, whereas I felt the Sennheiser PXC550 sound quality was rather poor.

(6) Sony put the right amount of touch controls and hardware buttons on these headphones.  One thing I really didn't like about the Sennheiser PXC550 headphones is that they didn't have a hardware on/off switch and instead the power option is built-in to rotating the ear cups.  That just seemed like something that would quickly break and I also never did figure out how I was supposed to turn off the headphones while still using them wired.  There's simply no way to turn them off.  Sony has a dedicated hardware power button, as well as a multi-function button that can be setup (via the app) to control ANC or digital assistants, etc.  So far I haven't had any problems with accidentally activating a touch function. Volume, skip, and pause touch functions have all been very responsive.

(7) Although I'm not using the included case (I bought a 3rd-party case that I like better), it's still a really nice case.  I think the Bose case is nicer, but the Sennheiser case was just pathetic and wasn't much better than a bag in terms of protecting the rather expensive headphones.

Overall, without getting into too many specifics about the other two headphones, I rate the Sony headphones as the best for me.  The slightly beat out the Bose QC35-II headphones in terms of ANC as well as sound quality, and there's simply no comparison when it comes to Sony's touch controls and superior USB-C charging.  The difference between the Sony headphones and the Sennheiser PXC550 headphones was like night and day. The Sennheisers had vastly inferior sound quality and horrible comfort to the point that I couldn't even really test/compare the ANC because there's simply no way I could keep the Sennheisers on my head long enough (the ear cups are actually painful).  It was also a nice touch that the Sony headphones came to me fully charged, whereas the Bose and Sennheiser headphones were only partially charged.  Who wants to wait to fully charge their new device?

So, in summary, the Sony WH1000XM3 headphones slightly nudge out the Bose QC35-II headphones, whereas the Sony headphones obliterate the Sennheiser PXC550 headphones so badly that they really aren't even in the same category.

author: kunfusion84
title: Top notch noise cancelation
content: Very comfortable pair of headphones.  Noise canceling is top notch.  Not as loud as some of the lower end headphones Sony offers.  The design of the controls is the worst I've ever used.

author: Keesha Hardaway
title: So not what I was expecting
content: The controls were hard to operate. Noise cancelling was more noise reducing.

author: gig
title: Privacy Setting
content: After carefully reading the privacy notice on the Sony app, I would never buy another Sony product.  WTF is wrong with these people?  The arrogance. Can't we just buy a pair of headphones and listen with them without worrying about your privacy?

author: Aram T
title: An amazing pair of headphones
content:
Having owned Bose QC2, Shures in ears, and a host of lessername headphones, I had been curious about the multiple claims Sony was better. Having now used them for a few days including train rides, I'm blown away at how good these are and how they exceeded every expectation.

Sound - so much clearer than others, you feel in the music.
Noise cancelling - i can have someone next to me talking and not hear them, they are that good. It's a bit unnerving too though so I can't keep it on all the time
Microphone - great if you have the headset on the right way - this is so strangely critical. I wore it backwards on a phone call and noone could hear me. Was frustrated and though the mic was bad... realized I had it on backwards and magically everyone heard me just fine. Noise canceling is great at picking up on your voice too.
All in all, highly recommended. Just love them all around.

author: Philip Edsel
title: Really dig these headphones. Prefer them to my Bose Quiet Comfort Headphones.
content:
I was excited to compare them to my Bose Quiet Comfort 35 headphones, and I got a pair free from Sony for review. First glance, I definitely prefer the look of these Sony's. They're more sleek and a little more modern looking. They also seem to have a bit of a lower profile on my head.

Sound-wise, they're phenomenal. The app lets you do cool things like adjust the ambient sound control and EQ and even optimize for atmospheric pressure, which is a little over my head, but they definitely left no stone unturned. I haven't tried them on a flight yet, but I imagine they'll be pretty unbelievable in that context. I was a touring musician for 8 years and I'm super used to in-ears and over the ear cans for recording and these feel super punchy and detailed. Seem to have a little more punch than the Bose as well.

In regards to comfort, the actual ear foam is amazing, although I will say after wearing them for about an hour the top of my head gets a little sore. The Bose headphones tend to do the opposite, where my ears get a little sore after long use. But these just require a little repositioning and you're good to go. Super light and enjoyable to wear though otherwise.

My favorite thing though, and where I think they really shine in comparison to the Bose headphones, is control. I had no idea these were gesture controlled, which is a super dope feature. You swipe forward or back on the ear to move tracks and up or down to adjust volume. So simple, but really amazing in practice.

Ultimately both are great headphones, but if I had to choose between the two, would definitely go with the Sony pair. Hope that helps!

author: Dina L
title: Perfect for travel
content: Perfect for travel! Cancels out the sound of the plane engine. Can’t travel without them!

author: John Blandford
title: Best Headphones Ever
content: I love these headphones. Great sound. Comfortable.  Amazing noise canceling. Sometimes I wear them just to block the noise and enjoy the silence.

author: Mark ward
title: Best headphones ever!!!!!!!
content: These have the absolute best noise cancelling ever.  I walked down the halls of my high school between classes and could not hear a thing!!!!!!!!! When you put these on the world round you disappears as you get engulfed in the music!!!!

author: Criticalthinker
title: Not as great as reviews claim!
content: I am a little confused by the rave reviews on these headphones. I expected much more than they delivered. The sound quality is good enough, although I am not wowed by it. I like the sleek look of both the headphones and the storage “purse.” The headphone set is comfortable on my head and the cans don’t crush my ears like some sets do. But the noice cancelling is very poor! I have used other noise cancelling headphones, so I know what the difference between ambient sound and noise cancelling should be. And these don’t provide that wall of silence. Maybe I got a bum set? The other annoyance is that the finger-touch volume changing doesn’t always work. I guess it’s fussy or something, but I can get it to work less than 50 percent of the time.

author: Eric Fincher
title: The best headphones!
content: These headphones are durable and comfy!  Phone app is easy to install and use.  Phone app allows easy customization of sound settings, etc.  Sound quality is outstanding!

author: Mickey
title: Best headphone I've ever used
content: I rarely review. I've had the Bose QC35, B&W PX. The Sony beats both in being light weight, comfortable and best in class ANC. It shapes to my head much better than any other headphone I've used.

author: Will Mason
title: My favorite Bluetooth headphones
content: I’ve had Bose Quite Comfort headphones but I like these better.

author: Abishek Jhureley
title: Love it
content: Works great. I use it daily for my 2-3 daily work commute.

author: Bob Cooper
title: Great sound, great features
content: These  headphones are the most comfortable and best sounding that I have ever used. Very satisfied with them.

author: Timothy N.
title: Manufacturing defect
content: I bought them 30 days ago. But they have a defect, I’m returning them. Online reviews show people complaining but Sony isn’t responding. They have a manufacturing defect where they make inconvenient noise in the left ear

author: Mario Da Silva
title: expensive but worth the money sound quality is amazing
content: I use this pair of headphones to block out the noise in an open plan office and play a mixture of different music and it works very well  good sound comfort and excellent noise canceling. they are expensive but if you want to play music and block out the work you will not be disappointed.

author: david wall co. ☕️
title: amazing!
content: sounds great. cancels all sounds. 12/10

author: Emmanuel Grant
title: Excellent
content: Like how easy it was to use and setup out from the box. So far best headset I've invested my money with

author: Nicolas Yepes
title: Best NC Headphones
content: Used them on several airplanes now. It’s like you’re in your own little world. Definitely superior to the Bose counterpart

author: Sir Charles Panther
title: Very Good Noise-Canceling Headphones
content:
My son got a whiff of this product, and liked it so much he demanded a set for Christmas...which he got.

In the package you get:
• The foldable headphones. They fold into a pretty small space, but the folding is not fully intuitive, but there is a template in the case to help you along.
• An airplane two-prong adapter; nice, but is this really needed anymore?  Maybe on Air Tajik.
• A 48” male-male aux connector, one end straight and the other “L”; good length, and a good thing to add into the package.
• A 9” USB-to-mini USB cord; this cord is way, way too short.  Put another 27” on it, at least.
• Documentation/instructions; very well done.
• A black zippered carrying case.

There is no assembly required, other than connecting your cord to the phones and going.  Mine had a little charge left, but it faded pretty quickly; you’ll need about three hours to charge them up fully.  If you’re going corded, the phones work just fine without a charge and without going noise-canceling, but a lot of the really cool control features do not work, such as the volume and music selection controls.

Optimal use of this rig is with the app, which is available at the Play Store and with Apple.  Of course, this means that Sony is tracking what you listen to, how often, probably how loud, at what time of day/night, and every other possible metric you can think of.  That’s your tradeoff.  The app enables the touch controls on the right ear cup, which are pretty cool.  These controls do NOT work when you’re going corded.

When you switch the phones on you get a very pleasant female voice announcing “power on” and then “power off” when you shut down.

Comfort: As a longtime Bose noise-canceling owner, I have to admit: the Bose rig is more comfortable.  The cups are bigger and softer, and the headband does not weigh as heavily.  This is not to say that this rig is uncomfortable; it is quite nice.  The set adjusts easily and quickly, and the cups do fit snugly and completely around the ears for isolation to allow full noise cancellation effect.

Sound: so how do they sound?  First of all, the Bose noise-cancellation is better.  It’s more complete.  These cancel noise very well, but when you cut the phones on you get a subtle background hiss.  They work, and work well, but by my comparison Bose is better.

If you like loud, these go loud, and there is a surprising lack of distortion.  They really do rock, and reproduce both bottom-end and high-end sound quite well.  Voice comes through clearly, and separation is very clear and distinct.

Unlike the Bose noise-canceling phones, these have a rechargeable battery, not a standard battery.  That’s a plus, but you’ll need to plan ahead on charging.

Documentation: Lots of paperwork with this item, all of it highly instructive and useful.  The controls and all of the features are very well presented and clear.  You will need the instructions, as some of the controls are not really that intuitive.  You get lots of contact info for Sony in case you have a problem with the set, or in case you have questions.

Price: These come in at about $350.  Yeah, expensive.  But they fully deliver on all stated features, and then some.  This is a high-end product, with a ton of features and premium sound, so I do believe that this is a valid price, approximately equal to what Bose is getting for their noise-canceling headphones.

Bottom Line: This is a premium corded/cordless set of headphones, with a very nice set of features.  I recommend you audition these and the Bose before you purchase, as they are highly similar, but differ in a few subtle ways, specifically the noise cancellation and sound reproduction.

author: Amy Le
title: Debatable
content: I bought one for myself and one for my boyfriend. My boyfriend's headphones worked fine, but my headphones were not working properly. The volume would suddenly skyrocket to max volume. I guess these are "good" for the price, but be cautious.

author: ACyclic
title: Good headphones but has issues
content:
Generally a good headphone
Noise cancellation isn't as good as Parror Zik for my own footsteps when walking
Turning them on/off is annoying, you have to hold down the power button for 2 seconds - why not just a tap?
Crashes Spotify on my iPhone after I accept a call, I have to reset the headphone

author: Santiago
title: Noise cancelling works just perfect
content: This works perfect to isolate myself while I'm working and the room is super noisy, I don't hear anything.

author: Professor Prime
title: Better than Bose in every way except the main one: comfort
content:
Amazing sound compared to the Bose QCII, and excellent sounds for $300 headphone. Swipe controls are fine, not amazing but they work.

Problem for me was simple: the Bose are comfy on my big ears. These were tighter and ran hotter. My ears and head are probably larger than most. But it’s also that the Bose are so incredibly comfortable.

In the end, I want this sort of headphone to wear for 4-6 hours a day. So comfort is king.

Also connectivity was Ok but lacks multi device blue tooth pairing. Minor pain. Not the end of the world.

A pass from me. Returned them and kept the Bose Quiet Comfort 35 II

author: kenneth lindsay
title: nice to go wireless
content: good quality, will test them on upcoming flight to florida.. comfortable to wear

author: The Slayer
title: Comfortable, Great sound, and excellent noise canceling
content:
I bought these because I travel quite a bit for work and I wanted something to drown out noise at the airport and on the plane.

Comfort:
They've been comfortable for me.  I've worn them at the airport and on long 4 hour flights.

Sound:
The sound was crystal-clear with good bass.  I played my lossless media and the improvement in sound and tone was noticeable with these headphones.

Noise-canceling:
I'm no authority on noise canceling headphones.  I've only had a few different sets and this set was by far the most expensive.  So the question is, did it work on the plan?  It didn't completely eliminate the sound of the engines, but enough where it wasn't noticeable unless you listened for it.

Extra:
One of the cool features was to change from Noise-canceling to Ambient Sound.  This was useful when the Flight Attendants or Pilot was speaking...it stops whatever media you're playing and you can hear everything slightly amplified without having to take your headphones off.  A couple button pushes later and you're back to noise-canceling.

The other thing I like was the gestures to the right earpiece.  You can stop the music, fast-forward, or reverse, increase/decrease volume...all with swipes or taps.

Overall, I"m happy with my purchase.

author: Cliente Amazon
title: Sony
content: Todo perfecto

author: Tanzim
title: Best sounding headphones I've ever tried
content: If you're in the market for great noise cancelling headphones that sound amazing, this is it. Can not complain about the audio quality at all. It feels comfortable and premium overall. I've heard that Bose has better noise cancelling (although have never tried it), and these ones made me a little nauseous from prolonged use in the beginning. But I did get over that after a month or so and absolutely love them now.

author: Alphalpha
title: Makes Listening More Pleasurable...
content:
I am surprised at how much I enjoy these headphones. My listening experience has dramatically improved. The sound quality is very good. But more surprisingly, the soundstage is very broad. I have used them for audiobooks, music (Classical, Jazz, Classic Rock and Hip-Hop), and streaming shows (for which there is negligible lag between audio and visual). First off, these headphones improve the experience of all of these things. I find myself discovering nuances and details in music I am very intimate with. I also find myself, for example) turning my head when a dog barks off in the distance in a show. The sound is very balanced and somewhat neutral for a Sony headphone.

The touch controls are easy and intuitive. The microphone is clear and responsive with no echo or complaint from those on the other end of the line. The noise cancellation has minimal effect on the SQ. The canceling is beautiful. They are excessively comfortable for my larger than average head. These are great.

10 of 10 would buy again. Thinking about a set for my wife and my father.

author: Yizhang Shen
title: Excellent built quality
content: It’s very good overall. Better looking than BOSE one.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazing
content: Amazing headphones beats all other out there.

author: George Marc Thompson
title: Very light
content: Very comfortable

author: Stephen
title: Pretty Good but not Great
content: Overall  comfortable, noise canceling seems inferior when compared to other brands. Touch controls are horrendous, physical buttons would have been a better option. They serve their purpose without being anything special. I would not buy again.

author: Harmony
title: Too costly
content: I'm placing the return......when I compared with other products in the market...its too costly

author: K
title: Great headphones
content: These sound really good.  The size control is very convenient also. The cushion is good but not as comfortable as my old Bose but I think the sound quality is definitely better.

author: Kodiak
title: Simply amazing
content:
By far the most comfortable headphones i've owned. The headband does become irritating after hours of wearing but that's  really fine. My ears have yet to overheat under these which was my biggest problem with over ear headphones. The sound quality is definitely the best i've experienced. The bass has such a good range reach and can be nearly removed or overpowering depending upon where you set the levels in the app. The touch controls arent my favorite for convenience reasons seeing as they arent perfectly responsive (could just be me not being used to them yet) and I accidentally hit them sometimes, however they do add an amount of class and quality to the headphones. I haven't heard the microphone quality myself but nobody ever has a problem hearing me if I talk via bluetooth on the phone. I do wish there was a voice feedback (or ambient sound turn on) when two way voice is active for phone calls and voice assistance (ex. Google assistant). I dont ever know how loud im talking due to the noise canceling. Noise canceling isn't perfect but according to all tech reviews i've read and watched these have the best noise canceling to date. Sharp sounds such as gunshots, small dogs barking, and like tapping your pen still come through but definitely quieter than they normally are and often are easily overpowered by music. Talking can get through but muffled and often incoherent depending on the volume and distance of the subject speaking again easily overpowered by music. Constant sounds  soft sounds, or low sounds such as highway traffic, trains, cows, neighbors tv, wind, and other are nearly always muted entirely even without music playing.

Overall, they are worth the price and are definitely a good buy if you can afford such.

author: Jon
title: Pretty crazy sound & technology
content:
These headphones are pretty awesome. They’re comfortable, have amazing sound quality ( rich, deep bass), and look super sleek.

The noise cancelling is pretty amazing but could definitely be refined further. Sudden sounds or those of a louder nature can still be heard.

The only thing I’m not the biggest fan of are the controls. The touch pad is very gimmicky and doesn’t always respond well.

The price is better than I expected it to be. Hopefully these will hold up over time, they seem to be very durable and made of nice material. Keep it up Bose!

author: Richard Neidkowski
title: Absolutely amazing!!!
content: Freaking Awesome!!!! Bought these for a trip to San Diego coming up and tried them while I was blowing leaves.  Amazing.  I own a Landscaping company and used them today while using my Redmaxx 8550 backpack blowers,  silenced the blowers.  3 of them running at once. Was very skeptical about the noice cancelling the blowers but it worked.  Didn't do it 100% but a good 90% muting the blowers. Now, I'm using them for work till the trip

author: Xu Dong
title: Creaking Problem
content: My headphones creak really badly. The slightest movement makes them creak. It might just be my unit but I'll definitely be returning it for a Bose or Sennheiser.

author: Otisdemilo
title: these are great.  Best purchase of the year thus far.
content: The noise cancelling features are amazing-- I have had other high end noise cancelling headphones and these are clearly the next generation.  They are rather lightweight and comfortable and easy to wear.  The settings are clear and the app works perfectly fine.  The microphone isn't epic, but is functional for answering phone calls.  Overall I have no complaints and can highly recommend these.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Fantastic noise-cancelling and battery life
content:
Amazing compared to the already-good WH-700’s. Remarkable battery life. USB-C cable is comically short....
I’m not an audiophile, but I do spend a lot of time on airplanes, and they provide a little slice of quiet heaven against the background noise.
I was surprised at the amount of discreet frequency pass-through: I can clearly hear nearby conversations...
Definitely recommend overall

author: D.Ayotte
title: These things are truly amazing.
content:
I have had these for a few weeks now and wanted to  try a bunch of different scenerio's before posting a review.  I have the latest Bose version of noise cancelling blue tooth headphones too, I couldn't make up my mind. :-)  So, for rocking out, and listening options, I prefer the Sony.  The app that comes with the Sony is so much better for pure sound.  I am using an iPhone XS Max, and response time for using the app is very good.  The Equalizer in the Sony app is one of the big selling points for me. You can go into manual mode and really dial in your favorite sound, or use one of the presets.  The bose app has no EQ options and that is a real drag.

Today, I wore these in the garage to see how they would compete with a very noisy air compressor and I was totally blown away.  I could actually listen to classical music while the compressor was blasting very near to me.  Taking the headphones off and putting them on a few times just to see it was really that good, and it was.  You may need to use the app to adjust the noise cancelling level depending on your needs, or set it to auto mode.  I also tried it on the riding lawnmower and it is really stunning.  I didn't try the Bose in either situation, no time today, so I can't comment on how well the Bose will block out an air compressor..

The Sony app is not  perfect though.  Every time i open it, it reconnects and its a bit odd, but works well.  also, using the headphones on multiple devices is not very smooth. Fortunately, I have most of my music on my phone.

I do like the tones and the voice of the prompts, some people have mentioned them as a negative, but I'm not one of them.

They are very comfortable, but they feel a bit heavier than the Bose, and some folks may find they sweat easier with these.  So, Bose wins the comfort category.  Also, Bose can connect to multiple devices easier.

I will almost always use these over the Bose for at home use.  But I do find myself wearing the Bose when I am working. The subtle weight difference ( or so it seems ) and the comfort make me prefer the Bose for work.  The sound quality of the Bose is very good, and plenty sufficient for all day listening, which for me is usually classical, or easy listening.

Ah, and I must also comment on the touch controls.  I was very concerned about them not working well, or being triggered by something and annoying me.  But so far they work almost perfectly.  i use the touch option to stop/start music, adjust the volume, and skip to the next song.  It is very cool..  hard to believe that this technology exists today.

Battery life is great too.

author: Darius McDougle
title: Very good quality
content: Best headphones

author: Misk
title: Perfect. Amazing. Worth every penny.
content:
Unbelievable! Absolutely amazing. I use these 10 hours a day at work and the noise cancelling is fantastic I don't think I can go back to a pair of headphones without such good noise cancelling.

The build quality is top notch! These are comfy and light great for all day use with short breaks. The battery just goes and goes and charges unrealistically fast! The touch controls are responsive and intuitive. I can't think of any real cons just very minor personal gripes.

These are my personal favorite Bluetooth headphones and I would easily recommend them to anyone.

author: Max
title: The best
content: Writing a lot of words in this review would simply waste everybody’s time. All you need to know is that these are the best ANC Bluetooth headphones on the market at the moment. Period.

author: Eric W.
title: Headband too big
content: The headband won't collapse small enough to fit on my head comfortably.

author: rgsilveira
title: New benchmark for ANC headphones
content: After going back an forth between the 1000XM2 and the Bose QC35II, ended up buying the Sony and it was awesome..... Until a few days later when they released the 1000XM3!!!  I quickly turned the XM2 and bought these. They made a substancial improvement over something awesome! Slight improve on sound quality, BIG improvement on noise cancelling and a great job redesigning everything! They look a lot nicer (even though this is personal opinion) on my head. I would also note that they are very comfortable.

author: Archie Owen
title: Its worth it! Would have went with black pair instead.
content: Great product, just recently received mine and put it to use. This is my first pair of noise cancelling headphones I've been using apple ear buds for years and this was definitely the best investment I made. I love music! Although when I ordered mine I wanted to get the black pair but it would arrive after christmas I sort of wish I waited for the black pair instead of the silver pair. This color just doesn't suit me I suppose..

author: Udit Asija
title: DO NOT RECOMMEND Sound quality is BAD; Wireless connectivity -Average;  ANC- top notch
content:
I order them expecting a lot as they are #1 Wireless Headphones for 2018 and 2019 till now. Packaging, carry case and headphone material quality is amazing and frankly I expect that considering a 350$ price tag.

My honest unbiased review :-

PROS-
1)Great headphone build quality and looks great
2) Lightweight and Less head clamping force- thus can be easily worn for long durations without any headache, ear fatigue, etc
3) Active Noise Cancellation is clearly the best which it endorses. Compared to Bose Qc35, these are better by a clear margin in my opinion. The ANC on these is customizable too according to various environments which I appreciated a lot.
4) Sony headphones app is pretty good with customizable EQ & ANC. Also has preset EQ options and self adaptive ANC setting.
5) USB-type C charging and quick charge options are wonderful.

Now coming to the CONS, and I have some major ones here

1)Sound quality is of prime importance to me ( way more than wireless connectivity and ANC) & sound is the worst thing about these headphones considering the 350$ price. My previous headphones (For eg- ATH-M50xBT sound so much better that I dare compare sound quality.
Basically the Mids & Highs are compromised a lot according to me . there isn't enough clarity and sound muddy especially after 50% volume.

2) Lows and bass which are advertised as great are average and noticed frequent distortion and bass cracking at higher volumes. Has a strong bass but isn't a thumpy bass , rather sound really artificial. Bass was where I was most disappointed.
As much as I appreciate the EQ customizability , no matter how much I played with the EQ settings I couldn't get my desired sound. Even at extreme EQ settings it stays bass heavy (though not satisfying one)
3) Max volume isn't as high as it should be in my opinion, but this may vary with every consumer.
4) Wireless connectivity- connecting bluetooth was smooth BUT I noticed some intermittent connection breaks with my MacBook Air while being in the same room.
5) Touch controls are good but you will experience accidental pressing while trying to adjust the headphones or sometimes wrong function might work. basically takes time to adapt and still wouldn't be 100% accurate. I prefer the mechanical buttons for volume and track change.
6) soundstage is average, have experienced way better in closed over ear headphones.
7) Ear cups are pretty bulky. Don't expect a sleek look. Pop out significantly over ear.

In conclusion as the cons were to bothersome for me especially the sound quality and sound stage, I returned the product. If you are looking for wireless over-ear headphones specifically for the Active noise cancellation and sound doesn't matter much then go for these. But if you are spending 350$ on a headphone , I guess you are entitled to great sound. So I DO NOT RECOMMEND these headphones .

author: Nathaniel Elayda
title: Best at ANC! Hands down!
content: If you're looking for the best ANC Bluetooth headphones in the market right now, this is pretty much the cream of the crop. Sounds quality is also great, however it does sound a little 'muddy' for my taste, but easily fixed with my phone's EQ and not the headphone app's EQ(it forces you to switch to SBC from the superior LDAC). Built quality feels premium, folding and extending/retracting the bands requires little effort and is a smooth process. Definitely a worthwhile investment!

title: Good Purchase
content: good fit, decent sound, noise cancel worked well on plane, also use them for gym workouts

author: Scotty133
title: Nice Headphones with Great Noise Cancellation
content:
I narrowed down my choice for noise cancelling headphones to this model and the Bose QC headphones.  I have never owned over-ear headphones so I wasn't sure what to expect.  However, I'm very happy with my purchase.

Pros:
Great Sound
Excellent Noise Cancellation
Excellent battery life and Charge Speed
Work well with my iPhone 7

Cons:
My ears get hot when I wear them for awhile
The touch controls are a little tricky at first.  I still occasionally skip a song while trying to control volume.

Overall, I'm very happy with the product.

author: Alex
title: Call quality sucks
content:
Better than Bose in every way except for call quality. Because of a software programming feature. They are virtually On usable for call quality in the car. Or anywhere else that has background noise.
I love these headphones and it really disappoints me at Sony has not fix this issue. The mx2 had the same problem.

author: Mavs
title: Great design/features and decent sound but overambitious touch controls with a potential fatal flaw.
content:
I had high hopes for these headphones as I needed a good set of cans for my commute.  I had really grown accustomed to entry-level "audiophile" over-ear headphones like the Audio Technica M50x but despite their decent passive noise isolation, ambient noise in the subway or walking across the George Washington Bridge sometimes drowned them out.  I wanted a set of more portable, wireless, noise-canceling headphones and read that these struck a good balance.  I did not expect audiophile quality sound.  So let me break it down by categories:

Sound (3-4/5): Decent.  These are not "audiophile" grade by any means.  They are pleasant, warm, easy to listen to (not fatiguing), better than most ear buds, decent bass (though it can overlap with low mids), and with the equalizer can be customized a bit to fit your preference.  But compared to audiophile grade they are not as detailed or clear.  Still, for a set of active noise canceling headphones loaded with features, it's a good enough sound for a commute.

Noise-canceling (4/5): Very good.  In some settings it is really impressive and makes the whole world seem to disappear.  Obviously it can't block out unpredictable transient sounds and it won't completely eliminate very loud low frequency rumbles (like the subway) but certainly dampens them impressively.  One disappointment is its handling of wind noise.  Wind sometimes seems to feed into the headphones.  I think this is because the microphones are picking up the wind and failing at canceling it (so it ends up getting transmitted into the headphone).  It's not a fatal flaw and typically not a major problem unless the wind is really strong.  But this is the reason ANC doesn't get 5/5.

Build (4/5):  Although it initially feels like a plastic toy I grew to like the build over the time.  It is light and sleek.  Nothing much to say about it.  I suspect durability could be an issue but haven't had them long enough.

Comfort (5/5): I thought they were very soft and comfortable.  Not too much clamping force.

Controls (2/5): This is the potential fatal flaw.  I would have given this a 1/5 but I do like the concept of the touch controls and when they are working well it is very convenient.  I wouldn't have minded occasional hiccups but here is where the real issue.  On cold and/or windy days, the touch controls were spontaneously activate.  This would cause voice assist to activate randomly or tracks to pause/skip.  It made the headphones unusable outdoors on cold and/or windy days.  In addition, a few times the controls stopped working, then became fritzy.  I had to turn off/on the headphones to get them to work.  This was the most disappointing issue the headphones had.  Many people will want them for commuting which for many involves being outdoors.  This problem essentially renders them unusable for this application.  In normal indoor environments (or airplanes I suspect) they work well.

Other features/misc (5/5):  Loaded with neat features (some useful, some fun).  Decent phone app with equalizer.  Interesting ANC optimization and settings (though sometimes don't work that great).  Great foldability and semi-rigid case make them very portable.

Overall (3/5):  Great for indoor use or warm climates but potentially fatal flaw for those hoping to use them to commute in cold weather.  I will likely have to return them.  Also be aware that fakespot.com grades the reviews with an "F" suggesting high deception is involved (in contrast to the "A" that the Bose QC 35 II have).  I will may try the Bose QC 35 II despite possibly inferior sound given they have physical controls, are said to be more comfortable, ANC not affected by wind as much, and are also foldable and portable.  Alternatively, I may stick to my M50x or M50xBT or Sennheiser 598cs for better sound quality but no ANC.  The ATH-MSR7 is an intriguing possibility given it combines audiophile level sound with active noise canceling (but I haven't loved the sound signature).

author: Mi5terJ
title: Does it’s Job
content:
My girlfriend and I love each other. But sometimes, we just can’t listen to each other. These work at cancelling out each other’s voices when we just don’t want to hear each other.

Oh music sounds great as always with Sony cans and the noise cancelling works so well, it makes a 6 hour flight in coach bearable.

author: Lamar
title: Bluetooth isn’t good
content: Bought these a week ago been using for few days and while using Bluetooth it constantly stops playing the song and gives this mumbling noise, for the price I wouldn’t advise others to buy.

author: steve
title: Excellent Sound, Easy to use
content: I've had many over-ear headsets. These are the best, by far. Very comfortable even after several hours. Noise reduction is great. They fold up nicely for travel. Very easy hookup with bluetooth. Pricey, but I feel like I got my $$ worth.

author: Irwin Dustin
title: Impressive
content:
Sound quality is par with high end Open Sennheiser Headphones.
The bass is way more powerful as expected.

Noise cancellation is top of the line as well. However, I purchased this headphone because of my annoying upstair neighbor sending down very powerful bass vibration and the headphone does not completely block that noise (naturally because bass noise is low frequency)

Anyway, great quality. I am glad I got it while it was put on sale. Definitely a keeper and worth every penny spent.

*Only down side - Charger cable is not even a foot long. Come on Sony...

author: Amazon Customer
title: it works
content: very happy

author: John.C
title: Best All around headphone
content: Best headphone ever

author: MBodt
title: Great sound
content: I forgot how good sound can be via headphones. These are great for traveling or sitting in Starbucks and drowning out the noise.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Hot to wear..tight on large head
content: Not the best for the gym. The vinyl earcups will make your ear area sweat during workouts. Tight on the head. Accidentally changes volume

author: Thomas
title: Excellent Quality
content: I did a lot of research between these Sony headphones and Bose noise cancelling.  I travel a lot and these have been amazing!  I've gotten so I use them everywhere.  I can mow the lawn and not hear the mower.  The sound quality is excellent and the Sony app to fine tune them works great.  Very happy with this purchase!

author: H
title: The bestest
content: It is the best for me

author: Jeremy Young
title: 3,000% Recommend (and I don't do that often)
content: These are currently my favorite headphones. I bought my wife the latest Bose Quiet Comfort 35 II's for our upcoming trip to Thailand at the same time as these, because she's, sadly, "not really into bass," these absolutely destroy them, not even a remotely fair fight. Once you spend the time to turn on your best audio setting on your phone, spotify/whatever, the headphones themselves etc... you will hear what they can REALLY do. Out of the box they were pretty good but after maxing out your (in my case) GS10+ phone audio settings, customizing your equalizer settings, turning on the extra goodies in the headphone app... these are the best bluetooth NC headphones imo. I would have regretted the Bose and felt ripped off. To be fair Bose are ok if you just don't care about sound (like my wife) and want to use them as basically, $350 NC earplugs for a flight. Bottom line, just get the Sony if you actually like sound and are planning to travel any time soon. 0 regrets.

author: Martin
title: Super
content: Superb

author: Ahmad

author: Jetpack
title: Great noise control
content: These headphones are pricy, but they do a great job of cutting out background noise.  Welcome to the modern office.

author: Frank P.
title: Disappointing sound quality.
content: Tried listening using bluetooth sound quality just didn't impress. Used input jack from AK70 and sound quality did not improve. Just to make sure I wasn't loosing my hearing I compared the Sony's to my Grado SR-80's and was relieved to discover it was not my ears. This was my first pair of noise cancelling headphones. Perhaps it's the nature of the noise cancelling feature but the listening experience was just not what I would expect from a $348 pair of headphones. I didn't try them in a noisy environment so I can't speak to there ability in that regard. I returned them.

author: Dzhalal
title: Good, but little problems that start to really bother
content:
I got this product to study at the library. As a noice cancelling and music playing device, it has been excellent. However, there are couple of things that make give it only 4 stars.
First one has been widely discussed. It can only connect to 1 device. It does that really well. The moment I open my laptop it's all ready connected to it. However, switching between devices (for me it's my phone and laptop) is a headache.  Moreover, it really likes connecting to the device it was connected to the last time. So in order to switch sometimes you have to go through holding the button for 2 seconds (which turns it off), and then for another 7 seconds so it's ready to pair up with a new device. Get's quite annoying especially after you have used something like AirPods, earbuds for far less money.
The second thing is that does not turn off unless you disconnect it from bluetooth or manually turn it. In real life what happens is I pack up my stuff to go for lunch or classes, get home 6 hours after and the device has been on all this time. Or it was one the whole night. As a result, the amazing battery life kinda loses its point.
I have been using these headphones for 2 weeks and still might return them.

author: Freddie
title: That they do cancel out noise
content: Very comfortable to watch movies

author: M. Cruz
title: Super comfortable. Excellent features
content: Replaced my mdr 1000 with these. Worth it.

author: carlos
title: Favorite noise canceling headphones
content: These are my favorite wireless headphones, awesome noise canceling, nice design, extremely comfortable, and great battery life. I’m really happy with this purchase

author: Dru Mozingo
title: Best Headphones I've Ever Had!
content: Everything about this product is high quality-- sound, comfort, noise canceling. The noise canceling is excellent and will help any open office worker (like myself) find peace and quiet. Do yourself a favor and buy these.

author: Jagdeep S Sandhu
title: Better than QC 35 II
content: I have 2 Bose noise canceling headsets. The sony one has better noise canceling than bose. I used both Sony and Bose. I do not like to fly, but when I do, I prefer Sony. Stay curious my friends...

author: Michael D. Lamberty
title: Definitely worth the money!
content: Pairing these with my phone was a breeze, once I read how to turn the headphones on. You have to hold the power button for 2 seconds. The Sony headphone app is easy to use and really helps you understand the different features these headphones have. I broke these in on a five hour flight and they rocked it! They are comfortable and don't weigh a lot. After 4 hours of use, I didn't even realize I was wearing them. The pads do get a little dingy from the oils of our skin though. However, they're user replaceable. The battery life is amazing about 5 hours total of use and the battery was still at 90%. Now onto the meat and potatoes... I fly a few times a year and my ears always hurt afterwards. These headphones did an amazing job cancelling out the noise from flying, my ears didn't hurt. Apparently there was a crying baby a few rows back. I didn't notice. One thing I did notice and is totally worth mentioning is the sound quality difference between wireless and wired. After a few hours of wireless listening to flac files from my phone, I decided to hook up the included headphone wire into my portal amp and dac. The wireless sound quality is decent and kind of muddy, even with playing with the eq. Once I was wired into the amp, the same song as before sounded considerably better. And the noise cancellation worked just as well wireless or wired. The included travel case is a big plus in my book as well. Overall, these are worth the price and a great solution to a noisy environment.

author: Altus van Tonder
title: Super satisfied
content: The touch interface on the headphone is very intuitive and easy to use. The sound is amazing! Very very happy

author: George

Now they start randomly going into the mute mode as if my hand is cupped over the right ear when its cold out, rendering them entirely useless outdoors when I want to wear them. I feel like i've purchased a 300 dollar pair of earmuffs!

author: moobycow

One of the better purchases I have ever made. I commute via subway, and the difference between these and lower cost noise cancelling headphones is night and day. I no longer miss portions of what I'm listening to as trains arrive.

Also the added windmill cancer protection really makes the cost/benefit a no brainer.

author: Raj

author: Don DeGooyer
title: Not great for working out in a gym setting.
content:
The sound is good, no question.  However, when I'm at the gym with a group of other people (wearing bluetooth headphones) working out in the area, I get a lot of Bluetooth interference.  I can't walk very far away from my phone without experiencing some interference.  If there is not many people in the area the Bluetooth works fine.  I say this because I had no issues ever with the JBL bluetooth headsets.  They were not noise cancelling though.

Furthermore, with respect to lifting, my shoulder hit the side of the headphones, often pausing the music.  Lastly, the headphones randomly shut off for no reason and I don't know why.  I would like to return these headphones because i need something less bulky, but missed the deadline to return them.

author: Arif Satria Wira Kusuma
title: Best Headphone
