Otro problema que tuve era al dar pausa y ponerme los audífonos en el cuello, el roce con mi ropa ponía play nuevamente sin darme cuenta. Valorarlo que otros audífonos con los controles de botones no darían el problema. Si no tienes problemas con este detalle son unos audífonos perfectos.

Excellent quality. The noise cancellation is spectacular! I used it on a flight from Costa Rica to Los Angeles and Los Angeles to Shanghai. It is spectacular. Actually it isolates external noise dramatically. The battery performance very well. I'm not sure if it lasts the 30 hours it promises, but I was able to make the outward flight without needing to charge the battery. The only BUT I have is the volume control. Being tactile, it is very easy for a touch to change the volume. Another problem I had was to pause and put the headphones on my neck, the touch with my clothes put play again without realizing. Evaluate that other headphones with the button controls would not give the problem. If you do not have problems with this detail they are perfect headphones

author: A. Wolf
title: Love headphones except for Alexa
content: I love these headphones except for one thing. I cannot get Alexa to work with these earphones. That is the only frustrating option that does not work.

author: Henzo Zee
title: Broken after 9 months use.
content: This is overall a very good headphone, good noise cancelling and user control. However after 9 months normal use the right frame is broken. I had to issue a repair request.

author: Eric Rubens
title: BEST combination of sound and comfort I've ever tried!
content:
I've taken these headphones on two international trips and have been blown away by the overall quality. Three things matter to me most when trying out headphones:
1) Sound - Rich and crisp sound across all genres. From rap to electronic to country, the WH1000XM3 appear to handle pushing both bass and treble. You can also fine tune the equalizer through a variety of presets or customize your own settings via the mobile app.
2) Comfort - BY FAR the most comfortable headphones I've ever used. Even a few hours into my flight, I could barely even tell they were on my head. I love listening to music as I try to fall asleep on long flights and the padding around the ears is so soft and comfortable it makes dozing off a breeze. They're also very compact and light compared to other competitor's noice cancelling headphones I've tried.
3) Noise cancellation - Whatever technology they've developed seems to be hands down the best on the market for noise cancellation. I thought the noise cancellation on my Sennheiser PXC 550 headphones were good but this is a whole next level. On top of that, you can control the degree of noise cancellation and also dictate directionally where the noise is coming from inside the mobile app for added performance.

Overall, the Sony WH1000XM3 headphones will be my new go to choice for my travels. The case design is sleek, the product performs amazingly, and the battery has lasted over multiple days of extended travel. Thanks Sony for making music a little bit more enjoyable for me!
Disclaimer: I was given this product for free in exchange for my honest review. The thoughts expressed here are my own from testing the product over the past couple weeks and are not influenced by the company in any way.

author: JRRivera
title: Pairing SUCKS for IOS
content:
Was so excited when I tried these on and heard the noise cancelling.

Now that I have them they are a total nightmare to pair with my apple IOS devices.

If you've got them paired to your phone you have to go into settings, disconnect, and then connect to your next device. If you don't nothing will work.

Worse, I spend more time trying to pair and re-pair with my computer. Almost never works.

No amount of noise cancelling could make up for this terrible user experience.

Contacted SONY ad their advice was to pair with only one device. So a four hundred dollar pair of headphones that only works with one device... What's the point?

If I were you I'd stick with the Bose QC-35 - they perform better.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Almost Perfect
content:
Before I bought these I had been using Bose QC35's and lived them, still do.

After seeing all the hype about the M3's I figured I would give them a go.

These headphones are great. The app is useful and easy to use and the sound is excellent. Noise cancellation is effective and practical.

The only thing I find myself missing from the QC35's is dual pairing. It's just a little annoying to have to go back and forth between my phone and tablet, but it's not a deal breaker.

Overall, these have taken the #1 spot in my bag for headphones on a daily basis and I would recommend them to anyone.

author: Brett Whalin
title: Awesome headset
content: I love the hand swipe features and how intelligent the headphones are. The sound quality is great too. My only gripe is the aux cord that came with it as a backup was a bit to rigid at the ends for its own good

author: amirigor
title: Love them
content: I love these... Even though I haven't gotten to use the often (I have a 2 month old that keeps me busy).

author: Kyle Ladrech
title: Regular Guy who Pays Close Attention to Audio Quality
content:
I have tested the Bose Quiet Comfort 35s, Bose 700s, Beats Studios, VModa Crossfade II Codex Editions, Sennheisers, Harman Kardons, and several other over-ear headphones in the $300-400 range. The Sonys have the edge in regard to sound quality. If you’re into diverse frequency music with a blend of bass and treble I can guarantee you they have the best sound on the market. I was impressed...going from a heavy pair of $400 VModas to this lightweight, almost cheap feeling pair, Sony absolutely stood out as more satisfying.

That aside, noise isolation is decent. Sony’s proprietary system crushes ambient sound and you’ll begin to wander how you ever lived with that horrific white noise in your life. But voices are still audible, they really only cancel out the humming and not all frequencies. Still one of the best on the market and a must-have, but the technology is obviously still in development.

The call quality is poor. I actually can’t use them for phone calls because I feel bad for the people on the other end. They sound like you’re using the speaker of your Nokia back in 2006, muddy and distant. Your friends will tell you it’s fine and it doesn’t bother them, but your real friends will tell you to turn them off immediately bc they would rather talk to themselves than deal with that. If you’re trying to weed out fake friends this may not be an issue.

In conclusion, if you need over ears for a desk job where you feel a little less like yourself every day these are your best options at this time. The over-ear market, however, is not impressive. If you care significantly about audio quality and don’t listen to music with noticeable levels of bass, go with Bose.

Don’t buy Beats over-ears or the new Powerbeats Pros. Do buy the Powerbeats 3 Wireless, they are the best in-ears on the market.

Don’t buy Bose in-ears. Don’t buy anything Harmon Kardon, Sennheiser, or VModa.

—Kyle Ladrech

author: Jorge
title: You will love them, buy it
content: I love you, where have you been all this time?

author: SDormann
title: Saved my husband
content: My husband's tinnitus had gotten so bad that flying was painful. These made our last two trips totally doable for him!

author: Justin g
title: Great in every way except...
content:
I love everything about these except 3 things:

1. Ears get hot when ANC is activated

2. When on a plane or in an environment where there’s a lot of noise, the ANC can make you a little bit nauseous or seem a bit unbalanced.

3. The usb-c cord they include for charging is comically small and can be annoying if you’re looking to charge them while out and about.

Otherwise, a fantastic pair of ANC headphones with great sound quality.

author: KRN
title: Best headphones.
content: I can't imagine better headphones. The sound is amazing. They are comfortable. The noise cancelling is such a relaxing addition to my NYC travels. It gets rid of all the stuff that hurts my ears, and leaves enough ambient for me to be safe and know when to listen. The battery life is AMAZING. Just so good. I'm pretty much going to stick with this for as long as they keep making them. It's renewed my love of music, walking, and being in the city.

author: Franklin Chernyakhovsky

author: anthony Rza
title: You cant go wrong with this Sony product they knocked it out the park on these wireless headphones
content: Phenomenal quality...sound ranges and complete noise canceling..wish they had more colors..like bronze or other colors

author: Amazon Customer
title: Lifechanging? Quite possibly.
content:
I have the dubious pleasure of being a software engineer who works in an open office - possibly one of the world's loudest. Imagine a room 30ft/20ft with 30 people in it, most of whom are on conference calls at their desks for most of the day. Now, make the room entirely out of hardwoods and glass, with hard, low ceilings, so sound echoes and is amplified. If, like me, you have focus issues, maintaining productivity can be a challenge.
For the past 4 months I've been making do with my Bose QC over-ear headphones. They were... OK, I guess, but terrible at cutting out voice, so any quiet bits of music, or gaps between tracks, and the conversations come blasting through. And I've never been particularly happy with the audio quality on these headphones. They "did the job", if barely.
But not any more. These Sony headphones are nothing short of miraculous. I can truly tune out my environment, without turning music up to hearing-damaging levels. On top of that, the sound quality (even with Bluetooth) is exceptional - better than the Bose by light-years. A rock-solid 5 stars on these puppies.

author: Hassan Ali
title: Great purchase
content: It’s a great purchase but the touch bottoms aren’t that great. I always accidentally click them. And you have to be very precise or you missclick  it

author: Víctor

content: Very quiet. Exceptional sound. Great blutooth connectivity. Only con is they turn off when unplugging aux cord

author: Amazon Customer
title: Awesome !
content: Love these!

author: Mark D. Kline
title: I still have the 1000X from 2016
content: Wanted to see what this version had.  Very pleased.  I do wish Sony would include Amazon Music in the selection field, so we can listen with the optional features.  The download folder you can't change which isn't great.  I took 1 - star off for that.  Reason you get head sets is to listen to your music collection.  I like that you can adjust the Noise Canceling feature.  My other headset will be for work, this one will be for travel.  Also glad they give a cord so we can connect it to the airplane audio system.  Wouldn't be able to watch movies when I travel without it..

author: Raven
title: Needs a more powerful built-in amp.
content:
Wish it had more volume. These at max volume aren't anywhere near what you would consider loud, rather are just comfortable volume.. which sounds good on paper, but in reality means you're running these headphones at 100% volume nearly all of the time, then if you have any songs with a quiet audio mix, you then wish these headphones had that little bit extra oomph..

So while the noise canceling is nice... for $349, I would have expected a better amp, so as a result I'll be returning these and just sticking with my normal headphones as the noise cancellation isn't worth the trade-off for loss in volume.

Sometimes instead of increasing or decreasing the volume, I finish playing the next song ...

author: Thomas
title: Changed my Life
content: Ever since I got these headphones, I can poop regularly. I think the extra noise that I used to hear made me stressed out unconsciously and I'm so much less stressed out. There is incredible depth to the sound of these headphones. I fell asleep with these headphones on, and I never do this because I'm so particular about the noise around me. It's easier for me to focus on work now. This is a serious quality of life change.

author: Frank beckwith
title: Sony's. Beat out Bose
content: I bought the bose first and returned them because of quality and performance.these sonys are better in every way possible

author: David
title: Best ANC on market, amazing sound, two key issues forced my return after a week...
content:
I really was impressed by the depth of the silence on these when at work and using ANC without music. Absolutely stunning. They sound great too, and are very comfortable. Not to mention the tech features... clearly best in class.

first issue - After a few days, the headphones would make the windy static noise in the right ear after being on for about an hour. This sound would flip to my left ear when turning XM3s around. It bothered me as you can literally feel the wind in your eardrum and it is uncomfortable, like its a bad artifact in the white noise. Weird...

second issue - The LDAC will stutter when set to LDAC output and High Quality 990Kb on Samsung S10. I am not sure if it's the phone's output, or the headphones DAC, or whatever...you must put it to 660Kb to work well. The app auto forces its back to 990Kb if you open the app, and your music starts skipping again...so that sucks. not exactly how you want to manage your Bluetooth speaker party...:(

author: mr s w cuthbert
title: Infinatly better than bose
content:
Love these headphones. I had the bose qc25 and the noise canceling was good and the sound quality was fair but these Sony headphones are amazing.
Noise canceling is better at all frequencies from the deep rumble of an engine to the high shreak of a baby crying.
My bose qc25 had a metallic high and mids lacked realism.
The Sony has crisp clean highs and a clean mid. Combined with an extended but not boomy bass, it made listening enjoyable without listening fatigue.
Although not true hi-fi, sound quality is better than the bose and is close enough to give me goosebumps on my favorite songs.

author: Grace M

author: Amazon Customer
title: Well done Sony
content:
I bought these headphones for a long haul flight and honestly it is not cheap but made my trip so much more enjoyable! Used it many times since, without complaints.
 I have big ears and headphones were always uncomfortable for me but this one actually goes over ear and I could wear it literally for 10 hours straight, no discomfort. And it looks so nice too (I bought the silver one).
It is cancelling noise pretty well, and not only airplanes: my husband plays guitar pretty loud and this baby blocked it all - not by itself but while listening to music, however that’s still better than any other headphone I’ve ever tried.
The sound quality still amazes me and the options to choose from are so cool, I like the live stage one most. I had no idea the music I was listening to in my car had so many layers until I heard it on these.
So, it’s pricey, yes. But it’s like business class, once you know how much better it is you won’t want to go back to your cheap earphones...

author: Pranav
title: Out of the world noise cancellation headphones
content:
I heard so much about Sony noise cancellation superiority when compared to it peers and I finally got hold of this beauty. I can’t hear the loud screeching sound by my air conditioner anymore with this headphone. The outside noise cancels by 70% without any music and with music you will be in a different world.

There is adaptive sound control which is helpful to cater noise cancellation based on your surrounding. You could position from where the the sound flows to your ears.

The headphones fit so apt over your ears and I wore it 6 hours straight without our any discomfort.

I got the product delivered to my Hub in great shape and it was delivered in 30 hrs of purchase. Thank you Amazon for superb delivery.

Overall it is a great purchase!

author: Anthony
title: Good headphones
content: I like the headphones but the first time that I ordered this they sent me a defective pair and I had to wait longer to use these headphones.

author: Teddy F.
title: I want to love these but..I can't
content:
Like many of you, I was looking for a great pair of wireless headphones which essentially boils down to these or the Bose QuietComfort 35s.

I will start off by saying the sound on these is incredible and easily better than the Bose. There is absolutely no contest in that area. These are a 10/10 while the Bose are approximately 7.5/10. The sound on the Bose isn't bad but for the price, they offer a far less impressive sound profile than the Sonys. Everything sounds great on the Sony while the Bose couldn't handle certain genres as well (bass heavy electronic music for example).

Now that that's out of the way, the reason why I will be returning these and keeping the Bose is because of the comfort level. As a software engineer, I needed a pair of headphones that I could COMFORTABLY wear all day and the Sonys simply do not live up to that task. After approximately 90 minutes, I start to feel a light pain on the top of my head from the clamping of the headphones and my ears start to feel warm which is extremely uncomfortable. I am then forced to remove them to reduce the fatigue before I can put them back on.

The Bose on the other hand I can wear seemingly endlessly without any discomfort.

I wish there was a pair I could buy that were a 10/10 in both sound AND comfort but for now, the Bose win.

author: Krzysztof Smagowicz
title: Even best sounding headphones are worthless if uncomfortable
content: I made a mistake of keeping those instead of Bose qc2. Shure they sound very good (albeit bass heavy) and have a lot of features, but after an hour of using you wanna take them off. I don't think I have that big ears really. Bose headphones are way more comfortable and roomy and can't really complain on music quality.

author: Brian Jensen
title: It's like a hug for your ears
content: 10/10 meme review

author: Linda
title: A bit disappointed, but overall happy!
content: Hate to admit that I'm a bit disappointed, but my issues with my m3(s?) are nothing worth returning them in my opinion. I mainly got these headphones because I heard the ANC and sound were amazing and they certainly are. As the phone quality, I must admit to a moment of stupidity on my own part. My first few calls with the m3s was what I was sort of expecting, due to multiple reports, bad. Then I find out I had the headphones on backwards, the right on my left ear and the left on my right ear. My call after correcting this? The person on the other end could hear me loud and clear. I do hear an echo of my voice, like I'm using a mic, but I can deal with it. My issues are that the headphones keep sliding off my head when I lay down or get up, I feel a bit of clamping(?) around my head, and I just had a problem connecting during a thunderstorm. Toodles!

author: Gamer's Wife
title: Relaxing
content: Transports me out if the day to day stress.

author: Arthur K. Heisenmenn
title: Completely different sound, WOW
content:
These are awesome. Picked them over the HD1 and so far I'm glad I did. The noise cancelling is amazing, I can't even hear my mechanical keyboard (its loud) typing this and barley hear myself swallow. This is my first pair of high quality headphones (coming from a pair of 30$ Sennheisers) and I'm blown away. If you want to hear music like it was meant to be heard, grab yourself a pair of these. I listen to basically every type of music, from country, rock, rap and EDM; everything sounds good through these cans. I can't get over the noise cancelling, I could probably use these on a gun range and it would muffle pistol shots.

They are incredibly comfy. Had them on for 2 hours so far this morning and I barley notice they are there. I have TMJ (jaw problems) and these don't bother my face at all.

Bluetooth pairing to my phone is the fastest I've ever seen it connect to something. I turn them on and as soon as I do I get the connected to Bluetooth message, which is awesome. No fiddling with settings or anything, it just works fast. Bluetooth on my laptop doesn't sound as good as on the android, likely due to Sonys LDAC support in newer android versions.

Comes with a cord to attach to a regular 3.5mm jack, used it on my PC to play some FLAC files I have and they sound even better than the LDAC Bluetooth, which itself is amazing.

As far as the warranty goes, make sure you buy the extra one, but NOT FROM AMAZON! The one on the amazon page only covers the speakers, not if your headphones snaps, which seems to be a problem with some Sony headphones. I actually got in contact with Amazon support and they got me in touch with Square Trade warranty. 3 years for $75.99 and it covers the headphones as long as they aren't lost/stolen. I already spent 300 on the headphones, so whats another 70-80 bucks to make sure they last at least a few years.

author: MP
title: Definitely Bose beaters on sound and noise cancellation
content: They are Bose beaters. Very comfortable and the larger driver sound is clear. Sony is clearly committed to winning. GREAT noise cancellation tio

Sound quality is excellent. Noise cancelling works great. Can't say enough good things about them.  Build quality, carrying case, etc.  Work seamlessly right out of the box.

content:
I have a Huawei phone and had to reset all of my Bluetooth settings to fully enjoy these---huawei has a known Bluetooth profile issue.

After that was done I'd share that active noise cancelling has changed my urban commute.  I no longer have to hear conversations on the bus, arguing on the train, loud conversations in the street,etc.  I have the ability to reach a sound profile that eliminates or masks most sounds around me.  I love the ability to reduce traffic noise while still being safe.

 Sure there are other headphones that will exceeded and headphones.  There is a but---if you live in loud urban environments it can be nearly impossible to find the combination or portable, good audio, and noise isolation.

I only wish the settings weren't completely on an app...other than that? I've no negatives.

author: Jamie Barrett

author: A. Storfer
title: The stuff the other reviews don't tell you
content: Just received these today...tested for a few hours on a range of music- from classical to jazz to hip hop, pop and classic rock. I am a bit of a headphone junkie and have had several pairs of Sennheisers (HD1, PXC550), Bose QC 25, QC 35, Parrot Zik 2 and 3, VModa Crossfade, Crossfade 2 wireless, Zn etc. Most of the positive reviews of these headphones are completely on point. Phenomenal noise cancellation. Great sound detail (I could hear people taking their foot off the piano pedals during Jazz songs such as Frank Morgan's Lullaby or the snare drum rattling from Barry Oakley's bass in Allman Brothers live at Fillmore east or Adele taking breaths between long notes) - HOWEVER, these headphones are so bass rich that it overwhelms the rest of the sound frequencies. If you're a bass-head, these are definitely for you. But, if you like a neutral soundstage, you will probably find this annoying. The good news is that on the app at least, there is a "clearbass" setting on the EQ that can be dialed down. However, they still overemphasize bass and I haven't figured out how to dial it down when connected to my laptop. Two other annoying things - while largely comfortable, I found the headband dug into the top of my head a bit and my ears got hot after an hour of listening. Second annoying thing - these things are HUGE when on (and I believe I have a normal size head). They look kind of dorky. If you want to look cool in your headphones, these are also probably not for you. However, if you're my age and care less about coolness than sound quality and noise cancellation, it matters much less (but still matters a bit). Anyway, just thought I'd share these thoughts with you. Thus the 4 star rating instead of 5. I'm out...

author: Thomas
title: Great noise canceling. Bad design...
content:
The noise canceling is fantastic... but... there is a serious design flaw both sides have cracked after a month of use. Although sony has replaced the product with one phone call and showing proof. Unfortunately I noticed the damage 1 day after Amazon's return policy, so I'm stuck with them. If it was within the return window I would have returned them and purchased a a different brand. Now I just have to treat them as if they were made of glass.
Main reason for choosing these over a different brand was because the charging port is USB-C which makes it easier  when traveling instead of bringing multiple wires with you. Another downfall is that they can only be paired to 1 device at a time. So if u want to use them on a different device it has to be unpaired and repaired.

author: Anonymous Identity
title: Amazing Headphones but not great for GYM ADDICTS
content: These headphones have phenomenal sound quality, noise cancellation, and comfort. However, they completely slip off when you start sweating at the GYM and I do not feel comfortable with having $300 headphones slip off and fall down. While, they may be great - do not purchase these if you exercise vigorously. I am sure they would be fine for a light jog or biking, but when it comes to weight lifting, HITT, or basketball, these definitely slip off. Some people say you can buy ear covers to help mitigate this issue, but I  was not able to find any success.

author: YUCHI LIU
title: Using it on all my business trip
content: I thing it's a bang for the money, better than Bose. I only find the volume control difficult to master.

author: lonewolfmtn
title: Disappointed in Sony and the paid reviewer hype
content: All he 'pro' reviewers gushed over these.  Low standards.  Not comfortable for long sessions, Mud/weak bass response..  Weak presence.  Noise Cancellation is not what I expected . App will not run from a laptop,  Controls do not function when connect via audio cable.  Phone app install process is obscene (make you install a 3rd party app first, then Google play  - then Headphone Connect - all of which is totally not necessary in today's world  - this should be a stand alone app with a single install- but no!  Can't even tell if/when it will work/be usable.  All of which could be overlooked BUT for the relatively poor fidelity.  Not pleased given the price.  Too many gimmicks (that sort-of-maybe work) and not enough attention given to sound quality. Down-graded to 2 stars because the bluetooth connection drops out way too often even at 2-3 ft away. VERY not impressed.

author: Jeffrey
title: Can't co-sign on these. Touch controls are horrible
content:
First, I love the battery life and the type c charging. The sound is good. The mic, not so much it has some static.
The build quality feels cheap, lots of plastic. I prefer the QC35 II in this department.
I knew it only could pair to one device at a time, but didn't realize how annoying that would be.
My main gripe with these though, and are a deal breaker is the buttons and touch control.
First, the two buttons on the left cup are very small and thin. Hard to find straight away as they aren't very tactile. One uses either Google Assistant or ambient level changer. The other button is the power button. Bose does this a lot better in my opinion.

Finally, the touch controls on the right cup are just garbage. It takes multiple taps to pause or play. The sliding gestures are a bit more reliable like volume and next track. The most reliable is the palm over ear to lower volume and allow ambient sound.

All Bose has to do is improve noise cancelling, sound a bit and add type c on their next iteration and I'll give them my dollars.

author: Chris
title: Cold weather and Wind turns these into expensive earmuffs
content: Sound and look great, I live in nyc and the right earcup stops working when outside on the cold, solution is to turn off the headphones and back on....really??? Do better Sony. Noise canceling is good but even on full Cancelling mode can still hear voices ugggggh, and the touch control once again when outside you have to keep swiping up, down, left or right for several tries before it does what you want...For $350 dollars these are a waste....Amazon take them off your site until Sony comes up with something better or else you will get alot of returns (As I Am Doing)....

author: SportsFan1109
title: Great
content: Moved from QC35 IIs, and I'm glad I did. Sound quality is a bit better, noise cancellation and comfort about the same. 30 hour battery life is the big difference.

author: Sanjay Tyagi
title: Great headphones, but fraught with issues after some use.
content:
The headphones offer better noice cancelling compared to the Bose QC35, but the app is clunky to use and I really miss being able to connect multiple devices at once and switching the audio between each device seamlessly.
Also, after using them for a couple of months, I'm having issues with the audio sticking and skipping- usually this is resolved by rebooting the headphones, but it's not something I would expect in such a highly priced branded item.
The sound is good, but I'm no audiophile.

Overall, I would say I'm not really impressed by these and would love to see what bose brings to the table with their next release.

author: Daniel Leone
title: Love them
content: Sony finally best out boss.

author: Diego
title: Great pair of headphones
content: I've had a couple of other NC headphones and they would hurt my ears. These headphones don't. Built quality is great and they feel great over the ear.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Just Amazing
content: I was between the CQ35's and these. Have been a Bose fan for years (still am) but just couldnt pass up the sound these produce. If you're looking for a more mellow flat sound go with the QC35's. These have a bit of bass but easy enough to get them close to the mellow flat sound of a Bose (again all about taste and what you're looking for here). If youre looking for a more home theater alternative these are your headphones. Bought them to block out some noisy neighbors when I'm watching movies or playing games and given that I can no longer hear my footsteps or 3D printer on top of the neighbors I'd say they over delivered in the best way. Hands down would recommend to anyone.
