author: Kennia
title: Great headphones - ANC could be better
content:
I was debating between these and the Bose QC 35 II. After reading reviews, seeing video comparisons and finally trying both I can say the Sony's have unique features that the Bose won't and vice versa, such as the Sony's have better sound, better mobile app and sound customization and personally, design.

Bose's ANC in my opinion is superior as well as how comfortable they are but sound isn't good. Price also doesn't change that often so you'll be paying a bit more for those.

author: MASS
title: Quality
content: Great

author: Sean D
title: Great sounding headphones
content: Very impressed with these expensive headphones. Sound is great, as well as battery life. They feel really nice too. I like the ability to go wireless or wired with these. I'd recommend this product.

author: Sherry Murphy
title: Fantastic sound and very comfortable
content: Excellent product. So comfortable and excellent sound quality. Highly recommend this product.

author: Paul
title: Peace in the heart of the city.
content: These are a life-saver amidst an ocean of distracting ambient noise.

author: Matt
title: GREAT SOUND!, but App update missing, and phone calls won't work
content: Hello everyone - these are great headphones. Now, a big feature of them is the APP which can't connect with the device, because of a missing/unavailable update.  Besides that, I can't take phone calls with them - people can't hear me. Something wrong with the microphone? Or with the software? A little lost and disappointed about that.

author: M. Merchut
title: Guess again if you don’t think noise cancellation is important.
content: Phenomenal performance overall. Battery life is superb. Control settings with the headphone connect app. make fine adjustments a breeze and effective. I enjoy different types of music and apply the custom EQ settings and sometimes the “Arena” or “club” effect, depending on the genre/song. This allows new ways to experience a song in a simple (and fun) way. The ability to drown out exterior noise with noise cancellation really allows an enjoyable acoustical experience no matter what environment you’re in.

author: SC
title: Great noise canceling quality
content: These are great all around head phones. My only grumble is that they seem to occasionally check out of noise canceling mode.

author: Julius Tucker
title: Whoa!
content: Goodness me if buy it again.

author: EKO
title: Terrible sound! If you care about MUSIC, buy an earlier model (e.g. XM2). Had to return them.
content:
A first for me. I have these Sony headphones: MDR-1000X, WH-1000XM2,WI-1000X, BC-WF1000X, as well as a couple of their WIRED ANC phones. This one SOUNDS the worst - by far!

(I suspect they had been returned to "Amazon Warehouse" for that very reason. "Inspected" sticker means they work, but haven't been evaluated for quality)

Here's what I can't live with. The overall sound quality. They sound bad. Legitimately bad. I honestly do not know what all the reviewers are talking about. The increased bass response is completely unnatural. Good bass does not make itself known, it's just a natural extension of the sound. Instead, it's readily apparent that the bass is cranked up. I can mostly live with that unless it takes away from the rest of the presentation. Going back and forth for a full day with the XM2's, I can definitively say my XM3 unit sounded muddy, muddled, and lacking crispness. The difference was astounding. I keep the response curve flat and leave on the default settings including the high quality stream. I'm using Google Music on a Pixel 2XL as my source. The highs lose their definition and edge. Things that should be clear, crisp, sound like they are coming through fabric or drywall or something. Going back to the XM2, they were far tighter and clear. The XM3 does soften the hard edges of older recordings. My albums by The Monkees sound better with the high treble softened, but on modern music, it's frustrating to try to hear the edge of sounds that now just blend like mush into the mid bass.

I had a co-worker do a blind test. After 20 seconds with the XM3's, he declared they sound terrible. He confirmed what I had been feeling and told me to keep the XM2's.

Maybe I had a bad unit. When I tested the floor model of the XM2's a few months ago it sounded like garbage but the reviews were so good I took a chance. My home unit sound way way way better. So with the stellar reviews of the XM3's I figured it was a safe buy. I am incredibly disappointed. I really really really really really wanted to like these. I really did. But reading gleeful claims that they have a "laid back" sound while comparing to the more "lively" B&W PX headphones is a joke. If "laid back" means lacks definition and accurate energy... then okay, they are super laid back. I want it to sound right. I want guitars to have that edge. Vocals to sound present, not behind a veil. Bass to have quick response, not lingering mud. These sound like they have a standing wave in the midbass.

As a side note: I've never gotten the NFC pairing to work on with the XM2 or XM3.

It seems I'm in the minority. But reading other reviews I see people talking about how similar the sound quality is between the XM2 and XM3. Not for me. Vastly different. I'll miss the greater sound stage, but I'll easily pick a more accurate sound than the mud.

author: R. Schein
title: Good music sound ... okay comfortable
content: Takes some adjusting on the ears for comfort.  Depending on mode cuts off noise cancellation suddenly.

author: ahmed mahmoud
title: Fantastic headphone
content: All is awsome

author: Ozan Emre ARAS
title: Amazing NC!
content: The design is strikingly good and the build quality is just excellent. The NC though is just otherworldly! I have used this in many places with a static background sound and my only complain can be that you get used to be in a very silent environment, taking headphones off is just heartbreaking! LOL!

author: Bill S.
title: very warm
content: We took these to Alaska  for the winter glacier trip and they kept our ears very toasty. Make sure you charge them before you go. They offer great protection against frostbite of the ears. I walked around in the snow and experienced the quiet of the snowstorm in a way that I've never perceived it before.  i guess knowing that you are safe and warm lets you connect with nature in a way you can't when your ear flaps are numb and the blood in them is starting to freeze. Easy to tuck these in under a warm cap.

author: ENES
title: Perfect product
content: I received the item and it was great condition, without and problem l received product.

author: Evigilant
title: Good headphones
content: Good headphones

author: B. Flanagan
title: Music sounds great, horrible call quality
content:
I've owned a number of wired headphones, from Bose and Sennheiser to previous Sony models. I have the Bose Quiet Comfort 35 II, which is the most direct comparison to this unit. The music on the Bose headset sounds very good, but lacks brightness, and there are no EQ modifications that you can make. On the Sony, the music sounds better, and you do have the equalization. Sony also has soundfield adaptation, so that the noise canceling is adjusted depending on where you are and what you are doing – sitting quietly, in a crowded public space, on a train. But to me, those simply add unnecessary complexity. And on a phone call, they are quality killers.

Immediately after I purchased these and started using them, I would get complaints from people when I was talking to them on the phone. At first, I brushed these off (I'm hiking in the woods, how good do you expect it to be?). But then, it was happening in my house, all alone. I tested it by calling myself and leaving messages, rather long ones, using both the Sony and the Bose. The call quality difference was startling. The Bose was clear, the Sony was muddled.

I waited until there was a firmware update, as I thought perhaps Sony engineers would be able to fix it. Alas, the update came, and all it does is add support for Alexa.

The other area of criticism I have is the touch controls. They work, but only intermittently. I probably look like a moron, wiping my finger on the right headphone back, forth, up, down. I've taken to using the phone to skip songs and adjust volume.

At $250 this would be a great set of headphones for just listening to music, and ignoring call quality and problems with controls. At $350, it's overpriced.

author: John
title: Broken after four months
content: This is ridiculous. They didn't even last half a year. Buy something else. The left ear cup cuts out and does not work. For $350 I expect better. Sony also makes warranty support ridiculously hard online, hopefully calling them yields better results.

author: Brandon S
title: First Noise Cancelling Headphones
content: This is my first time purchasing noise cancelling headphones and let me start by saying I am blown away by the Sony XM3's. The sound quality is top notch and I have absolutely no clue how the technology does what it does. I have a Dyson V6 animal and I could not hear it while vacuuming with the XM3's on. They were very easy to synch up to my phone and are very comfortable to wear for long periods. I just spent about 4 hours listening to NFL games over the weekend via the sirius app. Don't get me wrong at $350 these are an investment but if you can afford them they are well worth the money. Can't wait to take a long plane trip with them.

author: Rashomr
title: Noise cancellation level crazy
content: It sounds good and the real purpose of it is the noise cancellation which works perfectly

author: Jim.Moor
title: Almost perfect
content:
Wonderful.
Most people will find these PERFECT.

However, wish the ear cushions kept the speaker from touching my ears. Annoys me, keeping but contacting Sony.

author: Daniel
title: Not without flaws
content:
There are definitely some things about these headphones that make them less than ideal:

1. You cannot charge them and use them at the same time.
2. You cannot listen to them over USB-C.
3. You can use them wired, but the included cable doesn't have a wire for the mic. So you cannot use them wired, for example, for a phone call.
4. When using them wired, you cannot use any of the controls for play/pause or skip. This is technically possible, but was not implemented.
5. Configuring from the mobile app doesn't always stick. Sometimes you have to configure the same setting a second time the next time you use the headphones.
6. When changing between noise canceling, ambient, and no ambient control, there is a voice that announces what the setting it, and there is no option to turn this off.
7. Only includes a USB type-A (the old, rectangular style) to USB-C cable for charging. (No USB-C to USB-C cable included.)
8. The included charging cable is about 6 inches long.

My quest for the perfect headphones continues.

author: Nestor F.
title: The king is here.
content: Best headphones that I've tried. Excellent noise cancelling, even when it is off. Bye bye Bose, Sennheiser, B&W, etc. The king is here.

author: Richard g.
title: A real competitor to bose.
content: The sound quality is fantastic. It is better than being there. I like the multiple settings for ambient noise control based on activity. Its muting ability by putting a hand up to the ear is a great concept. The noise cancelling feature is very good but does not totally mitigate all background noise 100%

author: Jmp32
title: Awesome noise cancelling wireless headphones
content: These are fantastic!

author: lakshan
title: superbly...
content: Noise cancelling & sound quality is best

author: srujan
title: Comfort, best noise canceling
content: Comfort, best noise canceling

author: Thomas Neilson
title: Excellent Bluetooth Headphones
content: Amazing sound. Wow!  The Bluetooth works well and so does the noise reduction. These headphones paired easily with my iPhone and my Samsung TV.

author: stmaddy
title: Really cool!  Worth the price
content:
The sound quality is amazing.  The best I've ever had.  And wow!  The noise cancellation feature is impressive.  I have never had this level of noise cancellation with other brands.
There is a cool app that you can use to customize your listening experience....it truly makes a huge difference(like concert, club, arena modes..and others like the distance of the sound from your ear.  I still like the standard setting the best.  I love the touch to move forward or back.  You can also place hand over one side to make the noise cancellation turn off so you can have a conversation.  You can voice control with Alexa.  The headphones are comfortable to wear for long periods of time.  My teenage son mostly wears them while sitting so I don't know how well they stay on while on the go.

author: Francisco Trigo
title: Amazing sound quality and noise cancellation, but pricey
content: Great sound quality although the bass gets a bit too punchy sometimes when at the highest setting (don’t suggest going over +6 in the app). EXTREMELY good noise cancellation unless you’re riding in a bumpy car or experiencing pressure changes like a subway train.

author: Matt
title: Hands down the best Noise Cancelling Headphones ever produced
content:
I have owned numerous noise cancelling and regular headphones from all major brands ( I did work for the parent company of Harman Kardon, JBL and AKG). I fly a lot for work and have tried about all versions of HK,  Bose, JBL, AKG and Audio Acoustica. On ear, In Ear, active, passive cancellation. You name it. I have drawers full of headphones.
These Sony headphones beat all of them. The ANC is the best I have experienced, its almost too good and reminds me of stepping into the anechoic chamber at JBL which is a completely silent room with no echo.  The audio quality is extremely precise with a huge sound stage, but as others pointed out a bit bass heavy. Easy to correct with the very well designed app.
I picked the grey/silver edition being bald / blond they don't look so out of place ;-)  They fit well on my large head and have just the right amount of pressure to be snug but comfortable.
Lightweight and 30 hours of play time! They feel so well build, the cushions and headband are soft and supple.
As I type this I can not hear my typing noise, I can not hear closing a door. Its just about every external noise is erased from my world. Other headphones struggle with higher frequencies and voices. These bring you silence and bliss.
Very much highly recommended, despite the premium price. Can't find anything better at this time.

author: Dessicon
title: Sony WH-1000 XM3
content: These sound awesome!

author: RUNE
title: I have to stop trusting reviewers.
content:
Bought these because of the reviews and curiosity. Major disappointment.

Honestly the sound is muddy and the bass is unnatural. The poor excuse for an app is a total joke. I’ve no idea why they think we want some of the features, just give us the best possible sound quality, who cares about crap like sound stage positioning and fake reverb, etc.

I have the Bose qc35s for noise cancelling and travel cans, and have never loved them. However, compared to this they actually shine. They suffer from the Bose Sound but I’ve gotten used to them for travelling.

First thing I did when I got them was update the firmware. 40 minutes (!) later I was able to listen to music on these and eventually settled on EQ settings that are “acceptable” (-1,+1,+2,+3 and “clear bass” -2).

My references are Audeze and Etymotic Research and while I don’t expect that kind of quality, I would expect much more than this.

These are probably going back.

Edit: Returned them.

author: Seph 1
title: Bose killer!
content: Bose killer!

author: sadhan
title: Great headset
content: Sound was so amazing

author: Awesomeness_is_the_key
title: Top of the line.
content: performed better than expected, great quality

author: Randy Rodz
title: Awesomely good!
content: Sony at it's best! Sony has been the best in regard of Music quality sound, I'm amazed at the beauty of the sound on this headphones,  I love them.

author: javier gray
title: Wrong product
content: The product i received is not wh1000xm3 is wh1000xm2

author: Kelsey
title: Bluetooth malfunction
content: products bluetooth stopped working after a month, very displeased with the headphones

author: Vannyc
title: Better than Bose QC35II? You can't be serious.
content:
Honestly, I didn't need to get these headphones, as I've been a satisfied owner of the Bose QC35II for a while now. But I'd heard so many glowing reviews about the Sony ("NC function blows Bose out of the water," "Sony is the state of the art," etc.), that I thought I had to get it. I figured I'd give the Bose to my spouse who's been wanting a pair of NC headphones. I ended up giving up the Sonys.

First, and this is a really really key point for me, the Sonys are UNCOMFORTABLE compared with the Bose. The Bose earpads are deeper and the driver surface is more recessed than the Sony earpads. The result is that unless you have petite ears you feel the driver surface on your ears. My ears got sweaty after a short while.

Soundwise? Not bad... but not really better than the Bose. And the swipe volume control really really necessary?? Give me an up-down click function anytime.

Bottom line: I'm writing this so that any Bose owners out there who are thinking they should upgrade to the Sonys because of all the (exagerrated) hoopla... DON'T.

author: richard baxter
title: Nice product at fair price.
content: After reading on-line reviews I shopped for the best price and bought it.  Very nice product.  A little complex (for me) to set up pairing to my phone but did accomplish.  If I can......anyone can.  Nice!

author: Rich
title: OMG these things are great!!!!!!
content:
I am someone who never buys top of the line things like this, but I own and live in a side by side duplex and needed something so they can not hear me and also to block out so I do not hear them.

All I can say is WOW these are AMAZING.  I am not an audiophile and going to compare this to others or go into what if and what is and all that.  From a normal persons perspective, just WOW amazing sound quality.

The noise reduction is simply unbelievable.  I turned on a double window fan, a 16" fan on a stand and a big floor size air purifier all in the same room and with these on could not hear anything.  Take them off and it is like I am in a wind tunnel and can't even hear the normal TV.

The sound quality can be adjusted with their app and after I adjusted it to how "I" like my sound, you just stand there in AWE as it is so quality.  I know the price is a lot, but these 100x exceeded what I expected.  Just WOW.

author: mkaicher
title: Everything you need to know...
content:
I recently discovered the importance of owning a top-quality set of wireless noise-cancelling headphones after moving to New York City last fall. Walking the streets and riding the subway day in and day out becomes an altogether different experience when you can escape into your own world of music, audiobooks, or even just the relative silence offered by ANC headphones. Before purchasing the 1000XM3s, I had some junky wireless earbuds that, at the time, I thought sounded pretty good. I was WRONG! Compared to the 1000XM3s, I might as well have had a pair of tin cans strapped to my head.

If you are reading this review and are seriously considering these headphones, then you have likely read other reviews and already know they are in the top of their class in terms of sound quality. I had planned to use them primarily during my commutes but have since found myself wearing them throughout the day. I have rediscovered my music collection, am hearing things I’ve never heard before, blah blah blah…all those wonderful things people say after switching to some expensive speakers/headphones. But it’s true, they sound GOOD! As you’ve probably also already heard, they do not have a perfectly flat response. They are a slightly bass-heavy, which is fine, even preferably for most of what I listen too.

If the bottom-heavy response is holding you back, the Sony Headphones app offers adjustable EQ with factory and customizable user presets. Additionally, you can select multiple “surround” settings as well as sound position controls, neither of which are very useful in my opinion. More important to me was the LDAC and Aptx-HD codec support. I’ll admit, it took me a couple days to figure out how to get these things to run LDAC with my Samsung Note 8, however, once I got it working, I absolutely noticed improved quality over the default SBC codec. Unfortunately, using LDAC requires operating in “priority on sound quality” mode which disables the surround, position, and equalizer functions. Fortunately for me, I am not particularly interested in these options anyway. At least these things support high quality codecs in the first place, unlike Bose.

You know what else Bose headphones don’t have? USB type-C! While this was initially not a major selling point for me, after using them every day, I am grateful for the faster charging of the type-C format. A ten-minute charge (or less) almost always gets me back to 100%. Not that I really need it. These headphones last FOREVER. The longest I have continuously used them was about 8 hours (with ANC on). Afterwards, I tapped the power button and the sexy Sony woman voice said, “about 70% battery remaining”. Extrapolating from that, the advertised 30-hour battery life seems accurate.

Noise-cancelling is great! I don’t know what else to say. It’s not 100%. Obnoxiously loud people will still be faintly audible, but otherwise, pretty much all of the outside world is effectively cancelled out. I have not tried Bose ANC headphones or previous Sony models, but basically all reviewers say that the 1000-XM3s are the best on the market and I have no reason to believe otherwise. Also note, the Headphones app allows for customizable levels of noise-cancelling. There is an adaptive noise-cancelling feature which will adjust this setting after automatically detecting whether your are sitting, walking, running, or in transit. I have chosen to disable this as I prefer full noise cancelling 100% of the time. But I do see the value in this feature. Hopefully I won’t unknowingly walk out in front of a bus.

I basically love everything about these headphones. Even the hard case feels luxurious and is literally as compact and thin as they could have possibly made it – an important feature for those of us who carry bags around all day with limited space! My only complaint is that they do not support multiple simultaneous Bluetooth connections, that is, I cannot connect my laptop and phone at the same time - a minor issue considering it takes only 10 seconds to manually switch between devices.

Anyway, I hope this review will be helpful to those on the fence. I spent days researching these damn things before pulling the trigger. They aren’t cheap for good reason; some serious top-notch engineering went into these headphones. You will not be disappointed!

author: Mozart
title: Excellent Headphones with some minor drawbacks
content: These are great: lightweight, very good noise cancellation, comfortable, excellent battery, fantastic controls and great fidelity. Worth the investment for my daily commute and even during work hours. The drawbacks are minor but worth noting: double tapping to play doesn't always work (pause works flawlessly), popping sounds during bumpy bus rides are annoying (probably not fast enough to cancel effectively), and noise reduction is not 100% and is not very good for voices.

author: Anubis
title: GOOD PURCHASE
content: Exactly what I want

author: Daniel
title: Good product
content:
My Bose QuietComfort 20 Acoustic Noise Cancelling headphone broke, the right earbud  separated which generate whistling noise even  if I glue it back, very disappointing.  Also I got tinnitus recently, I heard the in the ear headphone can cause it, that's why I want to switch to the over the ear headphone.

Lots of reviews praised the Sony WH1000XM3, but there are lots of criticisms about the call quality, the first thing I did when I got this device was to test the call quality, I am happy to report that it performs very well with Samsung S8+ cell phone.  I tried to call out and received calls in the quite room or a room full of noises, the other end(wife) said she can hear my voice clearly, although sounded a little far compare to the the cell phone, when I connect the headphone with the cell phone with the supplied audio cable, my wife the quality is the same as the talking to the cell phone directly.  The same tests were performed after I updated with the latest firmware, and still good.

The noise cancellation and control etc. are excellent, the only thing I am not satisfied is there is no blue tooth connection priority list configuration.  Yes you are pair this headphone with multiple blue tooth sources, but it only reconnects to the last connection, ideally if the app on phone can provide a configuration page to specify the connection priority is first computer then phone, and when I walk in the office and turn on the laptop, it should switch the connection from my phone to my laptop, and when I turn off my laptop it should switch back to the phone.

author: MJM
title: Tight and Hot. Otherwise sound incredible.
content: Love everything about these headpones EXCEPT they feel tight and hot.  Sent back going to wait for the next Gen Bose. (? QC 45) I need headphones I can wear all day.

author: Andrew
title: Best Noise Canceling, Hands-Down. Still Pricey
content: The sound canceling technology in these puppies is literal magic. It’s hard for my brain to comprehend how such a thing is even possible. They are also remarkably comfy. I decided not to keep them simply because of the price compared to the sound quality. They are almost as expensive as my Bang Olufsen H9s, with truly much flatter sound in comparison. At this price point there are better sound quality offerings. I would still highly recommend these headphones if noise cancellation and long battery life are your primary reasons for purchase.

author: Honest P
title: Awesome headphones
content: Outstanding Overall. Favorite headphones ever. Ridiculously comfortable and excellent batter life and works well with iPhone. Also the app allows you to tune them for every environment and it’s so easy to do. These are fantastic and worthy of the price

author: JM
title: Headphones mess up ALL the time
content:
For $350, these headphones are not up to snuff. The touch controls screw up all the time, with the headphones phantom activating Siri or listen in. This can only be fixed by turning the headphones off and on, but sometimes I can't even get them to turn off without plugging them in. The problem seems to be the worst in cold or wind, but it happens inside, too.

Google this problem, and you'll see that LOTS of other people have had the issue, as well. I'm going with Bose next time. $350 for these is just unacceptable.

author: Elisha Hutchins
title: overall good
content:
bought these for travel they work great
only thing i dont like is the touch controls buttons would be much better and id like to disable or  Reassign the controls specificlly the digital assistant that comand actually makes these less valuable

author: David
title: Best headphones for this price.
content: You will not regret this purchase. Best headphones ever. Amazing sound quality, amazing in everything, just buy them. Sound is perfect bass and stuff and amazing noise canceling.

author: Don from VA
title: Actually better than BOSE!
content: These headphones are all they are advertised to be and more!  About the same cost as the newest BOSE model, only better! Noise canceling feature is excellent; sound quality is excellent (don't even need the app to adjust the factory set sound settings, unless you are an absolute sound freak)!  Love the touch control features, and comfort of these headphones. The kit even came with the charge cord, the single jack cord and the adapter for the double one, for those times you may need it!  Bluetooth works perfectly!  The only issue is that it is not bluethooth compatible with my iPad (not a big deal for me).  Works well with all other Apple devices that I own. Nice carrying case as well. Glad I chose these over the BOSE! Would highly recommend these to anyone.

author: J
title: Definitely wait for the next version...will NOT work on professional conference calls
content:
I did a lot of research, so I knew about issues others had regarding the mic, side controls, etc.  Sometimes there are bad batches, so I figured the major issues should be resolved by now.  I decided to pay full price and test it out.  Music is spot on, it is as good as everyone said.  Before bringing it to work, I decided to test the mic at home with both no ambient noise and loud TV.  I tried calling myself with both the iPhone and Google Voice on PC paired to the headphones.  When the room is quiet, the mic actually worked decent.  My fiancee said I sounded like I was in a tunnel, but she could make out what I was saying.  So it appears the most serious mic issues had been resolved.  I cranked the TV up loud, and with NC on, my voice could be heard but the background noise was overpowering.  I tried using the mic on my iPhone and it worked better than the headphones with loud ambient noise.

I brought the headphones to work as I needed to drown out some cubicle farm noise.  When room and people were quiet, my remote coworkers did not have any issues hearing me on conference calls.  They did mention that it sounded like I was in a bathroom.  No complaints, it was definitely good.  The next day, my boss tried calling me with a lot of co-workers talking loudly around me.  He said it sounded like I was in a movie theatre and said the people around me were louder than my voice.  He told me to immediately switch to another headset.  I called back using my iPhone and everything was fine.  This confirms the ambient noise problem on other reviews I seen.  Appears to be a hardware limitation and placement of the NC/mics.

So yes, the music is good.  But at this price point, I felt it was not worth it.  The noise canceling feature on much cheaper headphones work almost as well.  I do not believe the excuse that the mic should not be important on these (since they should be used mostly for music) as they are asking top dollar.  Any feature placed by the manufacturer should work flawlessly.  Otherwise, remove it.  The Bose can do it, so I am confident the next version will address this.  Until then, back to my $20 Logitech headset.

author: Edwin A.
title: Muy recomendado
content: Muy buen producto

author: Subhan
title: Light years ahead of Bose QC35 II
content:
I'm a musician and I take music everywhere I go. I ordered both of the Bose and the XM3 and had plans to systematically compare the two before I picked one and gave the other one to a friend.  After the first 10 minutes of testing and comparing,  I almost forgot I bought the Bose too. I found Bose to be extremely low tech for 2019, meh sound quality, okay ANC and doesnt feel as if you're getting a bang for your buck.
Go for the Sonys, you will not regret the purchase!

author: Jeffrey N. Fritz
title: Comfortable Headphones with Excellent Audio, Impressive Build Quality and Amazing Noise Cancellation
content:
I have a soundproofed studio, therefore I generally don’t have much need for a noise cancelling headset. In fact, you won’t find a single one in my studio. However, I do have times when I want to audition tracks outside of the studio–sometimes while my wife watches TV, listens to ABBA on her Echo, or talks over her iPhone. Sony has a decent reputation for studio headphones. The Sony MDR-7506s that are in use in my studio are nothing short of legendary. Therefore, I decided to give the Sony WH1000XM3 Noise Canceling Over Ear Headphones a try.

The headphones come in a nice zippered case and include a USB Type-C charging cable, an auxiliary audio cable (in case you want to listen Bluetoothless) and a set of printed instructions. The case itself even has a diagram showing how to store the headphones. That’s a nice touch.

There is no charger included and I found the included USB charging cable to be way too short. It’s maybe three inches long max making it difficult to place the headset in a stable position while it is being charged. I would have preferred a longer charger cable and also a longer audio cable as well, perhaps a coiled one. After all, everything else about this headphone is premium, so why not the cables? In fact, the headset shouts “quality” even when it first comes out of its carton.

As stated previously, the Sony WH1000XM3 Headphones can be used wirelessly over Bluetooth or with a wired connection. Also as stated previously, I’ve never owned a pair of noise cancelling headsets. I have to say that the noise canceling in this headset is amazing–almost startling. When I switched the noise cancelling on while sitting about five feet from the TV audio system, the TV became dead quiet. I could see the actor’s lips moving, but I couldn’t hear a word that they were saying. That’s pretty amazing!

Noise cancelling ability aside, I was interested in evaluating the audio quality of the Sony WH1000XM3 Headphones. Could they stand up to the Sennheiser HD 598 and Sony MDR-7506 headsets that already occupy space in my studio? Actually, I started listening not in the studio, but on my iPad Air via a Bluetooth connection to compressed MP3 music. I found the quality to be more than acceptable. Quite good as a matter of fact. Then I continued my listening with a wired connection to a my studio audio system. I auditioned a variety of high quality, uncompressed audio files. This included jazz, rock, folk and classical tracks.

My main test piece was the classic “Take Five” by the Dave Brubeck quartet. This track really tests an audio system during Joe Morello’s drum solo. On a “good” system Morello’s drum has a sharp cracking sound. It’s a very difficult sound for many headphones and audio systems to reproduce and they wind up instead making the crack a dull thud. And, yes, with the the Sony WH1000XM3 Headphones Morello’s drum sounded sharp and clean. I heard the cracking sound. Paul Desmond’s alto sax sounded almost as if it was in the room.

All-in-all not a bad showing for Sony. The overall sound quality was very good. These headphones have a wide sound field with a clean open sound. To my ears, the bass sounded a touch heavy although certainly not boomy or forced. This was easily corrected by using the studio equalizer to pull back the lows slightly and push the highs up also slightly. I did nothing to the midrange. The sound that I heard was more than acceptable. I experienced no ear fatigue even after several hours of listening.

These are extremely comfortable headphones to wear. They are closed-back, so the ears do get a bit warm, however. The headband is nicely padded and easy on the head as are the earphones themselves. Given this comfort, plus it’s excellent audio quality, impressive build quality and amazing noise cancelling ability, the Sony WH1000XM3 Noise Canceling Over Ear Headphones have earned themselves a permanent place in my studio.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great headphones
content: Very comfortable, great controls and audio. I’ve been wearing headphones for 60 years now and everything considered these new Sonys are the best.

author: Daniel S.
title: Maybe? Never More Disappointed in a Purchase
content:
Don't know if I have written a review before, but this purchase was a disaster.  I read every review I could find; CNET, Amazon Reviews, Videos and was really excited by what Sony came out with; the cover the Right ear to hear Flight Attendant, the noise canceling, comfortable cups etc.
I had Bose for years --but they are wired-- and the wire in this WeWork and Coffee Shop World is major pain.
I got the night before 14 hour international travel, took out on the night before to set up, charge and take with me; first, the Noise Cancelation is now where near the quality of Bose.  I was in first class and could hear voices from what I thought was the row behind me, I turned to shoot them a look and it was first row in Coach.  Now I may sound like a Diva :) but there is a serious issue that you have to turn the volume up to block out noise-- that is what is wonderful about the Bose they block out plane engines so you can save your ears a bit.
The features; what I thought was great, was just overcomplicated.  You have to use the app and if I heard "optimizing" once more, I was going to throw them into the ocean.  I just want to put on a set of headphones and enjoy, chaning for altitude, adjusting, etc etc. just too much.
Punch line?  I took them on this trip, came back to US, got a coffee at Starbucks and someone stole them!  ha!
I think the person may return them to Starbucks, not because they are kind hearted, but because they are such a disappointment.

author: Nick
title: Best headphones in the market
content: I would highly recommend these headphones after testing several brands. The sound quality is amazing and the app is best in class.

author: Christina Avenoso
title: Best headphones I have ever owned
content: Best headphones I've ever owned.  Comfort is ridiculous, I can wear them for hours and it doesn't feel tight or anything.  Sound quality is great and the noise cancelling has been such a nice feature.  Battery life is INSANE

author: DarkStarMagnolia
title: Best overall Bluetooth  headphone on the market. One small issue.
content:
I decide to do a lot of researching before making a big purchase like this. After weeks of investigating I made my choice and boy am I happy. As someone who takes Audio quailty very seriously  I was shocked about how good these  bluetooth headphones are. I never knew bluetooth audio was this good.

The noise canceling on these  is out of this world. The material quailty is top notch and I didn't  notice any pitching from  the  headband. My only issue is that my ears do get warm after wearing these for a few hours. However this is not a deal breaker in my book.

author: Prong Praison
title: Almost perfect
content:
I was so excited to get this product. I would say that Sony has better sound quality but it's also boomy. I have to use headphone to listen to music everyday and even use it for mixing. So far I would say that it's very bassy. Good thing that Sony let you adjust the EQ, that helps but still that's kind of annoying to have to adjust the overall sound.

Noise cancelling is very well done. My ears got a bit numb after a few hours though. The pressure is pretty strong even though I adjusted to fit myself. Sometime after using it for a while I feel very weird and feel like I can't hear well. Not sure why.

I also agreed with many people that the pad around the ears could have with deeper. It hurt my ears after a few hours.

Overall I think it's one of the best headphone out there. Those are just a few things they could improve in the future!

author: DaniloSouza
title: So happy I purchased this headphones
content: Amazing!!!!!

author: Shoppin4Deals
title: Amazing purchase!
content: Great product, great sounding headphones!

author: ROBERT   KENNEDY
title: Awesome sound
content: Ilove it

author: Ke'Vaughn Waldon
title: On The Fence Line!
content: I watched some YouTube videos trying to find out what was the new flagship for Sony headphones. Once I located them here on Amazon, it took me a month to find out how bad I wanted them. And honestly, it’s the full package. I would say it needs more bass or an increase in decibels, but anymore of that would probably harm you. It works for me and I’m a bass head. I would say if your on the fence line, you could check them out like I did at your nearest Best Buy. Unfortunately, for me trying them on there didn’t justify there potential until I had them in my claws. The Sony WH1000XM3 give so many options within the app. And, if you don’t get the headset application then your really missing out on these baby’s. All in all, I give them a 9/10. Come on now, nothing is perfect!

author: Fred
title: Love it
content: What can I say: "It's SONY"

author: Corey Wagner
title: Amazing
content: Better than Bose with better battery life. I also love the USB-C charger.

author: Floyd B.
title: Comfortable, wide variety of uses and fun usage
content: I enjoy using these headphones. So fun to play with the touch controls, the ambient microphone is great for when I’m at the gym and someone talks to me. Also the mic for the phone calls is really clear according to the people I’m on the phone with. Comfortable fit and not to heavy to wear for long gaming hours.

author: Chris1205
title: Comfort
content: I like the noice canceling a lot. However my ears start to warm up and get sweaty after a while. So keep this in mind. Other than that though these are amazing headphones.

author: Zee
title: Good balance across sound spectrum  - tweeter to bass.
content: Not very fond of touch/swipe controls. But sound spectrum is nice and wide for great overall listening with good bass. Like the lightness of the headphones and just right ear grip. Good noise cancellation to tune out loud TV and ambient noise. Will test them on a long trans Atlantic flight in a few days. Hoping for the best.

author: Amanda
content: I love these headphones. They're absolutely amazing. I returned mine to get the other color and I miss them everyday.

author: Jim Griffith
title: The Total Package
content: The sound of the XM3s is top notch, compared to other blue tooth phones. Not quite in the league of more expensive wired phones, but considering the price differential, an excellent sounding product.  Noise cancellation is also top notch. Adding Alexa to the phones requires use of the button normally used to vary noise control, but you can control noise cancellation variation easily in the app. I use them when cutting grass with a tractor and it greatly diminishes the engine noise.  Phone calls received are good, although I haven’t needed this feature much, to date. Fit is comfortable.  I often use them in wired mode, with the power on, and find them better than my older wired phones (which aren’t the expensive pro type).  One thing to note: the ads say “now with Alexa”, but you still have to download and set up Alexa. Not a big deal, I guess.  The volume control takes getting use to, since it requires you to move a finger up or down on the right cup but it work ok.  Sound quality was my primary goal and the XM3 doesn’t disappoint. Overall, very happy with the whole package.

author: mathew tekansik
title: The BEST!
content: These are the best wireless noise-cancelling headphones I have found. The sound quality is phenomenal as well as the comfort. The Bluetooth controls dont always work on the first try but that is more of me getting used to the placement and function.

author: Brooks Thomas
title: Top Notch Noise Cancelling Headphones
content: These Sonys are as advertised - superb sound and ambient noise suppression. Volume control is 'touchy', literally, but once you get it down, easy and efficient. They're worth every penny.

author: H.F.
title: Equivalent to Bose, limited Bluetooth range
content: Sounds quality and battery life are fine (battery lasts a couple of days).  Noise cancellation is great (from someone used to high end Bose), and touch based audio pass-through and volume slider are useful.  Bluetooth range is somewhat limited compared to other options though.

author: ronnyek
title: Excellent sound cancelling
content:
I knew what to expect buying these after doing a lot of research.

After trying the sound cancelling with nothing playing... They do a great job. People talking and sounds are dramatically quieter.

I then started to play music (classical at reasonable volume) and combined with sound cancelling... I could literally hear nothing outside of the music. I was most impressed when wife was using blender or vaccuum and I had no idea.

In addition to excellent audio quality and sound cancelling... The integration with Google assistant is fantastic.

They are a bit pricy... But we're definitely worth it to me.

author: Lee Miles Bradford
title: Noise cancelling and sound quality are excellent
content: I’ve had these for a few weeks and overall, I’m impressed. The sound quality is excellent and the noise canceling is great. I use them for music and television and the block out my loud neighbors. For these tasks the Sonys are outstanding.  Using them for calls isn’t great and the Bose Quiet Comfort 35 II really beats Sony in this category.  Not sure if it’s the position of the microphone but calls are not great with the Sonys. I still use the Bose for calls and Skype. But for watching a movie or listening to music, Sony can’t be beat. The one issue for me is that the Sony don’t adjust small enough for my head and fall off easily while exercising or even if getting off the sofa. Not a deal killer but the Bose definitely have a better fit to my head. But overall, great headphones

author: S
title: Great NC headphone
content:
This is a great NC headphone. Very comfortable to wear. I don't have problems with wearing it for a few hours. Although it is heavier than QC 35, it's hard to notice the difference (unless you intentionally want to feel which one is heavier).
* Noise cancelling
Unfortunately, in 2019 there isn't a headphone that cancels human voices perfectly. With NC on without playing music, I can still hear people talking. But it's difficult to tell what they are talking unless I concentrate on the conversation or the people are talking in a sharp voice. Some music can easily cover people's voice.
* Comparison with QC 35
I first tried QC 35 and got a headache after wearing it for minutes. Then I tried XM3 and felt that it was better (could be that I was already getting used to NC headphones). Anyway, there are more levels of ambient sound you can choose from compared with QC35. If full NC makes you feel uncomfortable, try let some ambient sound in, which may help.
I somehow believe the gestures on XM3 is cooler and I like using it. I don't like finding buttons on QC 35. XM3 can also optimize NC based on the atmosphere pressure and how you wear the headpone, which I don't think QC 35 can do.

author: Janky
title: Noticable Upgrade!
content: I upgraded and bought the MX3s. Compared to the MX2 which I used for over a year on many bus rides on Connecticut Transit system I have to say these are the best of its series. The noise cancellation improved greatly as I have asked people if I sound more clear on phone calls. I am not a fan of the Alexa integration, but it is an option that others will probably find useful if they own a line up of Alexa products. I prefer the google assistant as it has worked for me for years. Sound quality if you are integrating it with Sony;s Smartphone audio drivers and technology then it is superb. Do not expect it sound better on your cheap iPhone X for your phone does not possess these advanced audio features. I never really use it for gaming, because I have a PS4 Pro which does not integrate with it. However, as a music producer I can say these will definitely replace your studio headphones of the same price unless you have a  2000$ studio headphone this will suffice tremendously well. The Comfort has also so greatly improved as well. Much lighter and improved padding for the top of your head so when you have long media sessions you do not have to worry about feeling the metal band as it compresses over time. The XM3s are practically identical, but as I have described above these changes are what makes the XM3 by far the must have choice in this model lineup. 5 stars.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Serious issue within 30 days of purchase.
content: Within 30 days of purchase the power button did not work. A recommended reset did not resolve so I am exchanging because I love the fit and performance when working. I will update this review after the replacement arrives.

author: Cheryl Pappy
title: Headphones Stopped Working After Two Months
content: These were fantastic headphones until they stopped working less than 60 days after purchasing. I am having difficulty getting a hold or anyone from Sony or Amazon to assess for repair and/or replace. This is frustrating.

author: Rich
title: Battery only lasts a few hours
content: Comfortable.  They do a fair job of cancelling noise, but the battery life is not as described.

author: Damon
title: NICE
content: This is simply the best headphone ever....The noise cancellation is beyond amazing and overall quality on point

author: sanzil
title: awesome headphones
content: do look for deals on this thing

author: Logan
content:
I heard a lot of hype and thought the noise canceling would be better.

It works well at canceling out low end deep noise. Higher tone things like people talking still cut through.

Build quality isn’t great, they feel really cheap and everything is plastic. I’d be surprised if they last a year.

The microphone is pretty useless.
It sounds Muffled and unclear to the person you’re talking to.

Charging cable is really short.

Feels hot and gets sweaty after being worn a couple hours.

The ear cups fold the opposite way of what would make sense.

Case looks ugly

Battery life isn’t anywhere near the 30 hours advertised.

Touch screen is annoying. It gets bumped on accident a lot when you take them off.

Changing the volume is hard, a lot of the time you skip tracks instead of adjusting volume.

Only one synced device at a time??

author: Tom
title: Great product
content: Did exactly what it is suppose to do.

author: Rita Shah
title: Great noise cancelling headphones but a little big for smaller heads!
content: These are great sound quality, noise canceling. But I’m a 5’3” female and the size is a little big which doesn’t allow for as much comfort as when my husband wears them. But would def recommend for watching videos and listening to music and drowning out any background noise. Especially great for travel!

author: Fabricio
title: Marvelous product
content:
I own the Sennheiser HD1/momentum 2.0, which at some point cost 400 dollars. In comparison, these sony headphones are simply better.

Sound quality:  Quite wonderful.  The implementation of LDAC codecs was brilliant. Since I own an android phone, I am able to play HiFi songs and be amazed by the rich highs and mids.  Regardless, LDAC alone doesn't mean the sound will be awesome, but the headphones do matter. And these are some of the best Bluetooth headphones out there. (if not the best tbh).

Noise Canceling:  Quite great. I won't say it is perfect because it will NOT block every single sound, but it is up there as one of the very best noise-canceling headphones.  Noise-canceling headphones will have a mild "pressure" effect while listening, which can lead to some discomfort and headaches. These ones are no exception, but at least they don't seem too bothersome. Plus, one can easily disable the noise cancelation.

Build quality:  The HD1/Momentum 2.0 are very sturdy and even a little heavy. The ear cushions are leather and it feels quite premium to the touch. Also, the leather allows for a fresh and breathable experience.  The Sony headphones are made out of plastic, which may or may not break easily. So be careful with them and try not being TOO active while wearing these.  Other than that, the materials are good, the ear cushions are very soft, and the overall fit is comfortable.

Battery life:  I can wear these all day without worrying about the battery. If you charge these at night, you won't have issues listening to music during the day. I also LOVE the fact that these have a USB type C connector. which means that you can charge them quite fast.

Buy these and you'll notice the difference. I would highly advise buying these whenever there is a sale and the price drops lower than 300.

author: Amazon Customer
title: This are great!!
content: The functions are a little hard to operate properly. Other than that it’s AMAZING!!

author: N. Gustafsson
title: Amazing noise cancelling
content:
Just bought a second pair of these amazing headphones for my wife. Noise cancellation literally turns off everything else, people around me speak in inaudible whispers, the office A/C is gone, airplanes are silent. In my own world of little or no sound with these on. They are far better than anything I've owned in the past.

The only gripes I have are a) the ridiculously short charging cable. Buy a USB-C cable, too, if you buy one of these. It seems like they saved a cubic inch on the case, or so, by having a unusably short cable included; b) there's nothing 'silver' about the Silver variant, which is what I bought first. It's tan or beige, or very pale brown, but not 'silver.' Not unattractive, but if you think you're getting a silver-colored set, think again.

author: Francisco Reyes
title: Now I know why people pay $350+ for this headphones
content:
I have been using the Sony MX1000XM3 for about 4 months now and the experience has been fantastic. Thru out the years I have spent more than $300 dollars on those cheap Bluetooth headphones and they always end up failing within months. This headphone in the other have been a joy to use. Here is my Pros and cons
Pros:
-noise cancelling is amazing, I have use these headphones on a C-17 flight and the ability to block the obnoxious noise of the plane is incredible.
-USB C, do I need to explain more ?
-Super comfortable for long hours of use
-battery life is really good on average 25+ of battery life between charges
- gesture controls works great
-pressing the power button will give you the battery % on a voice feedback
-noise cancelling controls on the left ear cup
-app for iOS and Android is decent, serve its purpose

Cons
-not free

overall amazing experience worth every penny.

author: Justin
title: Great headphones for travel
content:
Pros: High quality build. Noise cancelling is amazing for travel. Sound is perfect. App is easy to use. Battery life is very nice and charges to full battery level fast.

Cons: ears get a little hotter than in the bose.

Would highly recommend these over any other pair out right now.

author: R. M.
title: Simply amazing: sound, comfort, ANC.
content: I bought these with the intention of watching TV /playing pc games, but had to return them because they do not support aptx low latency (the lag on aptx HD and standard sbc was just too much, unusable for gaming with). However, I miss them every day and wish I could have found a use for them. If they have aptx LL, they would've been the perfect headset for me for my pc gaming. These are much better than the Plantronics backbeat pro 2, which I also tried. Those do have aptx LL but the comfort just isn't remotely close to how good the xm3 felt on my ears. Ended up just getting a logitech G533 on sale, which sounds and feels way worse than these xm3's, but there's no lag in pc gaming so it'll have to do.

author: hoppy
title: Worth it & fabulous headphones
content:
These headphones are awesome- comfortable, crisp sound... I purchased these to replace my Parrot headphones. I travel all the time.
Spendy but worth it if you use them constantly.

author: Connor Weinman
title: Worth the price!!
content: Nothing but great things to say about these headphones. Noice cancellation is amazing and sound is excellent. Not to mention the battery life is far better than other high end Noise cancellation headphones. Well worth the price!! 10/10 would recommend.

author: Geoffrey
title: Perfect for traveling
content:
I LOVE THIS PRODUCT, but there is one minor issue.

I love the sound of these headphones. They sound amazing. Accurate sound music and even calls.
The noise cancelling I love. (Warning) Once you take these off, everything sounds a bit loud, but I think that's a good thing. I was used to having everything be quiet.
I was on call with the gf, and she said the microphone was good, and she didnt really pick up on back ground noise. I think the reason why people say the mic is so bad is because when you have ambient noise ON, the microphone tries it's best to pick up all the noise you would hear (background noise) and play that in the headphones. I would see why they do that. The passive noise proof ear muffs do such a good job at keeping noise out that they have to play sound back through the microphones.
That isnt the minor thing that bugs me. It's that after long periods of time, the top of your head gets sore from the headphones. The cushion that contacts the top of my head is really soft, but it still gets to me. So if you have a long flight, you might have to adjust these to keep the soreness low on the top of your head.

author: Ryan
title: These things rock!
content: These things are superb.  Great highs, mids & great bottom end bass.  The Bluetooth feature for handsfree talking is terrible & the gimmicky controls on the right ear cup are worthless.  But I didn’t buy them for either feature, so I could care less.  Battery life is excellent as well.

author: Charles Short
title: Best headphones ever.
content: These are the cat's pajamas!

author: Kevin R.
title: Rustling Sound When on Noise Cancelling
content: I really love the headphones and I take them to the gym all the time. Dont hear anyone and best to block out all the sound. I bought this on Sunday, 5 days ago, and everything was good. UNTIL, for some reason when I activate Noise Cancelling the music shifts more to the right side of the headphone so I need to go over half my volume to not notice it and and theres no music playing it has a rusting sound on the right side that is loud and annoying. I haven't changed any setting on the app at all and havent needed to go over half way on my volume except for when on Noice Cancelling. I would give it 5 stars but because of the rustling noise I will give it only 3 stars. The product is well known for the NC so I'm not so happy that it didnt keep its reputation.

author: Hussam Lafi
title: Goodbye my beats studio 3
content:
Very comfortable and superior sound quality
10/10
Goodbye my beats

author: Keen
title: i just cant believe hot good it is
content: the best headphones I've ever had

author: Amazon Customer
title: Worth the money
content: Excellent quality. Would recommend these if they're within your budget.

author: nonstopmotion
title: Lightweight, comfortable, fantastic sound quality
content: I have not yet had the opportunity to test them in a noise cancelling situation but so far everything about these headphones has performed as advertised. It was easy to sync up the Bluetooth connection to my iPhone. I recommend this product.

author: sdm
title: Very Comfy!
content: Great on my trip to London!

author: Travis Fennel
title: Expensive but worth it
content:
These may seem expensive if you're coming from the same place I did.
 Let me tell you, these are worth every penny, especially in an office environment.
I can't hear anything or anybody! Sometimes I put them on just for the active noise canceling, and don't play anything.
But when I do, the sound is perfect. Wind doesn't seem to bother these either, and you don't hear it on the other side of the phone.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Spendy but very high quality
content: Great sound, battery life and noise canceling

author: FSL
title: Good product, the foam is not as confortable as my previous headphones
content: Good product, the foam is not as comfortable as my previous headphones,

author: hyw695540015
title: Giid
content: Good

author: Elisabeth J
title: Crackling noise in left ear bud turns a stellar product in one I had to return
content: There is a widely reported issue with these headphones, and Sony has not yet taken action. With noise cancellation on, many user report hearing a faint 'popping' or 'crackling' noise in the left ear bud, when turning their heads or touching the ear bud. The issue was not bothering me very much in the beginning, but drove me nuts after a few weeks, especially considering the lofty price tag. Headphones in this price category should be flawless. This is why a decided to return them. Otherwise, the headphones are great: fantastic sound quality (markedly better than Bose QC-35 II) and great looking .

author: Trevor Lawler
title: These are 10/10. Incredible Sony product.
content: I have the Bose QC II’s and bought these Sony’s for my mom. No comparison. These are the best headphones I’ve ever used. Same price as the QC II’s. Highly recommend.

author: GUILLERMO
title: Best noise cancelling headset
content: Best noise cancelling! Superb battery life and beautiful sound!

author: x4g10sk
title: Great sound, amazing battery life, rapid charge
content: Great sound quality. Supports LDAC, aptx, aptx hd. No lossless format. Battery life is unbelievable. 3 hours tops and it takes more than 24 hours of nonstop use to empty. And that's paired to 2 devices: phone and transceiver. Assistant button is nice, provides somewhat less abuse prone way to use Google assistant.

author: gg
title: My Honest Review of SONY 1000MX
content: They build quality is jst awesome, ear-cups fit well in the ears and the noise cancellation is mind blowing, you cant hear any ambient sounds or noise. google assistant works fine. Sound quality is not far from an average Sony XB450. Bass not that deep but its generally okey. Controls work fine as expected . The only drawback i have noticed, when you connect the set using the 3.5MM connector direct to a laptop or a computer, you lose some sound quality. Battery life is mind Blowing, i player music 1Hr at 50% and i only managed to used up 2%. General opinion, its jst awesome for travelling

author: Richard Merson
title: Great so far!
content:
I liked how snug these headphones fit and don’t hurt after long time wear.
The noise cancelling is great. However, I was hoping for complete blockage. I can still hear some ambient noise around me. But it doesn’t affect me hearing what I’m listening to.

author: Rene Funez
title: Best headphones by far. Great job Sony
content:
Quite impressed with the sound and noise canceling not to mention light weight these headphones feel. The bass feels so good even a very low volume. I did try the new Bose 700 but I will say that my Sony WH-1000XM3 are far better regarding sound and noise canceling.
Just one thing missing on the Sony which Bose has is multiple pairing. That’s a neat feature I did love from Bose 700, other than that I’m super happy with Sony.

author: mbean
title: Great sound!
content: The sound from these is truly wonderful.  I'm listening to Tidal on both my MacBook Pro (aptx) and on on my iPhone (AAC) and hearing amazing detail.  The noise cancellation works.  Battery life is great.  I've only had them for six weeks, so can't comment on durability.  I was wary of spending $300 for headphones, but so far I am glad I did!

author: RM
title: Best of the best
content: I have waaay too many headphones and earbuds. I travel almost every week. I love my Sennheiser true wireless earbuds but wanted to see if I could find some comfortable noise cancelling headphones for my trips on the plane. I have Bose headphones. These are - full stop - the best darn noice cancelling headphones. Period. Nothing else is even close. The sound quality is excellent and the voice cancelling blows my mind.

title: the best headphone!
content: the best headphone that has an awesome ANC on the earth! when i turned on the noise cancelling, everything magically and dramatically disappeared from my ear except the music i was playing. JUST BUY IT!

author: A. Edwards
title: Unacceptable audio dropouts
content:
I returned these headphones.

I'm really, really trying to buy into bluetooth tech for headphones, but every single set I've bought has experienced audio dropouts with regularity under normal circumstances. In the case of these Sony headphones, sometimes I couldn't even turn my head without having the audio stutter.  Coming from wired headphones that never cut out, I'm not ready to compromise with tech that doesn't perform at least as good as what it's replacing. I'm not sure what to attribute the dropouts to. Maybe I should wait until Sony updates from bluetooth 4.2 to 5.0.

Overall, I was really excited to try these out. I waited a long time and ended up placing an order for these when shipping was estimated at a month away. When they work, they really work well! Sound quality is pretty good. As good as any closed set I've heard priced around $150. Active noise canceling on these in New York City isn't the silent oasis the Sony marketing materials make it out to be; there's still significant sound that leaks in whether your walking on the sidewalk or riding the subway. When used in an office, I can still clearly hear my coworkers talking 20 feet away from me. There's also an audible hum when ANC is turned on.

Controls were hit and miss. I can't understand why Sony continues to use the touch sensitive ear cups versus physical buttons. Buttons are easier, reliable, and there's no ambiguity when you click the buttons. The touch sensitive controls didn't always respond when I wanted them to, and sometimes responded when I didn't want them to. In my experience, I had to get the swipe up/down absolutely perfect in order to adjust the volume. I much prefer Bowers & Wilkens' implementation on their PX headphones.

Maybe my expectations were unrealistic. Am I expecting miracles? No. But for ~$400, I would expect a top tier experience without the compromises that I'd settle for in a set of $20 bluetooth headphones.

Given my experience, I can't recommend these.

author: Beachy Girl
title: Best Sound
content: Used this on a trip and the cancelling part was great!!  The sound when playing music was so clear and deep.  Highly recommend these headphones.

author: Siwei Nie
title: Touch control malfunctions in cold temperature
content: Took it out for a jog first night after I got the headphone. Temperature was around 30 F, and the touch control went crazy - skip tracks, stop then start playbacks etc., without any input.  Otherwise a decent noise cancelling headphone. But it will have to go back...

author: Andy B
title: Strange squeaky noises while on head
content:
I have owned many Bose headphones where the "leather" or plastic ears disintegrated over time.
Thought I would try the Sony product instead.  The audio quality is OK.  But the "leather" or plastic ears make strange squeaky noises while on my head.  I have to keep my head absolutely still to avoid.  So far, I'm disappointed.

author: Micro Megas
title: Mastery
content: Unbelievable quality.

author: JARREN SWAZO
title: Better Than Expected!
content: Simply amazing - better than expected in all facets!

author: Carrie Randall
title: Beautiful
content: Beautiful! Comfortable and easy to use. Charge lasts a looong time. Folding ability for travelers. Nice case

author: ANDREA B.
title: These are the world's best noise cancelling headphones period.
content: If you have to fly frequently, and you haven't tried these headphones to help with the inflight noise, or if you have always used Bose, and believe that you're using the best, think twice. These headphones beat the Bose in a heartbeat when it comes to cancelling noise. The battery life is just unbelievable in a very good way, and the sound is awesome, it;s true that there are other headphones that sound as good as these for around the same or even lesser price, but no pair of headphones on the planet will give you great sound, and the best noise cancelling of all.

author: Mana ali
title: Great headphones
content:
Exceeded the expectations especially the battery life is superb, however you may feel a little bit humidity around your ear if you using it more than one hour (not significant)

The app on the iPhone needs more updates but it works nicely, better app for Android  users

author: Jack E. Wilkinson
title: Excellent headphones with one MAJOR exception...
content: These are some of the best headphones I've ever used.  The noise cancellation feature works better than any other headphones I've ever owned, include previous Sony models.  My one and only complaint is that when the batteries do run down, you can't use them with Bluetooth.  What???!!!  I'm glad that Amazon could get me a next day shipment of a cable long enough to reach across the room to be used while the headphones recharge in the middle of a program.

author: Ken B.
title: Great headphones!
content: These headphones are great! I use them in the evening when I want to relax to some soft music and they work great. The sound quality is amazing and the voice cancellation works really well for low frequency continues sounds. Sony really did a nice job on these headphones, and IOS app that customizes it.

author: ppdoc
title: Best I’ve listened to.
content:
Have been using Bose for years but my headset disappeared. Read the reviews from 2019 and night these. I was a violinist, a radio DJ and have an over 20K database of music.

First song - Have a Cigar. David Gilmour’s guitar is powerful and bell clear. The end of the song where the transition is from left to right is almost scary. The song feels like it’s coming from inside my head.

Second piece - Last movement of Beethoven’s 9, “Choral”. Each voice crystal clear. Minimal loss of highs and lows. Not overwhelmed by bass. Blow you away sound.

Third piece - Miles Davis - Freddy Freeloader off Kind of Blue. The trumpet and the piano are so crystal clear you can hear the fingers on the keyboard and Miles’s tone is classic.

Last piece- Mendelssohn Violin Concerto in E recorded by Jascha Heifetz. First movement. Picked because it is such an old recording. Granted it has been cleaned up. But it would be hard to tell that this isn’t new if you didn’t think about stereo as this was originally a mono recording.

These headphones are unreal. Expensive but worth it.

Next test is on my zero turn mower for 3-4 hours. Will test noise canceling at that time.

author: Alexey
title: Cracked when was putting on my head
content:
Sound and noise cancelling are great comparing to others.
For volume control I think i'd prefer physical controller rather than touch.

The biggest issue: after about 6 month of use (bought these in May 2019) the right side of holding the dynamic has cracked when I was putting it on my head. It is not completely falling apart, but sometimes right dynamic falls off hanging on the wire. There is a thin piece of plastic that seems had cracked. It felt solid initially -- poor construction for this high price :(

This doesn't seem to be covered by the warranty :(

author: Jen
title: Great
content: Great product

author: Justin Kam
title: Great Headphones but didn't work
content: When I first received these headphones, I charged them up fully and tried turning them on but they did not work.  I called Sony and I was told that I got a defective pair. The return process went very smoothly and I now have a perfectly working pair of headphones. Everything about these headphones are amazing, especially noise cancelling and comfort. My favorite feature is cupping the right ear cup to decrease music volume. Although very expensive, these headphones are worth the price.

author: Mr. Wise
title: Cheap plastic! Save your money
content: The sound quality and noise cancellation are very good. However the headphones are very flimsy, made of cheap plastic, dull colors, too big and bulky. I have the silver and they do not look good at all. Terrible design with the control function that's located inside the right ear padding. It's very sensitive and if you don't swipe perfectly in the correct direction it ends up skipping songs or activating the Google Assistant. It's very aggravating. In order to change the volume you have to continually swipe  either up or down. And there's a slight pause between each swipe which makes it  take extra long  if you're in a hurry to switch up or down the volume. These headphones are definitely not worth the expensive price tag! I will be going back to Bose!

author: Mammynun
title: Outstanding!
content:
I've had these for almost a year now, and they're fantastic!  I travel almost every week and these make air travel almost enjoyable... nice and quiet, no crying kids, no engine noise, just silence.
Music sounds great. Between the Sony app and adjustments on my phone I hear things I've never heard before... probably because the noise cancellation works so well. Battery life is outstanding, I can do CLT to SFO and back without charging them.  They're very comfortable too. I don't use the phone or Alexa function.
I should have bought these years ago.

author: Michael Lescord
title: What a Find
content: Touch controls work just fine (after I got over my idiocy moment).  The controls are super slick for volume, track change, pausing and nearly complete rapid muting.  The App seems functional despite mediocre reviews.  The noise suppression is not complete in mid-range (voices are very soft), but is quite impressive in other frequencies.  A large box fan 3 feet away (on high) isn’t audible with ANC alone.  It’s very very comfortable.  I love these headphones, paired with an iPhone 8S.

author: JPrince
title: Quality product
content: Great design. Very good sound quality and effective noise canceling.

author: Robert Astle
title: The quiet was eerie at first...
content:
Others have written extensively and accurately about the excellent quality and convenient features of these headphones, so here is my individual experience.

I got these headphones after returning another pair from another brand. Hoping that these headphones would not prove to be another disappointment, I eagerly fitted them onto my head. They were very comfortable, I immediately noticed. Much to my satisfaction, they felt lightweight and secure. I raised up my hand and pressed the power button.

"Power on."

What came next was a captivating, eerie silence, the likes of which I rarely get to experience. I have a big family, and there is a constant chatter of activity in my house, but it could no longer reach my ears. I started playing some of my favorite music from my computer and began to experience the true depth of beauty that these songs possessed. I could detect artistic nuances and subtle melodies that I had never noticed before. This, however, was just the beginning.

It is now possible for me to sit in one of the noisy common rooms of my local college campus and listen attentively to the calculus demonstration on my computer, completely oblivious to the nearby fountain, air conditioning, and chatty students nearby. I can enjoy a relaxing evening on the balcony and not have to tolerate the traffic noise drowning out my music. While time and usage will truly test the value of this product, I am happy to report that so far, I am immensely happy with my purchase.

author: Sha
title: Don’t buy
content: I received these in December.  I use them almost everyday.  Suddenly they started acting up.  Without touching them they start changing songs, starting Siri and going haywire. I have to restart them etc.  VERY ANNOYING.

Bought these after my pair of XM2s were stolen and I definitely got my money’s worth.  I had the XM2s in black, so I decided to go with white for the XM3s and i’m glad that I did because it is beautiful in white!

As for the upgrades, they are so much comfortable to wear for prolonged periods than the XM2s.  I also like how the XM3s will tell you the exact percentage your battery level is at and the XM2s did not have this feature.  I also loved the change to USB-C, as I can just use my Switch charger to charge the headphones.

You will love  the way the phone fold up for you back pack and pop out for use on the airplane.  They cut out all jet noise and you can still hear "fasten the seat belts" message.  I feel so relaxed while using these headphones so will you..  they are not cheep but once you use em there is no going back.

content: Bought these headphones for my husband and he absolutely loves them. They are perfect for traveling (not too bulky).
