The headphones squeak on the left earcup and they also randomly have pauses in the middle of songs. The worst thing, is I can no longer connect this device to my MacBook. I’ve reset the device to factory settings but it cannot pair nor is it discoverable.

I did not have the same number of issues on my older 1000XM2s so I feel like Sony REALLY dropped the ball on this product

author: Preston Boler
title: The best money I've ever spent
content:
This is a bit long but it's very detailed.

These headphones are amazing. If that's not convincing enough, they're well worth the price, too. I listen to music every day, and these have the wonderful sound quality I was looking for. They sound great out of the box, but if you spend a few minutes in the optional (but highly recommended) companion app, you can tailor the sound to your liking for an unmatched experience. The noise cancelation is phenomenal. It won't block out voices, but it's not meant to. It blocks road noise out perfectly. Extremely comfortable too. I have a large head and I can wear these for a full day without fatigue.

This headset is wireless and can be used with the included cable if desired. The headphones also include the NFC Pairing feature. You can just tap your phone flat on the left ear cup and it will pair automatically. The touch control on the right ear cup is a bit hard at the start, but once you get used to it, it's hard to live without. And the headphones also have a feature where you can cover the right ear cup with your hand and it let's outside noise in. It works very smoothly and very quickly.

These headphones are very versatile when it comes to types of music. With a few adjustments in the app, they can go from shimmering classical to loud metal to powerful hip hop. The app let's you adjust every characteristic of the sound you could possibly want. On the physical side of things, they're made of plastic with a soft touch type texture. They don't scratch easily though. They're very flexible and the ear cups are extremely soft, but not so soft they collapse onto your ears. They come in a carrying case that is one of the best I've seen. It is very small and can fit everything you need. I even fit a charging brick in the pocket inside.

If you have the money and are serious about buying these, don't talk yourself out of it. I couldn't recommend these any more. I have let a dozen or so people try these with varying genres of music and they all agreed with everything I've said. I would buy these again if they got lost or broke, but these are so durable I don't see that being an issue.

author: Robert kirkley jr
title: Waste of money
content: Waste of $400 bucks. My 950’s blow these away. The bass is WEAK, the volume is WEAK. The noise canceling is good, but i would compare these to a cheaper brand (like fisher price). Dont waste your money!!!

author: Marissa
title: Quality Headphones!
content: I LOVE these headphones. I wear them everywhere! I love the hand gesture controls and I love the noise cancelling. They are also light and comfortable. My only complaint is that they do slide off your head pretty easily.

author: James Evans
title: Great headphones, but don't expect it to cancel voices
content: The sound and bass are great. They are very comfortable and light. Noise cancellation is good, but do not expect this to remove the voices of people talking. For that you might need a passive-active combo.

author: Thor Omundson
title: They good
content: They good

author: Michael Worobec
title: Yes, they really are as good as everyone says!
content: I am delighted at how great the noise cancellation works. Noticeably better than Bose.

author: Amazon Customer
title: They're Okay
content: Honestly I'm not sure what all the hype was about with these noise cancelling headphones. I tried the Bose Noise Cancelling Headphones in the store and I didn't think their noise cancelling was that great. So I watched some Youtube product reviews and gave these a shot. I don't know if my expectations were just much higher, but honestly its not like they cancel out a ridiculous amount of noise. I can still hear everything around me it's just dampened. Definitely not cancelled, and honestly it doesn't do that much for me even when working in the office I can still hear every ones chatter, people walking around me. Opening and closing of doors. It's not cancelling that much noise. The Bose did a worse job, but it makes you wonder. The most annoying thing about these headphones is the fact they can't pair with more than 1 device at a time. Every time I go from my apple laptop to my Linux desktop it takes at least 15 minutes every-time because I always have to re-pair them. If I didn't have to re-pair them every-time this wouldn't be an issue. It really sucks. The only thing that is keeping me from giving these headphones 2 stars is the sound quality is pretty good, battery life is good, and they feel comfortable to me. Honestly, in hindsight I probably would have been better buying some headphones for $100-$150.

author: niko
title: Noise cancelling is phenomenal, sound quality is great!
content: So far so good. Noise cancelling is seriously great. Took them on an airplane and it transported me to my own sound quality controlled plane.

author: Zach
title: Good overall
content: The touch buttons don’t work very well for me

author: amazon.jungle
title: The greatest headphone I’ve ever owned
content:
Cutting edge features
Works well
Sounds great
Battery life is awesome

author: diamondscar
title: Top of the Line in 2019
content:
I've had these headphones for 2 months and they do not disappoint.  I previously had the Bose QC35's and the XM3's have dethroned the previous king.

Noise-cancelling:  Better than Bose, more adjustable to different environments, allows flexibility with which sounds to block.

Sound Quality: I seriously thought I was losing my hearing since there were some sounds that I didn't hear when listening to my QC35's.  Nope, it just turns out that they didn't have great high frequency response.  The XM3's have better highs and lows, and the separation of sounds is fantastic.

Here's the most important part: using the XM3's with an Android phone you can use Sony's lossless LDAC connection.  This means you have 3x more bandwidth over bluetooth.  The result is a huge difference in sound quality vs a normal bluetooth connection.  They also support Apt X HD, but I don't know of any phone that actually supports that codec yet.  The only issue with LDAC is that it will drain your battery faster, but if you have high quality FLAC music on your device, you won't want to miss out.

Call Quality: I've never had an issue with call quality or disconnects.  Sounds clear as a bell and I can walk and talk just fine.

Comfort: As with all over-the-ear headphones, they can get a little warm, but it's nothing that can't be managed.  As for the cups, they are incredibly soft and pliant.  I hope they don't wear out quickly.  The cross bar is comfortable and barely noticeable.

All in all, I can't think of a reason to dislike these headphones.  Although my wife enjoys my hand me down QC35's, she's quite jealous over the hands free controls on the XM3's (which is amazing and intuitive).

author: Edward Matson
title: Can I return
content: Having problem with back noise from tv coming through

author: SunbowSue
title: Lightweight, great quality!
content: Bought for a Christmas gift, recipient very pleased.  Hope they hold up!

author: quiltdolly
title: Expensive for what you get
content: A Christmas gift, that I had asked for. In  less than 3 weeks . the microphone did not work. Sony was contacted and a replacement sent. This is a good set for listening but talking does not work well as  people can not  hear you. This is a known problem that I hope Sony fix's for new models.

author: Anthony
title: The Noise Cancellation isn't all that great.
content: I study at a coffee shop so noise cancellation is a pretty big deal to me. I tried these for a few days and they didn't get the job done. I found that the Bose QC 35 II worked better. If you're looking for pure noise cancellation, Bose is the better option.

author: Tyler J.
title: These are some pretty amazing headphones
content: I bought these headphones to use while I am detailing cars and all I can say is wow! It completely blocked out all the annoying noises and I was able to listen to music comfortably for roughly 5 hours of detailing the car. I completely forgot I had them on which goes to show how comfortable these things are. I would highly recommend these to anyone. I'm extremely happy with my purchase.

author: Sanjeet Kumar Rath
title: Nice Headphones
content: Nothing to dislike.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Buy the bose.
content: The touch pad constantly has problems with randomly changing track, pausing, and changing volume

author: wes
title: Nice..
content: Nice...but if you care about extra bass get Sony MDR-XB950B1..THE BEST OF THE BEST..

author: chifan_bushuwan
title: can not upgrade firmware
content:
can not upgrade firmware, with iphone app or android app
what can i do?

author: Kevin
title: Avoid if you wear in cold
content: Has a critical defect in cold weather that requires you to reboot it every time you go outside. Sony has refused to offer a fix, such as disabling the touch controls that malfunction in the cold. Would not recommend for anyone who uses their headphones outside during winter.

author: Louise V. Keane
title: Amazing how they cut out noise!
content: Used on 11 hour flight and they were amazing in cutting out the noise of the airplane and the sound of two crying babies.

author: Eric Levitt
title: Sounds Amazing and Super Comfortable!
content: So easy to connect to my phone.  Sound is AMAZING.  I had them on watching a training video and didn't even hear my son come into my office!  All I had to do was cover my right earphone and it lowered the training audio so I could hear my son speaking to me.  And they are super comfortable!

author: Crosley B. Jackson
title: Bought the QC35 II first, kept these
content: I've always loved Bose products and still own a few, but these Sony's are just awesome. While the QC35 II's are very comfortable, have some nice features (multi-BT connection, actual buttons), and do sound good I thought they substantially lacked bass. These Sony's are great - the app is more built out too allowing you to tweak the EQ and the sound is full. Also, for those with NFC on their phone, easy connect/disconnect option by tapping your phone to the left ear. Rad. Love these headphones.

author: Lauren
title: Better than all my old Boses. Much more comfortable. Great sound, bass, and love the controls
content: The ability to control your sound source (on/off, forward, backward, hi-low volume) is almost worth the price alone along with ability to turn noise cancelling off completely or with some optimization of the ambient environment. However the sound is astonishingly good (I listen to bebop jazz primarily). And they are so comfortable I have worn them for 10 hours a day. Buy them.

author: Ariyan
title: Not the best noise cancelation
content: It sounds great but I'm not so sure about the noise cancelation don't fall for the reviews on YouTube they were probably paid to review it if you want good noise cancelation go with Bose

author: Gabriel Brock
title: Best I’ve ever heard!
content: Far and away the best headphones out there. I thoughts beats by Dre we’re good until a friend let me try his sonys. Amazing!!!

author: SH22
title: Unparalleled Noise Canceling. Loud Beeping is Obnoxious
content:
Noise canceling is unparalleled. Just wow. If this wasn't the case these deserve a 1 star for terrible obnoxious loud beeps when operating any controls, device powers on, or any other action. This to me is unacceptable, and am now looking for alternatives.

Lastly audio recording (ie call quality on the other end) is entirely mediocre in a quiet environment, and terrible in a noisy environment.

author: James in Dallas/FortWorth
title: Worth the price
content: The saying you get what you pay for applies to these headphones. I love the noise cancellation feature it works very well. The bass is very good. The sound quality is very good and I can adjust what gets emphasized via the app. It's a breeze to connect to newer devises. My only issue is older devices with much earlier bluetooth have a harder time connecting to the headphones this may be due to the earlier bluetooth tech not being up to par with today's tech. These headphones have received a great deal of great reviews and I was ready to be let down but I am pleased they are right.

author: Rishi
title: Great buy considering the competition
content:
Correction: after 3 weeks of usage, the charge does not last, and the touch controls do no listen to the commands. I love the software correction of music. But other than that... It's up in the air. Do try your luck.

This is better than B&W PX 1000. There sound quality is great(customisable to a great extent, good lows) and it's wearable all day. This is just my first few days of listening but happy so far. The build quality is not as great as B&W but I feel the sound is more important. Ditto with nose cancellation., much better than others.

author: SUBASH GUPTA
title: Amazing
content: No complain, best ever!

author: Mr. Iowa City
title: Best Wireless Headphones
content:
Pleasantly surprized the improvements have made over the original (Sony Noise Cancelling Headphones WH1000XM).  Sound is outstanding, more comfortable & the noise cancelling is the best available (2019).  Draw backs over the original:
can't handle cold weather (stop working @ 32º).  i haven't tried using them for phone calls, but i've read from other reviews the volume is super low.  It's not a perfect set of headphones, but it comes really close :)

author: Grant
title: Amazing headphones
content: I was debating between these and Bose QC 35 II. I am so happy that I went with the Sony's. The sound quality is amazing, the build is amazing and the mobile app offers a wide variety of sound customization options. The only negative thing that I would have to say about these is the lack of Windows/Mac app. If Sony were to provide an app for computers with the same level of sound control as the mobile app then these would be the perfect pair of headphones. I would advise anyone who is on the fence between the Bose and these to look at spec/feature sheets of the two side-by-side. There is clearly no competition.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent noise canceling
content: Easy setup. I don't believe I needed the Playstore app. Synced with my phone without a hitch. Noise canceling is exceptional. I have a noisy dishwasher but I can stand right next to it and hear just Chopin. Same standing near the a/c return vent. On the balcony about 20 feet from a busy street, I could occasionally hear a bit of car noise. But so much better than my old (15 years) Sony noise cancelling headphones. I am indeed impressed.

author: Atigun
title: Not for Alaska.
content:
I was really looking forward to this birthday present from my wife.  I go through headphones every 6 to 12 months.  Since music and audiobooks are a big part of my life, I'm willing to spend a dollar a day for quality sound.
These headphones are nice and light.  They don't clamp your head like a vice.  Sound is superb, when temperatures and car travel aren't involved.
I don't think these last the 30 hours advertised.
They are sweatier than any other brand I've used; Anker, Cowin, Sony 950bt, and others.
Noise cancelling is amazazazing.  I work with snowmobiles, chainsaws, gas augers, etc., so this aspect is important.  It fails however in unlikely situations.  Driving in our Alaskan bumpy roads, you can hear the sound clip when you hit a bump.
The deal breaker with these cans is that they malfunction in the cold.  I've noticed that the problems start at anything below 10 degrees f.  This is the 2nd pair I tried.  It will start to think I am pressing the ambient or google function button.  Then, depending how much colder below 10f, it will think I'm clamping my jand over the right earcup, and cut the sound thinking I jave my hand cupped over the right can, so the sound cuts to inaudibility.
I wanted to like these.  I wanted to love them.  But, the idea of them doesn't stand up to what cold Alaska has left to offer.
The good news is that for most of you southerners is that these are auditory ecstasy.  Be warned, for Minnesota and north... look elsewhere.

author: Alexei Bastidas
title: Poor Build Quality
content:
These headphones sound great, best noise cancelling I've had, and have fantastic battery life (coupled with USB-C charing which is awesome).

So why 2 stars? The build quality is not good. All the circuitry is encased in crappy plastic leading to the legs breaking easy. I first owned a WH1000MX1 on which the leg broke after accidentally falling asleep with them on. Okay I thought, its weird that the headphones broke but it was probably my fault for falling asleep with them.

Decided to buy these to upgrade, and within two months, they also broke. This time though I have a hard time taking blame -- I was walking my dog, and flipped the headphones off my hears and onto my neck as someone was walking by. After chatting with the person, I go to put the headphones back on to see the plastic leg is broke, and the right ear cup is dangling by a cable.  I will note, the headphones, as with my prior MX1s, technically still work -- they circuitry is intact. The problem is I have to wrap em in electtical tape to get them to stay on my head.

I'm really sorry but I don't want to wear $400 headphones that require electrical tape to stay in one piece.

If you're the type that babies their headphones, you might never run into this issue. If you're like me and use your headphones everywhere, they need to withstand a slight shove from the ear to the neck.

Went ahead and bought older model Sennheiser Momentums, and while the noise cancelling isnt as good, the build quality blows these out of the water.

author: Jim
title: Great battery life and sound
content: I use these when I travel and it makes the "joy" of airline travel melt away. The sound range is fantastic, the battery life goes on and on, and they are very comfortable on my bald cranium.

author: Orin Garriott
title: Better than Bose
content: Love them

author: MBH
title: Very Good Sound Quality - Very Poor Call Quality
content:
I got these after perusing a bunch of reviews here and on YouTube. The call quality thing was a known issue, but it sounded like it might have been fixed. It has not. My WH1000MX3's arrived yesterday (2/27/2019) and they immediately asked to be updated which I did and it was a very long process. After the update, I listened to a few choice "sound quality" music selections and so far, so good. Took them to work today and started off the morning enjoying the quite stunning ANC and listening to tunes whilst I toiled. And then, I got a phone call. I could tell the client was mystified as to where I was so I quickly switched from the headphones to my AirPods. "Ah, that's better. Where were you?", he said. I explained about the new headphones and he said, "They sound AWFUL!" I then tried another call from a quite room to my Mom. She was also confused as to where I was calling from. I switched to the iPhone itself and she said, "That's better!" Finally, I called Sony Tech Support, explained what was going on then switched from iPhone to headphones. He said, "Oh yes, I hear what you mean." After about 5 minutes of going through all of his troubleshooting references he said there was no published fix for the issue and he would be happy to replace them with another pair. I told him I would just return them to Amazon.

So, as others have stated: These headphones sound really good. The ANC is stellar. They are comfortable. If you want to use them for phone calls, look elsewhere. They are really bad at that.

author: Matt Cook
title: Amazing
content: Outstanding. My first pair of noise cancelling headphones and the blow me away every time I put them on. I can't believe I didn't get them sooner

author: Tarek Mahmoud Sayed
title: neat product
content: battery life is fantastic, the noise cancellation is very good. I gave it 4-stars because I have a Sony XBR TV which I was expected this headphone can be recognized by this TV even I have latest firmware on the TV and the headphone but this was not the case. I am hoping the future update of the firmware will solve this issue.

author: Melissa Owens
title: Pretty dope
content: So I bought these because apparently  Bigfoot decided he wanted to give apartment living a go and moved in upstairs. Which is fine and dandy, good for him, not so good for me. If you’re wondering about the activity levels of such a magestic creature, it seems to only be active between 7pm-12am. So between 7pm to midnight I have these headphones on about 90% of the time and I have to say, I can’t hear a damn thing that hairy bastard is doing. The sound quality is great, the ambient sound feature is quite enjoyable and the fact it can connect to my TV is pretty dope. So if you have an extra $348 plus tax laying around, definitely go for these. Only thing is, I wish they were a bit more stylish or at least came in some more colors.

author: Tommy
title: Nice headphones
content: I really like the noise cancellation.

author: Bejamin
title: Stopped turning on
content: After several months of use, they wouldn't turn on.  I called Sony and gave them the number located on my headset.  Just received a new pair and they are working great.  Crispy sound, not as bass-heavy as I like, but optimal for blocking out noisy roommates.  Hopefully, these ones have a brighter future ahead.

author: william balll
title: Awesome!
content: Excellent sound quality

author: KW
title: Great Christmas gift
content: My husband loves these. We originally were looking at a different brand, but after comparing them side by side at a shop in the airport, he really wanted these.  It comes with a cord to be wired also.  Lots of cool features.

author: Adri B
title: Amazing sound
content: I bought these for my very picky husband and he loves them! I tried them on as well and the sound is amazing! Definitely recommend.

author: Dan Paulauski
title: Noise cancellation
content: Honestly wasn’t sure what to exactly expect but they definitely are worth the buy im glad i bought some i dont travel much but for listening to music to relax with nothing bothering me is amazing

author: Marc Dehandschutter
title: Baas heavy
content: Work as advertised. A bit bass heavy on the flat setting but you can correct it withe the app.

author: Brian Gerlach
title: Awesome
content: Awesome

author: Mohammed
title: I recommend it
content: Great quality and sound cancelation

author: J. Allen
title: Has what I want, missing what I NEED
content:
Pros: looks cool (I got silver-really more champagne color which is good), bass & noise canceling is on point, extra features (cover ear to pause nc, extra sound options in the app, usb c) also on point

Cons(and why I went with qc35ii): you cannot connect to more than one device at a time and switching between devices is cumbersome and annoying af, touch controls(accidentally skipping tracks when trying to adjust volume, read from others they don’t work well in the cold, accidentally pausing when adjusting headset, etc. found that i prefer a physical button), have to choose between Alexa/Siri/google/nc to use an actual button for (qc35ii has Siri built in to the play/pause button and then the extra button can be set to another voice assistant/nc)

If I needed these just for fun and travel these would be my top pick but I need them for work (Web conferences, cell phone calls) and school (studying) mostly. In both of these situations I need to be able to receive notifications from two devices simultaneously ideally or at least be able to switch between two devices easily. Unfortunately neither of these is possible with these headphones. I have to mess around in the Bluetooth settings every time I get to work and am ready to switch from my phone(Iphone) to my pc(surfacebook). Bose can do it no problem but Sony can’t. So I will have to be practical in Bose instead of cool looking in Sony. If aesthetics and sound were all that mattered to me it would be Sony hands down but I’m 30 now and efficiency is more important... please get it together Sony 😩

author: S R Walker
title: Superb
content: Superb sound. Excellent noise cancelling.

author: E. Nieman
title: Great in open offices!
content: I love these. I work in an open concept office, and need to shut out annoying conversations and noises to focus some times. These are so much better than my old regular over ear, non noise canceling headphones I had. I’m traveling a lot soon, so I’m excited to have these for plane rides too. The battery life is great for what I use it for, I can charge it every few days and I’m good! These are definitely the best headphones I’ve ever had. I couldn’t compare it to any other noise cancelling headphones, since these are the first I’ve invested in. They’ve been worth it for me!

author: AGH
title: Happiness in solitude
content:
I bought these for a noisy office. The noise canceling blocks 80% of the office noise. When you add audio on top of the noice cancelling 99% of the sound is gone.... including the loud voiced associate that sits nearby.

Sound quality is flat without an equalizer... available via an app from Sony.

Battery life is great.

I have two gripes:

1.  microphone for calls. It picks up a lot of ambient noise. It doesnt come through the headphones but can be annoying for people on the other end of the call.

2. Including charging cable is short.

author: Omar Abdel Hamid
title: Best headphones ever
content: Amazing headphones. Everything so perfect.

author: Mark Hutcheson
title: Headphones
content: This product is awesome.  All the details about it are true.

author: Mitran Kakar
title: Good headset
content: work as it says, didnt like the volume control much but i am old fashion and like buttons

author: samer
title: unpredictable, useless for phone conversation, lousy bluetooth sound quality
content:
If you are going to use the headphone cable to listen to music on these phones, then you have the right set.  They sound great in this scenario.  For the rest of us, this is a cheap sounding, unpredictable headset.  It makes unnecessary sounds when it changes conditions (you can turn off the feature, but not the sounds, choose your poison).  I have no idea why the bluetooth sounds good sometimes and at other times sounds like a dollar store headphones.
When you try to use them for a phone call, for some reason, they replay the last sound you heard.  For some other reason, the noise cancelling stops completely.  Some people I call, think I am calling from Atlantis, the lost continent. Others say I sound muffled and like I am talking from under the shower.
SAD!

author: Howard M. Sherer
title: Sony vs ER4 earphones
content: Very nice headphones with only fair sound quality. They are also too large for light travel. Also they don’t let your ears breathe, so they become uncomfortable when you are in a warm area. I am comparing these to my Entoymic ER4 earphones which are far superior in every regard.

author: Yong Zhao
title: Works like magic
content: Before I bought it, I did have doubt about its performance. As majority of nc headphones could not achieve what they claimed, except Bose. Now it does provide superior nc results without the wire air pressure feeling from other ANC headphones. I would recommend it to anyone searching for a ANC headphone which does a good job.

author: Glenn
title: Great noise.cancelling headphones
content: Great set of headphones. Very comfortable to wear. Battery life very good. Only one thing, the charging cable. All my charging is done through a surge protector. It sits on the floor. Charging the headphones is a real problem. They have to sit on the floor to charge. Not sure what Sony was thinking when making the cable so short. To make it desk top charge, you need to pull out your laptop, or a portable charger. Very inconvenient. They are great reference being away from your device. I use them with a phone, and have been several rooms away, and did not loose a connection. Noise canceling is excellent. You can use them as wired headphones also. Nice feature. Except for the too short charging cable, great set of headphones.

author: rick l weigart
title: Excellent
content: I use this 8 hours a day. It's fantastic.

author: smw9794
title: Great!
content: These headphones are amazing. I bought them to use at work and I immediately get into a quiet zone when I put them on. The noise cancellation is so great and the sound is top-notch. I have an older Bose headset as well and definitely find myself grabbing these more often over the others.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Got is really good for wide heads
content: Great graduation gift couldn’t be happier

author: Catskinner
title: A mixed bag with one fatal flaw
content:
I've been testing these at the office and comparing them to the Sennheiser HD380 Pro that I usually wear at work.

The main selling point, which is noise cancellation does work. I don't know if it's better or worse than other models with active NC but it actually doesn't isolate much better than the HD380. Perhaps it would fare better during flight, I really don't know.

The comfort is decent, not as good as the HD380 but also much better than the ATH-M50x for example.

The sound is well...also decent but average at best. The bass bleeds too much into the mid-range IMHO and the stage is rather narrow - which is surprising because with all the DSP going inside one would think that it's trivial to EQ them to the user's preferences - and one would be wrong because there is no EQ function at all in the companion phone app.

Speaking of the companion app, it's rather pathetic. It's only real use is to upgrade the headphone's firmware and this is a process that takes a ridiculously long time.

Overall they have a decent  but not exceptional sound, won't squeeze your head to death but are not particularly comfortable and they do block ambient noise but not any better than a good set of well isolated standard headphones. They do however have one fatal flaw and this is the choice of material that is used by SONY. It stinks. There is a constant smell of chemicals from the headphones and the case and it makes me nauseous to keep them on my head more than a few minutes.

author: Jim Salchenberg
title: Great quality and comfortable
content: Travel on planes over 50% of my time.  These are great.

author: Christopher P. Nicolas
title: Late arrival
content: Product was late and i had to be without a headphones

author: T. Plunk
title: Good for travel or recreational use
content: Works well.  At work the touch controls are annoying.  I always accidentally press them.

author: Arturo Garza
title: good Quality
content: Good Product

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wurth et
content: Perfect. But Just need buttons..don't even bother with touch pad for raising volume and skipping.

author: L. Grant Canipe
title: As good or better than the other top brands
content: When compared to the top Bose and previous Sony of the same caliber, these seemed to meet or exceed their quality.

author: James Mack
title: Great sound quality and comfortable
content: Sound quality is mind boggling, noise canceling is the best I’ve ever experienced, the only complaint is the function that allows you to hear ambient sound being a little hard to engage.

author: Paul
title: Amazing
content:
I never realized how loud airplanes were until I took these off mid-flight.

The up/down swiping for volume is tricky and I often accidentally swipe for next/previous track on accident. My solution is to not use that feature

author: ashley
title: Great until they're not
content: These have been amazing, before they started arbitraliry turning themselves off over and over right after being turned on with over 50% charge. These are $350 dollars. It's ridiculous for me to have to have them broken after three months of ownership. I have never dropped or impacted them in any way.

author: Gus
title: Missing one critical feature
content:
These are some of the most comfortable and best-sounding headphones I've owned, but they lack in one HUGE area that Bose and other competitors beat them one: multi-device connection.

In order to switch devices, you have to turn off bluetooth on the currently paired device, turn off the headphones, turn them back on, and manually connect them to the new device. Bose allows you to do this with a switch on the headphones, or by pausing playback on the first device, and playing sound on the second device. Sony needs to include this feature by any means if they want a best-in-class product.

You can take calls from one device and play music from another, but that doesn't solve the multi-device issue.

As someone who switches between a laptop and phone all day, this is a deal-breaker.

author: Ato Oppong Aikins
title: The best headphones ever!
content: Best headphones ever. Good noise cancellation, incredible audio quality, good build, comfortable to wear, extremely long battery life, fast charging, etc. This headphones are truly unique, value for money!

author: PorterJohn Chambers
title: GREAT!
content:
Best headphones i've ever had.
Does what it says, and more.

author: Hit Men Trumpet
title: Superior noise canceling and sound!
content: Excellent noise canceling! Music sounds amazing!! Quality materials, feels solid in the hand. Great fit on the head!

author: Slavman
title: Love em!
content: The sound and look of these is amazing.

author: Robert M Wilson
title: Best of the best
content: I bought 8 different wireless headphone within a month.  The Sony phones are the best.  If the price of the Sony phones do not bother your pocketbook,  then by all means, the Sony headphones should be your choice.  Keep in mind that hi-fi is very subjective to the listener.  Also the comfort of the headphones is excellent.

author: Tigran
title: Owesome headphones
content: Verry good device

author: Stephen Davis
title: AMAZING!!
content: AMAZING! I bought these headphones before taking a recent flight. As I’m apt to do, I spent countless hours reviewing tech websites to make sure I made the right purchase. I was cautiously optimistic and anxious to test them. From the moment I turned them on and the drone of the airplane engine vanished I was sold! These headphones are everything that were promised...and more! I actually felt sorry for my fellow passengers who had to listen to a crying baby all the way home while I sat in my private world and enjoyed a movie and then some music! Best money I’ve ever spent on a tech device!!

author: Satisfied Customer
title: Excellent
content: Really like this headset.

author: Jordan
title: Amazing Headphones
content: Was looking at the Sony's and the new Surface headphones. After trying them both in store, I found that the Sony's had better comfort, sound, and Noise Cancelling.

author: jason thompson
title: Best noise cancellation I've seen
content: Recently bought these headphones and they are 100% worth every penny spent. The noise cancellation is perfect and the sound quality is beyond good and with the connect app it makes everything twice as good at least. Battery life is amazing and the quick charge is a life saver. 20/10 would buy these amazing headphones again they are worth the money.

author: R. Guldner
title: Sound Is Great but Made from cheap plastic
content: I have owned these headphones for 3 months. The sound is terrific and on par if not better than my wife's Beats. However they are made with flimsy plastic and the headband snapped into pieces when I removed them from my head. Bose and Beats seemed to be constructed better. I cannot recommend anyone buying this product. I am hoping to get a refund from SONY rather than a replacement as I don't trust the durability.

author: Winston, TN
title: OMG...Best Noise cancelling EVER!!!!!
content: I live in NYC and have developed terrible tinnitus. The need for quiet background and soft music without inference is the only thing that calms me down. These headphones are unbelievable. They cancel out ALL outside horns, sirens, etc. It is pin dropping quiet. All others I am giving to goodwill. Wish they made ones I can sleep with. I cant wait to them when flying in two weeks. Will update upon my return.

author: ramon d.
title: fancy
content: volume control is a lil finicky, but sou d quality and noise cancellation is amazing. PLUS theyre extremely comfortable. would be 5 stars but Im cheap... too expensive.

author: CB
title: Nothing compares.
content: I've had a dozen high quality headphones from Sony and Sennheiser studio monitors to audiophile headphones from Fostex and AKG, but these particular Sony's are the beacon of what's possible right now and they kick ass. They feel fantastic, they're lovely to look at and to control (especially swiping the volume controls and the feel and responsiveness of the connectivity buttons). They're light comfortable, incredibly high quality and they sound awesome. I bought the Bose Quietcomfort 35 II after buying these because I wasn't quite sure given the great Bose reviews - and 300+ bucks is a huge investment - and ended up selling the Bose on eBay immediately. They didn't feel as durable or high quality and the Sony's sounded and felt better. The Bose are really good and I'm sure they'll strike back but these are just in a different league. I've had these mated to the "Avantree Oasis Plus aptX HD Long Range Bluetooth Transmitter" for use with my receiver at home and mixer at work and they work great together. Also the app is really really cool... We're done with cables.

author: Yuhang
title: good quality, but
content:
The noise-canceling function is incredible, I always feel so noisy in the surround when I take off my headset. The battery is great, it could be used for several days before charging, and it only took less than an hour to get fully charged.
The touch-control keys are easy to be miss-pressed, however, it's cool and fun to play with.

author: Gryffindor
title: Best Noise Cancelling Headphones!
content: These noise cancelling headphones are AWESOME! They are comfortable and can be adjusted big (for us big headed people, LOL). The noise cancelling is very, very good and I love the touch controls and the ability to cup one side to temporarily stop the noise cancel to hold a walk-up conversation. The battery life is astounding! I did not have to recharge them for nearly two weeks AND I was using them every day at work!?!? Pairing them can be a little tricky with a new computer, but once done, it connects every time. They are pricey, but have been worth every penny!

author: Shari A.
title: Noise Cancelling at its Finest!
content: My son purchased this and he loves them!  They work beautifully.  Mom doesn't like them that much as he doesn't hear me:)

author: Peter Gitta
title: These headphones ruined my hearing
content:
I haven't been able to hear anything since I got these. What am I supposed to do now, Sony?
Noise cancelling so effective it's almost disconcerting. Only negative is they tend to get hot after a while, but that's over the ear. What can you do?

author: Martin Taylor
title: Good stuff
content: Love them

author: Sam
title: That Noise Cancellation
content:
Needed a need pair of bluetooth headphones as my 3 year old Plantronics were falling apart. The most important thing for me was noise cancellation, my Plantronics were ok given the era they came from and I had tried several different earbuds that I wasn't impressed with. After reading the claim Sony was making on this product and the reviews I went with these still skeptical. Well, I was wrong. The noise cancellation is uncanny, when set on full on does amazing job of filtering out even obtrusive noises.

The material is ok, streaming Google Play music from my phone is decent not fantastic but the noise cancellation is by far the best I have ever experienced.

author: Mark Bradford
title: I researched and tried all the leading brands.
content: I researched and tried all the leading brands, but Sony is streets ahead. Build quality, noice canceling and sound quality are untouchable for a bluetooth product. Stunning headphones.

author: Tristen
title: Best headphones I’ve ever owned!
content: I really like these! They cancel noise very well and the ability to let sound in at a simple touch is incredibly useful

author: andrew waggoner
title: A+
content: Great headphones. Sound quality is great, they are comfortable and sleek. Very happy with this purchase.

author: Ksears
title: A respectable update to the XM2's, but with inherited shortcomings
content:
First off, I bought through another retailer because Amazon dropped the ball on delivery and informed me of a 10-day-delay the day the headphones were supposed to arrive. Come on Amazon, I know you-- you're better than that.

I returned the 1000XM2's and purchased the 1000XM3's, paying about a $50 premium in price to upgrade. It was worth it.

Good:
-Excellent noise cancelling, same as 1000XM2's
-Excellent sound signature (tighter and deeper bass than XM2's, the tiniest bit wider sound stage due to larger ear cups)
-Massively improved comfort due to larger ear cups and improved headband. Decreased clamping force. They float!

Bad:
-New touch pad design sucks, and seems a little less accurate than the XM2's. The textured surface from XM2's gave your finger some stopping force. Now when the touch pad doesn't read your input, it's like missing a golf swing as your finger fly's off the pad. Doesn't feel like an update at all. And oils from your fingers show up on this surface much more.
-No multi-device connectivity. Seriously Sony, why?! There were SO FEW criticism's of the XM2's. Still can't believe they missed that opportunity.
-There seems to be more sound leak compared to XM2's? It's hard to tell if it's worse ANC or a worse enclosure, but there is fan in my elevator that I can now hear that I didn't with the XM2's. Could be that the XM2's were letting in another frequency that helped mask it from my attention, but it's hard to say. Still incredible noise cancelling.

Conclusion: More of a (necessary) facelift to the XM2's than a new generation of the 1000X's. Is it worth it? Heck yeah.

If you use these at work: The peace of mind from the battery life, comfort, and ambient noise features is invaluable. You just don't have to think about these headphones during your day, and that goes a long way.

If you're an audiophile, these sound way better than the Bose QC35 II's. Coming from my beloved Vmoda crossfades with the 50mm drivers and super wide sound stage, I still find these capable and enjoyable.

If you're a gamer, these pair up PERFECTLY with Vmoda's boompro microphone (hooks up to PS4 controller). This was a big deciding factor for me. Having a pair of headphones that can do anything is awesome (and gaming with noise cancellation is awesome if you play games where you need to hear footsteps). Included a photo with the mic.
